Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: BobConn.
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel on corner of 53 and Ave of Americans. Close to Times square and everything. the hotel is very clean and quiet. Comfortable beds, bar, movies and great shower. You will be very pleased and comfortable here. Can walk to many places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tracey m
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located right in the heart of New York City, Rockefeller Center. The hotel is huge and has many restaurants inside the hotel to dine in. The concierge is very helpful in giving directions and recommending nice restaurants. It's a safe location and the rooms are a nice size and clean. The prices vary but are average for the New York area. They have a very nice size gym. The hotel is within walking distance of all Broadway plays, Central Park, Radio City Music Hall. I highly recommend it. Very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “New York Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BJBJMS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3/24-3/25 and was surprisingly happy with the room. The room was very clean and the bed had no unwanted visitors. I would recommend the Hilton over some others I've stayed at in NYC. Yes it is a BIG hotel and NYC is a BIG city, most things in NYC are on a large scale. There are Starbucks, Deli's and Au Bu Pain nearby for breakfast and lunch, also street corner vendors will sell you good fresh pastries and coffee. Room service - don't be foolish unless you think paying 40.00 for a grilled cheese sandwich is a deal. Do try to get on a high floor if you are bothered by street noise, I stayed on the 19th floor and there was a little street noise but not a big deal. The hotel is within 5 minute walking distance to the best 5th avenue shopping and also about 5 minutes walk to Times Square and Broadway. Do not expect to be treated like a celebrity or have anyone remember your name, this is not a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for Central park, Fifth Ave and Rockerfeller Centre”
Reviews.Author: Mazmannan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to New York for a long weekend city break and stayed in this hotel for three nights in early March. We took a flight from London and landed at JFK airport around lunchtime. By the time we arrived at the hotel it was mid afternoon. The hotel is a large hotel, and is ideally located within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. Our first impression of the hotel was that it was extremely busy. We noticed a lot of young people who were carrying placards with names of various countries of the world and guessed that they were attending some sort of a United Nations related conference. Check in by Indhira was efficient. Our room was on the 21st floor. It was a king size double bedroom measuring 290 sq ft. It was modern in décor, although I was not too keen on the brown coloured theme. The lighting was adequate. The view from our room was (predictably) of skyscraper buildings. The room had all the usual mod cons associated with Hilton hotels. There was a large flat screen TV; minibar; air conditioning; bathrobes; safe; all bathroom amenities etc. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and which guarantees you a good night’s sleep. You can cut through the breakfast area to 54th Street – so there are a lot of people passing through all the time. Our room rate included breakfast – but we were not overly impressed with the breakfast buffet. I think that the management should review the variety and the quality of food on offer and assess whether it truly represents value for money. If you prefer your coffee from Starbucks, there is a Starbucks café next to the breakfast area. All the staff members are helpful and they work hard to ensure that the hotel’s standards are upheld. The staff members who run the concierge desk are extremely helpful too. Ruth in the Business Centre was very helpful. The price to print one page from a file is $1, which I think is quite excessive. Later I had to make an important phone call using the room telephone to a number in the US. Again, I felt that a charge of $1 per minute was excessive. Readers should remember that in New York and almost everywhere in USA, tipping at 15% is the norm. This is just for “an okay” service. 20% is for good service and 25% is for “wow” service. It is useful to have lots of $1 bills handy because when you arrive at the hotel, you are expected to tip the man who takes the luggage out of the taxi and the bell boy who brings your luggage to your room. The same applies to when you are leaving the hotel. Sometimes the lifts can take a bit longer than expected to arrive. The Hilton Vacation Club sales people may collar you to attend a presentation. Be polite and firm and say no if you are not interested. I would recommend this hotel as it is within walking distance of Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, 5th Avenue and Times Square. MAZ MANNAN 12th March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't eat breakfast at the marketplace”
Reviews.Author: PSO123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many nights in the executive level. Nice room, nice view. Great location. However, we chose the breakfast inclusive plan because we usually eat a large hot breakfast. The buffet was good but we had a problem with the waitstaff. We were there about half an hour, finishing our coffee and they actually took away our coffee refill pots because they decided our breakfast was over and they wanted to seat someone else. I told the waitress I was upset about being pushed out of our table and she smiled. When I took her name, she then offered me coffee to go. Is this the hotel policy or is this the waitstaff policy? We left and went upstairs to the executive lounge for coffee. The continental breakfast there is very nice and the waitstaff is excellent. In summary, very nice hotel, and I would stay here again, but eat breakfast elsewhere. Bs

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: niagara_chris
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for a conference at the hotel. The very best part of the hotel is their location, perfectly situated in Mid town, close to the Theatre District, Times Square, Shopping and Central Park. Excellent Location. The room was clean and well appointed, though a little on the small side - which is, I think, typical for NY hotels. Space is at a premium, so this was expected. Wireless internet was super fast, though pricey. Only 2 out of 3 elevators worked while I stayed, however they were super fast. Used the starbucks in the hotel each day, which was a great feature. Fitness centre has been recently redone and it was one of the best I've ever seen in a hotel. I was able to opt-out of housekeeping for one day in order to get the fitness centre for free. Otherwise there is a charge to use it. My bed was decent; the shower was great. Any interactions that I had with staff at the hotel were professional. Overall a very decent experience. No disappointments. Once again, you can't be the location.

Reviews.Title: “Their service makes up for the price. Always enjoy our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Daronbabin
Reviews.Content: We have frequented numerous hotels in the Manhattan area. The Hilton never disappoints. The prices were a little steep. That aside, they were very attentive to our needs during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected - Desperately Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: TMinTC
Reviews.Content: When I think of Hiltons I usually think "well kept" and "nice". Our room was spacious, but wallpaper was peeling from the walls (and was very dirty), the bed wasn't comfortable, the bathroom sink wouldn't drain, the bath tub was in poor condition and the tub/shower kind of smelled. We also encountered some issues with the elevators being full for over 15 minutes in both directions (the staff finally allowed us to use the freight elevator) and the common areas were under construction. Neither of those issues were the fault of the hotel, but they did not help with our overall impression. What I can say -- the staff were nice, we were offered a late check-out, and they did help us when we couldn't leave our floor. Bottom line, an okay stay but nothing special. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel if you care about having working internet or customer service”
Reviews.Author: doubleJ24
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I am staying at this hotel for the SES conference which is in the hotel otherwise I would have already left. On the positive side the location is great, but thats the only positive at this point. I am now on my 3rd room in this garbage can of a hotel. The first two smelled horrible so I immediately asked to be moved. I was finally moved to the 39th floor and the room here is okay. Problem is, there is no ethernet connection and the wifi is abysmally slow. I plan to post some some screen shots later that show how this hotel's wifi is worse than dial-up! Reason, I'd like an ethernet connection is that, I have a travel router, that I could plug in and fix the problem. I did bother to talk to tech support even though I knew it would be a waste of time, and they were completely unhelpful. In the end their suggestion was that ALL 6 of my wifi capable devices were the problem and not their network. When I challenged them on this by quoting speed test numbers which were lower than 0.2Mbps, they tried blaming the problem on pop-up ads/my internet browser! Sorry tech support, but I am not an idiot and resent being treated as such. POP-UP ADDS?!?!? SERIOUSLY?!?!?! So because I desperately have to work during the day for the next three days and DO need a reliable internet connection, I have been trying to get into another room that has one. To do this, I have had to sit through nearly 10 phone calls with customer service and the front desk with about 80% of those people showing some major attitude and being rude questioning why I couldn't just work in the lobby and insisting at first that their wifi was fine, but then admitting later (when challenged) that there were widespread complaints. Finally they offered me a room on one of the executive floor which (when I arrived at) smelled really nasty and was in fact smaller than my room on the 39th floor. If you are paying extra to stay in one of those rooms, you are an idiot. The executive floor room was worse than my room on the 39th floor. I tested the wifi up there and it was equally as crappy. (less than 0.2Mbps). They did have an ethernet connection, but the smell was so awful, I didn't want to move for the 4th time and make my wife endure the nasty smell on top of being in a smaller room. I called the front desk again to ask if they had anything else that was at least the same size as my room and had an ethernet connection and was led to believe that they had larger rooms available on the executive floor but was never offered one. The person told me, that it must be that "you don't like the decor up there" so you "won't like any of the other rooms". I told her I didn't want a smaller room and could care less about the decor. No offer was made to give me a room upgrade or some kind of discount. Internet aside, I have to say the customer service here has been absolutely abysmal. I have talked to so many rude people that have given me a ton of attitude and grief for simply asking them to make good on their word that the Hilton has high speed internet in every room. I'll be sure to update more later, with photos, and screen-shots of the internet speed tests I have performed, confirming that their internet is positively awful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Benji S
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay with family was very enjoyable. Decent size room (for NYC). View was of rooftop construction so could have been better. Location was perfect and complimentary breakfast was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Stay--No problems”
Reviews.Author: LiJo4145
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem. I stayed here for 6 nights while attending a conference. Our room was not ready when we arrived, so we decided to go to the MoMa. The hotel sent us a text message when our room was ready. The staff was attentive and efficient. The room was spacious and well maintained. The Executive Lounge was a great place to relax and unwind after spending the day in sessions or meeting. We never experienced an unpleasant or unhappy episode during our stay. We will definitely stay here again when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice in midtown”
Reviews.Author: FlaCrab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business by myself, and I was very pleased. The rooms are good, but not great. What set this hotel apart from the others for me was the fitness center. This had to be one of the top two or three hotel fitness centers I have visited in the world ... and I have been to a hundred+. You have everything you need for a complete workout here. It rivals the Intercontinental by Hyde Park in London for the fitness center quality. Fitness staff is great. They sell clothes, the equipment is top notch. This is a rocking place to work out. If you are Hilton Honors Diamond, the amenities in the Diamond Reception area are pretty good: nice appetizers, nice setting. I was not thrilled with the hotel restaurant, but you can say that about the majority of hotel restaurants. This is New York; you have hundreds of great restaurants to choose from, so why waste time and money eating in the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Indignant Clerk at the Gift Shop”
Reviews.Author: Charlene W
Reviews.Content: The hours of the gift shop in the lobby are posted as 6:00 am to 12:00 am. However, at 10:30 pm the lights were all on with music playing in the background but the doors were locked. Needing something important from the gift shop I waited for the clerk to return thinking that they would be only be gone for a few minutes. When he returned some twenty minutes later and I (along with others who had been waiting) questioned why there was no sign stating "be back at --:00, he became very indignant. Not the type of service staff that you would expect at a Hilton hotel. On the other hand, the housekeeping staff could not have been friendlier and my room was always clean and well stocked with toiletries. I travel to New York frequently and have stayed at this hotel before. Had it not been for the service and attitude of the clerk in the gift shop, I would have given it a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “England UK”
Reviews.Author: Michelle532
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to NY, great stay at the Hilton, we had an updated room on the 8th floor which i did request via email before arriving, staff friendly and gave us our room until 3pm check out on day of departure at no extra cost. Excellent location and felt very safe with this area, Would recommend this hotel especially for 1st timers in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “like a small town”
Reviews.Author: andrejist
Reviews.Content: the most important thing about the hotel is itbeing in the very center so you dont have to worry about the NY traffic especially during dinner events.There are lots of good restaurants,shops an everything nearby.Times square ,Maddison ave, and the 5th street are in walking distance.But the hotel inside is always busy,always crowded ,even in the midnight the lobyy is full of people.The rooms are clean,the breakfast is very satisfactory.The staff is not like the ones in small boutique hotels but they try to help.I didnt have any problem with anything event though it was very very very busy period ..

Reviews.Title: “Way below our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Swede555
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York held very high expectations. however, the service wasn't as outstanding as we would have liked. Also, the hotel was a little too far uptown for our liking. The rooms on some floors were very outdated, and the executive lounge (Hilton Honors benefit) was the worst one we had seen. The breakfast was pitiful and the staff acted as though they didn't want to help. However, the bellmen got us a cab quickly and helped take our bags to our room. The rooms were nice enough (on the remodeled floors) and the beds were comfortable. The view of central park was nice. Overall, a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: FnM
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Hilton New York with my wife. -Location: the best location in NY if you want to stay close to all midtown attractions, most of them at walking distance or reachable by a short cab ride. -Arrival: extremely busy arrival area: we arrived by taxi at 9.30 PM, no one came to us to help with our luggage even though we waited for a couple of minutes. -Reception: very efficient and fast check-in procedure even though without a smile, a more welcoming attitude would not be bad. -HHonors: being a gold member, we were upgraded to a King Deluxe ( booked a standard king room ) and we were given 2 "express breakfast" vouchers per day to be used at their ground floor cafeteria or at the Starbucks located inside the cafe'. This was exactly what we were expecting. -Room: spacious ( for NY standards ! ) but old and in need of renovation, bathroom extremely small but with a good size shower which was very appreciated. Located on 15th floor, it was quite noisy from street traffic. King bed not as large as most of king beds I have experienced travelling the US, the mattress wasn't as good as in most of the Hiltons I've visited in the last few years. It was an interconnecting room: unfortunately the noise from neghbours was very noticeable, with lack of privacy which annoyed us for the whole stay. This should never happen. Avoid this room configuration at any cost. All in all, the room didn't meet the expectations at all, especially considering we paid 323 USD per night and for this money we would expect a better room, even in NY. -Housekeeping: very efficient, we had room cleaned every day while we were having breakfast. A point of distinction ! -Breakfast: good size buffet with large variety of foods. Our so called " express breakfast " was quite limited in choice, but we can't complain since we didn't have to pay for that. Once more, service was quick and very professional. -Our stay: no major complaints except for the notes concerning the room. -Overall: I don't think I would return, the location is probably the only plus. Even if I'm a Hilton Gold Member, I will chose other options if I had to return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Busy - like a transit station”
Reviews.Author: Rasmie
Reviews.Content: Big and soulless - but in an excellent location. Spent too much time waiting for elevators - some of which were not working. Rooms were good and kept in immaculate condition by friendly and attentive staff. Breakfast is a frenzy - not relaxing and ludicrously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SammFam
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here recently for work and fun.The location is excellent with Times Square, Central Park and Rockefellar Center all within a couple blocks walk. There are multiple choices for close subway stations to whisk you away to any part of the city. The room was small and there was a constant, repetitive "whooshing" sound in our 6th floor room that we never did identify. It was probably the elevators, but it sounded like maybe the subway ran beneath the hotel. Could that be? I'm fairly sensitive to noise but this noise wasn't bothersome. We couldn't hear much street noise with the windows closed which I thought was impressive for being in the city. The room service food was terrible and over priced so don't bother. There are plenty of restaurants and street carts to choose from so go grab some takeout if you'd like to eat in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and Ridiculous - Locked daughter out of room for 5 hours”
Reviews.Author: TryW
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times. On last trip traveled to NY on business, teenage daughter with me. When we checked in together, the clerk did not mention we should add her name reservation. They were having trouble with the key system and issued temporary keys. Summary- THEY LEFT MY TEENAGE DAUGHTER LOCKED OUT OF THE ROOM FOR 5 HOURS. I was in mtgs, but when she texted me I called and was told it would be worked out. I was assured security would let her in to the room, but the supervisor overruled. She had ID, and was clearly staying in the room but their "Policy" meant a 16 year old was locked out for five hours. I will never stay there again. No common sense, no regard for the safety of my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dtoy2003
Reviews.Content: Only is stood 1 night, but location great for anywhere in the city. Room was clean, nice size and the front desk were very pleasant & helpful. Was very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lvnn
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice rooms, the price is accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “VERY popular hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night and would stay here again for sure. The hotel was pack with a lot of groups but my room was quiet. Just what you would expect from a Hilton...nothing outstanding...just a clean, safe, very functional hotel. And the location is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4; a combo of 3s and 5s”
Reviews.Author: educationtogo
Reviews.Content: These are the things leading me t a 5: - the location is fabulous; half way between Times Square and Central Park - the hotel uses Peter Thomas Roth toiletries which is a true luxury for me - the staff, including the cleaners, the desk and security are very helpful, and respectful of teenage visitors. The hotel works with teachers to provide a good experience for everyone. These are the things leading me to a 3: - room temperature is hard to control; it seems like a 1 degree change on the thermostat lead to me either shivering or sweating - the windows need either replaced or re-insulated; it was hard to fall asleep with the amount of traffic noise that got through - the beds and the bedding were far from first class - the common areas of the conference facilities need furniture for informal group collaboration

Reviews.Title: “Great Room -- So So service”
Reviews.Author: Lillian P
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was only concerned with getting you to sign up for their frequent guest service. I was offered free internet or free use of the gym (really!! 15.00 for the gym) if I gave up one day of housekeeping. I took internet service as this was a buisness trip. The internet service was pretty much unusable and it was extremely frustrating to have to go to the lobby for interent. The elevators were slow. The real agravation was the last two days when the hotel had a seminar of some sorts that involved hundreds of teens. They clogged the elevators getting on the up when they wanted to go down and vice versa. The slow elevators became unusable as they were always full of the teenagers. One day after waiting 20 minutes to get on I resorted to just walking down the 13 flights. This hotel was only two blocks from my office, but I am not sure I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Evelin456
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay in New York. A lot of good restaurants nearby. Rooms very large enough, especially compared to some other I have stayed in. Also price for NY was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay during large convention”
Reviews.Author: kleiker
Reviews.Content: Our group amounted to 3000 people but the NY Hilton handled the large meeting with ease; they were very professional. The stay was in late February. I have stayed here before and find the Hilton to be well located: there are lots of stores, resturants, museums and subways in easy walking distance. The breakfast, the only meals I ate at the hotel, was good if a little pricey. All of the hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. My room was comfortable and everything was in good order. My only complaint is that it was rather cold for late February and I am a senior citizen and I had a bit of a problem in keeping the room at a temperature that was comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: drb671
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was good for a large scale hotel of its type. We arrived late, since our flight was delayed and our check in was quick and without issue. The clerk explained all the benefits and coupons, etc. I'm a HH Diamond, and this hotel has lots of perk options (coupon at Starbucks or restaurant in lobby instead of lounge). The room was decent size for NYC, although it could be updated. The furnishings were new but the bathroom was clean but dated. The Executive Lounge was nice when it wasn't prime time. I was not quite prepared for circus that occurs in the Executive Lounge on the weekends. The fact they have a hostess to keep the seating orderly was definitely a plus. The selection was decent, but it was overrun with kids sticking their hands in everything. Needless to say, we opted for other venues after that experience. I used the health club and it is a nice club for a hotel. They seem to advertise it as something spectacular, but I wouldn't quite go that far. It had a great selection and sufficient number of options if there are several others in the gym. As I stated, it was a good experience for what we paid and knowing the scale of the hotel going in. The location was definitely great for a navigating the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - tourist trap, rip off city”
Reviews.Author: kimbo81
Reviews.Content: My office is across the road from this hotel, so it isn't surprising we have a corporate rate with this hotel, I have stayed in NYC 4 times in the last year and every experience was better than this one by a mile. First of all the concierge and staff on the desk are not attentive, it was quiet no one bothered to help me with my bags, or show me where the lifts where, I actually felt like an inconvenience. The room was an ok by NYC standards although there was some sort of stain up the wall in the bathroom, could have been blood, but certainly didn't feel clean. The first thing I do in a hotel is hook up to the internet $14.99 is pretty pricey, in this day and age...you can get it free at McDonalds not sure how the Hilton still think they can charge this rate, to make matters worse this doesn't even cover multiple devices! I woke up on my first morning and headed to the gym, they wanted to charge me $15 the woman on the reception desk was obnoxious and rude to me and a woman and her children. She was raging about how she couldn't bring her kids in and it wasn't her fault the person the day before didn't do their job properly. I was exhausted just listening to the argument so skipped the gym and headed back to my room. No shower gel, just a bar of soap and to my delight no towels, so I ended up having to dry myself with tiny hand towels, it took 15mins for room service to deliver some towels by which time it was too late. And no apology!!! Breakfast was in keeping with most Hilton's a large variety but incredibly expensive with tip it was $40 if I were you I would get breakfast elsewhere around the area, rather than wasting your cash here. I decided to check out early and head to Boston early so I didn't have to stay here another night. On check out there wasn't any interest in my protests about triple charging for the internet or lack of towels, the Hilton have also tweeted me about my experience although I am not convinced much will happen, so I have decided I will not stay in another Hilton in any city that I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent- not impressed with anything else”
Reviews.Author: lafayettepurduefan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a convention. The location of the hotel is fabulous- it is close to everything. Walking distance to Times Square. The rooms are small which is what I expected. We had a quiet stay which was a plus. Expect to wait for the elevators. The staff was not helpful at all. It took me 3 phone calls to find out where something was within the hotel. If my convention returns to this hotel, I think I will be looking for a cheaper option. I expect more of a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: rjw420
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a solid choice: Great location, all the amenities, and it functions well for biz travelers. Two thumbs up to the large modern gym (if you care about exercise). And thanks for finding the jacket I lost. Note: No, it's not cheap and it's not quiet. This is Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “The whole experience was weird and unsettling.”
Reviews.Author: Yunha C
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is nice, but the service is poor. It took forever to check in and check out--there were 20 people in line and the hotel didn't bother putting more people at the front desk to help them (there were only two people at the front desk even though there was room for six). And I was taking a nap in the afternoon in my room, and some man just waltzes into my room and then walks out (I think he was management or something because he had a keycard and I hadn't misplaced mine). I just know he wasn't part of the cleaning staff. Really weird. Oh, not to mention, the man working at the Concierge desk made my mom really uncomfortable by asking her personal questions and hitting on her even though she just wanted to know where she could print documents and he wouldn't take the hint that she wasn't interested.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Poor overpriced service”
Reviews.Author: GregandRosann
Reviews.Content: This is a very large fast paced hotel in a good location in a fast paced city. Our suite was large and clean however attention to detail was not only lacking the staff was unresponsive. We were missing the iron in the room and waited over an hour for our request to be answered. The maid didn't understand our request, obviously a lack of command of the english language which we encountered a second time when we asked the gentleman who finally brought the iron for bathrobes which were also not in the room. An air purifier was running when we arrived at the room and after it was turned off at our request was left in the middle of the floor. Apparently someone was smoking in this non-smoking hotel. The bathroom was very small with poorly working shower and toilet. The room service menu was overpriced and the same as the overpriced cafe menu. $24 hamburgers in a cafe?? The executive lounge was over capacity obviously entertaining conventioners who were not on the executive level floors. The service in the bar was spotty. On Friday night around midnight walked out after waiting almost half hour to order drinks. The speed dials on the phone were not the noted parties in some instances making for some confusion when trying to call for our car when checking out which only resulted in a rude attendant answering the call and a $51 dollar/day charge. With all the hotels in NYC you can stay at a better hotel in just as good a location for the same price or less with better service and higher quality. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firstpastthepost
Reviews.Content: This is a typical conference style hotel in a very good location in NYC. It's located very close to a subway station and is near several major tourist sites. Upsides: location, decent executive lounge, clean decent sized rooms Downsides: Very long waits for elevators during peak traffic times (eg check out), rooms are dated and in need of updating on Executive floor

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not clean place”
Reviews.Author: AIWIW
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently for 3 days and the hotel is located centrally and most of sites within walking distance. I was attending a convention and the exhibit hall on the 3rd floor had very poor lighting. Exhibitors had to bring in table lamps light to lit up the place. The water fountain on the 3rd floor hall near the toilets were filthy with algae on the water sprouts. One of the doors to the the 2nd floor exhibit hall opened to trash collection and awful smell greeted us when the door was opened. For a hotel like Hilton, we did not expect this. Disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: John-Liege
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hilton, 6th Avenue at 54th Street, in November last year and recently last February. The hotel is very well located in Midtown. The service at the reception is correct. The room are not very big and I had an older one during my stay in February. The view on 6th Avenue is not bad at all ... Breakfast is ok with a large choice but if you prefer a quick one, there is a Starbuck in the hotel as well. Restaurant is not really great and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: savi2
Reviews.Content: This place is very convenient , located in the heart of all the attractions. It is within a walking distance to time square so it is very easy to get sound especially to the night shows. It is well decorated. The room service is average. This is a kind of place if you stay and want to travel around during the day. I didn't use any facilities inside the hotel though I was there for 5 days. There're lots to see in new York!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nickel and diming irksome”
Reviews.Author: ddleffers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two kids for a conference. Good points - location is great, they allowed us to check in early and we were given a renovated room. The staff were friendly and professional. Bad points - everything is extra - fitness centre, wifi, even holding your bags for a few hours after checkout. It just felt as though they had one hand in my back pocket at all times. There are a lot of options in New York and I am pretty sure I will take advantage of that in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chad M
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to see the city and all its sites, this location was amazing. Right off time square and central park. Hotel is a little tired, rooms could be updated. There is a subway station 1 block south that takes you anywhere in the city. Dont forget to stop at Mangonlia Bakery 2 or 3 blocks south. Most amazing key lime cheesecake on this earth.

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel with windows that open!”
Reviews.Author: Capelin
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying at 'the conference hotel' but was pleasantly surprised that the service was very good, the was room renovated since my last stay there 11 years ago, and place worked with large crowds. It lived up to its 4 star status, unlike quite a few other 4 stars in NYC, with a spacious guestroom, desk and sitting area. Most of all, it was quiet; my room faced the back of the hotel, not the street. My only complaint is that the wireless didn't work, even though it exists and registered my logon! A pretty good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great base!”
Reviews.Author: Backwell5
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here 15th -20th Feb for a Short break to see the sights of New York. We booked 2 rooms - 1 for our teenage daughters and 1 for us and were given rooms opposite each other on the 18th floor. Rooms were a little dated but were spacious with really comfy beds and were both clean. Linen and towels were changed daily and maids were supurb in their jobs. All staff were really courteous and helpful - the odd one got a little irritating though as they tried to sell Hilton honours club type stuff until they got to know you a little better! We never ate in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The best feature, we felt, about this hotel was its location, being close to Time Square, Central Park, Rockerfeller Centre and the main shopping areas- fantastic! Overall a great base at a competative price and I would recommend to anyone visiting this supurb city

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, friendly staff and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: 4Aroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (mom, dad, a very tall teen and a 9 year old) drove to NY for the winter school break and had the best time possible. I knew the Hilton would be crowded but it really was quite lovely and the busy conferencegoers and families on vacation did not overwhelm the staff at all. We got a very reasonably priced executive club room off the Honors site (not using points) and it was a large room with two double beds and ALOT of moving around space. The shower was so good my husband has purchased the showerhead now we are home! The club included morning breakfast (lots of choice), evening hors doevres and nighttime cookies. The location is the best and we could not have found a better place. Finally, my husband left his iPad in the safe...and guess what...housekeeping turned it in and they are sending to our home.

Reviews.Title: “It's just not worth the frustrations.”
Reviews.Author: Smyth-Beijing
Reviews.Content: We have reached 1,000,000 points on Hilton. In general they are fine. We stay at this particular one because our company has a deal here. But, we have now decided to never stay again (usually two - three stays per month) because 1) the wifi never works properly. Can't keep a signal and 2) laundry bags are NEVER replaced in the room by housekeeping. Every single time we're here we have to first call and have someone come up with bags (this can take an hour) and then call again for a pickup. Laundry is never returned by 7p. It's always late. So, it's just not worth it to stay here even if these are small inconveniences. There are plenty of places that do get it right. They'll be getting our business from now on. And yes, all of these small problems have been brought to the attention of the front desk managers for the past 5 visits so there's no need for a Hilton rep to now say we should have brought this to their attention. We did. Time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: beachgorrs
Reviews.Content: We are just completing a stay here at the 6th Ave. NYC Hilton. We thought we had a mix up with our rooms and had complained to Carlos at the front desk. He was very nice and courteous with us and helped us through the experience. I have to say I was very impressed. The hotel is large but the staff make it feel cozy and friendly! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, resonable price!!”
Reviews.Author: JCMass
Reviews.Content: We took the Limo Liner from Boston and were dropped on the sidewalk outside the hotel. The Hilton was very central, and we walked almost everywhere. Central Park was only a few blocks away in one direction, Times Square in the other. Rockafeller Center was just around the corner. The staff was unfailingly helpful, and cheerful. We were greeted by everyone from housekeeping to the front desk. Though we are not handicapped, we were given a handicapped room and frankly we enjoyed the extra room and the ease of the walk in shower. We were on the 14th floor and there was no noise from the street. The room appeared newly re-done and was very comfortable. We have never stayed here before but could not have chosen a better hotel. This time of year the room was $239.00 per night, reasonable for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, average service, good location”
Reviews.Author: AJBoston5996
Reviews.Content: I came here for a one night "staycation" with my 2 girlfriends who live in NYC. The location is great for tourists - close enough to Times Square but not so close you're IN Times Square, which can be miserable. It's massive inside - the lobby was chaos - but the registration staff was friendly and efficient. I was able to check in about 2 hours early. The room was just OK. Certainly clean and big enough, but not spacious. However, I was annoyed that they "lock" the thermostat at 71 degrees in the rooms. I understand the energy implications but 71 degrees with 3 women showering/drying their hair, etc. made the room stuffy and uncomfortable. If they want to conserve energy, they should go the European route and let you adjust the temperature while you're in the room (via your card key) and shut everything off once you leave. For $250+/night, I would like to control the atmosphere in my room. I was VERY unhappy with the attitude of one of the bartenders at the lobby bar (the bigger one with the windows onto the street). He was unpleasant (to put it lightly) to my friends and I. We were having a 'girls night' and I realize this hotel is mainly for business (I've attended several conferences there), but there was no need for his rudeness. All in all, a decent hotel in NYC. Just don't expect too much from the rooms/service and go elsewhere for drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Always good.”
Reviews.Author: tyler_cp
Reviews.Content: This is a huge downtown hotel. It shouldn't be criticized for not offering a "boutique experience" or "personalized service". I've stayed here 3 times. With this Hilton, you get 4 star quality done well: a clean & well furnished room, very comfortable beds, professional & friendly staff, and a central location. They also let me check-in at 12 p.m., and secured a Saturday night reservation, at one of those "impossible" restaurants, within two minutes. Stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dshreyas
Reviews.Content: HIlton was a very good hotel in a great location. The rooms were nice and clean. The concierge was helpful. Most of all the Location. Step out of the hotel and everything is near by!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeldieIrishTerrier
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, very close to a lot of the bigger touristy things to do. Was there for a conference and I rarely get to stay in a Hilton, so I thought it was a nice hotel, but they are obviously in the process of upgrading the hotel. I did not have a renovated room that they show on their website with nice tile and glass shower door. It seems as if they are doing it floor by floor as I saw some people getting off on floors that the hallways were certainly newer (new lighting, paneling, no wallpaper, etc). Overall, pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melmic
Reviews.Content: Just a few Blocks from Central Park, shopping on 5th Ave, the lights of Times Square and a Broadway musical. We spent a long weekend on one of the executive levels in a king room that was in need of an upgrade. (Rug stained and wallpaper dated) The room was clean the hot water plentiful and the bed was excellent. The exec. lounge was packed during the early evening hours and the morning continental breakfast had a line even though the room holds over 80 guests! This is a hugh property with a ton of guest each day.

Reviews.Title: “This time I did not sleep at the hilton (I did many times but now I live in NYC) but I want to rate review it coffee bar: noisy,”
Reviews.Author: FrancyG72
Reviews.Content: I go quite often at the Hilton. I used to sleep here when I did not live in NYC. It's a very clean and comfortable hotel. I reviewed it before. Now I live in NYC and I quite often go there for lunch (good). Last week for the first time I tried its coffee bar. It was quite unsatisfactory. The place is incredibly noisy. We ordered two slices of cake (average), a cup of coffee (nothing great) and a bottle of water. But listen to this: while I was writing on my computer, the waiter took away my bottle of water. I called him back and kindly I said "inadvtently you took away my Perrier. i was still drinking". insteda of saying sorry, he want away mumbling. He came back with a half bottle ofwater (mine) and another one full. He put in front of me with a "ok, now?". Giving a new bottle for free was nice but rudeness , as a famous commercial goes, is "priceless"! I don't think I will go again in that place

Reviews.Title: “Great Location friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: I brought my family with me on during a business trip to the Big Apple and we stayed at the Hilton New York. Check in was swift and efficent. We had a room on the tenth floor, which was high enough to avoid all but the loaudest noises - Sirens, etc - from the street. Staff at the front desk, concierge and executive lounge were uniformly helpful and friendly. We stayed in a room with 2 double beds and while not luxurious large, was more then adequate for our family. It looked newly remodelled and was crisp and clean. The TV was an awesome HD set. Of course being in NYC the point is to get out and about and the hotel is well located for this. Its a quick 2 block walk to Rockefeller Center, close to the theater district, MoMA and Time Square - but not so close to it to be sucked into the craziness there. Its a quick walk to subway lines downtown or crosstown. My only - very minor - compliant was using the elevators to get to the executive lounge was a hassle. The Hilton Honors floors were 8 & 9 and I was on 10. The elevators ran in 3 or 4 soerat banks that went to different floors. I had to take an elevator down to the lobby or fitness center then catch another elevator up to the lounge on 44. Some busy mornings that coud be 10 minute trip. It would be nice to have direct access to the lounge from the HHonors floors. I have to say the view was worth the ride as you can sit in one corner of the lounge and see into central park, or the other look down 6th Ave at the Radio City Music hall. The breakfast buffett was also good - especailly the bagels - for a continental breakfast offering. Lastly I have to say I got a killer corporate rate of <$200/ night. At that price for NYC the value was unbeatable. All in all The Hilton New York will be my first pick for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Work Trip”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld262
Reviews.Content: I had a so-so stay at the Hilton on 6th Avenue. When I checked in, I stood in the HHonors line when I checked in being that I'm a gold member. The person checking me in did not ask me if I had a number and forgot my number wasn't on the reservation. When I tried to get on the internet, I realized I would get it free as a gold member so I called Customer Service and they gave me the code as well as putting my HHonors number on the reservation. The internet had limited availability the first night and I could barely manage to get anything done. I left my laptop in the office I was visiting the rest of my stay rather than lug it back and forth for nothing. Also, after finding out that I was a gold member, I never got any of the perks from the hotel. Great size room for NYC and amazing hotel gym!!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Trip to New York at the Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: This is my first ever review on any hotel and what a better one to start. For years I have read the reviews on hotels before my family and I travel. Currently I stay in Hilton brand hotels around an average 70 nights a year. So, I am very selective on where I stay. I have read the reviews on the New York Hilton prior to staying there in December 2011. I feel many people are very critical. What I can say is this, my family had the very best time while we stayed at the Hilton New York. We had a 2 double bed suite on the executive floor. We were surprised to find a Christmas tree in our room as we arrived along with ornaments and small presents for our children by the tree. We were also welcomed by fresh cookies, milk, and Dilan's Candy bar as well. We were called every day to see if we needed anything by the managers! The executive lounge was busy at Christmas, but not an issue and the food was out of this world! In closing, believe me Hilton knows how to take care of its customers. We will be back at Christmas again this winter and can only expect the same service we received in December 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start. Very Good Finish.”
Reviews.Author: btmarsh
Reviews.Content: I planned my trip to New York around attending Barry Manilow in concert. He was scheduled for 3 shows and my friends and I had tickets for all 3 shows. After checking into our hotel, we found out all 3 shows were canceled and postponed to April. We tried to call the box office to get a refund and received horrible customer service. After 3 failed attempts, I went to the hotel Concierge for help. I approached Ralph with the problem. He was on hold with the box office for 30 minutes and was able to get my refund returned to my credit card. Since we had free time with the cancelled concerts, we asked Ralph to help us plan our trip with recommendations to attractions, restaurants, and things to do. He was able to plan everything from dinner to directions for us and our trip ended being one of the best vacations we had, despite the cancellations. The hotel's Concierge staff, Ralph in particular, is a definite highlight to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Valentine Weekend Stay.”
Reviews.Author: carocaro8
Reviews.Content: My husband and my brother in law gave me and my sister a surprise Valentine weekend stay in the city at this hotel. It was extremely busy in the lobby area but New York City is always busy everywhere, plus this hotel is huge. The rooms where clean and modern. The bed was comfy, we got the 29th floor and the view is super. I had buildings all around but I didn't care, I loved it. We only slept there, we didn't try room service or any restaurant so I can't comment on any of those services. My overall stay was very nice, the only thing is when you stay on top floors like the 29th floor, you hear this buzzing sound at night, it did not really bother me but you can hear it. I would definitely go back and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice and both times it has met my needs. This hotel serves it purpose of providing a place to sleep for those on business. I have never heard any traffic and the doors close very quietly. It is a little run down in spots but it is not bad overall. It is close to underground, Times Square, and Cental Park. Sometimes there is a line for a cab outside but it has never taken me more than about 5 mintues to grab one. If you come to be spoiled, you will be disappointed. If you come to get out and do things in the city, I think you will be happy. It is not cheap but neither in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Overall really good hotel let down by a moneygrabbing feel and the need to update the executive rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: stayed in an executive room right on the top floor. Looked very old and dated with some paint peeling off the ceiling. However the lounge was first rate and the breakfast and hors d' oeuvres were fantastic. Location of the hotel was amazing - we walked to see Chicago in under 10 minutes and central park was only 4 blocks away. one significant downside was that they charge for every little something they can get away with eg Wifi and for leaving our bags for a few hours after checkout which just makes the place feel cheap. I've never stayed in a hotel that charges for bags storage before. There really is no excuse to charge for things like this separately, especially the wifi. It was free in the lounge and the lobby, why not the rooms?? Overall really good hotel let down by a moneygrabbing feel and the need to update the executive rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Poor value.”
Reviews.Author: ATPTour
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights whilst attending a conference at the hotel. Clearly geared towards large conferences, even the lifts were trying to sell me litigation software... the location is perfect for getting to Central Park, the shopping around Fifth/Madison Av, Times Square and Broadway - they're all a ten minute walk away. Gym was surprisingly big and well equipped... though pretty busy. Beyond that though, it all goes a bit downhill. Maybe I expected too much from a giant conference venue in NYC. Aircon and lifts very noisy, room so small there wasn't space for a cabinet on both sides of the bed, breakfast service was appalling though the food was OK. As a base for exploring New York it would work quite well, but if you're planning on staying in your hotel (why would you do that in NY?) then try the W on Times Square...

Reviews.Title: “I actually like this place”
Reviews.Author: pinkilly2
Reviews.Content: Ok, the Hilton New York is a huge hotel but it has a few very unique selling points - You can open the window a bit - I had a renovated room on the 33rd floor and they had a good size - it is really close to Central Park for a run - Very New Gym Equipment But it does not have - a Laundry over the weekend - the Lobby is always packed with people on the floor surfing in the internet - as a Diamond Member they give you free breakfast - but only a very lousy version - as soon you sit down for your 'free' breakfast they want 16.00 - I denied as it was not clear to me and after asking for the manager the fee was waived - and gave the amount as tip to the waiter - if you are expensing the charges - the minibar comes a day later as a separate line item and you will not have any invoice for it I still enjoy it as the value for money is very good!

Reviews.Title: “If you like a convention hotel this can be your choice.”
Reviews.Author: Victor B
Reviews.Content: The NY Hilton is not, for sure,the best Hilton worldwide. For instance: the SÃ£o Paulo Hilton or the Beverly Hilton are thousand miles better. However, if you stay in the Executive Club levels, where they include breakfast, you might be getting a good value for your money.Inasmuch as the lobby looks like 42nd. street on New Years Eve, and service is either slow or absent, you still have a fantastic address. I have been there in the past 12 months two times, one in february 2011 and, recently on december 2011-january 2012. I arrived at 7 am and there was nobody at the front door to take the bags from the taxi and, worse, there was nobody to help us with the bags to our room. The room itself looked tired, with many stains on the floor and furniture. There was no shaving mirror in my room and the person to whom I made a complaint just said that "some rooms do not have shaving mirrors". So , I went to the drugstore next door and bought one for 12 dollars. The maid seervice is fast but polite. The wallpaper in the bathroom needed serious fixing. Another negative issue lies in the fact that the coffee-shop closes at 2.00 pm and, after that time, you have to go out to eat. Their italian restaurant is so-so and only opens for dinner. When I left, I called the bell captain to send someone to help us with our 3 bags and he said it would take 25 minutes. So we went down with our bags. No big problem unless you consider that I am 83 years old and my wife is 80... Anyway, if you can live up to accept these things you may go to the Hilton NY. Myself, certainly, I will not go back unless I cannot find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for New Year”
Reviews.Author: atlhonest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights over New Year this year and had a good stay. Positives - Location well placed for 5th Avenue shops, Radio City and just a few blocks to Times Square. We walked everywhere or took taxis for getting Downtown. Room was large, modern and comfortable. Plenty room for suitcases and shopping bags! Very good breakfast options and no evidence of long queues other reviewers had warned of. Really good if you are a Gold Hilton Honours members as get free coupons every day. Small store within hotel to stock up on drinks and snacks if needed. Room service excellent. Negatives - lobby was always crowded with people sitting and lying everywhere with laptops and devices to get the free internet. It was a bit strange and intimidating! Not all of the hotel has modern rooms, we had booked a modern one then got upgraded at check-in to what turned out to be an older room on a higher floor. We didn't like it at all so we went straight back to lobby to get upgrade cancelled - strange I know, but the modern room was just so much better! Room service is not all night, just until 1am. We made this mistake on New Years eve/morning after returning from Times Square celebrations. Also make sure you get a key for mini bar, they had run out when we were there so it was a very sober and hungry night! I recommend if you can get a good price, we used Hilton's own website and found it to be fair. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jantaro
Reviews.Content: If you're in town for a conference, you may be forced to stay at this property. Otherwise, it should be avoided unless you get a really good deal. I stayed on the 31th floor and had to pay for a poor connection internet connection (just 1 bar, and it kept disconnecting). Technical issues are outsourced to AT&T, so no one is really responsible when problems arise. When I showed the problem to the reception (brought a screenshot showing the connection issue), they did not offer to remove the charge. The Marketplace cafe offers a descent buffet, but the service is horrible. There are plenty of waiters standing around doing nothing. Not once was I offered a refill of juice or coffee. With barely any customers in the restaurant, the waiters prioritized chatting instead of actually working. Buffets in Asia will always have a drink bar, but to give you a reason to leave a tip, that is never provided in the US. There was plenty of hair from prior guests on my bathroom floor, but apart from that the room seemed fairly clean. The bed is comfortable, and the check in process was efficient (though they forgot to give me my free breakfast coupons).

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: KMB33
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference in January - love the location. For NYC the rooms are cavernous and extremely comfortable. Bar service nothing spectacular - waited so long in the lobby bar we just up and left. I agree with the previous comment about the charge for luggage storage - tacky. BUT the fantastic gym made up for it. I was able to keep up my workouts as if I was still at home (which was great since there are amazing restaurants within walking distance every direction). Thank you also to the weather gods for giving me a 65 degree Saturday in Central Park in January. A mini bar charge appeared on my Visa card after I got home - I called the hotel to dispute as I NEVER indulge in mini bar temptation - they took the charge off right away, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Location / views at least make up for a lot of shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Limehouse_Lil
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel which hosts big conferences and trade shows. Tired decor and many inconveniences, especially woefully inadequate lifts for the number of guests - up to 10 minutes wait at busy times (walking's not an option to the 44th floor!). Expected far more from a $300+ room - long overdue for a makeover and upgrade, although for a Manhatten hotel it was a decent size (unlike the bathroom). Wifi is only free in the executive lounge/ public areas - resulting in the vast marble lobby areas often being full of even business-suited guests sitting on the floor huddled over laptops and iPads. Fabulous views over the city from exec lounge on 44th floor and the location - 6th and 56th - is convenient for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: caligirl123
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. A few blocks from Time Square. A few blocks from Central Park. Near 5th Ave shopping. Across the street from Radio City Music Hall. I walked everywhere and only took a cab a few times. The hotel was clean, room was clean and I loved the big lobby. The only part that SUCKS, is that you have to pay $3 per luggage piece when the hotel stores it for you before or after checking in or out. It really puts a damper on your trip to start off paying to store luggage. Really cheap of the hotel to not accommodate luggage storage. Also, breakfast buffett downstairs is $30. So I went around the block to Majestic Deli and got some breakfast for a lot cheaper. They also have great pastrami sandwiches there :)

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Impersonal, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: sweiser
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel. Crowded lobby, long corridors, "organized taxi line" (like an airport or bus station), sets of elevator, etc. Apart from these "public" areas, room is good. Large room, enough closets, nice bed, nice bathroom. VERY WELL LOCATED. Close to Time Square, close to 5th ave, close to Central Park, full of good restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton NYC - Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mcos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for a trade show. Great location. Food / beverage service needs to step up when a convention is on prem. I need to see this hotel when its not packed. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Staff always ready to help”
Reviews.Author: mibgoo
Reviews.Content: Just a two night stay,but treated like a regular. From the phone to the desk they make you feel welcome. Breakfast buffet was very good and wait staff friendly and stop to chat with you...your OJ glass is never empty. The only exception was waiting for the Etrusan restaurant to open, I should have listened to a staffer leaving...hinted I should try elsewhere. When the Etrusan did open the waiters were indifferent at best. Told them we theater tics and ordered the pre-theater menu,but needed to be out by 6:30. Dinner got mixed reviews (desert was very good)...but at check time, the waiter add ten dollars for two coffees...I told him it was included. He loudly declared it wasn't, so I had to escort him to the window at the door displaying the menu. He said well they must have changed it. Through out the dinner the staff mainly talked to each other! Did not get into the taxi until 6:50...for a 7pm curtain! Another good point about this hotel, besides location, is the doorman can get you a taxi when none are to be found!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; average Hilton”
Reviews.Author: katertonks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - right near central park, very close to restaurant row/Broadway and Lincoln Center. I visited 2x in January and was a bit disappointed with the hotel, however. I stay in Hiltons all the time and given the price of this hotel (compared to others in the chain) I found the service to be particularly sub-par. Room service (on an off hour) took a particularly long time and more than one employee was marginally rude. My felling is, if the location isn't a priority, stay at a different hotel in the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkJean
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights in a club room and so pleased with our choice.Large room with views in direction of Central Park. Room well maintained and serviced.Club room great for buffet breakfasts and evening nibbles.Think the standard of food had improved .Lots of fresh fruit, good bread and great coffee machines.Receptionists of the clubroom very welcoming especially the weekend one who gave us lots of advice to wrap up warm and have good footwear on after a recent snowfall! The hotel was well placed to catch the 5 or 7 bus to the Lincoln Center.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to celebrate my birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: idmark001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for 5 nights 25th - 30th Jan and spending my birthday on 28th Jan in New York while enjoying the comfort of a great Hotel.I have stayed at the Hilton in the Maldives, London and Cardiff and found the standard of this Hotel good. Warm and welcoming from the moment you step in the Lobby and throughout the Hotel. The Housekeeping staff do a great job and can never do enough for you and check several times if everything is ok. We had a standard room on the 36th floor with 2 single beds which were comfortable and more than welcome after a day's sight seeing. Plenty of tea and coffee with a coffee maker for you to use. Breakfast is plentiful and you have loads of choice and the staff there are brilliant keeping you topped up with coffee juice etc and always finding time to see what you were doing that day The Hotel is perfectly placed for all the things you want to see and excellent for shopping I found New York easy to get about due to the fact the the Hilton is so well situated and I would recommend the Hilton Hotel 6th Ave (avenue of the Americas) to all

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kikibat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Friday in early December; we used points for the stay. Our room was on the 15th floor; no great views, but room was clean, neat, and bed was very comfortable. By NYC standards, room and bath were generous. Location is amazing - we brought our 3 year old, and walked everywhere - first to FAOschwartz, then to dinner, then to Rockefeller xmas tree; the next day we did Times Square. You cannot beat the location, especially during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of some (?) executive floors”
Reviews.Author: GerardN
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on business at the Hilton for a few days. Positives - - prompt and friendly check-in (am a Silver level Honours guest, ie I don't stay at Hilton properties very often, yet there was a separate counter - very convenient) - good, central location - Starbucks on property - quality toilet articles - some but not all floors have been refitted and look nice. I used the standard room of a colleague on the last day as I was unable to secure a late check-out and it was much more contemporary than the 80s fit-out in my 'executive floor' room. Negatives - - On the second night, someone had organized a large reception at 10:30 pm in the Presidential Suite above me. Despite a number of complaints from guests, and multiple assurances from management and the security manager, the function continued until 12:20 am and kept me awake. The hotel said that the function had not been authorized but that didn't seem to have lead them to close it down. - As an apology, the manager offered me 'extra points' and a fruit / wine service - both much appreciated but my weekend was ruined. The duty manager also offered a late check-out for the day of my departure. Unfortunately, he forgot to note this in the system and Hilton was unable to honor this. Another major inconvenience. - My room on one of the executive levels (40) was in dire need of an update. Other than a ~2002 model flat panel TV, the room featured 1980s carpets, bed, phones and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: Jenna W
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great room, great location, great staff. We were travelling with our 5 year old and they upgraded us so that we would have a little more space. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 occassions. The first time we were upgraded to the Penthouse on the top floor. Was the best way to spend my first time in New York. Amaxing views over central park. The hotel itself is really well positioned & witihin easy walking distance of 5th Avenue, Times Square & Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ca920
Reviews.Content: Ok... its a Hilton, right? Overall, its probably a little tired and dated (at least the room we had on the 39th floor was), but it has many redeeming factors: Location - close to all of downtown, around the corner from a Dean and Delucas, the staff were the friendliest I have ever seen - really good and genuine - especially checkin/out and at the Executive Lounge. By the way - the Exec lounge is great and not to be missed. Many other positives, but I was actually impressed. I paid $207 per night for a King. Cons: The Bed was terrible - mattress clearly worn out, the computers in the Exec lounge need work - very slow. Other than that, remembers it is inner city NY, so as long as it is clean, safe and central, you are OK. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A T
Reviews.Content: Hilton New York is in the middle of everything! You're walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave with all the shops, theater district & Time Square! Everyone was so friendly and was able to check in early at 12noon. Our room was a bit small but I guess it's NYC... We had a great time exploring the wonderful city. The only complaint I have is that the bellman recommended a very expensive steak house near the hotel called Empire. It was not what we were looking for a family with 2 toddlers. We felt out of place. We were looking for something more family friendly and casual. The steaks were very expensive & was just okay. We can get better steaks in Dallas and much cheaper too. Overall our stay was wonderful! Looking forward in staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: southlanarksire
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to New York we had spent a fair bit of time researching for a central location to be near to the attractions we wanted to see and ht the spot with this hotel. It is in a busy safe location being near the top of Sixth Avenue, meant the main shops on Fifth Avenue were literally a block away taking 3 minutes to walk to and Time square 8-10 minutes walk away on Seventh Avenue. We stayed in a comfortable Deluxe room on the refurbished 14th floor, (much better than refurbished standard rooms on 9th floor). There is an excellent breakfasr servIce in hotel where you are presented with a choice of continental breakfasts or full breakfasts which range from abouT 14 - 23 USD, continental breakfast at 17 USD was more than ample and we all took that every day of our stay. There is also a Starbucks and take away available in the hotel. Free internet acces is available in the huge hotel lobby but not enough seats for the demand to the extent people were camped out on the floor which was a bit off putting on arrival. i found if you went down to the lobby and logged onto to the free wi fi, you were given one hour's access which still connected in my room. For a worthwhile and informative city tour I would recommend the "see it all" tour with "On Board City Tours" where the local guide gets off the coach with your group(about 20) and talks you around the attractions and water taxi and gives loads of informal snippets of wisdom. WeI booked this prior to travelling and found it to be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: GLC_12
Reviews.Content: After researching numerous hotels in Manhattan for our maiden voyage, we decided on this Hilton hotel due to its location. As first timers to New York, we weren't too familiar with the city but were quite pleased when we arrived and realised how central this Hilton was. The Rockefeller Centre is only steps away, a very short walk from Central Park, literally short blocks from all the action in Times Square and 5th Ave and the list goes on and on. The staff were very warm and accommodating, our executive king room on the 35th floor was perfect for our 11 night stay. It was beautiful to experience Christmas and New Years Eve in this amazing city - everyone was in a great spirit. The Hotel was always alive - the Christmas decorations and music made you feel like you were part of a movie. We loved it and will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loven great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Lauriebydasea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Hilton. We were upgraded to a suite with a partial view of Central Park. But all the views were good when you are 43 floors up! We had access to the Executive lounge that was so great. And it saved us a ton of money, as they offer a substantal continental breakfast, homemade cookies and coffee latte stations. Oh and in the evening, lots of hot samples of goodies, you can make a meal of it for sure. The room is surrounded by three walls of glass overlooking the city, so beautiful. We sat up and watched people ice skating in Central Park while it was snowing. Very clean hotel and comfortable beds. We especially enjoyed its central location to everything. Ten minute walk to Times Square, Rockefellar Center (do not miss THE TOP OF THE ROCK!!!) best view of all of Manhattan, shopping on 5th Ave (don't miss Henri Bendle for great accessories) the Plaza for lobby for afternoon break is over the top. Have fun, we sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel in manhattan, hilton standard ok”
Reviews.Author: user2777
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 8 nights over new years eve at the hilton. Executive King size bedroom. We recognized the hotel in earlier visits to but never took the chance to stay at the hilton. Checkin in we saw a long line of guest at the reservation desks but clearly structured by normal, HHonors, diamond etc...., so queueing up at one line it was not so long waiting time. We checked in, got a room and went up to the room. First impression: clean room, standard equipped with king bed, desk with chair, LAN cable + wireless, an armchair and very small sidedesk. The bathroom was very clean, this is something i highly appreciat. Nothing unclean, everything fresh. The room was actually not like the photo on the website (booking.com), difference was the missing seperate seating area and coffeetable. What hit me with a little surprise was that everybody, from the doorman to the room service staff was extremely friendly. A short hello, a wellcome to new york, even in the floor when we arrived at the room, the staff cleaning the floor and some rooms, they looked up, said hello and asked if we need assistance. Very very nice experience, especially after at least mor than ten stays in different hotels in manhatten we also experienced at some hotels a little of an arrogant attitude, even in very expensive hotels. Not at that hilton. So this was a very positive! After a while at the room, i decided to go down to the reception and ask about our reservation and the difference to the shown photo on the booking website. I had a printout of the reservation with photo so i asked the frontdesk about the difference. i was told that this is very often the case and that she was very sorry, but can't do anything about it because the hotel was fully sold out. Reason why I asked was, that the trip was one and a half months after our wedding and supposed to be a short honeymoon trip. I mentioned that but also said that I understand that we booked exactly the room we got only the photo was misleading. But surprise, the lady offered me a free wireless for some days, since she was sorry not beeing able to help with another room. Great gift, since the price for wireless lan is somehow from the stone age like 15$ per day. So we went out for shopping and sightseeing the next day, and afterr returning in the evening we found a surprise gift in the room: a bottle of sparkling wine, two champaign glasses and a card from the front desk wishing us a wonderful stay and all the best for our marriage. This was very nice and hit us by surprise. Why the big surprise on our side? Taking into account that the hotel was so crowded by tourists and visitors, long queues at the front desk and so also a little hectic with argueing guests and whatever, the staff always stayed very friendly and in our case even was very sensitive in listening. Aft that story a little more on the location. There is more or less no better location if you are in manhattan for shopping and the usual sightseeing. MoMa is just 50meters around the corner, 5th ave and park you can reach within minutes. Even a nice deli is just opposite the hotel, like a starbucks in the hotel and another one opposite the street. Some ok restaurants are also close by. A walk to columbus circle is also only some ten , and then you're just about to enter central park. Subway stations close by to take you downtown or wherever. Executive room comes with an access to the executive level lounge. There you're offered breakfast everymorning. If hotel is very crowded go an check for breakfast early (opens at 6.30 if i remember correctly), so beeing there at 8 to 9 is ok but later you might have to wait untill seated because lounge is full. Some postings here already mentioned the elevators. Yes you sometimes have to wait, but even when the hotel is very full around holidays waiting time still was ok. There are three express elevators to the floors 40-44, which shortens waiting time. Taking the stairs to exec level (in our case room was located on floor 41, exec lounge is on 43) is much quicker than waiting. So all together, even if you are not a fan of business hotels or bigger hotel chains, this hotel was a great experience we did not expect. Thanks to the staff, we really felt to be welcome in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: twiz4765
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and couldn't fault the location or the staff who were excellent ,hotel is very busy but plenty of places to eat nearby ,rooms are good just what you would expect no complaints

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum1964_10
Reviews.Content: Very average property. Hotel is quickly becoming "tired" and needs updating, especially the bathrooms. Rooms arent quite as bad, but showing their age. Location of property is awesome, but thats about it. Had problem with Hilton.com as they didnt send confirming email so I thought I didnt finish my online reservation. Booked one 2 days later, and they tried to charge me for two rooms. Took over an hour of my time to get the 2nd room removed from my card. Thought this was supposed to be a "service industry" ?

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: global2AlbanyNY
Reviews.Content: I spend 60-70 nights on the road. This hotel has some annoying features. Elevators are slow and often under construction. Getting a cup of coffee to go in the morning is a like a part-time job. Takes forever to get your order, then you have to swim through the long line of those waiting for a table for breakfast to reach a cashier who will take your money for grossly overpriced coffee and light breakfast fare (high even for NYC). Much better leaving the hotel and getting breakfast. The bathroom lighting is inadequate, and not designed for female travelers. And of course, typical of many hotels, not enough electric outlets near the nightstands for cell phones that you want to use as an alarm clock. There are much better choices in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TravelWeyes
Reviews.Content: The Hilton NY is in an excellent location for NYC Holiday travel. We were there for a Hilton Club presentation and did not pay the full room rate. We fully enjoyed the experience. MOMA (Museum of Modern Art) is just across the avenue with its wonderful gift store. It is within walking distance of major attractions such as Fifth Avenue store windows, the huge Christmas tree at the skating rink, theater, etc. Lastly, there is a lovely air of adventure and festiveness among the travelers. The hotel itself had very pleasant staff. We were given an early check in. We found the rooms to be of modest size (good for NYC), exceptionally clean and comfortable with excellent bedding and attractive decoration. The full ($35.00) buffet and continental ($19) buffet breakfast was good but extremely expensive. There were also take out options and Starbuck's Cafe.
