This section of NYC is extremely expensive at all times. If you walk a few blocks, you will find more reasonable alternatives. Maid service had one quirk of entering unannounced. I experienced this when I was napping and did not put the privacy bar on so that my husband could re-enter easily. The door opened and awakened me, I saw a figure enter, look at me and heard, "Sorry." I called the desk and they said that it was probably Housekeeping. This of course was a reasonable explanation but not acceptable. My caution is to use the privacy bar when you are in the room. We did not have anything taken.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Babycakesk
Reviews.Content: Was initially concerned about staying here after reading other reviews. My husband is a diamond member @ Hiltons so I was expecting to be pleasantly surprised. & I was! Service great, although the breakfast wasnt great it was nice to have a Starbucks on the premise & you can NOT beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Internet Connection”
Reviews.Author: Claudia23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and reasonably confortable for NYC standard. The location is very good, as it is breakfast. I liked very much the bread! On the bad side, internet connection was terrible. Regardless the option that you select, there were several blackouts and most of the time the internet speed was extremely low (it took hours to download 10 megab). If you need to work using internet, I guess this hotel is not a good option. Also, we used the two tea bags in the rooms the first day, which were not replaced the following days. The heating system is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, clean and comfortable otherwise”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelDude
Reviews.Content: This seems to be the theme for Hilton properties in NYC. Clean and comfortable but the staff just seem to always be too busy with whatever they are doing to help the guests. For example, I watched someone in the "HHonors Diamond" line wait 15 min while the front desk staff chatted idly in the regular line. Just bad customer service in my opinion. Otherwise, it's a hotel in NYC. Small rooms, good location, not really much more to say.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Close to Subway,Attractions and Central Park”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreTuition
Reviews.Content: This Hilton location provided a consistent experience for us as when staying at other Hiltons in major metropolitan cities. There are other hotels in the neighborhood, that are also close to multiple subway lines and Central Park an easy walk away, but the Hilton offers a reliable quiet, clean and less crowded street experience. It is very convenient to the theatre district, Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center and of course Time Square. We arrived late morning and as would be expected, no room was yet available. They stored our luggage for free, we toured around, and they sent a text message when the room was available. It provided us a stress free afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: dfgood1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three night stay in January 2012. The room was small with dated decor, it felt like a nondescript motel room. The bathroom was really old - looking though clean. The only nice thing about the bathroom was a rather funky shower curtain with oversized hoops and a curved rail. The TV was flat screen and a good size. My air conditioning unit started making strange noises at 4am on the last night which woke me and I was unable to get back to sleep. This was dealt with efficiently by staff : I was moved to another room and offered complimentary breakfast and a late checkout for the inconvenience. Breakfast was in The Marketplace, a truly uninspiring place with less atmosphere than an office canteen on a Monday morning. The orange juice was awful and bore a distant relationship to oranges, the selection of fresh fruit was very poor, the cereals were in individually sealed tiny boxes and the supplied bowls were too small. Cereals were eaten with teaspoons, no dessert spoons were supplied. The milk was in an unmarked jug, full-fat, half-fat, who knows? The cooked food was canteen standard. The selection and quality of bread was very poor. The tea consisted of two foil wrapped teabags and a flask of hot water. You would get a better cuppa at a Boyscout camp. This was deplorable for a global hotel brand. I wonder what guests at the Hiton Park Lane in London would say if their tea came in foil wrapped sachets with a flask of hot water ? There was a small area for Japanese style breakfast. The hotel has a good location for tourists. There is a member of staff who stands outside the door all day whose main purpose is to summon taxicabs by blowing lustily and frequently on a loud whistle ! I'm sure a quieter way could be found. Overall barely adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience in the Heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: kimandal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton on 1/18 - 1/20. Excellent service, great accomodations and perfect location. I was attending a conference in the hotel so I was able to experience their banquet services as well as the front desk, bar, restaurant and front desk. The banquet rooms were comfortable and well tended. The front desk was friendly and quick to check us in to the room. The lobby bar was very accomodating more people joined our party and continued to add seats and even created a special drink from a recipe one of us had from a magazine. When we weren't that thrilled with it they replaced it with a diffent drink. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious - both the buffet and ala carte from the menu. The front desk and the concierge gave excellent advice for food and sites. The room - 2125 was recently remodeled with a modern twist. Comfy bed, quite, with king bed, sleeper couch and all the amenities. Finally, I injured my knee and needed a wheelchair and help rescheduling my flight and getting to the airport. I couldn't have asked for more concern and support. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in a heritage building”
Reviews.Author: ferno1302
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience which I will never get in my life time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice for business travel”
Reviews.Author: uncgradincharlotte
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient for business travel. I stayed on the 22nd floor - rooms were spacious for NYC, and looked newly renovated and modern. Precor gym facilities were very nice, and adequately maintained. Would have appreciated a continenatal breakfast for more HHonors members, but this amenity was only availble for Diamond members. Due to the size of the hotel, elevators seeimingly took forever, so be sure to allow for a couple of extra minutes of travel time. Convenient location to Starbucks, nice restaurants, local market, and for entertainment, you can't beat the proximity to Times Square, Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: luvtosing
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton New York on Avenue of the Americas on a number of occasions. It is less expensive than the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, and in a less congested area of New York City. The positives: the rooms are nice and I love the location (close enough to walk to Times Square, but also close to Rockefeller Center, Fifth avenue, etc.) There is something to be said for not hitting a wall of people when you leave your hotel. There are also fun eatery options nearby (Applejack Diner, Ellen's, Magnolia Bakery). Unfortunately, it seems that lately, every time we stay, there is something wrong. A lamp in the room is broken, heat not working properly, fuse blown and no lights in the bathroom, room not stocked with shampoo, etc. Whenever these problems arise, the hotel staff attends to them quickly and with very good customer service. However, at some point the lower price and great location start to be outweighed by the hassle. On our last trip, of note was that it took forever to get an elevator from the club level floors, which was an inconvenience. Valet parking was also a hassle, as drivers have to drive around to the back of the hotel, and the process takes a long time, especially when, for whatever reason, no attendants are around. I think this property is worth a try for the location and price point, but I am hoping that the staff works out all the kinks in the future, as repeated visits have proven that these issues are not one time occurrences.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly for business and stay mostly at Marriott and Hilton properties. I was here for 5 days during the recent NRF show; it was my company's assigned hotel. This hotel is very good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I could hear the person next to me brushing his teeth and other bathroom things. The sound seemed to be coming through the bathroom vent, which I assume is basically just a hole in the wall with the space between the studs as the duct. Now the good news: - The room itself was reasonably quiet. Even though I had a connecting door, no sound or light penetrated it. The walls are not totally soundproof, but they're fine for an old building. - The windows are double pane and adequately sound resistant. I was in a recently remodeled room on the 32nd floor and slept well. The windows also have a section which tips open and closes securely. Drapes were floor to ceiling black-out. - The ventilation system worked quietly and effectively with fan choices of Auto, High, Med, and Low. - Internet was problematic at first, but was fixed quickly and effectively after I called. - The location is close to Times Square, but not right on top of it. - Several good delis, cafes, and food carts within 1 block. - Common area and services: Excellent fitness center; prompt room service; Starbucks on site; carryout food from the lobby level cafe (but you can do better if you walk 200 yards in any direction); reasonable elevator performance; nice lobby; very good service from all employees. I've stayed at most of the major hotels within a 5 block radius of Times Square and would say this one is in the top half.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling lobby, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days while attending a convention and found the stay to be fairly pleasant. The lobby area was always bustling with groups of tourists but not so busy that you could not get around. My room was clean and comfortable and was fairly quiet although you could hear people talking nearby in the morning. There is internet in the rooms for a fee, although it is free in the lobby where you could not possibly work. The restaurant was fairly crowded in the AM but there is a real Starbucks in the hotel that you can also enter from the street. The staff was friendly and let me check in early which was much appreciated. The location is great and close to a lot but not too close to Times Square. Finally, there is an Avis across the street if you need to get a car.

Reviews.Title: “New York city excursion”
Reviews.Author: MJF10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only comfortable , it is centrally located. Rockefeller center, broadway shows, and shopping is walkable to this hotel, The staff is helpful and courteous. If you have the chance to stay on the executive floor, the breakfast and the service and food is very good. Prefer to stay here on trips to N.Y.C,

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong staying at Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter001
Reviews.Content: The best thing of staying at Hilton starts with the reservation process: Quick and easy. I opted for a pre-paid deal with no refunds. Check-in took less than 2 minutes. Room at 14th floor with a nice view and nice furniture. Coffee maker was not working but as soon as I let them know it was promptly changed. I give a 10 + for this hotel, not only because of comfort and great staff but also because the location can't be better (walking distance after a Broadway show and to plenty of restaurants and bars). I have been to this hotel many times and I can't imagine myself in NYC without staying at Hilton. Toiletries are of good brands. I would suggest Hilton provide cotton swabs as well (as almost all good hotels do). A plastic envelope containing 4 cotton swabs daily would be good (this is only a suggestion to improve comfort).

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Surpassed”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel for so many reasons and did not want to leave. Firstly, for those that love mid-town, then this hotel ticks that box perfectly since it is in between Central Park and Times Square, with the 5th Ave shops also right around the corner. Other famous landmarks also surround this hotel within a 10 minute walk radius. More importantly for me, the famous Halal guys corner stand is also across the road, which consistently has queues due to its popularity with locals and tourists alike. The rooms in this hotel were better than expected. We had a king size bed with a sitting area in the room. The sitting area had a lounge and small table, making it a perfect spot to sit back and relax while watching TV. The king size bed was a proper king bed, instead of 2 singles pushed together and was soft and plush making it perfect to crash after our long flight. The room furnishings and bathroom fittings all gave the room a relatively modern feel. Large in-room safe provided, making it easy to store valuables including a laptop. Bathroom was equally spacious, fit for 2 adults to be in there at the same time. Decent amenities provided, although no cotton earbuds. All creature comforts were catered for, such as large flat screen TV, bar fridge, office desk and chair, sufficient wardrobe space and complimentary water on arrival as well. Room service was great in always maintaining a clean room upon our return. The hotel provides free wifi in the lobby area. The gym is large and new. The machines are plentiful and new, making it easy to be able to work out. There are also free weights provided and lots of room for everyone. The pool is also just as good, but too cold for our visit. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Whenever we walked down the corridors, the room service staff always greeted us politely and reception staff were professional and helpful. Concierge was also knowledgable and equally courteous as the other staff. Overall, we were very impressed and more than happy to come back and stay here on our next visit to mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMom123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location, two blocks south of Central Park and two block northeast of Times Square. Standard rooms are small but attractively furnished. We had a room with a view of Central Park. Hotel is large and the lobby is always busy with people coming and going. The staff was friendly and helpful. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good choice for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Beetch
Reviews.Content: The location and service are good and walking distance from all the usual places you'd want to visit. The hotel is always busy and packed and there is a good, lively atmosphere in the lobby. The bars were always busy too with quick table service and a great choice of cocktails. These were pricey but that's what you'd expect in a NY hotel. The room was large and the bathroom a bit on the small side. The minbar is locked and you have to request key at reception. There is no wifi in the room which would have been ideal. The toilet was blocked onthe 1st night and they came and looked at it very quickly. Same thing happened the 2nd night so I was moved to another room and they did not charge me for the 1st night which was very generous of them. The staff are friendly and helpful but you can sometimes wait a long time on reception as they queues are sometimes long. Overall I think the place is good value for money and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More Days Inn than Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sb444
Reviews.Content: The only parts of this hotel that are maintained are the public areas, and the lobby is very nice. The rooms, however, are fairly run down and shabby. Prices are of course high since it's Manhattan and a great location, but just don't expect the usual Hilton quality. The smallest hotel bathroom I'ver ever seen featured a broken hairdryer and someone else's hair in the shower. I would look elsewhere if I needed a hotel in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Rooms, Great Hotel Gym”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in January 2012 for 6 nights for a conference. I travel a lot for business and this hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. Rooms are large for NYC-- clean, spacious, and comfortable. Elevators are quick and fast, even though there is a lot of traffic and many floors. In-room internet worked great and the fitness center (although it cost $14.95 to use) was large, well-equipped, and open 24 hours. Definitely reccomend for business.

Reviews.Title: “Huge business hotel”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat56
Reviews.Content: I have attended many shows at this hotel in 20+ years, but this was the first time I stayed overnight as a guest. The lobby is always packed -- very high energy. The rooms (sleeping area ) are large by NY standards and fairly well appointed (including an in-room coffee maker), although the bathroom is on the small side. Trying to call down on any of the pre-set buttons (like guest services) results in a constant busy signal -- our TV remote did not work, but we had to call the operator to have her locate someone to send a replacement, and although that was done on a timely basis, the person was in such a hurry that he wouldn't even come in or wait til we had tried it before he left. Location is good -- more or less midway between Times Square and Central Park. If you don't mind madhouse crowds or not-too-personal service, this hotel is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Safe area, great breakfast, good location midtown.”
Reviews.Author: KimKuwait
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Service excellent. Breakfast enormous. Love the location. Central Park walking distance, 5th Avenue a block away, great bistro Rue 57 across the street and up one block. Only problem was no free wi-fi and wi-fi charges were really expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.....Loathed it”
Reviews.Author: AussieGaijin
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, had it not been for the excellent location of this hotel, I would have given it a lesser rating. No doubt this hotel has a superb location. Located on the Avenue of Americas, its an easy walk to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue, The Apple Store, Subway Station etc. Taxi's are plentiful if you are not feeling energetic and there is a myriad of food options nearby. The hotel itself is typically Hilton. Large lobby with plenty of traffic. The service is also typically New York (though I would expect a little more from Hilton). Its cold and unwelcoming. Doorman made no attempt to help with luggage from the car on arrival, the front desk clerk was chewing gum and porter service to store luggage just didn't exist. Do not try to check in before the allocated time, you will just be swatted away! The room is also typically Hilton, good size and clean, but a gross lack of equipment. No robe in the room, minibar is locked, no toothbrush etc. The corridors were the biggest let down. Room Service trays left out for 48 hours, housekeeping leaving used linen on the floors of the corridors, poorly maintained with peeling wallpaper and paint and generally a damp smell. Late a night, security was good around the hotel and I liked the fact that you had to show your key to enter the hotel. Overall as I have stated above, the location is fantastic. Its just lacks any finer touches or personal service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: elirnerak
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past several years, always for business. The place is enormous and the rooms are nothing special-- some are a bit more "tired" than others. The in-house restaurants are typical hotel-quality, but of course that is unimportant considering the location and the availability of great restaurants nearby. The hotel air is very dry (like most hotels) so I would suggest bringing along one of those portable travel humidifiers. All of my encounters with staff were very pleasant with the exception of the bell captain who would not allow us to carry our own luggage up to our rooms, a feat that we were more than capable of doing. If you approach by car, it is helpful to know that you can unload and load your luggage directly in the attached garage, rather than waiting for a spot behind a cluster of taxis outside the main entrance.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's eve in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Car23P
Reviews.Content: the location is as good as you can get in NY, between the 53rd and 6th. The room and the bed were small compared to the standards in USA, it was anyhow quite clean, quiet and enough comfortable. The staff was helpful and the concierge helped us book a restaurant on new year's eve very last minute. The hall was often too crowded and too many people sitting on the floor connecting to the internet: this made it look like a train station. We did not try any of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore...”
Reviews.Author: toddie1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a whole back. Excellent location to explore the city. Executive floor a must as has access to executive lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: experto11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very big hotel. The public areas are like a bus station. Avoid to ask for a breakfast, use the menu not special orders. It can cost you a lot....

Reviews.Title: “Just don't try to connect to the internet”
Reviews.Author: santjordi
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property for almost a dozen years of conferences. It is always just what you would expect from a property this size--clean, busy, a little impersonal and often a few minor glitches along the way. Those are all generally minor. I love the midtown location, but hate the prices of local restaurants. What has been consistent is internet connectivity issues. Many years they have brought up a "Bridge" to boost the signal. That never offers much help. Last year and this, I have traveled with just an ipad. Last year wasn't too bad, this year was terrible--literally 3-4 calls a day complaining about not being able to stay connected to the net. I had plenty of signal, I just kept getting dropped. One day they announced there would e no connectivity while they attempted to remodel the system. That didn't make any difference. If connection is important to you as a business traveler, maybe you ought to consider another property

Reviews.Title: “Unique experinace”
Reviews.Author: TShip
Reviews.Content: I stepped into an empty conference room to seek in a peaceful place for a webinair I need to view, and picked up the phone to ask if I could get lunch delivered from service, as a hotel guest. Room service said it was outside of protocol, what they did do was contact Arsen Buneta, Meeting Attendant Supervisor. He came personally to check on me, take my lunch order and deliver it back to me personally. Congratulations staff and organization for taking the imitative to attend to my needs as a guest and client. It's the level of attention and service that will keep me as a Hilton customer.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Brash, good quality Just as you expect a Hilton to be !”
Reviews.Author: TonyMus
Reviews.Content: When taking a cab to the Hilton New York, make sure you tell the Driver exactly which Hilton in New York you want, as we were taken to the wrong one ! Check in was easy and we had a room on the 21st floor which afforded good views. The room was typical Hilton and of a good standard with good floorspace. The Bathroom was the usual half hearted shower over the bath arragement and nothing to get too excited about but in keeping with what you expect from a Hilton. Breakfast was as one would expect; Choice of Express, Contiental or Grand Buffet Evening meal can be taken in the Breakfast room or there is a separate 'A La Carte' place to eat, which is good, but not brilliant. When you book a room at $289.00 watch out for the additions: State Room Tax $25.65, Room Occupancy Tax $16.98, City Tax $2.00 and finally Javits CTR Fee $1.50 (whatever that is ) All in all, we had nothig to moan about but likewise,we had nothing to rave about during our 2 night stay.As the title says....Just as you expect a Hilton to be !

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmathis00
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a very busy Sunday-before-Christmas. The room was certainly above average as far as amenities, as well as square footage. After our first venture out, it was apparent what a wonderful location we had. We made our way to Central Park and Times Square in no time. All employees of the hotel that we encountered were very polite and helpful. This is an excellent hotel for a quick (or extended) stay in the city for seeing the sights and wonderful exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: EMTConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I experienced a one night stay at the massive New York Hilton (Avenue of the America's between 53rd and 54th streets in early January 2012. I have stayed here previously. If you bring a vehicle as I did, you must enter the parking garage on 53rd street(which runs west). You when you drive up to the main entrance of the hotel on Avenue of the America's, you are advised to head to the garage rather than have a valet take the vehicle, which is a little bit of a pain. The hotel, which has almost 2000 rooms, has a huge lobby with virtually no where to sit down. So, in a part of the lobby near the shops, bar and restaurant, there are always dozens of people, mostly teenagers, etc.. sitting on the floor, backs up against the wall with their tablets and laptops accessing the free WiFi. The Hilton charges for in room access. I used my Hilton points (on special) for my stay and had a room on the 18th floor. The room was nice, nothing special, with a very small bathroom. I was surprised that the carpeting in the room was almost worn through in several places, mainly where the desk chair is. This should be replaced and not be found at a hotel, especially of this caliber and price range. I was also surprised that the in room coffee maker on top of the mini bar was dusty. This turned me off from considering using it as I did not feel that I should have to give it a thorough cleaning. The bedding however was extremely comfortable which is usually the case with Hilton. I had the breakfast buffet in the restaurant in the morning which had the standard offerings. Very expensive, but that is expected, especially in NYC. I needed late checkout which the front desk happily arranged and I was happy about that. So, a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good on a very busy night”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a quick trip to NYC with my family right before New Years. First stay at this Hilton property in the city but location was key. Lobby was hopping due to the holiday week and warm weather but check in was quick and connecting rooms on a high floor were available as requested. Rooms were larger than my typical NYC room (I visit New York about twice a month) and were clean and well lit. Prefer the walk-in shower in my king room over the tub/shower combo in the children's room but both bathrooms were clean with better counter space than the bathrooms at the Waldorf. Big plus for me is that the room was well insulated from both street and neighboring room noise. Beds were very comfortable and wifi was working efficiently. There were some minor issues with the elevators but were handled quickly and graciously by the staff who led our party and several others to the service elevators where we were escorted to the lobby (almost like VIPs :)). Location was perfect for our itinerary. Throughout our stay the staff was always pleasant and approachable -- offering greetings and directions without hesitation. For my business trips I typically prefer a quieter lobby but will definitely keep this hotel at the top of the list when my family goes to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas shopping break”
Reviews.Author: Liralisa
Reviews.Content: Located in a fantastic position, within easy reach of 5th Avenue, Rockerfellar pretty much across the street and Central Park about a 10min walk away. Hotel was v busy as you would imagine at this time of the year but check in was quick and easy. Rooms OK but hotel could probably do with a bit of a facelift, eg some of the wallpaper marked and needed re doing but on the whole OK and didnt bother us too much. Beds very comfortable and our room had huge LCD TV with good selection of channels - perfect when waking up at stupid o clock in the morning with jet lag to watch something, however the room was very small, that small that it only had room for one bedside cabinet on the right hand side. I was quite surprised at the small size of the room as typically everything in the States is normally oversized! By the time you unpack 2 suitacases and your hand luggage, you were pretty much falling over everything to either get into bed or out of the room! I would have probably suggested that this room would have been better laid out as a single room as opposed to a double room to create more space and better guest experience. Overall, we were happy with our choice of hotel, more so because of its central location than anything else as it was within easy reach of most of your main NY sites.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says...”
Reviews.Author: Ade C
Reviews.Content: We went with a Hotel brand name we knew and the location as mentioned in other comments is perfect for Central Park, Times Sq and shopping on 5th Av. Staff at reception were superb and upgraded our room after the first night when we mentioned the constant lift noise. Sadly we had two itmes of clothing go missing from the room which was a suprise, bloody annoying and the reason for the low score. There is so much to do and see, the Hotel is really just a place to sleep and freshen up. Don't limit yourself to eating breakfast here as there are plenty of places that specialise in providing really good food with really good staff.

Reviews.Title: “I love New York!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie G
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York (Avenue of the Americas between 53rd & 54th Streets) is a very large business/convention hotel, but my visits there have always made me HAPPY! The location absolutely could not be better: walk to Central Park, the theatre district, Rockefeller Center, all the great shopping on Fifth Avenue and other nearby streets .... I LOVE THE HILTON NEW YORK, any day of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dawalker05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a quick trip to the city. The hotel is very near Times Square and all of the shows. It is a very large hotel however I thought that Inhira who was the representative that checked me in was great. Really no complaints, a very nice stay close to everything that we needed. Wish that I could stay longer and experience more of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a value!”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5in5states
Reviews.Content: I started to search on-line for 3 night business stay, and this popped up at the beginning for under $200 night. Didn't go further, just booked it. Main-line Hilton cheaper than most lesser chains - I'm in! No, not the St. Regis or Four Seasons, but very nice for what it is. Staff was great, needed late room cleaning, extra coffee, etc., and everything was on-time and the front desk even followed up to be sure and see if I needed anything else. Business center expensive but didn't waste any of my time, and everything was right the first time. Great central location near the subway and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Will definitely give it preference next time!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas treat for the grandchildren”
Reviews.Author: lita_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel in the past-the executive lounge has improved a lot The staff keeps the line moving in the breakfast ares-the coffee;food is always replenished-one can see how the staff work to make it enjoyable-stopping by to say hello-Ms. Amy Moreno needs special mention for making sure that the place runs smoothly-One can see her helping out-getting the tables ready for the next guests and this is done w/a smile We will be back. My grandchildren had a funtime-so did we!I liked the security at night when someone asked for your room key before you are allowed to enter

Reviews.Title: “Typical chain hotel, clean & tidy but soulless”
Reviews.Author: Emmaj78Sussex
Reviews.Content: As we were staying over new year we were limited as to where we could stay, I would not have chosen such a big hotel if we had more options. Having said that it was clean and comfortable and had all the basics you need. In my opinion it lacked atmosphere and was too big but I knew that anyway. Location was good, most things in walking distance but would be better positioned in a street in the 40's but again that's my opinion. If you like the "chain" hotels this will be fine as you know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel lousy food”
Reviews.Author: GourmetWaynePA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the New York Hilton but were very dissapointed at the food in the lobby lounge. Noisy, poor servcice and very modest food. Stay at hotel but do not eat there

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Irishtourist83
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March 2010 for the SES NY conference that was being held in the hotel. The hotel was the perfect base for my needs for the conference and is ideally located for exploring the city. This was my first trip to NY and the location was ideal for seeing some of the city's top attractions- for example Central Park, Rockefeller centre etc etc. As you would expect the rates are expensive but rooms are very good and spacious in my experience. In typical New York fashion there is also a Starbucks on the ground floor!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its brand name”
Reviews.Author: SporeArduino
Reviews.Content: A pleasent stay, good room service, polite staff and great location. Times Square and 5th Avenue is around the corner, and it's ideally located when I visited during Macy's Thanksgiving Parade when all I need to walk down one street. One more tip: if you love hot and Middle eastern fare, check out the Halal Boys. It's a food cart parked next to the Hilton. You can't miss the queue (and the breathtaking smell).

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate stay”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: Reservaion made on booking.com for 5 nights for a one bedroom suite for e nordhausen. Initially was a problem because my passport says nordhausen. Couldn't believe that. Room was on 43rd floor. Black ac and heating vents, carpet sticky, sofa bed not sleepable and had dirty sheets, had to put a towel underneath door because too noisy from air whipping through halls. Thank goodness i brought two comforters for the couch to make a bed for my daughter. We also booked a towncar for the airport via the concierge and it didn't show up. Beds uncomfortable. Housekeeping kept putting my toothbrushes back in bathroom even though i keep them out. Why? Guess it bothered her. Room service was fine and waiters nice even though they were busy. A bit pricey though. Internet doesn't work unless you order premium at $18 and for each device. All this experience for 529/night. If i hadn't have booked a nonrefundable rate i would have been outta there.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton? Just the price is Hilton, rooms are very, very poor”
Reviews.Author: Sebastiaan1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. Loved the city, the location of the Hotel is ideal as well. However that`s about all the positives on this hotel, it`s damp, cramped and made out of cardboard. Bathroom is poor, as are the finishings in the Bathroom with lots of molds. The rooms itself smelled like a dozen of cats used it as a litterbox, it really was beyond poor. The Hotel desperately is in need of a refurb, tearing the place down and rebuilding would be the best as it all is noisy as hell....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Halawis
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, too much wait at the elevators, long hallways. Good breakfast though, ask for a room near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Lobby is nice”
Reviews.Author: Thomas L
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby but then you get in elevator and you end up in an old "best western" style room. Nothing wrong with that as long as you know it upfront and don't pay Hilton price.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC ACCOMMODATION NOTHING SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: Penfroman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before xmas 2011. Fantastic location but this is nothing more than a typical faceless corporate branded hotel, so don't expect the world. Food in the restaurant was overpriced and the service slow. Rooms were rather old and worn, need a refurbish. High noise levels from inconsiderate guests in adjoining rooms, one fighting all night, the other with crying kids. Starbucks was in need of refurb, smelled of mold. No visible security at this hotel, anyone could walk in and around the place, so much for personal safety!

Reviews.Title: “HILTON NEW YORK: Locarion and people”
Reviews.Author: jzkpmd
Reviews.Content: HILTON NEW YORK Â  There are four things I look forward to when I am in a hotel in another country. 1. Location 2. Personnel and service 3. Room and amenities 4. Food and other services Â  The Hilton New York gets my 4 stars for location and personnel/services and 3 stars for the rest. Â  Our hotel was on 6th Ave. and 53rd street - right at the center of things. A few blocks from Central Park, a block away from the shops and sights of 5th Ave. and just a 10 minute brisk walk to the theaters along 42nd - 44th Sts. and 7th avenue. But far enough from the hectic hustle and bustle of the Tie of Broadway. At 6th and 7th avenue, from e Hilton New York, one could access two different subway lines bringing you to different parts of the city. Â  Â Right when you arrive, the hotel personnel make every effort to distinguish themselves ( attentive and courteous) from other hotels' personnel (isn't this the customer service)? DespiteÂ the hectic holidays, the still managed to smile. Despite the fact that we took a broadway.com promo (hotel plus theater show), I didn't feel any discrimination. We were treated as regular paying guests. Â  Â However, the Hilton is a business hotel. Elegant not opulent, classy but not cold. Rooms were 3/5 and I've been in much more better ones but just right enough for a stay in NYC. Our standard double bed room was just right. Mattresses were comfortable and linens were changed everyday on request (environmental concern). Bathroom amenities were of standard fare. Don't intend to open the room fridge and replace what you've gotten as weight sensors automatically charge you once item are removed. I get a USA today. Room service is prompt and the persons answering are helpful and courteous ( very much unlike the European hotels I've stayed at) and this I've got to hand it over to the Americans (at least at the Hilton).Â  Â  Â The only thing at struck me was that, if you looked closely, the paint was peeling off at certain places and some of the Â door edges bear signs of wear and tear. Â  Â There is no free wifi in the rooms. It's a LAN there which you have to pay for. Free wifi is at the lobby and you have to go down for this. Â  Â  Food for breakfast was standard but I think they included some Miso soup and congee for their Asian guests but buffet breakfasts at the Shang ri la in Manila could beat this hands down any day of the week. What the Hilton lacked in food offerings were offset (again) by the head waiters and servers being so attentive and courteous. Â  Â  Will I come back? Yes! I like the Hotel, the people and the location and that's important because I'm sure the rooms are due for renovation and food could be better.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: PeppeKat
Reviews.Content: I loved loved loved staying at this hotel! You are close to all the nice shops on fifth ave, radio city, rockefeller center, central park, st. Patrick's, times square, and some amazing halal cart across the street that is almost always full. I mean what else could you ask for? Big hotel, Starbucks inside, and after a certain time at night they make you show your key to get in. Safe, great location, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-Town Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Knettix
Reviews.Content: One of the most convenient hotels for the sights in Mid-Town! Times square behind the hotel, Fifth Ave & MOMA across the street. Great hotel. I stayed here this June on business and was amazed at the range of sights and destinations within just a few blocks of the hotel. This place is a gem. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: penguinitis
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel. Very nice room, nicely furnished, clean and guest friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pollypManchester
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed in a standard room on the 19th floor from 23rd to 28th December. We had no problem checking in - walked straight up to the desk, no queues for the lifts either. We had a couple of issues with the room - more towels and cups needed and a broken hairdryer- all sorted within 10 minutes. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Can't comment on the restaurants as we ate out - so many places to eat nearby. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Only location is good that's all”
Reviews.Author: Moomeow
Reviews.Content: We were touring around USA for almost a month and stayed at a couple of hotels in few cities. This is what I have to say about Hilton new York: Pros: great location for tourist as it's at the centre of every place of interest. Cons: no matter which level of membership you are either walk in, gold or diamond, no difference. The waiting time for check in counter at hhonors or diamond counter was so much longer than the usual counter. I am a diamond member and believe me this doesn't mean anything at all. Upon check in we asked for a nice room and was told that the room assigned to us was nice. When we walked into the room, to our horror, it was so dim even we switched on all the lights and the bathroom was so pathetic. The furniture was so old that you can smell it. Looks no diff from any 3 star hotel actually. No upgrade at all. So we went down back to the front desk to complain and she gave us a much better renovated room. Still the bathroom is so tiny. Don't understand why she couldn't give us this room from the beginning. Have a feeling that the staff will try their luck to give away the old ugly rooms first and hope the guest will just accept it without any complaint. It's wasting so much of our time on queueing to changing room etc. The hotel is seriously under staffed as we had problem getting through our calls to concierge especially. The lobby was really busy and crazy. Morning breakfast was chaotic and we decided to take away from second day onwards. On check out day, we were being approached by a man before the taxi queue to tell us that we can take his town car to JFK airport at $69 instead of the usual $85 cuz he give special rate to Hilton guest. We were made to understand that was hotel limousine so we took his car. As usual the taxi queue was chaotic. Upon arrival at the airport, he told us that total should be $69+tax+toll fee+20% tipping. We really felt that it was a rip off and the hotel staff should have control over this kind of crooks that hang around and behave like he is from the hotel limousine service. He seemed to know the hotel bell boy well and tipped him when we went into his car. Overall, you should stay in this hotel only for it's location purpose, and don't expect anything else from them. We stayed at hyatt 48 lex at Lexington ave earlier and the service was so much better even though it's a small hotel. Their breakfast is complimentary and it's simple and nice. Room was nicer as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but like staying in Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Diamond member, and stayed in this property from 12/26 - 12/29. This was the holiday week between Christmas and New Year, so maybe this isn't the normal experience. My room was comfortable, clean, and well-maintained. The noise level from people in other rooms is not good. I had to listen to a family fight on one side of me, and crying children on the other. Normally when I sleep you couldn't wake me up with a bomb, but this noise level did. As a Diamond member I was given vouchers for access to the executive level club for free breakfast or coffee from the Starbucks in the lobby. I couldn't use anything because whatever you went to had a line more than 50 people deep. The property itself is pretty good, actually, but the crowds and noisy tourists ruin the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: CJinPA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 4 or 5 times for business & pleasure. Property has great location and decent rooms but is so poorly managed that I'll stay elsewhere. Despite staying on "executive floors" you will have to deal with long lines for skimpy breakfast, understaffed registration desk, out of service elevators, etc. some staffers tried to compensate but it appears mgmt has given up, and the price no longer makes this a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Massive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydCityBoy
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to the Big Apple, and I thought I'd splash out and do it in style. The taxi ride from JFK was filled with excitement and nervousness. This was New York City. I'd been dreaming about coming here since I was watching Sesame Street! There is a flat-rate fee of $45.00 now (excluding tip), from JFK to Manhattan, which was very lucky. I was there right after a public holiday and the traffic was terrible. My driver tells me it would have cost me well over $100 if not for the flat-rate. Phew! Finally, I arrived at the Hilton New York. I was early for check in, and told to check my bags and come back at 12:30 and it should be ready. So I wandered around the surrounding area for about an hour and a half, and boy, was this a good location. Having a great central location and being a 'safe option' were high on the list when doing my research, and the Hilton was a good choice. In that short time while waiting for my room to be ready, I had seen the LOVE sculpture, sussed out where the MoMA was (for another day), ate a pretzel, stumbled upon Radio City Music Hall, which lead me to Rockefeller Centre and the Plaza was all being set up for the winter ice skating, NBC's news studio, the LEGO store, NewsCorp headquarters (in the midst of the phone-hacking scandal, it was a media circus!). I trotted back to the Hilton at exactly 12:30, and the big beaming smile of the lady at the check-in desk ushered me over and had everything ready to go. Such lovely staff, especially for New York. The room was quite small, and was decorated as though I'd stepped back into my grandmothers house, 20 years ago. Very 'old-fashioned' style. Hear me clear, it wasn't old or out-dated, it was just that regal, old-style of decor. Maybe I'm just too young to appreciate it, but it wasn't anything to write home about. The bath was TINY. The water level wasn't even over my legs before the overflow plug was reached. Mini-bar was extortionate. But hey, this is New York City... I wasn't here to sit in the room! Don't you dare get in a taxi from this hotel, unless it's more that a 20 minute walk! I saw so much of the city by walking everywhere. Times Square, Broadway are about 10 minutes walking away, and Central Park about 15. I never ate, drank or ordered room service, so I can't comment. In summary, it was a great experience, it was a huge, busy, grand hotel, in a wonderful location. That being said, I did come across some other hotels on my walking about, that were on my list which were much cheaper, and had just as good a location. Would I return to the Hilton New York? No, I'll be going boutique next time, this old cookie-cutter didn't pull at my heartstrings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, easy walk to Shopping, Shows, and Rockefeller Center”
Reviews.Author: jlm456
Reviews.Content: The New York Hilton on 53rd and 6th, is a great location! The rooms comfortable fit 4 adults, and the bathrooms are complete with Bathtub, shower, single sink, and toilet. they do provide nice bathroom amenities. There are a lot of people in and out of the hotel, so prepare for short lines at check in, taxi line, as well as for the elevator. The lobby bar was great to drink, eat and people watch. the staff was nice and informed. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “See you very soon!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Shaws_Holidays
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in to the minute we checked out we had a very pleasant stay. We stayed on the 39th floor which is the Executive Level. We did however encounter one problem, on our second from last day we had an overflowing toilet and it flooded our room, this is a small problem but it wasnâ€™t dealt with in the best way, I have since then spoken to the Hotel Manager about this issue and he was very fast in getting back to me and have compensated us in a very kind and generous manner. The hotel is lovely, itâ€™s standard to a Hilton, if you have stayed in a Hilton before you will know they all have the same room layout, nice big clean bed, big bright bathroom, lots of storage and a comfortable room to stay in. The room was cleaned well every day, fresh towels and bedding and the bathroom was spotless. We had booked Breakfast on each day we were there but out of 4 we only went once, the queue every morning was very long so we went out to eat, its a very large hotel so booking a time slot for breakfast would be a good thing for the Hilton New York to introduce maybe?! I cannot stress enough how good the location is, it is one avenue from 5th, 3 or 4 blocks from Central Park, 10 minute walk to Broadway and the centre of Times Square. Would I stay in this hotel on my next trip to NYC? Definitely, I wouldnâ€™t pay the extra $30 per person for Breakfast every day though, and I wouldnâ€™t book an Executive Level room again, we found we were always waiting for lifts and out of 6 of them only 3 went to our floor, were out and about all day so we didnâ€™t need this level of room. Thankyou Hilton New York for a very pleasant stay, we will see you very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Tgetg
Reviews.Content: + great location: close to all major tourist attractions + clean rooms: anything else would be disappointing + comfortable beds: you need some good rest to keep up with the pace of the city + iron and board (came in very handy) + sport facilities: my parents were fans, i did not take the opportunity to use them (if you are in NYC go for a run in CP instead) - old room: they have definitely seen better days. Furniture has been chipped here and there - noisy: if you get a room close to an elevator...don't wait, get it changed or ask for one far away from the beginning. Sleep quality would have been excellent if not for the noisy elevator. - pricey: i got invited, but next time i plan to go to NYC, i would imagine there are other places at a better value-to-money ratio

Reviews.Title: “Triplets' first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: tripletsaunt
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days during Christmas week with the fine folks at the Hilton. I took my triplet 14yr old nieces for their first trip to NYC. I have stayed at this hotel many times and chose it for the location to everything we wanted to do for Christmas. I booked 2 rooms due to having 7 people and the front desk was able to put us 3 rooms apart, which made it very convienent. We had a deluxe double room and it honestly looked as if they had just remodeled it. We were on the 14th floor and had no problems with the elevators. There was a line for check-in but that has been the case every time I have stayed here, no matter what time of year. The bathrooms were great, the tub drained and the lighting was fantastic. The room was also very clean and we slept great in those beds. The rooms were a great deal as I had paid $189.00 per night. This was a prepaid special and I always look for these. Please don't overlook this place. The location is the best and the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Large, busy hotel with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Umechan
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant experience at the Hilton New York. Check-in was crowded when we arrived, but the executive floor/Hilton Honors check-in line was shorter and quicker. It was worth the upgrade. All of the employees we encountered were friendly and helpful from reception to the cleaning staff. The hostesses at the executive lounge were particularly friendly and compentent. Our room was comfortable and, although it was not renovated, it was very clean and nicely decorated. Personally, I appreciated the traditional decor b/c it felt more like old NYC. The bathroom is small, but the shower had great water pressure and had plenty of hot water. We had an issue with a broken toilet and they had someone up to fix it within 10 minutes. Couldn't have asked for better service. A special thanks to Kelli for the delicious welcome treats she sent up to our room. They were a great surprise and much appreciated. All in all, we enjoyed the Hilton. The location can't be beat and we had a wonderful Christmastime experience in New York City.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “If you got a good rate ... stay”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo V
Reviews.Content: It's a very good hotel, well placed , VERY BIG ! The location of the hotel was good and close to Central Park, Times Square and many of the big shopping centres. The room service is not 24 hours . good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Spuriosity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton when we visited New York for the first time for a long weekend. The location of the hotel was good and close to Central Park, Times Square and many of the big shopping centres. As we checked in, we were greeted with really friendly staff such as the security guards who stopped to chat and recognised us as we came in and out. The room was nice and modern, although we didn't spend much time in there. While we were in the room, we'd like to have used the wifi provided in order to research where to visit next, however we would have had to pay $14 a day for the privilege. No thanks! There was a safe in the room to contain your valuables, however the safe itself wasn't attached so someone could just walk off with it! The main vice we had with the hotel was the fact that we were in a room that was adjacent to one of the lift shafts and made our room extremely noisy and busy. We were in room 1501 (15th floor) and any rooms directly above us would have been affected in the same way. There were separate lifts that serviced the floors 1-15 so I can imagine rooms adjacent to those were in a similar predicament. Overall, despite our short stay in the hotel, it was pleasant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Hilton New York will change your reservation without telling you.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler1944
Reviews.Content: This morning I booked a room at the New York Hilton for three nights and received a confirmation with a stipulated price in my email. Tonight I just happened to look at my online account to see what the reservation said only to find that the same reservation had been upgraded without my knowledge and the price had been increased!!! At no time did anyone at the Hilton system notify me of the change. I appreciated the upgrade but not the rate change... even though it wasn't excessive. It should be noted that I also never requested or approved an upgrade. I would think that if the Hilton is going to upgrade without a request that that upgrade should not result in a price increase. I canceled my reservation after notifying the reservations desk as to why, and will very possibly never consider making another reservation here. I should also state that I have never seen this happen at any other Hilton hotel I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Great Location, Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fl_mermaid
Reviews.Content: My uncle and I stayed at the Hilton New York Dec. 16-20...four nights in all. I cannot say enough about this hotel--from start to finish, the staff went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied. When I made reservations online a couple of months ago, I requested a refrigerator in our room for medicine. When we checked in, the clerk noted that request and told us that our refrigerator was already in the room. We got to our room, and it wasn't there, so I called down. The customer service agent was most apologetic and said the refrigerator would be there in a matter of minutes. He called again in five minutes to check, and I told him that it had not arrived. He apologized profusely, then told me it would be there ASAP. It was there momentarily, and the young man who installed it was most polite. We received another called within 5 minutes, checking to see if the refrigerator was there yet. I'd say this all transpired within 15 minutes of our checkin. We were given a handicapped accessible room (although we didn't request one) on the 10th floor. The bathroom was a little larger than in standard rooms (I had stayed in this hotel before). Our room contained two double beds and was plenty large enough for the two of us. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's on 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) between 53rd and 54th street. Radio City is two blocks away. Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral are just a few blocks away as well. There are two subway stations on 7th Avenue and 53rd, which was very convenient. Broadway and Times Square are closeby, as is Central Park. Again, you couldn't ask for a better location!! Neat factoid: the Ziegfeld Theatre is right next door on 54th Street. It is an old-time movie theater, and while we were there, Tom Cruise's new "Mission Impossible" movie premiered there....red carpet, tv crews, papparazzi, etc. From what I've read, seeing a movie at this theatre is a real treat, although we didn't have time to do that. Maybe our next trip!! The one downside to this hotel is its bar. We were looking to have nice cocktails in an upscale atmosphere during our trip. One night, The Bridge Bar was not even open, only the Lobby Bar, which is where we went. We were NOT impressed with the selection of cocktails or the quality of them. The following night, The Bridge Bar was open, but it was the same menu...so we left and walked up 54th to The London hotel, where we had our nice cocktails in a great place....but the lounges were the only blip on our otherwise fantastic stay at this hotel. Also, next door on 53rd, there is a deli that is open 24 hours--it has really good prices and good food. We used it several times....and there is also a food cart that had a long line non-stop...from what I've read it's fairly famous. Here's a word of advice: check the room prices occasionally after you book. The hotel is not cheap--we paid $369 a night for a deluxe room. I originally booked in Sept. for $419 a night, but checked Hilton's website from time to time. About a month before our trip, I saw the price of our room had gone down $50 a night, so I book the new room and cancelled the old one, for a savings of $200 overall.... Again, the hotel is beautiful, has an excellent location, and a very helpful staff. The rooms are clean and nice, and overall, we found this hotel to be wonderful. I'd highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location, the rest is very average”
Reviews.Author: BuddyDoogie
Reviews.Content: The location is perfection, the rooms are not. Peeling wallpaper, cruddy shower, old carpets are what greet you in the hallways and in your room - not what you should expect from a hotel with prices above $300 per night. The room termperature was never right and the elevators are so slow that the rumor on our floor was that if you walked down one flight via the fire escape stairs, you could catch another bank of elevators - we did that a couple of times and it was much faster. But not a good idea when you had luggage or packages. Room cleanliness was fine, but saw the same trash in the hall the entire 4 days we were there - someone is not paying attention. We have stayed here multiple times, this time for a dose of New York during the holidays, and come back for the location and because we are loyal to Hilton points.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: pdr123
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Hilton are really big (for New York). If you are needing to share a room, this is the place to stay, given the room size. I stayed on the Executive Floor. The lounge has great views and is a really nice place to unwind after a busy day in the City and before heading out to dinner. I would not recommend the breakfast due to the cost. However, with this great location, there are many great breakfast spots really close!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: travelsmitty
Reviews.Content: I just returned from one of several stays in the past few years at the New York Hilton, and my first stay at Christmas time. It's a typical large and busy chain hotel, but the location is very convenient for the best of the city. Radio City Music Hall is in the next block and Rockefeller Center is very close. I didn't try the MarketPlace Restaurant or the fitness center, but the Starbucks inside the hotel was very convenient (to reach it, walk to the back of the hotel and go straight through the MarketPlace). There's also a convenience store across the street from the Starbucks entrance that has a small hot buffet, sandwiches, bottled drinks, etc. that could be a reasonably priced meal option. Be sure to pick up a delicious cupcake from Magnolia Bakery, in the block that's just past Radio City Music Hall! The Hilton New York is very clean (yes, I'm picky), the maids are friendly, and it's a convenient best-bet when staying in NYC. It was a great plus to snag this room on the Hilton website at the nonrefundable, prepaid rate of less than $200 per night. Can't beat that during the busy holiday season!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton NY, rather the Double Tree!!”
Reviews.Author: Syksey99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton whilst on a recent business trip to New York, and i was not taken by this particular Hilton offering. The staff seemed disinterested in your needs, as if wating for someone rich and famous to walk through the door offering them a bed of peacocks to lay on whilst they peeled a grape and stroked their foreheads. The rooms were nice, but not overly exciting, especially for the price. It was a pleasant experience at the Hilton, but it should be more than that, i should have the WOW factor you really expect from the Hilton NY. I stayed at the Double Tree Hilton in the Financial District a few weeks later, and comparibly it was a better experience than its more expensive and stuck up relation!!

Reviews.Title: “great location - nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ltomte
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 days in this nice hotel. Location is great - right off Time Square, many dining options at walking distance (we didnt try the hotel's restaurant though). The gym is small but always empty (open at 6 but they will let you in earlier if you ask). The staff was helpful and our room was nice and clean (higher the better - ask for one on the street side)

Reviews.Title: “Location was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LisaThib
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of it all. We were able to walk to just about everything we wanted to see. The rooms were regular size and housekeeping was very good. Room service came quickly also. One negative was dining. The MarketPlace prices were ridiculous. Breakfast was $35 for American $25 for Continental with only a fees la carte items. A family of 5 would not be able to eat breakfast for less than $150. I would suggest staying here but not eating here as there are many inexpensive and good restaurants in the area. Bistro Milano is a short block away and is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: KDHSc
Reviews.Content: Great place that is very convenient to just about everything. Hotel staff was quick with service, extremely polite, and concierge was very helpful. Comfy bed, great pillows, and a shower big enough for 2. We were on the 29th Floor so we had a limited view, but it was still nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “A Step Up In Class”
Reviews.Author: meanguitar
Reviews.Content: We stayed At the Hilton New York ( Ave of the Americas and 53'rd ) Dec 2011. I am always looking for a goog NYC hotel. We stay in the city as often as we can. There have been some clunkers and some finds. We would not have even considered this hotel, due to its normal rates, but we saw an online offer for $169/nite pre-pay, and NO cancellation. We stayed two nites and thoroughly enjoyed the city at holiday time. Parking is a left turn off 6th ave (ave of the Americas) onto 53rd...go half a block to the parking garage on right.rate per nite as of this review was $51...average for the city. if you can, do as we did and drag your bags around to the front entrance to check in...this saves the hassle of a crowded curbside scene. easy check in was followed by a nice room above the 22nd floor (highly recommend this for quiet). For an NYC room, this was a spacious two double bed affair. Outside of NYC hotel rooms being too noisey, this is my second pet peeve...too tiny. So far , we were relieved on both counts. Bathroom was typical older New York: pedestal sink, lots of tile, combo tub/shower,decent room for one person at a time. Hot water was Always HOT! some other hotels, you get tepid water by 9am. Plenty of towels, non smelly soap and shampoo, thank God. The bar downstairs is very large and well appointed. We did not try the restaurant. Front desk area was huge and always busy, but well staffed. The location has been admired by other reviewers...I agree. Clean? As a whistle! A Quiet and roomy stay in the best city in the world? I'll be looking out for future specials.

Reviews.Title: “Holidays at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KarenKatz
Reviews.Content: Dear Ms. Cahill: My family recently stayed at the New York Hilton. We had an amazing time both in the hotel and out. The accommodations were amazing, warmand comfortable. The service was impeccable. From the executive lounge staff, to housekeeping; from the front desk (love that you let the pregnant women who work there sit down) to the parking attendants, we were treated warmly and courteously. We have been visiting your hotel for about ten years now, myself dovetailing the weekend stay with the Symposium Medicus conferences that you allow to be held there during the holiday season. I love that I can combine professional needs with an amazing hotel stay in mid-town Manhattan. The proximity of mid-town, Central Park and Rockefeller Center only heightened the excitement and fun. The New York Hilton has become (for one weekend a year) our New York home and we feel so "at home" when we stay there. Thanks for the classiness, the comfort and the attention to detail. We look forward to many more visits! Oh, and thanks for letting us bring our schnauzer with us..she is family too!

Reviews.Title: “No hassles , good family stay”
Reviews.Author: tarapatiki
Reviews.Content: We came here as a family of 5 adults and 2 children. We had requested early check in and got it for one out of our three rooms. That was Ok since the rest of our group could put their stuff in our room and relax a bit before 3pm check in. Desk clerk found us three rooms on 10th floor. All rooms modern, well appointed, clean. Noise from street not bad. One of our towels appeared to be used and stained and then hung up neatly by previous occupants. This has happened to me before with another hotel chain. I think cleaning staff must be given instructions to only change towels left on the floor . Room service was good and reasonable by NY standards. We went to Starbucks for breakfast and also W53rd Gourmet Deli. Marketplace restUrant inside hotel too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveler22
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in NYC and stayed 3 nights at the Hilton New York. The location is perfect! Centrally located between Central Park, Time Square, Rockefeller and easy access to the Subway! The concierge gave great recommendations!! The rooms were much larger than expected and clean. Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BrianFSU
Reviews.Content: If you are in NYC arou d the holidays and want a spot near Rockefeller, great dining, and central park...this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Kiwilisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton as it was the venue for a conference. It's definitely a great location, so convenient for sight-seeing, but as other reviewers have suggested, it is in need of refurbishment. We upgraded to the 36th floor, in an effort to keep the noise to a minimum. Our room was very tired, and not what we expected from the previous Hilton we have stayed in (Toronto). Our ceiling had a large crack over our bed and wallpaper was peeling off in the bathroom. The shower was barely hot on the highest setting. We paid for the most expensive wi-fi, which would apparently allow lots of downloading to occur. We didn't want to download anything, but the basic wifi wouldn't allow us to Skype without cutting out. Even the more expensive wifi froze repeatedly, requiring one to turn it off and then on again. Surprisingly, given this, the wifi in the conference rooms was excellent. Check-in was easy. Cleaning staff were excellent and bathroom supplies were replenished regularly. The foyer was usually packed and could be difficult to negotiate. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants, so can't comment. I would agree with other reviews concerning the lifts. Sometimes very long waits - the executive floors I think can run an "express" mode, which seems to account for the lifts bypassing our floor, despite the fact that we could hear them going past. If I was to go back to NYC, I think I would look out for another hotel, even if the Hilton was a conference venue.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: phoenixmarcus
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here right now in room 2115. We are part of the big group from MIT. I found the check in too long. We were in the queue for 15 mins. Considering the school had 100 rooms booked they could have done a group check in. The room was dirty with hair in the bathroom and on the bed. The desk chair had torn and worn out leather. The bathroom tap is leaking. It did not give me a feeling of being a hygienic place. For the money they are charging its a rip off. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy - staff up to the task”
Reviews.Author: juninho_d
Reviews.Content: This is a very busy hotel.. There should ne no surprise there, it's a large hotel with conference facilities that is centrally located in Manhattan.. it's going to be busy, isn't it.. The good news is that the staff and facilities seem up to the task.. (with a few exceptions).. My room was on a renovated floor and, I had to say, I was impressed. The renovation certainly seems to have given the hotel some really nice rooms.. A little on the snug side, compared to some in other cities, but not small, and with good facilities.. I had a large bed and a nice sofa to relax on.. Other members of my family on the executive floor certainly considered my room to be superior to theirs (old style) on that floor.. This may have changed, now.. The breakfast room was busy, busy, busy.. but we never waited more than a minute or so to be seated and the buffet had plenty of variety.. hot and cold.. One niggle was that the elevators get very busy. There was a conference on when I was there and this seemed to mean that peak time traffic caused quite a considerable wait for an elevator.. Everything else just seems to work OK.. You will queue for a cab, for instance, but you'll get one.. Busy.. yes.. efficient.. yes.. The location is great for the mid town sights/attractions, most of which are within walking distance..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!! Very disappointed at our very first step”
Reviews.Author: fOifOn
Reviews.Content: We are on holiday for the first time in nyc and just checked in last night. We got a very bad impression on staffs here. My dad normally stays a lot at Hilton on business trip in other countries. And he told the front desk that he was the Hilton member. She replied with an unfriendly look down kind of face that he was just a beginner of the programme, not a gold member, he had no privilege on that and blah blah blah (couldn't she tell us nicely?). When we got into our room, the mini bar was locked. We came down about to go out and asked why it was locked at the conceirge, who were trying to help. While waiting for the key, being around 5-10 meters away from the front desk, the front desk shouted to call us and raised the minibar key then just left it on the table and walked away with no explanation. Around 8-9 in the morning, the housekeeper knocked on the door very loudly to give us the newspaper. We have stayed at Hilton in other places and the service were ok, except Hilton New York. Very disappointing. The service is definitely not a 4-5 stars hotel. I will be stay here more 3 more nights and wish I could move :(

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Anthonyuk26
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hilton hotel in New York. I have to say this was my first time in New York and found the location of the hotel to be fantastic. You are just a 5 minute walk from central park and all of the places you want to visit are in walking distance or near a subway connection. Our bedroom was to a high standard with a view overlooking the New York skyline, all the usual facilities that you would expect to find in hotel rooms were there with coffee machines etc. The service in the hotel was very good as well. While we were there the hotel had some very large functions and conferences on but don't let this put you off. The hotel is very large but i would say you have to expect that in the states. Breakfast was ok, I would advise to get an early start as the que can be long once you get past 9am. We spoke to the concierge team a few times about different restaurants and places to visit and each time they booked what we wanted and left a message in the room. All in all, like I said this was my first time in New York and thought the whole holiday from start to finish was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel but be aware that this is a very large hotel and can get very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... questionable services”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms themselves are ok - nothing special and bathrooms are aged. The facilities of the hotel are questionable - the breakfast is vastly overpriced even for New York and the bars are characterless. The elevators are very slow and crowded. The gym is ok, but there is an extra charge for this (unless you're a Hilton-Honors member) - fairly cheap to pay for a gym in a $400/night hotel room! I continue to stay here as it's very close to our NY offfice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get connecting rooms!”
Reviews.Author: empty186
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for the week of Thanksgiving, very busy as all the kids were there for the Macy's Parade down 7th Avenue. Lovely atmosphere. Location - Fantastic. Between 6 and 7 avenues Midtown West, everything within easy reach. Staff were great - Concierge ladies especially. Initially I was given a room with connecting door to another room. Considerable gap under the door as well as not being particularly soundproof! (Not Nice) After 2 days of very intrusive noise I contacted the Frontdesk staff who changed the room with no issues. One major issue I had however, while I'm aware that it was a very very busy period There were two (2) separate occasions where room service plates and foodstuffs were allowed to sit in the hallway for over 24 hours. There is NO excuse for this. I saw plenty of staff ignore the items as they went about their other business. Now this may have been a floor supervisors issue but the housekeeping staff on my original floor were stacking dirty linen in piles against the walls in the corridors! As I said, I know it was busy but come on..... All in all however, a great spot if you're doing the tourist thing.

Reviews.Title: “Average!”
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past few years for a conference. This time, the front desk staff attitude was slightly better than the previous years, but don't expect them to be super welcoming. They are cold, and do the bare minimum of what they need to do. The rooms are ok, nothing too fancy, and relatively clean. For $500+/night, you get the room and nothing else. We got one newspaper for the four nights we stayed. There is no WiFi in the rooms. They charge you extra $15 per day for WiFi. Seriously? I guess Hilton hasn't realized it is almost 2012 and WiFi is really available for free everywhere else. You can access WiFi in the lobby free of charge, but there is no place to sit in the lobby. There is a starbucks in the hotel, but unlike other starbucks don't offer WiFi (I guess the hotel doesn't let them)!!! Oh, and the HHonners...really, you get nothing for it unless you are a diamond member. Hotel location is great. But, if it wasn't for the conference, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: livinlyf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hilton, New York during our week-long holiday in NYC and it did not disappoint! The hotel is clean, rooms very spacious and close to many 'tourist spots' ie. Radio City, Rockefeller, Central Park. The only down-fall was the check-in, we didn't get checked in until about 8:30pm. The hotel was very busy at the time with lots of group bookings and being the stage for International Emmys. The front desk compensated for a free drinks voucher and other perks. That was nice. All in all, we will stay at this hotel again if we are back in the vibrant city of New York!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
