Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy reach of all those sights you want to see, just a few blocks away from Central Park, enable you to get away from the hustle and bustle of this busy city. A short walk from Times Square and the many theatres and restaurants. This hotel was clean, smart and well presented. We stayed on one of the 'Executive' floors, so were up high enough to be detached from some of the noise of the city, which may be evident on the lower floors. Had breakfast in this hotel, which was excellent, didn't have any other meals here, as we were out and about and with the myriad of restaurants available, didn't see the need. To sum it all up, I'd certainly stay here again, a first class hotel, ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Cant be wrong”
Reviews.Author: ContingencyPlan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton this November - Thanksgiving Day parade was underway 1 block away. Awesome weather, great location what can go wrong? If you stay at the Hilton, not muchâ€¦ I was upgraded to top floor, got free executive lounge entrance. If only the upper floors elevators were OK, it was perfect. The way they were Ill give it a 9.7 out of 10. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad value for price.”
Reviews.Author: rachsticle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located near Rockefeller Plaza. It is a very large hotel, and very crowded. The front lobby is very much a like a zoo. The elevators are crowded and there was always a long line for the elevators. The rooms were very small and the wallpaper was dirty and torn. I think that for 529 a night, this hotel should be a lot better. It is also very loud. We were on the 32nd floor and we could hear everything on the streets below, as well as everything in the next room. I also think a $25 wireless charge is excessive given the price you pay for the room. I won't be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but nickel and dime”
Reviews.Author: flygirlpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, close to a lot of the must see sights for the holidays, and the rooms were really nice, but the employees didn't make it nice. The front office staff were unhelpful, grouchy, not service oriented, and they don't go out of their way to make it special. The biggest disappointment was the breakfast staff. I am a diamond member, had a free 19.00 coupon for breakfast, and our waiter charged us each for the full buffet which is 30.00, because I had one piece of cheese, and my Dad had a piece of bacon. So, even though I only had a bagel and a piece of cheese, and my Dad had a bagel and a piece of bacon, we got charged an extra 22.00. Seriously? It is a huge shame, because the hotel is lovely, but next time I will remember the cheapness, and not the beauty. Who wants to stay at a place like this? Not me...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing accomodations, only saving grace was the location”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently here due to a conference with family. Booked an executive double room where the wallpaper was peeling in several places, the bathroom ceiling looked like it was going to collapse over the shower with plaster hanging odd the ceiling. My wife did not want to go near the window sill and forbade the kids to look out the window as it looked like it not been cleaned in decades and she was worried about the possibility of mold present. I understand it is a large and busy hotel, but we had to take a service elevator with other patrons as we waited over 15 minutes for an elevator on Sunday prior to check out. When served lunch at the conference, I had ravioli sauce spilled over me by the server who did not even apologize. Zip-Out checkout did not work as I decided to verify with the front desk if it had work, and not to my surprise was told that it had not worked. On the positive side: beds were comfortable. Executive lounge staff were friendly. Location very convenient For the price of $569 a night, one would expect a room that did not look akin to something you would find in a much lesser brand establishment. Obviously, the recent multimillion renovation did not include my room on the 36th floor. Will be looking for other brands next time in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hilton in the City”
Reviews.Author: pdbCapeMayNJ
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at this Hilton hotel because it is just a few blocks from Radio City Music Hall. In fact the hotel is a short walk to Central Park, Rock Center, Time Square, and some of the best shopping in the city. The hotel is big and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Parking was very easy and secure. The lounge bar and Bridges bar were great for a cocktail and chips after a day of shopping and sightseeing. I was very impressed and will stay here from now on when visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not very impressed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MitchellSeattle
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on the executive level. $539/night plus fees and taxes. Separate check in was taking far too long since one person was using it as the concierge. I went to the regular check in and it was much quicker although the person checking me in seemed as if I was a bother and she would rather be someplace else. The executive level is not worth the extra cost. I did not know if the hotel offered room service or had a restaurant as there was no book or binder in the room with such information. They charge extra for the fitness center, and $3.50 to hold luggage. This seems petty and unnecessary. Hotel was clean and my room was in good order. Shower had good pressure and never ran out of hot water. Bathroom is small. HVAC worked just fine and kept a steady setting. Bar was ok but expensive. $9 for a draft beer with stale potato chips. For the price charged, this was not a good value as the hotel and my room were just average. Much better value at other properties in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at New York Hilton”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a Saturday night (Dec. 3) with family to see the Radio City Xmas show. Check in was fast and efficient, and we were given a large 20th-floor corner room with two doubles and views of both Sixth Ave. and 54th Street, including a nice view of Radio City. The room was spotless, and the bathroom was smallish but clean and serviceable with good water pressure. Didn't use any bars or restaurants so cannot comment on those, but -- as others have mentioned here -- you really cannot beat the location of this hotel, in the center of midtown and close to everything. Was it crowded? Sure, it's Christmastime! Nonetheless, I would enthusiastically recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Turned Out To be The perfect Place for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy J
Reviews.Content: I checke into this hotel 3 days before Christmas of 2009. I thought my holiday was goin to be uined, but was I wrong. I had dinner in the lobby , which was great and they have chicken pot pie that is to die for. The rooms itself are very overrated. I was a little dispointed, but eveything turned out to be great so excused it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: irwins0001
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at this hotel. The location is great. The staff were always smiling and were very helpful. Cabs were easy to get. Bars were nice. The room was a nice size, but furniture, carpet, wallpaper, etc. needs updating. TVs are modern flat screens. The hotel is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for visting the City”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: For $330 a night we found this hotel to be worth the $$$. We've heard about small hotel rooms in NYC. Not here. Our room, on 30th floor was average hotel room size. Bathroom clean. Room seems updated with great large flat screen with HBO. Could hear street noise but did not keep us up at night. Elevators were efficient. Service when checking in was great. Great location to Times Square, Rock Center, Central Park, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Erik B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night in the city to celebrate our anniversary. The room was great (seemed new or recently updated) and the service terrific. I had champagne and chocolates waiting in the room and we did room service in the morning. Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton NY Avenues of America”
Reviews.Author: RichieBarbara
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Hilton in NY for the past 8 years on our yearly visits to the city. The hotel rooms are becoming tired and are in need of some cleanup. Peeling wallpaper. Stay away from the executive rooms.We had a hard time getting an elevator as there are only 3 servicing the upper floors. Other than that, great location and good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, great rooms. Room service a problem.”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticJohn
Reviews.Content: Travelled to New York with my future wife in late June 2010 to attend the marriage of a friend. My wife had stayed here before and she thought we could spare ourselves the trouble of looking for another hotel - she thought this was perfectly adequate. She was right! Although the hotel is huge and rather impersonal, the rooms are worth it, they are particularly spacious and comfortable. Location is also great, not far from Moma, Times Square, great shops and the Central Park. One minor problem is the lack of room service during the night - something that surprised us very much. We had to order something from outside and have it delivered at the reception downstairs. Breakfast was also nothing worth mentioning and overpriced. However we were pleased with our stay and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world service”
Reviews.Author: megan e
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay,the room and the bed was comfortable,great location the staff were very helpful I intend staying here on my next business trip to Newyork

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: EnglandJa
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the hotel is very well placed. But there are not enough lifts and the rooms and corridors need refurbishment. As an honours diamond member I was surprised to have to pay for baggage check in for 2 hours. The executive lounge is fairly small and drinks are not complimentary. The front desk staff do not smile. They are not particularlly helpful. There are very few chairs in the lobby and the bar staff wil move you on if you sit in the bar without a drink waiting for a taxi irrespective of whether the bar is busy or not. My first experience of an American hilton - not a patch on London hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Sela9
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after Thanksgiving day to celebrate my husband's return from Iraq and our stay at the Hilton was not enjoyable at all. I am a Hilton Honors member and the rooms were very small. The location is a great location in NYC, however, we were a party of 3 and when we checked in, there were no linens for the bed including the sofa bed. Plus dirty cups and forks were left behind and the coffee/drinks area was empty. I had to call them 3 times to bring the necessary items to our room. We stayed at a King Deluxe and to my surprise it was no "deluxe". After checking out and proceeded to the hotel's parking garage, it took an hour to pick up our car. Very unorganized. No communication between the workers. After this experience, we will not return to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: annedr
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this Hilton. We were able to obtain a great rate on Hilton site. We got to stay on the Executive level that included both breakfast as well as appeitizers in evening. Our room was well appointed, clean and comfortable. Location was close to Radio City where we had tickets to Christmas show.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Crowded Lobby”
Reviews.Author: BfloRef
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night on HHpoints over Thanksgiving weekend. While the location is wonderful, the management of crowds was poor. When checking in, a staff member in the entranceway looked at me with a puzzled look as we removed our bags from a taxi. The check-in/out line was quite long - even using the Hilton Diamond area, I waited for close to 15 mins to check out. The Executive lounge was crowded and to capacity both in the evening and in the morning. The room was nice size and comfortable. The location is nice close to 5th Ave shopping, Central Park and Times Sq/Theater Dist.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving trip”
Reviews.Author: Courtney S
Reviews.Content: The room was decent, but small on many accounts. The bathtub was scratched up in many spots and my poor husband had to duck ever time he took a shower since the ceilings were so low and the air vent was right above the shower head. When my husband used the bathroom for the first time the toilet would not flush at all. He quickly fixed it, but a hotel like this shouldn't have problems like this. We also had issues with a maid coming into our room while we were getting changed. They were very prompt to check us in, but only informed us where the elevator was and nothing else. We had issues with the elevator due to mass amount of people staying for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade (a large amount of the group was from the Spirit of America). Understandable during this time of the year, so we asked about using the stairs, which took us three people to help us find them and then come to find out the door was locked down in the lobby. Frustrated we went and waited for an elevator to come, which took about 20 minutes with the large crowds. What irritated us is that when we went to print our boarding passes we had to pay $10 to use the internet in the business center and then pay $1 per each page we printed. Yet the receipt that printed out after our boarding passes was free. One would think with the price you pay for the room the internet...or at least printing would be free. At the end of the day, the next time I come to New York City I wouldn't stay here at all. Over priced tiny rooms that need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Kincaid3580
Reviews.Content: I stay here and the Doubletree Suites in Times Square most often when I am in NYC on business (depending on availability). This is my "home" hotel. I even purchased a Hilton Time Share here 5 years ago because I loved the location. This is a great Hilton property. The rooms, depending on location can be roomy or on the small side. The Hilton Club floors are the best and while you must reserve them through Hilton Club they are the creme de la creme of rooms, but I digress. This is a prime people watching location as well. The lobby is always bustling with so many different people of all kinds and I can sit here for hours and just people watch. The restaurant is great in the mornings with the buffet AND they have a Starbucks attached to the hotel which is a huge plus for a coffee drinker like me. The hotel is minutes away from theaters, Times Square, great restaurants, and other quintessential NYC sights. The rooms can be on the expensive side, but, this is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Adult44
Reviews.Content: Yes, I get it. I'm in New York City and everything is expensive. But by the same token, there should be pride in your product. The Hilton NYC is lazy. It's a souless, train terminal of a hotel with worse-than-dial-up wireless internet and a bed much less comfortable than the one in the Hampton Inn at Laguardia I'd stayed in the night before for 1/3 the price. This hotel may have location, location, location, but it doesn't offer comfort, connectivity or caring as illustrated when I wrote to Hilton about the sub-par beds. I got a nice note from the Hampton Inn but deafening silence from the New York Hilton. Ernestine must work in PR here, "We don't care, we don't have to."

Reviews.Title: “Extremely busy!”
Reviews.Author: sobearies
Reviews.Content: It's actually stressful to walk through the lobby. A lot of people in an out. A fellow reviewer nailed it when describing the lobby as being "in the middle of a crwoded subway station". There were always a lot of smokers outside the hotel. The bellhops blowing their whistle excessively. The hotel is way to big and the elevators are insuficient. Very long wait each trip. Our room was very small. The staff, however, was very friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Hilton, 42nd between 7th and 8th. We were offered an upgrade at the desk and took it, 44th floor fabulous view. Staff so friendly wished we could have stayed longer. Don't be put off with the constuction - the street is staffed with bellmen who direct you to the lobby on 23 rd floor. Really nice holiday decorations. Rooms super clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded and noisy; a dissapointing experience”
Reviews.Author: AJS-NY
Reviews.Content: My recent stay was less than plaesant. I guess if you like to feel you are in the middle of a crowded subway station, this is the place for you. The lobby is massive and always crowded providing a less than intimate atmosphere. I must say that the staff is very professional and the place is clean but at $265 a night one would expect a room without peeling paint in the ceiling. Beware of the parking fees as well. Paid $79 for 25 1/2 hours of parking. Next time I think I will not be staying at the NY Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing that this hotel has going for it is the name... Hilton and that's not going to be enough to trick me again in the”
Reviews.Author: phlojo
Reviews.Content: Let me try to be as brief as I can. We reserved guest rooms and conference rooms in this hotel because we assumed the Hilton brand is one you can't go wrong with. Man oh man, were we wrong. We canceled half of our meetings in the hotel because these people just couldn't get it together. No white board until hours later, even though it was ordered as part of the reservation. The room was freezing cold and it took countless phone calls and random personnel visits for that to get fixed, if it ever did. The internet NEVER worked even after we were given a special free access code. The conference room service was so terrible we canceled the second day after we talked to some manager that was absolutely out of touch with what it means to provide a decent service that one would want to use again in the future... Enough said about that aspect of the trip. Now the guest rooms.nothing super amazing, clean rooms with good beds but very small bathrooms. Our room had the toilet paper holder way way to close to the toilet to the point where it was uncomfortable to use the toilet. To make things even more annoying the toilet was slightly twisted towards the wall. Go figure. We used the laundry service and that was a nightmare too. The laundry was 12 hours late and was only delivered after 10 phone calls with incompetent employees which all had major attitudes. To make things worse a random cleaning lady literally walked in the room without knocking one evening, and when she realized the room was not empty she mumbled something about checking to make sure we are ok and then she more or less stormed out. What was she really looking for? Exactly... Not to hard to guess. For $409/night this was by far the most disappointing hotel experience I have had in a long time. So disappointing I actually decided to write this review to warn others. I never wrote a hotel review before. From now on when I'll see a Hilton, I'll steer the other way.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the basics plus more!”
Reviews.Author: FrankDLaw
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the NY Hilton last month, we were dog tired after a 36 hour flight with stopovers. The last thing we needed was to be held up at reception. We were not disappointed. We were breezily checked in by a cheerful receptionist and given breakfast gratis on request despite it not being included in our booking. The room was suitably luxurious and the interior appointments were reliably Hiltonesque. Although the flat screen TV set looked a little dated, the rest of the facilities including the large bathroom was tastefully done. The bed was comfortable and we hit the sack immediately. I woke at 3 am and felt like a walk. Inquired at reception and was advised that it was safe to walk to Times Square from the hotel 24/7. So it proved. I felt safe taking the short walk to Times Square and soaked in the neon embellished buildings and architecture, which is an interest of mine. Saw a young couple making love in broad neon light at the side of a building on my way back to the hotel, but apart from that the walk was uneventful and I still felt safe! Throughout our stay, we were accorded the customary Hilton service that we'd come to expect. Breakfast was excellent with a large buffet spread. The only downside was the Hotel charged us US$3 per day for bag storage as we were joining a local tour to Canada and did not want to lug our luggage around. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ...price ......”
Reviews.Author: Milan K
Reviews.Content: Very nice location near central park i was there three times but hotel is old and i think dirty...bigest problem is that hotel is very big and old...but nice ...

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Thomasleemd
Reviews.Content: Although a little generic, this Hilton has everything you would want in a midtown hotel. Great location. Larger than average rooms. Very good fitness center....free if you are Hiltonhonors. Lobby bar is adequate. Wish there was more personality. For more character though I would not stay in midtown. Tip. Central park is really close. Take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: joeb1249
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for a family wedding and decided to make a weekend of it. As I shopped around, I realized quickly that even weekend nights in a Manhattan hotel are quite expensive. Nevertheless, I chose the Hilton on 6th Avenue for its location more than anything else. It proved to be a good move after taking the train to New York from Newark and then the subway to the Rockefeller Center station. That put me at 7th Ave. & 53rd Street, which was only a cross-town block to the Hilton. Although I arrived before 3 p.m., the staff promptly checked me in and gave me a key to my room. The room was well appointed and the bed was comfortable. I found most of the staff to be friendly and willing to answer questions, although the concierge treated me as if I were somewhat of a rube. I did finally get a restaurant recommendation from her, but that was the only time I felt less than welcome. It was an easy walk to Times Square, where I was able to pick up a half price ticket to a Broadway show the next day. I would advise travelers to expect a fairly long wait at the taxi queue in front of the Hilton after 6 p.m. It took more than 30 minutes to get a taxi, as most just drove right by. I checked out of the Hilton early on a Sunday morning and it was as easy as making a phone call from my room. It was a good trip and I would use this Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “dream come true”
Reviews.Author: lfarley
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the New York Hilton to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday. I had made a request to be upgraded if possible. We were surprised to find that we had been upgraded to a suite and given access to the executive floor. I am from Miami and have stayed at this property many times over the past 12 years because of the service and convenient location. I want to recognize the exceptional attention given to us by Claudia, executive level manager, who was able to honor our request and Madeline, executive level hostess, who always makes us feel as if we were returning home.

Reviews.Title: “A busy place, Hustle Bustle”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: A got a theatre package for a Christmas getaway. It was a hectic journey from Newark airport into Manhatten that day. When we arrivied at the Hilton before 3:00pm, even as I telephoned directly the day before, the front check in desk could Not find our theatre tickets to Wicked, part of the package. We were booked intos the Hilton for five nights. It was stressful using careful confrontation and then agueing with the front desk! So I called the manager, a petite asian woman, who simply when behind the front desk and came out with out tickets all ready for us in an envelope with my name on it.! ( btw..the production was that very night best seats) My lady companion was crying, upset and tired.We travelled from afar. They offered us an upgrade to a higher floor, basically the same room we requested, and inclued one buffet breakfast in the hotel diner. They were late checking us in, the place was very hectic. I opted for breakfast Each morning, which was agreed and turned over with a scowl. The rest of the trip was fine. The room was nice, two comfortable beds, a sheer curtain window, no view, but also no street noise. There was bathroom and private dressing area, only five hangers, and the room was clean and modern. A nice, very nice, flat screen tv and only a little scatch pad for stationery to make a note on. No letter and envelope type thing which I always would appreciate. The breakfast buffet was Very early, serve yourself and Still leave a nice tip for the coffee server. There was a pushy Jewellery store, high pressure sales staff, the shop in the lobby, beside the conceige. They would not leave us alone, even waving us in, when we were spotted just walking past. Annoying. It was again Holiday Christmas Season, there was a threatening trasit strike so people were on edge. Fifth Ave was blocked off in places to accomadate so many window shoppers, we Enjoyed Carnegie Hall,Handle's Massiah, and watched the skaters at the Rock, so the Location of the Hilton was good. A drafty windy street however,but outside The Hilton, plenty of taxis. Letterman Show was walking distance that was fun as well. I would prefer a quieter Hotel and location in NYC. This is really Times Square Area,so expect a lot of masses and crowds. The Hilton kept everything very secure, we showed ID at the door just to be in the Lobby, A friend who came to see us. who lives in NYC, had to show his ID to even meet us there. I again do not know what I would have done, if I would have simply accepted the continueous brush off, initially that "We do not have your theatre tickets", they were right were they were suppose to be. Clearly a non caring frustrated employee. This place is just another concrete high rise, the lobby nothing really special, a couple couches, a non spectular Holiday tree, and a maze off hallway to find the elevators. We got a nice package deal in advance,so in that way it was very much worth it. I enjoyed the room and the fact that yes, we stayed at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “use as last option”
Reviews.Author: mia74_11
Reviews.Content: the customer service for this Hilton was disgraceful. Staff HIGHLY unprofessional. NO assistance offered. I dragged 3 large bags to my room with no help. 4 door men stood and watch and kept talking amongst themselves. When a limousine showed up they all moved and even more came from inside. I asked for assistance at the concierge desk using a map and she was highly annoyed as i didn't already understand the streets. She pointed out the door and said â€˜ up that wayâ€™ and she walked away from me and went and took a phone call all infront of me. This is very central and good location so even if you get lost itâ€™s not hard to find your way back. Tea, coffee and bathroom Amenities were never replaced. Every evening I called and had to ask them for fresh amenities. nice hotel BUT if you need any kind of service pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service!”
Reviews.Author: DayungBidayuh
Reviews.Content: First time visiting New York. We picked the right hotel! Excellent location. A block away from 5th Ave, and a short walk away from Central Park, Times Square, Rockefellar Centre. My inlaws recommended the hotel to us and I'm glad we stayed there! The rooms are in good shape & most importantly, clean. Service was great, staff were friendly and if you're willing to spend extra, try to stay at the Executive floors. The check-in line is faster (never busy - no lineups)! You also get better views - especially if you are at the east-end corner facing Central Park! And the hotel lobby is always busy & lively! But it's what NYC is all about!

Reviews.Title: “"Need better housekeeping services"”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier297675
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY at least twice and year and have been faithful in staying at the Hilton for quite a few years now. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are okay. However the last few times I have noticed that the housekeeping in the bath and in the rooms is appalling. They do not clean- hair is in the shower drain, bathroom floors are not cleaned. In the rooms the debris left over by the previous occupants (in-between the beds and side tables is not vacuumed). Once when I checked in the waste basket was full of rubbish. I called customer service and informd them that I wanted all the furniture moved and the whole room vaccumed but they cleaned only partially when I checked. I have sent mails but there is no response. I have found a better hotel for my next visit and it is not the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayakranger
Reviews.Content: I re-joined the "Hilton Honors" loyalty program (after having my account dropped because apparently I did not stay at their hotels often enough, so they were DISLOYAL to me!) before my stay here with a cousin. When we arrived, approx. 1 hour before the check-in time, the room was not ready. We visited the reception desk approx 10 minutes later & it was ready, which was good for our plans. I had read the tips on tripadvisor & requested a high floor, away from the elevators. We were upgraded to a deluxe corner room on the 30th floor. We had to open the windows to air out the room from the spray used by the cleaning persons, but it did air out OK. The room was relatively large for NYC (I would think) & very clean & quiet. The beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was rather small but it had everything needed, except a working exhaust fan. (I admit that I didn't report it or complain.) My cousin had a problem with the shower curtain, getting the floor pretty wet after her shower, but I didn't have a problem with it, & the shower water was nice & hot. The reception staff were nice. We asked for a later checkout time & were given one without a problem. The hotel was in a great location. The hotel is big & the lobby is not "cozy" & there are no chairs, but the room had everything we wanted, including a coffee maker, which we did not use, & a small refrigerator stocked with items, that I would not DARE to try, due to the likely price. I was able to fit one of my own drink cans & water bottles in it.. The room was very pricey but so were the other hotels we considered. Our stay was on a Sat. night on Veteran's Day weekend, so some hotels were requiring a stay of two nights (but not Hilton). I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again depending on the price & if I had a person to share the cost with.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond - returned the items I forgot”
Reviews.Author: AdrianTorontoOntario
Reviews.Content: Of the large New York City hotels, I think the Hilton is the best - the rooms are in relatively good shape, the HVAC systems are modern and the street noise is relatively muted. Also, rooms are large by the standards of New York City. On a visit in September, though, Hilton New York really won my excellent rating. In a rush to check out, I left some shirts in a drawer. I called the hotel the next day, and the security team Fed-Ex'd the items home to me. That made me very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: pushkar26
Reviews.Content: The entry to the hotel is busy like a stock exchange. However, the rooms above are something to look for your stay in the hustle bustle of New York. The room service, and the quality of food served in the hotel are fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Noisier than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ng n
Reviews.Content: I was on 34th floor and with all the windows shut but I could still hear car noises. The noise from air conditioning was also loud and even when I turned it off, there was some other unknown noise. Besides, the shower current was not strong enough and at night the water was not hot enough even though I turned it to the hotest. Probably there was some 'competition' for hot water at night when everyone was taking a shower. Nice and clean room though and at convenient location. I like the fact that a supermarket is just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate comfort in central location”
Reviews.Author: Igles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work trip. We were able to negotiate a good group rate. Great location close to anything you need. Would recommend for any business trip but is nice enough and good value enough even for someone looking to stay here on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “ny conference”
Reviews.Author: beaglegal
Reviews.Content: spent 2 days at hotel for national conference.taxi ride from penn station to hotel cost was $7+tip. checkin around1:30 and was lucky to get room early. it's all a matter of timing to see if housekeeping has just finished up a room through their computer system. at first try, room wasn't available. but desk clerk waited a little and tried again. bingo! got one on 26th floor. king bed room was nice and large for NY hotel. wallpaper and bathroom seems a little dated compared to modernist, minimalist newer hotels. bathroom is a little small with toilet and sink efficiently side-by-side. but still nice quality and appointments with massaging soap and other toiletries for hilton. bed was comfy and clean. elevators were fast in transporting people to floors, even with large crowds. food and meals at conference were excellent. never left hotel given sessions and receptions. but hotel's central location to the "rock", 5th ave shops, short walk to times square and central park makes it perfect place to visit ny sights. only complaint was having to pay for wifi in room though standard for ny hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "host" hotel for NYC Marathon!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGinny
Reviews.Content: Last week I went to run in the New York City Marathon and spent three nights at the marathon "host" hotel, The Hilton New York. Although this was an expensive adventure it was first class all the way. From the service at the front desk, to the cleaning staff, to the beautiful accomodations and view of New York, everything was impeccable! The location of the hotel was perfect. It is a five minute walk to Time Square in one direction or a five minute walk to Central Park in the other direction. You just can't get better than that!!! I LOVE NY:)

Reviews.Title: “First hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Chiguy_11
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Hilton New York on October 29th 2011, the day New York had an unexpected snow storm. The front desk was very nice and understanding to my friends and I for arriving in around 9:00 p.m. at night due to delays from Chicago. After checking in we walked into our room and were amazed how nice it was. After unpacking we headed down to the concierge desk for some information on what clubs or bars we should hit up that night. Thankfully we had a great Concierge by the name of Winny who told us what the hot places were with only a couple blocks from the hotel. Her directions were flawless and made our long day a great night. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel, set aside from our evening on Sunday night at the hotel. My friends and I stopped by the concierge desk again and unfortunately Winny was not there, but another concierge greeted us warmly by the name of Eugenia. As we began to talk we told her where we wanted to go and she wasnâ€™t sure of the exact location, which is fine because I myself a concierge at another hotel based out of Chicago doesnâ€™t always know where everything is in such a big city. After Eugenia printed us off the directions she explained what train to take vaguely (later getting lost for about an hour because she wasnâ€™t specific enough on what train to take). But what really got me upset was the fact that she mentioned an ignorant comment about people who donâ€™t speak English. She said she cannot stand when guests donâ€™t speak English because she canâ€™t understand. I was confused why she would say this because as a concierge in a popular tourist city, being ignorant to others inability to speak clear English is very unprofessional, and the hospitality industry is no place for someone like that. I had a great experience overall, but just found that Eugeniaâ€™s personality for the concierge desk is unprofessional and it sets a bad name for Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel if you get a corporate rate”
Reviews.Author: HBPM
Reviews.Content: I get a very good corporate rate so this Hilton is good value for me (but maybe not for you if you are paying rack or close to rack) Rooms nice enough if small and poorly designed (hard to reach toilet flush in last room!) with quite good sound proofing. OK coffee machine in room . Paid wired internet. Free wifi in Lobby area this trip (new and very welcome addition) otherwise a Starbucks inside the hotel. Breakfast very very good but very expensive...great for the night after but too much ($ and volume) for a daily moring feed. Plenty of restaurants, delis, bars and street food (Halal Guys on corner) very close to tsok up minibar with milk, water etc and for eating out

Reviews.Title: “A Manhattan Staple”
Reviews.Author: Robert N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to the Hilton New York for many years on vacation and for me to do a little work (cable TV news) from time to time. We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station (had an unusual substandard experience at that Hyatt), the Sheraton Manhattan, Sheraton New York and The Roosevelt (stayed twice when it was in bad need of renovations and better policies), but we have never had a bad stay at the Hilton New York. During our last stay, a worker up on the roof accidentally spilt some very powerful substance that smelled like a harsh industrial chemical of some sort and it went into the air duct. The overpowering smell woke everyone up and some had to briefly leave the hotel; the fire department showed up because it was a HazMat spill. After an hour or so they had it cleaned up. These things happen. We did not complain when we checked out on schedule but did mention it to the customer service rep at the front desk (we asked what the smell was from), and she instantly removed quite a bit of money from our bill. Treatment like that means we will be back to the Hilton New York. We always get a club-level room, sometimes a mini-suite. These are spacious and breakfast comes with the price in the club lounge. Warning: the lounge can be packed at breakfast, so much so that there can be a line to get in. I suppose what we like best about the Hilton New York is the location: just several minutes' walk from the south side of Central Park, a few minutes' walk from Times Square and the Theater District, across the street from Radio City Music Hall, minutes from 30 Rock and the Christmas tree, and right up the street from Fox News HQ. Two of our favorite restaurants (Mickey Mantle's and Trattoria del Arte) are minutes away, too. Every time our room has been ready when promised and there's never been a problem with our reservations. Management has gone out of their way to make sure our stays have been very good. No doubt we will again stay at the Hilton New York when we next return to the greatest city on Earth.

Reviews.Title: “definitely would return”
Reviews.Author: mkziegler
Reviews.Content: great hotel, so close to everything, didn't even need a cab just walked everywhere, staff very friendly and professional

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: blondkid
Reviews.Content: it was my first time in new york. it was a while ago but I remember really liking it. the views were wonderful, the staff was wonderful, and the rooms were wonderful as well. Played a large role in my trip to New York and was very good.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in New York”
Reviews.Author: Evargsum
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here after atlantic voyage. Reception was handled quickly and as our corner room wasn't ready (arrived early for check in) we were offered non corner room on different floor with immediate effect. Room was spacious and well set out, however I have never been in a hotel room with an many lights, there were at least 14! Ate in the restaurant first day and two burgers with sodas cost $60, they were nice but expensive. Location is excellent for theatres, all the sights, most within walking distance and shopping. Only real problem we had was that luggage was to be brought to our room, however two hours after arrival it had not been delivered and and when I went to reception found it and a lot more waiting delivery, so I took it myself. Why is it the more expensive a hotel is the less likely they are to offer free WiFi, this is something they need to address, the mark up on burgers surely covers cost!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay while visiting NYC”
Reviews.Author: sheen24
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with large, clean, nicely appointed modern rooms. Comfortable lobby with interactive information screens and customer service-focused staff; smooth check-in/check-out and helpful info from concierge. Conveniently located to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Ave. shopping, restaurants and multiple subway stops. Would definitely stay here again when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “How Big? Soooo Big!”
Reviews.Author: mizmof
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this particular Hilton Hotel as we were in town for a family party and majority of family members were staying here. Check-in and check-out were flawless. Our room, on 6th floor, was of average size and modern, bathroom was small but adequate. The location can't be beat as it is within walking distance to Central Park South and 5th Ave.etc.. The staff members were extremely helpful to me and my family. We are CT residents affected by the end of October weekend nor'easter and hotel was very accommodating in giving us a late check-out so we could make other arrangements as we had no power at home. My only complaint is the price per room of $300+/night and internet charge $14.99! I prefer smaller hotels and most likely would not choose this particular Hilton unless deal was too good to pass up. If you like a lot of hustle and bustle and a BIG hotel, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel with all Services”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler16
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton twice. If you like small hotels, you won't like it. If you like large hotels will all services, it is great. It was easy check in and out. The rooms are modern, nice and large. The building is tall enough to get away from street noise at night. The location is just a couple of blocks south of central park and one block off 5th Avenue. There are several different subway stops within a block.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Rahul400076
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel - for business or pleasure. The location is excellent - very close to Time Square. First about reaching here - you are much better of using the taxi or the group airport van to arrive here from JFK or Newark airports. Dont go for the 'avoid the traffic and use the train' !! Or else you could be in Penn Station in 40 minutes (incl 10 mins just to reach the station on the airports) but waiting for cabs over there for the next 30. The hotel itself is great. But if you are planning to arrive early and put some luggage in the hold, remember that they charge you like $7 per day or so - which is really pittance but not free (thankfully they waived it off for me). The hotel is bustling 24 hrs and the happenning places are vely close by - so enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average, Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: 2NYEmptyNesters
Reviews.Content: A 3.5 out of 5 rating, if possible, would be more accurate as one reviewer noted. This hotel was very busy but nice and quiet on the higher floors (I was on 23rd floor). Housekeeping service was good but inconsistent -- one day I left a tip and a note asking for more towels and teabags. I got the tea but not the towels. Biggest Complaint? The bill for the SELF SERVICE buffet breakfast came complete with a 15% gratuity ADDED IN! Completely unjustified, particularly since we asked for water and it did not come... until we asked again later. Room rates are disproportionately high, given the many fine options nearby. A return visit is highly unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob2175
Reviews.Content: Had an Excellent stay at this hotel. It is centrally located and close to everything. Super easy to use the subway....got to Yankee Stadium with no problem. Stayed for 5 nights and had a high floor so I didn't hear the traffic or the city noise below. Loved the restaurants in the hotel. Its also very close to some of the best shops and restaurants in the world. Loved it!!!! Highly recommended, but a little pricey on weekends and holidays, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: BostonMeg11
Reviews.Content: I would rate this 3.5 stars if I could- it's definitely somewhere better than average but not quite very good. The hotel lobby was chaotic but check in staff were polite and efficient. The hallway seemed a little dated so my expectations weren't super high for the room. But the room seemed updated and was pleasantly appointed, very clean, comfortable bed, good pillows- bathroom was on the smaller side but was fine. Motion activated LED floor lights were really nice, especially when one person is sleeping and one person wants to get up without disturbing them. The 10th floor wasn't too noisy, we slept great. The restaurants in the lobby were packed but didn't have great reviews so we grabbed dinner somewhere else. The complimentary breakfast the next morning left a lot to be desired- but it's NYC and there are way better options for breakfast anyway!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-traveler68
Reviews.Content: Great location. Stayed in room 1303, although not large, nicely updated and clean. Service in the lobby bar a bit slow and waiters disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “superb location!”
Reviews.Author: t01192002
Reviews.Content: Great central location, no matter what your plans.

Reviews.Title: “Prettyyy, prettyyyy, prettyyy good.”
Reviews.Author: lolawally
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Midtown hotel. I was there for work and enjoyed a room as part of my conference block. The check-in staff was surprisingly nice and friendly. My room was only okay, I would say. I could just tell that at one point in the past it was a smoking room (no smoke odor, but you could tell by the smell, and a couple cigarette burns on the carpeting near the window). The decor was a little dated, but clean and nice. When I had some downtime, getting around to the approximately 134,512 things to do in the area was a breeze. I am a small town gal and I felt safe. The hotel lobby bar was always too crowded before the other bar opened for business at 5:30 pm. And it's best to go find a cocktail off-site given the outrageous hotel prices for a drink. I didn't try the hotel gym because it cost money to use and Internet was $18.95 for their premium service (which wasn't a very good connection at all for watching steamed videos). Oh, and the cable selection wasn't good (but you don't need TV, it's NYC.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location- Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SunDogandCompany
Reviews.Content: I stay in NYC hotels frequently on business and have stayed in 3 hotels in this vicinity of Ave of the Americas and 52 St, the other hotels being the Sheraton and The Michelangelo. They are all similar in price and all convenient to business in this area, but also convenient to Times Square, Broadway, 5th Ave. and Central Park. The Hilton has more business travelers and fewer of the tourists and high school bus trips that I encountered in the Sheraton. So I give the Hilton a plus in that department. Two things were negative for me at the Hilton. First, the rooms that I was in on two seperate stays are quite old. The bedspreads and all that was new, but the bathrooms are old. Everything from the height of the ceiling to the showerhead to the fixtures is dated. It all functions, but for $450 a night I expect better. Second thing that was a negative is the attitude of the employees in the Hilton Honors sections of the hotel. To access the Executive Lounge you need to give the monitor at the door your room key. The attitude from this person is they are somewhat inconvenienced by your presence. Then one morning I came into the Lounge to use the computers and one was not working. I asked the monitor for help and she again had a bad attitude. I suspect that the bad attitude may be a result of a number of people trying to "crash" the lounge, but that does not excuse it. So overall, better than the nearby Sheraton, and convenient to much of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: PBACedarburg
Reviews.Content: My second time in NYC. Traveling alone for a business conference. Great location to be in the action with the city. Good place for a business conference. Quiet, comfortable, and clean room to go to at end of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Vacaadventures
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a friendly front desk and our room was a good size for NYC and very clean. It took several calls to get a foam (non feather) pillow for our nephew but it got there eventually. Breakfast buffet was great with the kids and he wait staff was awesome. We were headed for MOMA was it was a simple walk across the street. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “chaotic, but efficient”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a great area, right by times square. There is plenty to do, and if the weather is nice, you can walk around without paying for a cab. The room was adequate, but beware: this hotel does change $30.00 for a rollaway bed, which is not typical in most Hilton's. We asked for a couple items to be brought to the room, and the front desk staff was very accommodating and brought them up right away. The breakfast was overpriced at 30.00 per person, but that's typical at nicer hotels in NYC. Overall, this was a pleasant stay, esp if you are looking to stay in the times square area. There were sooo many people at this hotel it became chaotic using the elevator and trying to hail a cab, but eventually it all worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed”
Reviews.Author: Enid H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really well situated for first time visitors to New York. Rooms were really clean and of a good size. Staff very helpful. Plenty of cafes nearby to grab an early breakfast before setting off to sight see. If this is your first trip to New York, you will not be disappointed.do plenty of research before you go and plan your route with military precision so as to not miss out on anything. We will def come back and stay at the HIlton again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a Hilton honors member and I would not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadebynikolai
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 300am and booked and call to let them know I was coming in at that hour. It took an hour to resolve this matter. They said hotel was fully sold out, thank goodness I had all my email correspondence and they finally checked me in. I am also a hilton honors member. I usually never pull that, but I was so furious with how they handled the situation. The room is very basic for a Hilton. Unless you stay on their club floors. And to me that is pretty standard also. The club lounge is always always packed and over filled with people. Not comfortable at all. It would be better to be downstairs eating. The elevators are always full and packed. The door men were helpful with directions and also getting a taxi but expected to get tipped. I would not recommend this hilton location. There are better places to stay in that location and for the same price too.

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay at a Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSiren
Reviews.Content: I took my sister to New York as a graduation present and she really wanted to stay at a Hilton so we chose this one. It had a very nice lobby and the staff was quite nice and helpful. We never ordered room service or ate at one of the hotel's restaurants (too pricey) so I can't comment on that nor did we have children with us. The room itself was nice, had hot water, beds were comfy. It had everything we needed and really, we were only in our room to sleep and we had no complaints there. No view to speak of, we looked down on other building roofs and straight at some others but I'm sure if you want to pay for a view, you can get one. The rooms were always kept very clean and the location was really good - minutes away from a subway but close enough to walk to most of New York's hot spots. Our favourite was being only minutes away from Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Three words, "not worth it"”
Reviews.Author: lostinatlanta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel because she was attending a conference that was being held in the hotel. For $500/night I expected more. Room was ok, but further dated and bed was "ok". Definitely not on par with other Hilton Hotels. I'm a gold hhonors member so we were given a voucher for the "express continental breakfast" ($19) value. Well come to find out that the express continential breakfast consistet of bread, tea, coffee, and OJ. I would have never paid $19 for this type of food, esp. since you can walk across the street and get a bagel and coffee for $4. When the conference ended we switched hotels to the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square and it was a much better/nicer place to stay. Rooms were about the same size but bed was better and only cost $300/night including full breakfast. If you have a choice to stay I would recommend the Hilton Garden Inn over this Hilton anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Helen D
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel as part of a package deal We emailed to say it was for our special birthdays and when we got there (before check in) we went to the bar and where given $15 voucher each to have a drink. When we arrived back after our day exploring they had placed a beautiful birthday cake and a bottle of bubbly in our room! This hotel is well situated in Manhattan for everything you need to do and see. The staff where all so polite and couldn't do enough for us. This hotel added to our fantastic time that we had in NYC. Rooms are a good size, clean and the beds are so comfortable - just what you need after a day our walking around the city. The Stage Deli is great for breakfast and Mama Mia is a must on broadway! Oh and there is a good supermarked just down the road if you need anything!!! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: gillian_spencer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hilton New York on Saturday 22nd October with my Daughter. We were visiting New York for our 40th and 65th Birthday celebrations. Staying at the Hilton made our holiday complete. We booked into our room, even though we were slightly early, almost right away. We were given drinks vouchers for the bar whilst we waited. The room was big and so comfortable. The beds were fantastic, as were the pillows. We slept so well after our long days sightseeing. We were also presented with a Birthday Cake and wine to add to our celebrations, which made our Birthdays so perfect. Many thanks to Kellie and Brian for making our stay so memorable. Staying at the Hilton New York was the best place to stay for sightseeing. Everything on the door-step. Can't wait for our next stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SteevyMontreal
Reviews.Content: We had a king on the 31st floor. The room was immaculate. The service in the hotel was wonderful. I had forgotten to remove the "do not disturb" sign and when we arrived back at our room at 4PM, I called customer services. The room was attended to within an hour. Super service and friendly staff. Fantastic location - close to Central Park, theatre district, Rockefeller Center, and 5th avenue shopping. Some great restaurants close by (Brooklyn Diner for breakfast and Basso56 for dinner). Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hilton does not let his guests down”
Reviews.Author: umu
Reviews.Content: We , a family with 2 kids age 11 and 12 ,spent a week in the hilton on 6th ave and we had a great stay , yes it is a busy place and the lobby in the evening is like a zoo .But we really had a fantastic stay and we keep on returning to this hotel: first of all location , rooms and bedding are great, we had two great connecting rooms ,the bar and breakfast lounge on the exec floor is so fine ,the hotel is not outrageous in pricing considering you are in nyc. However there was one thing extraordinary, we were there end of august when hurricane irene was coming ,and the people really took care of us , on saturday morning we had the possibility to fly back to europe through dulles airport if we left right away so we left in a hurry without properly checking out ; when we returned in europe we saw that an extra half night was charged however when mailing back to the hotel explaining the situation we were -without any discussion- reimbursed.We really can say 'hilton does not let his guests down'

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: GABETJTBC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our visit to the USA from Melbourne Australia. We arrived at 1am which we had notified them of this prior as we had a late flight. Check-In was smooth and easy. We arrived in our room to find a terrible smell, it was smoke like so we rang to tell them of this their answer was to come up and spray it with a peach smell spray which made it worse it stunk they would not change us rooms so we had to put up with it which I found really hard. If we had not pre paid for the hotel I would have found somehwere else. I took my shoes off to find that the carpet was sticky not just in one spot the entire carpet was like this so I had to wear my shoes from the bathroom to the bed because of the dirty feeling. I layed down on the pillow to find it smelt of vomit so we left the pillow with a note the next morning. And the beds are really uncomfortable because the bed rolled in to the middle. Which had us amost on top of each other. We had to keep the window open because of the smell which had its downside the noise. It was really old and rundown with rust and paint peeling in the bath room. The functionallity of the bathroom was terrible fancy putting a bench above a toilet. Lets just say my kids managed to knock a few things in there while they were going to the toilet. There was also very little space to put our things in the bathroom. On our first night when we arrived at 1am we forgot to put the do not disturb sign on but you would think they would have let housekeeping know that we only arrived a few hours ago at 9am they were at our door. The other thing that I found a problem we booked for 2 adults 2 children but in our room they only had 3 towels. Now I dont think its that hard to provide enough towels when we have said how many people were staying. We were then made feel like a hassle asking for another towel. They also charge per bag to hold your bag. If we had thought about it we could have held our room for 4 more hours as we checked out at 9am so they could have access to the room but when we went to put our bags in we were charged 3.50 per bag. To add to the terrible stay I had just bought a new suitcase a samsonite hardcase and when we went to get in the taxi even through my husband went to do it himself the bellman threw it in the cab putting a huge deep 5cm gash in the case. Our other cases never got this and we had flown 5 domestic legs and one international. Really poor and terrible service. We will never stay here again and likewise will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good New York location”
Reviews.Author: amandar044
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for location, rooms very comfortable and generally clean although a little bit more attention would make a difference. Hotel is a hub of activity, concierge desk very helpful. We were on the 22nd floor and slept great. We loved our stay and would definitely choose this hotel again for a trip in New York

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: previewfirst
Reviews.Content: Busy loud expensive - but it's new York so no complaints. It was a nice stay and perfectly situated close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “"Accomodation factory"”
Reviews.Author: cityshopper10
Reviews.Content: Hilton is very well located in Manhattan and the rooms are large for NY hotel. I was travelling in business and the location, well organized check-in and check-out and a quite, functional room was important. On the other hand the hotel was unpersonal, busy complex and it was very annoying that you had to pay extra for everything, even for leaving your luggage in the luggage room ($3,50 per piece). Wifi was expensive, $15/day and the connection was bad. The room price was ok but you might want to consider all these extras that come in addition.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: koppis
Reviews.Content: Five stars location, quiet rooms. Did not have breakfast at the hotel, but many places nearby that served breakfast. Location in the heart of Manhattan, and very close to Central Park and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kawidd
Reviews.Content: This is a large NY hotel but it lives up to what you may expect from a Hilton in a large city. The front desk was very efficient as were the concerge, bell station and luggage storage office. We had to store some bags for a colleague arriving later. It was perfectly taken care of with good retrieval instruction and protocol. The rooms was pretty good for size for a NY hotel. The bathroom was of good size and the bed was ultra comfortable. Everything worked and the process of getting a cab was also efficient. The breakfast at the coffee shop while pricy was also good. If you can get into this hotel at around $250, it is a good value. At around $300, it is fair and at over $375, you should shop. The location across the street from Radio City Music Hall and just one block north of the Rockefeller Cener is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Vast busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkers12
Reviews.Content: Vast busy and crowded hotel. Just about bearable if you stay in the Executive level rooms. Lacks a decent bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Sunday evening, and when asked for photo id, I realized that I did not have my folder with that included my passport. The front desk staff was very concerned, and tried valiantly to contact the taxi cab that brought me to the property, albeit unsuccessfully because of the day of the week and time. The front office manager joined in and provided a very caring attitude, and advice regarding contacting the Canadian embassy and local police lost and found. They even provided a free drink at the bar - gratuity included - for me and my traveling companion to try to relax. Fortunately, I located my folder and passport (my bad). The front office manager called me the following day, after I had checked out, to follow up, she expressed her gladness that the passport was found and to wish me a good trip. Could not have asked for any better caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at the NY Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BruceandPhyllisT
Reviews.Content: I combined a business and pleasure trip to the NY Hilton recently and overall had a great experience, especially with the person-Ingrid, who was working the Diamond Hilton Honors desk. She was great! So helpful, polite and professional. If you go there sometime, I hope you have the chance to interact with her. She made my trip even better than it was. The hotel is in a great location, nice room. no problems to report. Is it expensive? Yes, it is NYC after all and you're in Manhattan but I was able to use HH points for the weekend and it was well worth it. .

Reviews.Title: “Big, busy, city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: HungryBay
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel, central to 6th Ave businesses and close enough to Times Square, Central Park for diversions. Definitely geared for business, conventions - not a place suited for family vacation, although location is good. Quick check-in, cabs available 24/7 (although can be long wait during peak hours). Clean rooms, good service.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced even for NYC”
Reviews.Author: the_vj
Reviews.Content: Hilton usually means "high standards... for high price" type of deal. However, you only seem to get the high price in this one. 300 dollars for a night in a mediocre room with kind of "used" furniture, without breakfast and without internet included - sorry, not a good deal by any means. If anything, the overall feeling is that of a busy 3-star hotel, from check-in to check-out. I give 3 points only because this is NYC, so the price levels are generally higher. But one can still get better deals in central Manhattan, so the location is really not an excuse for the price. Luckily this was a business trip, so my own piggy bank did not suffer. On the positive note - the second floor has an immense ballroom and several smaller meeting rooms... and they were all reserved for a huge salsa congress while I was there. I discovered the happening only thanks to very scantily dressed women in the elevator. Well over a thousand of people of all ages, races and dancing skill levels participated, so just watching the busy dance floor was quite an experience. So, apparently the place is well-suited for this type of massive events.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Great Place to go for your 50th!”
Reviews.Author: HoppyBrenda
Reviews.Content: visited NYC for the first time end Sept/early Oct. Researched Trip Advisor for accommodations and after talking with two business colleagues who had stayed at the Hilton, chose this hotel/location. Excellent location, expected to pay more due to this fact. Booked deluxe double. Based on reviews on TripAdvisor requested room on upper floor and away from elevator. Good choice....22nd fl, not too noisy. We found our elevator very fast (22nd floor stay). I had emailed requesting corner room on higher floor & mentioned it was my 50th b-day celebration & we had a nice treat waiting for us upon our return to our room, bottle sparkling water and chocolate cup filled with chocolate covered strawberries. Yum! Nice touch, I thought. We found staff very friendly & helpful. Yes, baggage charge of $3.50 is an annoyance. When we arrived early Thursday morning automatically went to check our bags. Staff member suggested we check to see if room was ready rather than check bags and we were pleasantly surprised to find we could check in right away. Beds really comfortable, loved the pillows! Two "complaints", iron didn't work. When we requested another, it didn't work either. Be wary! We inquired at concierge desk as to where we could buy hop on/rip off pass. She said we could purchase there, giving deposit, and paying for balance of pass behind hotel at Grayline stop that was there (which we did). When we tried to buy pass bus driver refused to sell us one, although banner above bus clearly indicated "buy pass here". Grayline rep on street also refused, telling us we had to go to main office by Times Square. Needless to say, we were ticked. We crossed street & talked to another Grayline rep. He explained they wouldn't receive their commission, as we had technically bought at hotel. As it turns out the wrong pass was issued and we needed to buy another. We happily obliged the Grayline rep & bought new pass from him. Hotel were great in refunding the deposit when we shared what had happened. Recommendation: if not walking use subways & cabs to get around. Would recommend this hotel & would stay here again. Love NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... So so Service (at times)”
Reviews.Author: Mup3t
Reviews.Content: Recently I've stayed at Hilton New York for three nights. The hotel itself is very good - huge lobby, spacious rooms (especially for New York standards). I've stayed at the 35th floor (which was definitely a plus since floors 34th and above have a diferent elevator than the rest which means much less "traffic" at pick times) in a double bed room. Regarding the room it had a great view (I could see Central Park from between the buildings) and very confortable beds. The bathroom was okay, personally I think a hotel such as Hilton could spend a little more effort on there since it was really, really simple. Now, in terms of service - the front desk was very helpful and polite, nothing bad to point out. My personal issue was with the desk that books museums entrances and airport shuttles - I've decided to book a shuttle back to Newark airport with them and the employee was rather unhelpful, she book the shuttle and gave me incorrect informations of where to be at the time of the pick up, this led to the unfortunate situation that I lost the transfer and had to wait another hour for another one (even though I was at the place that was indicated 45 minutes earlier). In conclusion, and despite this unfortunate situation, I must say I recommend Hilton New York has a good place to stay both for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nortonski
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights in this hotel, rooms were clean & large. This is a full service Hilton & is extremely popular (it seems) & the staff are great. I only have 2 issues; 1) $27 for buffet breakfast + tax & tips (Inc juice & coffee) - as an HHonours member I getbandiscount, but still, $27 is ambit of a joke, I would recommend breakfasting in the Exec Lounge on the 44th floor...costs nothing! 2) Internet - INCREDIBLY slooooow...of course the fact that the hotel was rather busy no doubt contributed to this Apart from that, great hotel & in a good location - all in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Average Room, overpriced everywhere”
Reviews.Author: NavEEdTravels
Reviews.Content: I could sum it all up in one word. Average. This is my second stay in NYC, last time at a boutique hotel, this time we thought we'd try the chain. The room was average, however the experience left me feeling nickle and dimed. $150 extra on booking for "multi-person fee", $15.00 per day to use Wifi, the bar/lounge charged $9 per beer, food prices at the attached restaurant were ridiculous ($35 for a brunch buffet) and the final insult $3.50 per bag for storage for a few hours between checkout and flight. The boutique hotel we stayed at last time did not charge for wifi or bag storage. To top it off, one day when going out to explore the city, we were approached by hilton staff and asked if we wanted a free coffee the next morning. Considering I had been using the deli on 53rd to get coffee (excellent breakfast and coffee there) I figured why not. Unfortunately it was a lead-in to go to sales presentations on what can only be called a time-share program. I find it funny that the person who snared us and tried to book us into a time referred to "the professionalism of the hilton" in his schpeal. Professional would have been leaving some information in the room and leaving it at that. The maids carts were parked in the hallways the entire time we were there. The lighting in the lobby is extremely dim, be prepared for a headache. All in all, at the price we paid, we left disappointed in the accommodation, I expected more from the hilton for the price of over $400 per night. The good: The bed was nice. The view was OK and we couldn't hear the noise of the street on our floor (33rd)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, pretty.”
Reviews.Author: qtparties
Reviews.Content: NYC is a very expensive place to stay. Rooms are like paying for an oceanfront all inclusive property on the beach, with no beach, no free food or drinks. There's no getting around the costs. But it's a must see if you can travel here. If you're a Hilton Honors Member, you'll do pretty well! You get put on their membership floor with free hot appetizers for cocktail hour. Time square at night is magical in it's own way!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Stacy C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 friends when we were in town to run the NYC Half Marathon. Overall we had a pleasant experience and I would consider staying here again. Likes: - Location is great. Close to midtown, times sq, central park, plenty of subway lines. Really easy to get to where-ever you need from here. - Overall size of the room was great - esp for NYC. Plenty of room for the 3 of us to move around and spread out. - Starbucks passes. We got free coffee and a pastry for each day we were there. It allowed us to get a light b-fast for free, avoiding the overpriced buffet. - Halal food cart is right across the street. Long lines all day & nite (it moves fast) - but good food. - Housekeeping was nice. They had no problem giving us plenty of towels. Disikes: - Double beds!!! I don't see why hotels use these as its impossible for 2 adults to sleep in them (and we are thin people). This room was big enough for 2 queen beds. - High charges for internet service. $15 for a "basic" connection - WTF! I know hotels are doing this more - but it really makes me angry. - Breakfast in their cafeteria/restaurant is expensive - even for NY. - Concierge was rude to us. We asked a simple question about car service to LaGuaridia and she answered us with a ton of attitude that wasn't necessary. In conclusion...If you want to be in the middle of everything, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelly123456
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at this hotel for my Bachelorette party, with my sister and 2 girlfriends. The location is fabulous! We weer within walking distance of many attractions, gret shopping on 5th Avenue, and it is a 2minute walk from radio City Music Hall. It is also quite close to Magnolia Bakery, which is famous for their cupcakes and sweets! There are also 2 restaurents good for breakfast witin a 5 min, walk, though I do not remember their names and a movie theatre is also right around the corner. We walked to Times Squrae which is a 10-15 min walk or so. The beds were very comfy and the service was very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again! It is pricey, but for the location it is worth it bc you will also save money on cabs. In addition, at the time I was living in DC and took the DC to NY Bolt bus and it was within walking distance of the bus stops, very convenient!!

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Re G
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I stay in this hotel and could not believe the difference from my previous experiences. Room was dirty and had a strang smell. Asked to change and the new room was also old and bathroom was small. I paid for deluxe and I am sure they gave me a standard one. When I questioned check in saying that in my previous experiences room was better I was told that I was getting a deluxe room. Maid service was bad and the hallway always had cleaning carts left as well as trays and garbage. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: Memom
Reviews.Content: My family (husband & 2 boys) went to NYC for Fall Break last week. The Hilton on 6th Avenue had the perfect location - block from Central Park, close to 5th/Park/Madison Avenue, Rockerfeller Center and Times Square! The Executive Lounge on the top floor was GREAT for us. Coffee and Breakfast in the mornings meant one less meal to plan and buy. The cookies and snacks in the afternoon tied us over for late night meals. The hotel was clean and comfortable and we heard no noise from the street at night. For the price it just couldn't be beat! I'll definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “solid, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: travel99boston
Reviews.Content: was in NYC for one night. Got a renovated floor. Everything clean. Hallways quiet, room quiet. AC quiet. Street noise not bad, and we were not on a high floor at all. Minibar super quiet...never heard it. We didn't eat in restaurant (food looked fine, but it is not gourmet), starbucks in lobby. Obviously being midtown is a great location. Place was very busy given it's columbus day holiday weekend, and there was a corporate convention in the hotel. My one shocker was that we only got two bath towels. we could have called down for more but we didn't bother. It was a warm weekend, and the AC was on. We were able to turn off the unit completely in the room. we were actually cold by the evening, and used the spare blanket meant on top of the regular bed covers. Also, we were able to drive our car directly into the hotel. The parking is so easy, on the same level as the lobby. $51 for 24 hours, with unlimited in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of the city - 3,5+ stars”
Reviews.Author: Polina67
Reviews.Content: I traveled to New York for business. I don't think I will be able to surprise anyone with something special in regards of this hotel. It is typical very busy hotel, mostly oriented to the business travelers. However, I am sure it attracts a lot of families as well, considering its so close to Rockefeller center and all attractions what Big Apple can offer.I definitely can suggest to ask for room on higher floor if possible. My room was overlooking Ave of the Americas and despite that I was on the 16th floor still can hear the street noise. Room was quite nice, clean and pretty spacious for NY standards. There was this motion LED light installed on the bottom of the night desk, which I thought was a great idea, so you will not trip if you go to the bathroom at night. As far as the cons - I will really suggest reception desk to have more people working during the busy hours, because the line for checking in was way too long. Maybe the waiters need to go through some type of training of how to smile a bit in front of the customers. I never saw so many sad and bored to death faces working in the lobby bar or during the luncheons and receptions in the ballrooms. I know you may say it just a work, however these people are the face of the Hilton as well.Still I can swallow most of it,because I am devoted Hilton fan, but really hope that Big hotel in a Big city does not meant less quality of what that chain stands for.

Reviews.Title: “standards have slipped”
Reviews.Author: cam0061
