Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hilton new york for 4 nights ..on arriving the taxi popped open the boot and the door man totally ignored our baggage and went for the limo behind , the taxi man then told him he should be looking after all his guests , and he was right a shouting match them followed what a bad start ... on checking in our room was not ready so we were allocated another of same standard . we booked a one bedroom suit ! all ok untill no shower gel apparently everyone in new york baths, mmmm . and a dirty blanket in the closet not what i would expect from a hilton , and the price we paid ... got some shower gel but the cover was not removed so put it outside the room ... I hope the standard is better in dubai which is where i am going next , it has been of excellent standard before .. watch this space ..all said and done the hilton new york is a good location for site seeing and shopping i just hope they raise there game a bit ....

Reviews.Title: “First Time New York”
Reviews.Author: alastair4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at the Hilton NY in August. We had traveled from Boston on the Limo-liner bus service which drops off right outside the hotel. This was the first time in New York but my son had told me this was a top location and I was not disappointed. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway so this is a big plus. The hotel is huge, a little old, the rooms a little dated,but they where comfortable. You are in new York so really how much time do you spend in your hotel room.The Executive lounge staff are very welcoming, though the lounge can get very busy. The lifts are a bit of a pain in they are so slow, but I'm guessing this is just a reflection in the size of the hotel.We found the staff very good in general. We will definitely come back to New York and would have no problem staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - NY”
Reviews.Author: Kevin7979
Reviews.Content: I had a very interesting experience during one of my recent stays in New York. I was in town for a conference only to get stuck in NY during Hurrican Irene. I was staying at the Hilton in NY and given the circumstances I thought the overall service and experience was quite good. Maybe it was because we were there for a conferece, but communication was good regarding what would stay open and what wouldn't, what services would be available, etc. I felt safe and ultimately it was a non-event. Rooms were decent sized, especially for Manhattan and clean. Overall a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: DrCanadaGoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a ladies' trip to New York in June 2011. We were very aware of the bed bug problems in the city so we stripped down the beds and after very careful searching, could find no traces of the critters. Great location; easy walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and all the Broadway shows. The gym was well-equiped (pay $40 for a week) and although busy, I always got a workout. I slept very well and did not hear any traffic noise although my roomie found it a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: n0rwegians
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies in a quiet area of New York, but other wise central. It is close to Central Park and Times Square (you can walk). The hotel looks nice, but it is quite old. I would stay there again, but for the location, not for it's looks.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, New York City”
Reviews.Author: Shelley158
Reviews.Content: By booking the Hilton for a conference we got a bit of a deal, but if we hadn't received the price break, I think for the value for the cost is high. Yes, it is NYC and everything costs, but the rooms here are ordinary. They were clean. The bathroom was a bit short of toiletries and you would need to call for extras everyday. The hotel restaurant has breakfast but do not eat there as the food is quite substandard and the prices are ridiculous. Right across the street are many restaurants that will give you fabulous breakfasts and at half the price!!! The location of the hotel however, is fabulous. The Moma is steps away and so is shopping and other sights as the hotel is very central. A cab ride to just about anywhere was not expensive. So here staying here is all about location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: jmb560
Reviews.Content: Wow...This hotel used to be wonderful. My husband used to live there for work years ago and I don't think that they have done anything to the place in twenty years. We had stayed there a few years ago and were extremely unimpressed with the people who were running the place. Hilton had offered us a trip in order to look at their NYC timeshare. With the way the hotel staff treated us, there was no way that we were going to become part of that "family". So, now, years later, I booked a room on the executive level for a night's stay for me and my mom after flying in from Europe. The room was disgusting. The carpet was bubbling and there were big spots on it. It was damp. The bathroom was dirty. Honestly, we spent the evening walking around outside, had a couple of drinks at the bar, went to exec lounge to print our boarding passes for the next morning, tried to sleep and left at six in the morning for the airport. The desk staff was extremely unfriendly. If fact, we had returned to the desk to ask a question and got in line for the "executive" customers. The lady yelled at us that it was not open and to get in line with everyone else! I really didn't care, but the other business people in line were not happy! The lounge was nice, but you had to pay for drinks. We will need to find a new "home" for our New York stays!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God! When will I find a decent hotel in NY?!”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: It's the forth hotel in Manhattan I've tried for the last 1,5 years and again I was deeply dissapointed! But let's start from a couple of good things. The hotel has a central and very convenient location, close to everything. Pretty good fitness centre. Excellent executive lounge staff. That's all about good news. Now what was bad. Incredibly rude front desk staff (namely Tanja) - I was so furious about the way she talked to me that I even thought to change the hotel right away! Rooms are small, old-fashioned and dated. Plumbing are so noisy that in the first night I couldn't even fall asleep. Executive lounge breakfasts are mediocre. Only two elevators serving club level guest are far to be enough - you can wait up to 10 minutes in the morning to get down. Farwell to Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Good for biz traveler”
Reviews.Author: SoFLme
Reviews.Content: I'm Hilton Diamond member. Hotel has special Diamond check-in. Best exec lounge in any Hilton. Designated elevators get you up/down quickly. Safe area and convenient in mid 50's and 6th. Rooms good size. Many many foreign (euro and Japanese) guests. Tip your maids if you want the room clean. Everything is overpriced, but it's NYC and what hotel isn't?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TigerHeart25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Check-in was easy and the room was as expected. Room was comfy and cleaning staff extremely nice with the customer as their #1 priority. Located very close to subways, Broadway, Central Park, the LOVE sculpture on Avenue of the Americas, Rockefeller Center, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Big place, not at all cozy, but hey, it's NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel but clean, every amenity that you could ask for, and right in the middle of everything. If you are there for business its in the prime spot but if you are looking for a little leisure time there are bars and restaurants mere steps away. If you are looking chic, this isn't isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for no-nonsense functionality with all the perks of a Hilton, you will fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy lifts”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in NY at the Hilton. Good hotel standards as you would expect from Hilton, rooms clean, staff helpful etc. However I ignored the reviews I had read regarding the noise from the lifts, we were in room 3655 and during the day it sounded like we were in the middle of a tube station with a train going through. Fortunatly at night the use of the lifts reduced enough for us to get some sleep. Bar and restaurants pricey but inkeeping with the rest of NY. Did get a late check out until 4pm without charge and the boarding pass document printer facility was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: km9301
Reviews.Content: Very nice updated rooms. Walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, & Rockefellar Center. Very Busy Lobby. PARKING~ $45 EVERY 24 HR.....eg. late checkout: gets then charged by the hour which gets expensive....but it is New York. Overall, would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, for a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: dojay111
Reviews.Content: We only had a weekend in New York, but needed a great location to get to the theatre, Times Square Fifth Avenue, and Central Park fast and easy. We were only in our room to get dressed, shower and sleep. We had a great nights sleep in a comfortable bed. For as expensive as this room was, It was in need of a few minor upgrades, like the peeling ceiling in the shower. It was overall a very good stay, in a great location. It is worth walking down the street to the Starbuck's, rather than using the one in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Anthony (HGVC desk) made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Tiny2golly
Reviews.Content: As Gold HHonors members we have come to expect a certain standard. The hotel was great but the room size was a lot to be desired and this was after being upgraded. The gym was great! Breakfast was great but expensive. Not sure if we'd stay here again if we come back to New York, would be inclined to try another Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: matan_carmona
Reviews.Content: Good site wonderfully comfortable beds very helpful staff concierge services The room is well equipped

Reviews.Title: “Felt very important in new york”
Reviews.Author: mrbugsyph
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend Amy moreno, executive lounge manager, and her team for a superb service they gave us during our stay in the hotel. The lounge area was very clean all the time and they made sure that food was always replenished. They were also very helpful in teaching us how to operate the coffee/choco machine even when they seem to be busy with their work. Being my first time in new york, i had to do a lot of research for places to see and go. On our first night, while using their computer to print our tickets, they were about to close already. But they patiently waited for us to finish and even suggested some tips on getting better deals on purchasing tickets for baseball games. Ms Amy was also very friendly and even suggested several places and restaurants for us to visit and try. She never fails to greet and flash her big smile each morning. Job well done! I will definitely go back here on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Aaroncox
Reviews.Content: The staff there was completely unhelpfull when I inquired about personal business,I thought the personel was being smart with me and I found it difficult to believe that this was funny for them,and having them waste my time.I think its a vey nice hotel and one of the best places in new york for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: imhenryk1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in manhattan. With the covered drive way for pick up and drop off of taxis your never have to get wet in the rain. The front desk staff was exceptional in taking care of our needs. The room was updated though a bit small in the bathroom. There is a Starbucks in the hotel. If you are hilton diamond you receive comp wifi and breakfast. That is a great value in nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to Hilton name.”
Reviews.Author: travelerx070
Reviews.Content: This hotel's main attraction is it's location. Located so close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Times Square there are a weeks worth of attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE, RUDE, RUDE”
Reviews.Author: kalenacole
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel didn't even start yet and the rudeness of the reservations staff had me wishing our conference was at another hotel. So far I've had a reservations raise her voice at me, try to make me reserve a room even though I asked right away to be transferred to an events coordinator we're working with, then she put me on hold for almost 10 minutes and never came back. I am now staying at a different hotel! Can't imagine trying to deal with these people more than walking through the lobby and going to the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor housekeeping and noisy”
Reviews.Author: LizinVa
Reviews.Content: I accepted an offer to listen to one of their timeshare offers, so I can't complain about paying under $300 for two nights in Midtown. The room that they gave me was right next to the elevator and where the housekeeping staff worked out of, making the ambient noise excessive. The service was okay with the exception of the housekeeping staff who did not actually clean anything. When I checked in, I immediately checked for bed bugs, fortunately not finding any evidence of them. When checking the beds, I found numerous human hairs in the bed linens. This was also a problem in the tub; I found several hairs that were not mine as I had not used the tub at the point of checking. The towels were wrinkled and smelled less than fresh. Additionally, when I went to look out my window there were a bunch of guys right outside who were looking straight at me saying "hi"; a little unnerving being a solo female. On some positive notes, they did let me check in early and the hotel is close to numerous NY attractions such as Times Square, Fifth Ave shopping and Rockefeller Center. I found a great wine bar (Morell's) nearby just outside of Rockefeller Center where you can sit outside and watch people. I also found a great authentic pizzeria on 49th between 6th and 7th avenues. The thing is that if Hilton wants to sell a timeshare they should try to give potential buyers a better first impression; but alas I received the "single woman" treatment by them giving me the room with the worst location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: TorunR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gigantic and not the kind I would choose for myself normally. But this time it served my purposes, because of the walking distance to businesses I was visiting and very good subway connections. My room was large enough, a pity they saved it on the bathroom. The bed was really comfortable. The one bad thing about the room was the air conditioning which was much too strong. The room was like a fridge, and this was in August! I had to turn it off at night. And the wifi in the room costs about $16, which I don't like. Free wifi in the lobby that works poorly, try Starbucks across the street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location at reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would see the day when I would consider $290 a night cheap but in New York, for a 5 star hotel, it clearly has become so. I was attending a conference at the Hilton and started investigating google maps for nearby hotels that were cheaper, only to find Hilton itself was actually the cheapest. I arrived on a rainy evening, and porters immediately helped me and my belongings out of my taxi. Check in, considering it was the eve of a major conference at the hotel, was almost instant. The lobby was packed with people, including some guests that seemed to linger making use of the free wifi for their ipads, but I was able to cross the bright, low-ceilinged lobby quickly to my elevator. I got a room on the 15th floor which is actually handy as it is served by 2 sets of lifts. The room was not large but perfectly adequate to my needs, and was spotless, clean and had the typical contemporary Hilton decor with light wood tones and a good chair for my desk and a bed that was perfect (I fell asleep in my street clothes when I lay down, having arrived from Hong Kong). There are lots of great restaurants nearby, it is great for meetings, shopping (there are 24 hour drugstores and supermarkets), or shows between 56th and Times Square. The staff seemed quite accommodating to both leisure and business travelers, and that is probably the most attractive aspect of this hotel. It actually is a great choice for midtown, and all the boutique hotels in the neighborhood should take a close look at themselves and ensure they are offering both a competitive and differentiated full service experience if they plan to charge a $100 premium.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Help in time of Personal Crisis”
Reviews.Author: sgapdx
Reviews.Content: As part of the Oregon Flight for Freedom, I stayed at the Hilton NY from September 8, to September 14, 2011, in room 4034. Although my friend/roommate and I were scheduled to depart on September 12, 2011, due to a seizure episode, we didn't leave until September 14, 2011. When my friend called security to help me, I was incredibly fortunate that Thomas Ryan answered the call. Although I was in and out of consciousness, I do recall Mr. Ryan was polite, prepared, and professional. I also vividly recall when he asked who was my next of kin, that I perhaps too forcefully said I didn't want him to call and to scare my son. I further recall it was Mr. Ryan who took the lead in coordinating with the FDNY EMT personnel. Although I understand another security person, Emily, also was helping, I have no independent recollection of her presence and assistance. Nonetheless, I am equally indebted to her. At a time when I was "frightened to death", having Mr. Ryan's calm, competent, and kind presence and coordination of emergency care was a huge blessing. I have always chosen Hilton properties in which to stay when on vacation and when planning events at home in Portland, Oregon. This experience re-enforces how right those decisions are. In sum, I am a lifetime booster of Hilton properties, not solely but materially due to the extraordinary care provided to me in a time of great fear and great need by Mr. Ryan and Emily. My most heartfelt thanks go out to you and the Hilton NY

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: JWS45
Reviews.Content: Location was the primary reason for selecting this hotel. Price reflected the convenience. Room was clean and comfortable. Exceptionally quiet for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: has2bperfect
Reviews.Content: Room clean but decor a little tired, we only used the restaurant once, for breakfast, good food but expensive. The best thing about the hotel is the location, central and very close to Central Park. We would stay again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Tired tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: pdxdavidb
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel and very busy. We checked into a single queen room...it was outrageously small so we transferred to a double queen room just so we could have some space. The first room was so small we couldn't even find space to put a suitcase on a suitcase stand...in fact the room didn't even have one available. The second room was better...but it's decor is worn and tired. The queen sized beds don't seem to be true queens...let's just say it's much smaller than our queen bed at home. The bathroom is really small too. This was our first trip to NYC...so no comparisons available for value...but at $439 a night, we expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Khaled B
Reviews.Content: I'll start this review with a bit of clarification: there are seven distinct Hilton properties scattered about New York City so you need to know which one you're staying at, especially if/when it comes to walking around/transportation [taxis]. LOCATION: The flagship Hilton New York is a colossal 2000+ room convention hotel housed in a massive building on 6th Avenue [Avenue of the Americas] at 54th Street. Its location is probably its strongest point: across the street from the Museum of Modern Art, a block from shopping on Fifth Avenue, a few blocks south of Central Park and surrounded by restaurants, bars, shops, badly-needed/overpriced parking lots and signature New York City sights. Everything you need to see is all wonderfully close by. John F. Kennedy International Airport is 45 minutes to an hour away. ENTRANCE/LOBBY: Seeing as this is a huge hotel catering to huge events and huge number of visitors every hour, the lobby is expectedly huge. The space was renovated a few years ago and looks the upscale part as it should, but the waiting times to check in at the reception can sometimes take upwards of half an hour due to long queues. The staff handle their weight very well given the pressure they work under, with the entire check-in process taking no longer than ten minutes. ROOMS: Since there are about 45 floors in the hotel [give or take], elevators to the rooms are split into four banks of three elevators each, with each bank of elevators servicing specific floors [i.e. one elevator bank would go to floors 2-15, while the other went from 16-30, etc.]. This is convenient since it greatly eases the load of guests and visitors ferrying about, but can be a bit confusing to those not used to the system. Also, the hotel has been in the process of renovating their rooms, something which has taken a few years. Be sure to specify a renovated room at reservation or check-in; they're far better than their tattier, worn down predecessors. We were given two renovated, interconnecting rooms [king/double] on the twelfth floor. They were predominantly decorated in beige with white and red touches; very contemporary and relaxing. There are large windows that stare out into neighboring office buildings and the New York skyline/streetscape. Also, these rooms were HUGE by New York standards, with plenty of space to navigate around the beds, a real working desk and plenty of storage space seen in counters and drawers below the television and decent closet space. Unfortunately however, the bathrooms were tiny; this IS New York, after all. The three-piece bathrooms have a toilet, sink and either a bathtub or a glass shower. Counter space is tight and water pressure is mediocre to slightly above average, with moderately hot water available at all times. Another quibble has to do with the bed; although they're Hilton's patented Serenity Beds, all the traffic that these beds have seen resulted in the mattresses being very worn out, complete with body indents and lumpy bits. The pillows are fine, though. On the plus side, tea and coffee are replenished every morning and evening, so coffee junkies like myself can gorge themselves to a hot, free cup of Lavazza whenever the urge strikes. FOOD/BEVERAGE: We ate breakfast at the hotel's main restaurant two of the five nights we were there. The quality of the food is just above average at best, but there is a good selection of yogurt, baked goods and cereals. Also, the egg station is good since everything is made to order. There is a Starbucks in the building with direct access to the lobby, so this can come in particularly handy. There's also a deli across the street from the Starbucks, but none of us checked it out. Room service is decent; dinner arrived at our room within 30 minutes of being ordered and was hot and well-prepared. LEISURE: There is a gym in the hotel, but access to it is paid; we didn't use it throughout the duration of our stay. There is no pool. FACILITIES: The hotel has several floors above the lobby dedicated to meeting rooms and ballrooms, and these see tremendous use all year round. There is complimentary wireless Internet in the lobby, with paid access in the guest rooms. Consequently, you'll find throngs of people packing any available lobby furniture and even curled up in corners and on the floor harnessing their MacBooks and iPads at all times of the day and night. SERVICE: The Hilton's service is fantastic given the load that these people are subjected to on an hourly basis. They're efficient, to-the-point and still manage to flash smiles and crack jokes. The concierge also handles reservations for Broadway shows and tourist trips, saving time for visitors and making things oh-so-simple. Good on you, team. OVERALL: The [renovated] rooms are very good, the quality of food needs to improve and be prepared to battle hordes of people; this is not a hotel for the claustro/agoraphobic. That being said, however, this hotel's strongest selling point is its location, so visitors to New York will not be disappointed since the property puts them in the center of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: Hilton Honors member. I used to stay at this hotel regularly and later was in the "Hilton Club" timeshare which is located in this hotel, but transferred my timeshare membership to the West 57th facility and haven't stayed in this hotel for a while (or off the Club floor for an even longer while). I got a room with my club points for one night in order to get to an early appointment in the neighborhood. Although I'm used to the lobby here being very busy with long lines, I was able to get service almost right away at the HHonors desk and without asking was given a free upgrade to the Executive floor, which also includes a free continental breakfast in the Executive Lounge. My room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and everything was in good working order, which I appreciated. I especially liked the Internet access which worked very well, even for high-speed applications like watching videos, and was complimentary for HHonors members. The included breakfast was good despite the lack of any hot food, and the executive lounge offers a wonderful view to eat it. I appreciated the tables facing out windows so solo business travelers like me can enjoy the view and don't have to worry about sharing tables. This hotel is in a good location for midtown, convenient to several subways and with an all-night deli across the street for picking up snacks. There is also a halal cart by the deli that, judging by its lines some nights, must be one of the better ones. I was a bit disappointed that a bathrobe for use during my stay was not provided and also that some of the furniture and especially the carpet in my room looked like it had seen better days. They could probably get away with the furniture for a few more yeas, but the carpet was awful - really ancient, stained and looked like something from a budget motel. Since the Executive floors are supposed to be the nicer rooms, it made me wonder what the rooms on the "regular" floors looked like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aussiebabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks over Christmas and New Years Eve. The location makes this hotel hard to beat with an easy walk to Central Park, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. The rooms are small, the bathroom is tiny, and everything was looking very tired.Only problem that we found was with the restaurant, Starbucks all closed for a few days due to the Blizzard. But if was understandable. We would stay again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: VaneTaiah
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for a week of busy work. The hotel is very well located. That's the good part. Bad part is that the service is awful. It's like a huge airport where there's a call center for everything where nobody really answers for what you are looking for. You have to make a line for everything (check in, have breakfast, ask a question). My room was overbooked so I have to wait for 5 hours to have it ready (and I've payed for the room for 1 day in advance just to have it ready when I get there). I've booked a conference room and service was very poor. Rooms are kind of small and need some demodulating, specially if you compare them with other Hilton hotels around the world. My recommendation is that you should Stay there just if you are looking just for a good location and if you have lot of patience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, comfortable room, clean and family-friendly!”
Reviews.Author: reidhome
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I met my husband in NYC while he was at a business conference (in the hotel). Our room comfortably accomodated the 4 of us, and we had a terrific view of Radio City Music Hall from our window! We were just a few short blocks from Times Square, and the subway options nearby were many - very easy access to all of our tourist destinations! LOVED the free HopStop App for easily getting clear directions to all of our destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn70820
Reviews.Content: We love this Hilton! Have stayed there several times in the past 6 years. I think most recent was October 2010, but we are planning to go again in a few months. It is maintained well and the location is perfect. We like to do the theatre and museums and all of the great things that are available in NYC. Transportation is very convenient and the conciege is so helpful to offer help to those of us who need it! I've always felt that I was treated great. I acknowledge that extra help with my hearty thanks. I'd give it nothing but and EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back to the Hilton New York in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary L
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hilton New York (Avenue of the America's) during Hurricane Irene. We arrived Friday afternoon and stayed until Monday night. We're glad we stayed at the Hilton New York. Despite the fact that almost everything in NYC closed down on Saturday and Sunday, the Hilton New York made tremendous efforts to keep us informed and their services running for the comfort and convenience of their guests. Notices were sent to our room about closures and what was being done to offset those inconveniences. All available staff pitched in to help. We saw front office staff wearing their suits, working as busers in the dining area to keep the buffet stocked and the tables cleared. Our room was kept clean with fresh towels provided, beds made and garbage removed. While some facilities in the hotel had to be closed for safety reasons, we were given complimentary drink vouchers to compensate. Boxes of umbrellas were made available at the concierge's desk for the use by guests who ventured outside. All in all we were most impressed by the dedication of all the staff, front office and back rooms, who did their very best to keep a large hotel running, and guests safe, secure and fed, in a situation that was an unknown for everyone. I'd go back to the Hilton New York in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for short trips”
Reviews.Author: pereena
Reviews.Content: I visited New York with my family this summer and stayed at the Hilton on 6th Avenue. The location is great because its minutes from Central Park (for the kids), 5th Avenue for shopping and close to other attractions like Times square etc. The staff were very polite and the rooms spacious enough for four of us.

Reviews.Title: “In the midst of the frenzy”
Reviews.Author: Shoegirl04
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is in a perfect, central location. It is blocks from Central Park, the Theater District, delicious restaurants, subway stations, and great shopping. The one downfall is that it's ALWAYS busy - the lobby is always bustling with people and the taxi whistle is always blowing. Besides that, this hotel would be perfect. The rooms are decently sized for a NY hotel and they are super clean. The bathroom is small, but functional. The staff is super accommodating and always willing to help with any questions you may have. I've stayed here for business and pleasure, and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “They are Prepared to weather any storm”
Reviews.Author: madrews
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York during Hurricane Irene. I have stayed at this property several times before, but this time I was particularly impressed with their efforts to keep guests informed, comfortable and calm. Notices were sent around to every room, telling us of expected interruptions in services due to decreased staff and food and beverage options for the guests. In addition, the table of coffee urns etc was a thoughtful touch. Well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: jcook7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton 18th and 19th August 2011. I would highly recommend paying a few extra dollars and get an executive room floor, which guarantees being on a high floor. We booked this well in advance and the hotel offered us a further upgrade for a small fee. We stayed on the 44th floor, couldn't hear any traffic at night. We had previous experience staying in New York, and if you are on lower floors, you will not get a very good sleep. We read reviews before we left about the hotels included buffet breakfast. Yes the hard boiled eggs were cold, but there was plenty of other items to choose from. The blueberries were great as well as the other fruit items. This hotel is close to central park, which is why we picked it. My wife and I love walking through there during the day. Lots going on. Would definately stay at this hotel again. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bed felt like a cot”
Reviews.Author: rosie7612
Reviews.Content: everything else as expected. $15 to use gym which was just crosstrainers and treadmills essentially

Reviews.Title: “nice location, glad there was some revamping of the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lukefr965
Reviews.Content: Nice location on 6th avenue, however the rooms, as most in nyc are relatively small and noisy but this is NYC I believe. Some rooms have been revamped and are more pleasant mine, had only a shower which was enough being on my own (and never taking bath!).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, my room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: mergreen11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. But the cleaning staff should stand in the shower and look at all of the dust in the air vent. The bathtub didn't work that well. The drain didn't let the water out so it was like taking a shower in a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful and very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: AlanaBeightol
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in NYC!! It has an extremely easy valet station. The inside of the hotel is gorgeous and the staff is amazing! Melissa Beatty was extremely helpful and would recommend her if you want a great experience. There is a taxi line out from so it makes it very easy to get a taxi where you need to go. Also, the location is within a mile of many areas including Central Park, Times Square and Broadway! Extremely recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location...central to everything”
Reviews.Author: luv t
Reviews.Content: Hosted a group to Manhattan staying at the Hilton New York on Avenue of the Americas. Staff are very accommodating. Rooms were clean. Hotel is central to everything..walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Broadway. Only drawback is the fees charged for internet access & the exercise room. Very steep!! Received complaints as many hotels have free internet access these days. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, property getting dated, always frenetic.”
Reviews.Author: GEERSA
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is a wonderfully situated hotel, very close to Fifth Avenue, Central Park, many museums and some great restaurants. It is a large, bustling hotel and one can often feel like a rushed number instead of a valued guest. It seems to be geared to business and conferences, and likely is not a great choice for families (especially young children). The staff are generally very friendly and accommodating, but when unable to deal with issues will just blame the hotel's size and capacity for issues. Waiting for elevators (to go up, or go down) has been an issue every time we have stayed in this hotel, and often gets quite irritating. The elevator noise travels pretty far too, we moved rooms twice and despite having four rooms between us and the elevators were still subjected to elevator noise constantly. On my behalf my wife booked two rooms for this trip, one for us and the other for my in-laws. Despite checking in with my HHonors card, I'm still waiting for my points. Room wise, having stayed in both Queen and King rooms I would urge potential guests (if possible) to book a King room, the Queen rooms can be a bit small and the Queen beds seem to be a bit smaller than usual. Smallish beds and elevator noise did not make for as restful a night as hoped. The rooms are comfortable, but need some updating. While everything is functional, it just seems to be one step away from needing to be replaced. The plumbing system seems to be a bit strained, and in both the rooms our family had there were issues with basins and baths not draining. The mini-bar is quite basic (and New York pricey), and ours had several items past their sell by date (we had this same issue during a stay in January 2011) since the cleaning staff check the mini-bars daily this simply should not occur. The fitness centre requires payment or Hilton HHonors Silver or Gold status, at $15 a visit I found it quite irritating that the hotel did not provide a fitness centre for guests without payment or status. After complaining I was granted access, and was very pleased with the fitness centre. It is very well appointed, with friendly staff, high quality machines, and a good mix of cardio and weight training equipment. Wi-Fi needs to be paid for (seriously, in this day and age, complimentary wi-fi should be standard). All in all, the Hilton is comfortable and clean. It is not a welcoming hotel and feels formulaic at times. Despite four stays at this property over the past two years, I'm in two minds as to whether I'll return, it's missing the welcoming feel I expect at a hotel. Another reason could be that a front desk staff member basically stated that Hampton Inn provides more than Hilton - not quite delivering on the brand promise. You'll likely not be disappointed after your stay and the New York Hilton, but then again you'll likely not be impressed either, but I do hope they improve as the location and potential in this hotel is immense.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with the helpfulness of the staff”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I joined up with our daughter, her partner and our two-year-old granddaughter from Australia for a six night stay last month. We had booked two rooms on the Executive floor. We found the check-in staff helpful and efficient-they gave us adjoining rooms as requested with a crib in one; they advised that the rooms had not been refurbished but we found them both comfortable and entirely adequate for our needs, and of a good size considering New York standards. The real bonus was the Executive Lounge - well-furnished with constant soft drinks, tea and coffee permanently available, cookies in the afternoon and tasty snacks from 5pm onwards. The continental breakfast was more than adequate with a good choice of fruit,cereals and bakery items-ideal for a choosy two-year old-and the staff could not have been more helpful, finding us a suitable table each morning with a highchair for our little one. Amy Moreno,the Customer Service Manager for the lounge, went out of her way to ensure that we had whatever we needed. She and her colleagues seemed delighted to have our granddaughter as a special guest! The hotel is extremely well-located for all the main attractions that NYC has to offer. Our only complaint is that it became extremely busy for several days when a very large conference of Marketing Affiliates-whatever that means-was taking place. The delegates flooded the bar and lobby and made a lot of noise while networking, although I suppose that is the price you have to pay when staying in a business-orientated hotel in NYC. It was a relief to be able to retreat to the lounge after an exhausting day of sightseeing and shopping and I would recommend paying the extra for an Executive room for this reason alone. Overall,we considered that the hotel offered very good value for money and we would definitely consider staying at the Hilton again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, poor maintaince, overpriced - worse Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: azytnic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Because the Sheraton was full. What a mistake. First the positives â€“ Great location. Large rooms. Downsides â€“ Service poor. Cleanliness horrible. We had a NE corner room on the 7th floor (I believe it was the 7th). Lovely view onto central park. The room was large but quite dated. I can deal with the age but not the dirt. See the attached photos. There was at least 3-4 months worth of dust on top of the fire alarm. The wallpaper in the rooms had clearly visible dirty fingerprints all over it. In places the wallpaper was torn and poorly patched. This was not limited to our room â€“ the hallway walls were severely banged up with divots missing from the wall and black streaks from where the rubber bumpers of luggage and cleaning carts had rubbed against it. Part of this is due to the age, it is in desperate need of renovations. But a larger part is due in my mind to a clear and severe lack of direction and management from higher up. Dirty linen would be left on the floor in the hallways for up to 9hrs. A dirty glass was left on the counter at the end of the hallway for 2 days! While waiting for the elevator I saw and elderly man having trouble getting his cardkey to work in his door. He asked in broken English to a maid for help. She pointed to the phone outside the elevator and told him to call the front desk! This is supposed to be 4 star hotel? It was clear the man could barely speak English and even if he could the maid should have walked over to the phone and called the front desk herself to ask for help. If I was upper management at Hilton I would fire every manager in this hotel. If they were actually supervising they would address these deficiencies and instil a culture of service and quality. This is obvious not an isolated situation, browsing though photos on tripadvisor shows numerous other examples. I have never seen anything like this. I will no longer book at any Hilton but will stick with the Sheraton and the Marriot where I have never had such an issue.

Reviews.Title: “I expect better”
Reviews.Author: Gerard-advisor
Reviews.Content: Toilets don't flush properly, annoying loud speaker and LCD screen in th lift will drive you crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: SKG109
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay there fro four nights, unfortunately Hurricane Irene cut short our visit and we were gone in two days. Overall, I found this Hilton property to be good but not great. From the marginally acceptable bell boy service - took 25' to get our bags up - to constant waiting lines for customers to check-in, it was always a case of missed opportunities to be great. It was disappointing to see a customer point out the overflow of water into the hallway at the executive lounge. The lounge was exceptionally well staffed on Saturday morning but Friday am and pm, was marginal. The rooms are standard hotel rooms, which is a compliment in down town NYC! The rooms were made up quickly and the amenities were above average. The worst part was the elevators. The wait was unacceptable. Time for an overhaul of the elevators Hilton! We had a group lunch at the cafe where the service was good and the desserts - huge chocolate and carrot cakes! - were great! Overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but slightly dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: Purchased via Priceline bid; can't really complain too much given the excellent price I paid. The lobby area is a bit dated, needs a refresh, room was typical small Manhattan, but had been updated. Bed didn't seem up to par with quality of other Hiltons. Make sure to ask for a room away from elevators--hard time going to sleep with the horrible noise when doors would open. Maybe these are "special" rooms given to Priceline customers. Check-in was fast and efficient, but less than the warm and welcoming of other Hiltons; but this is NYC after all. Overall, if you get a good deal this hotel and location is great. Paying retail, you may be a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,but a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: smudgerBradford
Reviews.Content: The delux room we had on the 10th floor was excellent.Very clean, tidy and comfortable.the Hotel though, was very busy and noisy most of the time we were there, with large parties of delegates from company training meetings,who seemed to take over most of the bars on an evening.We did not eat in the Hotel for we thought the prices were a little expensive in the restaurant.Not to worry though, as there were lots of restaurants in the area near the Hotel, which served excellent food at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Wtbri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days room was small and stunk of mould and mildew and this was the executive floor. For almost 400 dollars per night I felt completely ripped off. Cleaners were the friendliest people in the hotel and the bar tender in the lobby bar was a complete misery. A bottle of beer in the bar was 11.77 with the tip that they automatically added. Will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Survived hurricane Irene in this hotel- fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: 747jet
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel for a two night stay in a "deluxe room". Check in was swift, but was upgraded to executive room. It was small and rather dated, but was able to downgrade my room type to the deluxe room and still keep access to the Executive lounge. Executive lounge was very different to European versions. Size was the first thing- it was exceedingly large, but with a drawback that it was noisy with lots of families using the lounges, so sitting quietly reading or working was impossible. The lounge does charge for alcoholic drinks, which is very different to European Hiltons. The deluxe room is tastefully decorated and had a queen sofa bed for extra guests if required. Lavazza coffee maker in room, but with dried creamer instead of half and half. Bed was exceedingly comfortable with very fancy LCD reading lights. The shallow American bath has been replaced with a spacious shower cubicle with a monsoon shower head! During Irene I needed to book a room on a night-for-night basis and the Executive staff at the front desk were exemplary. Special praise should go to Giovanny and Kelly who were exceedingly helpful. They had a lot to put up with checking in evacuees and stranded guests. I had to change rooms twice during the last part of the stay due to the day-by-day reservation as the airlines reworked schedules. I was offered a corner suite which offered a three window view out to the encroaching hurricane! Very enjoyable to watch as a rookie! The suite was not as up-to-date as the deluxe room decor but very comfortable too! I was heartened to see the true Hilton spirit of the staff during the hurricane and cannot praise them enough for their tireless efforts! Well done staff of Hilton New York, Avenue of the Americas!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: sbholo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton this past week for a business trip. Reception was extremely helpful, kind, and briefed me accordingly on the whereabouts of everything in the hotel (it is rather large). The room was a perfect size with a great large TV. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were plentiful and perfect. The bathroom was cleanily and nicely put together. The room also imcluded coffee and tea, which was nice. The Marketplace (hotel restaurant) had great food for lunch and dinner. The breakfast is fine, but certainly overpriced so I do not suggest going unless it is included with your stay. The wait staff is very professional, tentaive, and friendly. Also, off of the Marketplace is a Starbucks which i thought was great. The location is great; right in the center of everything! Times Square is a few blocks away and shopping too. This hotel was great but out of my price range. i would probably only go back for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Much2bdun
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Hilton New York! It is located conveniently to all that Midtown and 5th Avenue offer without being in the thick of Times Square. The room was very comfortable. Crisp white linens and dark wood were used to decorate the space. The bathroom was updated with a seamless, glass-doored shower and granite counters. The bathroom could have been a bit more spacious but we are talking about New York. The entire staff from reception to the parking attendents were friendly and helpful. By the end of the week, this hotel felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful hotel and comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a weekend in New York City. I managed to get a decent rate on the internet for a queen room at the Hilton. The hotel is very big and nice, it is in Avenue of the Americas, several blocks above Times Square, and the area is much more quiet than 7th Ave. or Broadway. Our prior experience in a Times square hotel had been worse, as the soundproofing was very bad and we could hear traffic noise all night long. Check in was very smooth and our room was ready when we arrived (12:15 am). The room was on the small side, but it was clean, and had a very comfortable bed and a huge plasma TV. The bathroom was also very clean and very well appointed. Even though we were close to the elevators and "only" in the 12th floor, soundproofing was great and we had a very good night's sleep. Check out was fast, as it usually is in Hilton properties, but we had to pay for each item left in locker room. Having to pay for items in the locker room reminded me of the days when I stayed in hostels, and I do not think it is a necessary practice for an upscale hotel. All in all, we will chose the Hilton again next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when in NY”
Reviews.Author: rickwood50
Reviews.Content: Location, standard of rooms and general standard of rooms are all great. The executive lounge is a perfect bonus when I can have access. For business it makes the perfect location for both up town and down town.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a good location for NYC”
Reviews.Author: DVP16
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is at 6th and 53rd which is only about 4 or five blocks from Times Square. Far enough away to avoid the throngs of tourist yet a short walk. Rooms are clean; staff is very nice and helpful. However I asked the concierge about tickets for a play and was told it would be best to walk to the box office, found that odd for a Hilton property. Also, our group had contracted for use of the executive lounge on the 44th floor. I did not get access when I checked in- took a day to straighten that out after a bit of arrogance from the front desk â€œonly platinum members can have access sirâ€�. Yeah well guess you were wrong. That incident aside the hotel is great service wise. Parking is expensive as I recall over 35 a night, but you can park your bicycle for 18.00 (yes I said bicycle). Drinks and food are also high. The breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant is about $35.00 a person. While there check out some of the street vendors food carts out front they have good food. Also check out Rayâ€™s pizza on 7th. Location is just about 4 blocks south of central park. You can also walk to 5th Avenue for shopping and all the Broadway shows are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: ValueWithClass
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is great! The location is fantastic and the rooms are nice. Our family got the standard room with two double beds. The room was clean, updated, tastefully furnished, and had a good sized granite bathroom. The front desk gave me the option of a higher floor for the view or a lower floor for elevator convenience. We chose the latter and never had to wait more than a minute for one of the 12 elevators. We called for service on a minor TV issue (which turned out to be something out of their control). The service person came within a few minutes of my call. The front desk dollowed up with a call asking if we would like a different room (not necessary). They really acted like they cared which is refreshing! They have the best fitness center of any hotel we've ever stayed in. There's a restaurant, lounge, ATM, theatre desk, attached parking garage, lots of cabs out front -- everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Scout7232
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on this hotel. Awesome location. Had a disability double room, which was large sized. Walk-in shower puddled out to the drain in the middle of the bathroom. Floor would be dangeous for elderly. No complaints. Request for quiet room honored.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled With Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: MaryR010
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the New York Hilton. I took my boys to New York, for our first visit there, to celebrate their high school and college graduations. I looked at every hotel in New York - believe me! - and I chose the New York Hilton because we were able to get a room with two double beds and a fold-out couch for the three of us, so they wouldn't have to share. The suites are on the Executive Level, which I now highly recommend! Also, the location is indeed perfect, close to everything in Midtown Manhattan. We stayed from August 6 through the 9th, on the 43rd floor. I was absolutely delighted with the wonderful service. Yes, it's a big hotel, so you don't always expect that. Everyone was friendly, from front desk to housekeeping, and quick to respond to any request. Whenever I had to call customer service from the room the phone was answered at the first ring - impressive! We needed the bedding for the fold out bed - I called and it was at the door in FIVE minutes. Couldn't believe it! The One Bedrooom Suite with two double beds was HUGE. A living room with couch and chairs, large TV, executive desk, kitchenette, closets - and a spacious bedroom with two beds, another TV, a sparkling clean bathroom.AND a big walk in closet! The beds were so comfortable I want to buy one for my home. Really! AND all three of us were thrilled with the complimentary Executive Lounge that's included with the Executive Level Suites. To be honest, I thought that meant a small room with a coffee urn and some cookies. Not! It's a beautiful large space on the 44th floor, windows line both sides of the room, it's like walking into a penthouse restaurant. All the hosts were so nice, it was furnished beautifully, and the food was wonderful - such a selection! - and the view!! -as I said, I felt like I was in a multi-million dollar penthouse. The breakfast was expansive and so nicely presented - fruit, bagels, pastries, breads, spreads, and more. And for two hours in the evening they offer a complimentary hors d'oeuvres buffet - dim sum and shrimp! Crackers and cheese and lots more. There's bar service in the evening (bar service is the only thing you have to pay for), so before I went to the theatre I stopped in for a glass of wine and some nice appetizers, sat at my favorite window seat that looks down on Central Park, and considered myself very lucky! We felt like privileged guests, it really was wonderful. And I couldn't get over the delight of enjoying a bagel, fruit and coffee in the morning while looking out at Central Park from the 44th floor. I was thrilled with everything. (And yes, they had delicious cookies too! :) Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: 47Marion
Reviews.Content: I stay in this particular Hotel fairly often. About a week ago I gave Hilton some negative feedback about my last stay because there have been a few unhappy incidents coming together and I was upset about a some things. It was mainly because my room was away from my collegues, old, very small and I just couldnt get proper internet connection for most of my stay. This time my experience was completely different. I checked into a beautifully new refurbished room which Design I totally love and most important of all I have an option to chose between either the wireless internet which is all over the house (and sometimes doesnt work that well) or the cable (which really provides the highspeed internet that I need to do my work or connect to the outside world:-).) Few little things, major difference on how I see and rate the hotel. What really got me into writing this review thou, is the excellent service I ve been receiving from their Director of Rooms and Guest Services Mr Brian Martens. He called me today to follow up on my problems I had last time and I could really feel that he was concerned and took my feedback very serious. We ve been chatting for about half an hour which is a long time for someone I know is very busy. He apologized and wanted to make sure that I am having a better experience this time, also explaining the changes the hotel is going through right now. They are in the process of updating the internet so everyone should have a great connection all the time very soon. Taking so much time for the feedback of one single guest , to me is really walking "the extra mile" as Hilton likes to say and Mr Martens has been extremely professional in doing so. Thanks to him and some other improvement, I will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stella8216
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a comfortable hotel in the heart of the city. The book The Hilton New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but staff could do better.”
Reviews.Author: RHH_8
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here with my wife and adult son and found the location to be excellent for walking to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre and subway stations. We were on the 14th floor and were surprised by how quiet it was at night for a New York city centre hotel. When we visited the hotel seemed to be very busy with numerous tour groups and school trippers milling about the lobby area. We had to wait some time to be attended to on arrival and what made it more annoying was that there were several staff standing about chatting behind the reception desk whilst we waited. The hotel shop was not what we expected from such a large hotel and staffed by a surly uncommunicative male who did not even acknowledge our presence. We had cocktails in the bar before heading out to see a Broadway show and again found the barman grumpy and unwelcoming plus the cocktails were unimpressive, poorly presented and quite expensive. So although we thought the hotel itself was very good our overall opinion was diminished by our contact with some staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BobDelrayBeach
Reviews.Content: Charged up to $20/night to use internet. Telephone in room not working. Chair broken.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping needs to do better ...”
Reviews.Author: SpringT
Reviews.Content: The location and general amenities of Hilton NY are fantastic, but their housekeeping staff simply took away from all the positives. During my 5-night stay, there were just so many gaps in their service on the 23rd floor: cleaning cart, vacuum cleaner, refrigerators, and dirty towels were left along the hallway on several occasions; strangely, a Crabtree & Evelyn conditioner that felt out of place with rest of their toiletries and a little "used" upon touch showed up on the second day of my stay and remained until I left. See pictures attached. Additionally, it might be time for some refresh of the hotel - there were watermarks on the celing tiles, and the socket off the wall in my room was falling off. It is such a shame, especially with housekeeping as this is generally a lovely hotel and great for both business and leisure travellers. The location is great and a convenient walking hub to businesses, restaurants and shopping. Plus, it's only 5 short blocks away from Central Park. You can do much better, Hilton! There are choices in the neighbourhood, and Hilton won't be one of them on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: yabeyabe
Reviews.Content: Close to Broadway; Central Park; St. Patricks; Rockefeller Center--this is where you want to be. Not a bargain, but not a ripoff. Nice staff. Good gym. Lots of international visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sara9889
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Hilton hotel, good for a business trip because you know what to expect. The room and bed were very comfortable, great air conditioning, very clean and the staff were pleasant. Nothing extraordinary, but no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “A great Manhattan hotel....”
Reviews.Author: ve3ikv/w6
Reviews.Content: The wife and two teenage girls just loved it. The "deluxe 2 double" room was spacious, well-appointed, and comfortable. The bathroom had new fixtures. There is a safe in the room. The bed had feather pillows, but you can request foam. The girls requested the foam pillows, some extra towels, and extra glasses, and the housekeeping staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. They all felt very safe there, and the general staff were also very friendly and helpful - when they had trouble printing out their boarding passes on the lobby computer, the staff took them over to the front desk and did it from there. The doormen were awesome and super helpful in getting cabs. The hotel is perfectly situated near MOMA, etc. There is a Starbucks attached to the hotel restaurant. If you are on a tight schedule, as they were, and want to hit the streets without a big delay for breakfast, there is a good fast NY diner about a block away - The Astro Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “lack of consistency”
Reviews.Author: poundsjim
Reviews.Content: Executive levels are good but tired. Some rooms are very small and others good but very tired. There are renovated rooms but not on the Exec level. The Executive lounge is overrun with kids and difficult to use as a business place - but maybe it was never meant to be that. The service in the lounge is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: JanetBDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location very close to Central Park, Museum of Modern Art, Rockerfeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and Restaurants. There are street vendors near the hotel as well. There are always taxis at the hotel. Rooms are very comfortable. There were four ladies birthday celebration and we had plenty of room for our luggage and toiletries. Loved it and can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and good experience”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_spaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location with easy access to the Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square and many subway stations. Even though it's a very big hotel has a good gym, good concierge and the staff is very friendly. Bad points is the long line to the lifts and internet very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJL
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for a trade show and needed to be near Times Square for the shuttle service to the show. This hotel was located far enough back from the hustle bustle of Times Square to suit me. A friend was also traveling to the trade show and staying there and they were very accommodating about putting us next to each other even though we arrived on different days. The room was clean, very nice and I was comfortable during my stay of 6 nights. Could have used a magnifying mirror in the bathroom for the price of the room, but that is just one of my pet peeves :-) I found the main lobby bar to be very loud, but hey, it's NYC and a big hotel. There is another lobby bara near the elevators that is much quieter where you can carry your drink to, but while you could sit there, the bar itself was never open during my visit that I noticed. Felt that the breakfast take-away could have had more choices and a place to actually sit. The restaurant offered breakfast, but the choice was the buffet only and it was ridiculously expensive. However, Starbuck's just off the restaurant was handy. There is a deli across the street where a much more reasonable breakfast - and a seat - can be had. There is a great grocery store one block over as well as several good restaurants nearby. I walked to the Met thru Central Park from there as well. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with large rooms, but Breakfast can loose you precious time...”
Reviews.Author: dileepsri
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel, well located for tourists, being close to shopping like Saks 5th Ave and more. Also for business executives, I like the large luxurious sized rooms, especially in the heart of Manhattan - NY. One real painful experience is having breakfast at the hotel. The queue's are painfully very long and if you are in NY for business, you will lose valuable time, and may end walking away from breakfast. If you are on a vacation, you will spend valuable time of your morning waiting for a table. The funny fact is that there re many tables vacant, just the cleaning, and seating seems a painfully slow process. I had to skip my breakfast as the queue's were too long. Otherwise, friendly staff and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gamnpapa
Reviews.Content: Our family 6 Adults and 3 children stayed at the Hilton New York for 2 nights before we left on a cruise. We visit New york City every year and have stayed at many hotels all which were good but this location was great. The hotel is very large and has almost everything you will need. Even though it houses many guests we still felt very comfortable and not hurried. The only disappointment was they did not have a coin operated laundry and this would have been nice for families. Our rooms were very nice. The staff were wonderful and very helpful. The bars and restraurants were good. I cannot think of anything bad to say about our stay. We will return to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel - always TOP NOTCH!"”
Reviews.Author: moggiebd
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we stay at in NYC - we love it.....have been going back year after year. This evening we returned home from our yearly jaunt into NYC for our daughter's dance gig at Radio City. I was thinking on our ride home that I really needed to drop someone a note to let them know how wonderful your hotel is.....each and every visit. We always stay at the Hilton New York, as the location is just perfect for the daily back and forth to Radio City. We have been coming for three or four years and each time we visit we are greeted by a perfectly professional front desk staff, always accommodating parking garage staff, courteous housekeeping folks, etc. Each and every Hilton employee with whom we have had contact has made our stay enjoyable and made us feel like we were an important guest. What capped it all off and made me write this note to you at 11:00 pm, is my phone conversation this evening with Emmanual Issaka. Upon returning home this evening, I realized that I had left a number of items in the bottom drawer of the bureau in our room. My son was devastated, as two of the items were new shirts he had purchased from the NBC store. I told him I would call the hotel right away, but not to get his hopes up. My call was transferred to Mr. Issaka, who could immediately confirm that the items had been recovered and that he would be able to send them to me with a quick exchange of a credit card number to cover the postage costs. He then phoned me back within ten minutes to relay the tracking number. I was astonished at the that level of service and at this hour. He was professional and courteous, just as every other employee always is. I assume you must get tons of emails on a daily basis and I am not sure this will even grace your desk, but I hope it does. You have a wonderful hotel that has become a tradition in our house. We look forward to our trip there every year. This year we even stayed for the entire six-day journey. That is not easy for our family to afford, but it is worth every penny. You can't put a price on the service and comfort you afford us on each visit. So, kudos to you and your staff for the exemplary service(s) you provide. We are big Hilton fans and look forward to our next visit. Thanks again for a wonderful week.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay, staff in executive level made stay excellent”
Reviews.Author: mbegan58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton on the Executive level. Room, ac, bed etc were very comfortable. The food and service on the Excecutive level were excellent. Two staff members in particular were very knowledgeable and professional and they both went out of there way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I'd like to thank Nadia Rodriquez and Amy Moreno. I will definitely return to this ideal hotel and location. Marcia and Ken Egan

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Hafq
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location. Central Manhattan. You can walk to several sights such as central park, times square and fifth avenue. It is a very large hotel and is always lively. Staff were very helpful. There are always taxis outside to take you to any other destinations further afield. The only issue was when a designer scarf I had purchased went missing from our room. Although I would not expect this from a hotel such as the Hilton and was very disappointed that this had even occured, the matter was dealt with perfectly by security and i was compensated for the loss quickly and efficently. Apart from this, we had no other problems. Even though there was this issue, I would not hesitate to stay here again as the service was brill and it was a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: OLDIESGUY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Hotel nice area walking distance to Times Square about 15 minutes,the hotel was a nice place too stay but did not like the double beds as they were not comfy at all in my opinion,the hotel was pretty busy that day,would i stay there again yes i would.The 50 buck parking a day was insane.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Richard_1977
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel exceeded expectations, and I've stayed at quite a few Hiltons. The halls and rooms seemed quite fresh (was this place renovated recently?), and the level of cleanliness and maintenance was first-rate. We were given a nice corner room on the 29th floor with views South down 6th Ave toward the Empire State Building and Radio City Music Hall, and East. The location is fantastic--Rockefeller Center, Central Park and upscale shopping on 5th Avenue are all a short walk away. The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful, and cheerfully answered all our questions. The place IS busy. Others have noted how hectic the lobby is at all hours of the day. We liked it--it has a charged, lively atmosphere that echoes the energy of New York. Does anyone really come to NYC for serenity? In spite of this, we did not feel that the wait times for the elevators was excessive, and getting a taxi out front was never a problem--there is at all hours a huge line of cabs waiting. In short, we loved it and this hotel will be on our short list for future trips to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: cmac555
Reviews.Content: It seems weird to review the Hilton in New York -- on the one hand, it's just another nice Hilton Hotel. But for a couple years it seemed to get a bad rap, with age and a lack of staff friendliness creating bad reviews. As a regular visitor, those days are gone. The rooms have been redone, and they're well appointed. The staff seems to have been given some customer service training, since everyone has become considerably more friendly and customer focused. While it's true you'll still run into big groups gathering in the lobby, the hotel badly needs a bar that's not on the first floor, and the Hilton Honors area on the upper floor is flat out boring, the overall hotel has once again become a very nice place to stay. And if you watch it closely, you can still find the occasional deal (in Manhattan dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing this hotel has going for it.”
Reviews.Author: ex3family
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for walking to everything. Beyond the location, the hotel was a disappointment. One of our two rooms was not ready when we arrived, even though it was 4:30 p.m. The co-worker without a room came to my room to wait to be called that a room was ready. When he called at 6:00 and mentioned the inconvenience, he was offered a late check-out... no upgrade. The hotel rooms need some TLC. The meeting rooms were freezing cold and the sound of construction was a distraction. They ran out of coffee both times that I went for a cup in the morning and said it would be 45 minutes to brew more. In addition to the price of the room, the parking is expensive, the gym is $15/day and the wi-fi is $15/day. Oh, and if you pay for wi-fi in your room, you still have to pay another $25/day to have it in the ballroom for the conference. Since a wi-fi signal must be available in the lobby, there are people lining the hallway to get a signal; it looks ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: mseclck
Reviews.Content: We brought our family for their first trip to NYC and the Hilton was a wonderful place to stay!! It was very clean and welcoming! The staff was very nice while we were planning our trip and once we arrived. The location was perfect and we were within walking distance of many of the places we wanted to visit. It was a Perfect hotel for a family trip and we would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. We will stay here every time”
Reviews.Author: midlothiantexas
Reviews.Content: Due to a late flight we arrived at the Hotel around 2AM (kudos to Carmel Car Service for sticking with us and waiting for us at the curb as we walked out). The staff was very friendly and the room we had requested was still available. The location is ideal for Central Park; shopping; Broadway and Times Square. The concierge desk knows everything and everyone in NYC. The Hilton New York will be our choice every time we make it up to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Style Hotel - good but too big”
Reviews.Author: Skibiketravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York for three nights. It is a Las Vegas type hotel - thousands of rooms, fast check-in, good room, but impersonal service. I liked it, but not that much. The service is way too impersonal, as it occurs in hotels with many rooms. The room was good though, and everything went well. It would not be my first (nor second) choice in NY, but if I got a good rate on it, I would be back. On thing that is very good is the location. Top location. Right in between Times Square and Central Park, and near subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: JohnSocal
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 38th floor with a view if 53rd street from 6th ave. to the river. The thing impressed us the most was the fabulous service. Everybody went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. The location is great near to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Billybailey
Reviews.Content: Using Trip Advisor as our main page, we booked our reservation for the Hilton New York through Priceline. During the reservation process, we had some issues with conflicting information given by the Hilton central reservation department. Not wanting to deal with the Hilton central reservation department in Manila, we contacted Kellie Cahill at the Hilton New York. She was very helpful and forwarded our concerns to Agnes Torres, the reservation manager. Even though her hotel staff had nothing to do with our issue, Agnes exceeded our expectation in not only correcting our problem without question, but also gave us a special treat. Thank you Agnes Torres for taking great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “I have the following small complaints”
Reviews.Author: LeePulaski_Va_
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very nice hotel in a great location. It is clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. I have the following small complaints: 1. The exercize area costs $15.00 per day. That is ridiculous. 2. You must pay to use the business center. That is ludicrous. 3. There is free internet in the lobby, but not in your room. That is crazy. 4. A draft beer in the lobby bar costs a staggering $9.50. That is insane.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KDWNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Very clean modern hotel with a perfect location Close to Time Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park. Good size room with modern bathroom and comfortable bed Helpful friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: lawtygrr
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to NYC, a combination business trip/family vacation. Check-in and check-out was very first for Hilton Honors members. The room was much bigger than I was expecting and appropriately furnished. The cleaning staff was quick and good. I did have one maintenance problem that was left unfixed for several days. The concierge desk was manned by efficient and helpful staff and pre-printed directions to major attractions were a plus. From the hotel it is an easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Hell's Kitchen, and the Show District. The elevators were slow and insufficient to deal with the crowds of people at peak hours. The lobby area was also in need of more seating.

Reviews.Title: “Good location rooms not that great”
Reviews.Author: thestreetsonthebeach
Reviews.Content: Check in was extremley slow even though we were honors members and in that line. Room was ok but bathroom had lots of hair in the bath and on the floor of the bathroom. The location was perfect for visiting all the fab landmarks of New York. Had a couple of maintenance issues which were dealt with promptly. Pillows were hard.Check out was slow as well

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: CapeCod1997
Reviews.Content: All around great hotel. Great location and great staff. Rome seem very new.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: DrKarll
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to get a chance for an upgrade and left a message for Kelly Cahill a VP with the Hilton hotel. I was very happy to get a phone call back addressing my request.
