When I checked in I had the upgrade I was hoping for along with access to the Executive Lounge. It is rare these days when a VP contacts you personally and gives you action not just a promise. All the staff was helfull and friendly from housekeeping, to the front desk. I felt safe, welcomed and individualized care in the big apple. I will certainly return to the hotel. Thanks again Kelly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Large Rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: thcu1981
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in NYC and took my family to mix vacation with business. Stayed in various hotels in NYC, but this was our first time at the Hilton. We had two connecting rooms on the 13th floor. First of all the rooms were very spacious for NYC. On our last trip to NYC we stayed at the Sheraton Towers and the rooms were very small so we were very pleased with the size of these rooms. Second, we were very pleased with the housekeeping staff. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping did a great job everyday. The hotel is within walking distance of many restaurants and very close to several different subway lines. The concierge has typewritten subway directions to many popular destinations which we found very helpful One small problem, the hotel restaurant has a grade of "B" which according to a NYC local is very bad since it seems that most every restaurant in the city has an "A". We avoided the restaurant just in case. Also, the hotel has a huge lobby with very few chairs. Several times we wanted to stop in the lobby and talk to friends but there is no place to sit. Overall though a very good and clean hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BangkokJames
Reviews.Content: For New York, this hotel was okay. Expensive, as they all are but it was in a good location and the rooms are quiet and clean. I did have a problem with the room that I brought to the attention of the general manager and he addressed it in extremely satisfactory way almost immediately. In situations like those, it is more a matter of how hotels deal with the problems the problems themselves. The question I have for this hotel and all Hiltons is why they charge guests for broadband access in the very expensive rooms rooms when they offer free broadband access walk-in people from the street in their lobbies and other public areas? I know it comes down to extra revenue but at the same time it alienates us and drives us to other competing hotels that offer overall better value for money. This trend in extra add-on fees and charges by the big hotels is causing tremendous customer angst and dissatisfaction. Transparency in pricing and booking is the name of the game if you want to be competitive, and these old-name hotels are losing it. Time to get back in the ballgame!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was even better!”
Reviews.Author: sherita1023
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in November and had an excellent stay. So when my mother, future mother-in-law, future sister-in-law, and I wanted to visit NYC, Hilton New York was my first choice hotel. We booked our stay and our airfare through Travelocity. We arrived very early in the morning, hours before check-in, and the staff let us store our luggage at no charge while we explored the city. We did have to pay $3 per bag on the day we checked out, but that was a very reasonable price. I used the concierge a couple of times for directions, and they were very helpful every time. When I asked for the best route to Ground Zero, they handed me a print off with directions there and back. Very helpful! The rooms are average size and very nice. We stayed in a room with two queen beds, and it also had a desk, armchair, and two end tables. The bathroom was also average sized. Probably the best thing about this particular hotel is its proximity to everything. Within walking distance are: Time Square, Central Park, Rockefeller, New York Public Library, and many subway stations. I highly recommend this hotel, and will probably stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pcameron
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We are diamond Hilton members so we stayed at the executive level and enjoyed the lounge that had free wine, beer and snacks in the evening and the continental buffet for breakfast. The rooms on this level are modern in decor and classy. The bar in the lobby was very popular and crowed each evening and they served the best Long Island Iced Tea I have ever had and I get those everywhere I go. Very close to Time Square and The Rockefellar Center and lots of other attractions. We also walked to Central Park from here, which took about 20 minutes, but we love to walk and explore new cities.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tastebud80
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby and great location. The hotel is a half block from the Metropolitan Museum of Art (MoMA), a few blocks south of Central Park, and a few blocks north of Time Square and Rockefeller Center. Easy walking distance to the shops on Fifth Avenue. The rooms are nice and clean, and the rates were cheaper than some of the hotels a few blocks away on Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: R0nin99
Reviews.Content: The foyer is a busy place. They need more seating for everyone who is trying to take advantage of the free wifi in the foyer. We had 2 adults and 2 children for 6 nights and were very comfortable in a Corner double room. Bathroom is small, but the room size is generous for NYC standards. Always had to request extra towels as they never allowed for the 4th person. Not enough places to hang 4 towels to dry and re-use the following morning. Try to get a high floor to minimise the noise. Be aware that there is scaffolding around the front of the hotel. Easy to walk to Times Square, Rocckefeller Centre (Top of the Rock, NBC studios), MOMA, subways, 5th Ave and Central Park. Try the cafe across the street (53rd) for breakfast - very nice. Also, you must try the Hallal Guys meal trucks parked outside the hotel, but get in early as the lines can get very long after 9pm right through till midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Midtown - the place buzzes with energy...”
Reviews.Author: john3489
Reviews.Content: This huge Hilton is amazingly large, has a great location, is very active - lots going on, it almost pulsates. You know you are in New York! While this may not be for everyone, I find it fun to look around and see all these people from everywhere and I like the energy. I use it for business and will continue to return. Suggestions - ask to stay on the 53rd Street (South) side to avoid any noise in your room from the various elevator shafts. The rooms are well appointed, flat screen TV (though I wish they would get true HD service), lots of drawers to put your stuff, big closets, good internet, nice shower, fine toiletries, a large safe, very comfortable bed and surprisingly quiet in the rooms. The Front Desk personnel are always very polite and helpful as are the housekeeping staff. All in all, this is the place to be if you want a reliable, clean room in Rockefeller Center area. You can walk to the Theater District, it's right on the 6th Avenue subway line, the street is wide and filled with fountains and lovely buildings. Radio City Music Hall is across the street. A great location with great people. This is an energetic spot.

Reviews.Title: “What a blast”
Reviews.Author: kate0574
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience from the minute we checked in to when we checked out a week later. We were greeted instanly upon arriving to the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly, kind and very helpful. The room was spotless, comfortable and quiet. The lobby was crazy with lots of students on tour which was fun to see so many people having a great time, but once you got to your room you would think you were the only one there. Everything is within walking distance and if not the subway is very close. It was worth everything we spent. I will return if I am lucky enough to visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: tupelolaw
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried because of the cost of this hotel compared to other nearby hotels, but the location right between Time's Square and Central Park was just too good to pass up. We had a great room, a great view and the hotel helped me get Broadway show tickets and even brought us complimentary chocolate covered strawberries after the show in our room. My wife is still convinced that I paid someone to do that, but they were just in our room with a little note from the front desk. Seriously, I am not a paid commentator, just a couple visiting from the South and we would book this place again in a heartbeat. It is a little crowded, but I assume all hotels in NYC are at this time of year. Also, there is a great Halal vendor across the street that is unbelievable. you got to try it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AuntED
Reviews.Content: Our room was much bigger than I expected--our last NYC hotel was half the size and not nearly as well-kept. Although the hotel has many floors, they've beaten the elevator problem by having columns of elevators divided by floors. We did not eat at the hotel, but the bar was quiet and the service there was great. We got a good rate in a package deal and we will definitely go there again. This hotel was full of students from foreign countries, but the hotel maintained an organized lobby and services.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but reliable”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: Large and busy hotel with many tourists. The front desk is always helpful and the concierge know where to eat. The Executive Lounge is too small for the number of people given access but the hotel provides a free breakfast at Starbucks for their frequent customers. Rooms and spacious and clean. Everything works!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DrlAnahuac_Texas
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, The Theater District, Saint Patricks Cathederal and numerous other sites. The room was cool and the bed inviting. Just what we needed after a long day of playing tourist. If you like a good strong cup of coffee you will be disappointed in the blend they keep in the room. This one drawback was more than made up for by the lovely lady at the Hilton Rewards Desk. She gave me coupons for complimentary coffee from the Hotel Restraurant for our entire stay. The coffee was outstanding. I thought this was nice since I'm not a member of the Rewards Club. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was excellent with plenty of high quality healty choices.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ViennaMichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton New York for 3 nights in July 2011. Chose it because of the location at 6th Avenue, very close to Times Square and Central Park. Overall, we loved the hotel, very friendly staff, good rooms. Hotel: The location is perfect, only 10 minutes walk to Broadway and Central Park. The hotel is very big, 44 floors, huge lobby. Out first impression was very positive, warm welcome at reception. Lobby and bar in very good condition. Room: Because this was a trip for my birthday and friends joining us, who have never been to NY, I sent a Fax to the hotel, that we would highly appreciate a room on a high floor. At check-in we were informed, that we got an upgrade to executive floor rooms on 41 and 44 floor with access to the Executive lounge. Rooms are very nice, not too big but very comfortable, great beds. Air condition is silent and working great. They are currently renovating the rooms, but we were glad having a not renovated room. Typical Hilton rooms, thick, draped curtains, nice wallpaper. Everything very well maintained. Only negative issue: The walls are really paper thin, one night we had loud neighbours and we thought they are with us in the room. Lounge: We had access to the executive lounge on 44 floor, free continental breakfast, non-alcoholic drings, free internet. Great view over New York. Only negative issue, they close at 10.30 PM and really kick our people. They could just close the bar and keep lounge open to continue work on the PC's. Staff: Entire staff was really nice and helpful. Restaurant/Bars: We did not use the restaurant, but there is a Starbucks in the Lobby and the Cocktail Bar on Ground floor was very nice. Good drinks and casual atmosphere. We will definitively come back to the New York Hilton. we stayed in NY during the big heat wave, so we spent a lot of time in the Hotel and loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel--Very hectic atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: natura11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at all the hilton properties in Mid-town from the waldorf to the hampton inn. The hilton is fine and in a great spot if you are a tourist, but was too hectic for me. For example even as a Diamond member it took 20 minutes to check in, the elevators were so full that I usually had to wait for 2 full before getting on and the concierge lounge had a line with a "bouncer" at the door was so busy. The room was standard for hilton. Probablly a fun stop if you're visiting as a tourist, but if you're an experienced NYC traveler or business traveler I'd skip...

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation and top level service”
Reviews.Author: gotchalks
Reviews.Content: We came for a family wedding which coincided with restaurant week. We used 50,000 points per night and received an excellent corner room on the 29th floor with windows on two sides, overlooking Radio City Music Hall. The Hotel seemed much fresher and cleaner than my business stay 3-4 years ago. The service was also quite good throughout, including a cot that we ordered for $30 (for the entire stay). The status coupons we received for the whole family allowed us seemingly countless items from the ground floor Starbucks (we could have instead chosen breakfast in the coffee shop); the children acted as if these we the best vouchers we had ever received! Bottom line: the beds are comfortable and the location is IDEAL for midtown, Central Park and Time Square. A Michelin one star restaurant called Rouge Tomate at 10 East 60th was by far our favorite meal (walking distance from the hotel). We will be back next July.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor overall service, poor room condition & terrible room service staff”
Reviews.Author: adl2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York by 6th Avenue for 1 week in July 2011. We travelled with 2 young kids ages 4 & 5. The location was excellent to walk to Central Park and a quick cab ride to Times Square. The room had a king size bed with a queen pull out couch and beautifully decorated. However, upon check in we discovered that one drawer was broken, the sink plug did not work and the bar fridge had been broken into by the prior guests and had rotten left over food in it. It took repeated calls to customer service to get the bar fridge and drawer fixed. The morning cleaning staff was terrible to the point that we had to get the afternoon staff back to re-clean the room which clearly had not been dusted or fully vacuumed. We ordered breakfast and tipped the man who set up the table in our room. However he then proceeded to argue about the tip insisting that it should be more for just setting the table up. Rather than have an altercation in front of our young children we just paid him what he asked for so he would leave.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, it was fine. I've seen much better from Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheAirwaves
Reviews.Content: We stayed on points at the very end of April. The doorman were the only memorable part of the stay. The front desk was generally very dry and cold, which I half expect in NYC, but I was really disappointed. The lobby was sterile and being comfortable and feeling at home would be an insult to their team. There is no seating, no management presence. The marble was well kept and buffed regularly. The elevators were quick. We were in a newly renovated room. While the bathroom was a little small (which again, I expect for NYC) the rooms were decorated nicely and comfortable for the three adults in our party. Overall, our stay was fine, but rather unimpressed with the service and I've had a more personalized experience at other "big box" Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: crunchmaster
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 13 through July 18th. They upgraded us to a room with a view on a higher floor. The room is clean and spacious, not very luxurious but perfectly adequate. Fabulous bed. Very pleasant and helpful staff. The location is walkable to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, MOMA and more, very central. We are planning a trip in December and will definitely stay here again. Free Wifi in the room would make it perfect, it was a hassle to go downstairs and I didn't want to pay the fee for the 30 minutes that I needed the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed stay”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: I must begin this review by stating that we stay at the Hilton at least once or twice a year due to the location. The good - the location is perfect for midtown with several great restaurants within walking distance. The bad - the hotel, along with several other hotels in midtown, house large groups of young children/teen actor/model groups that come down to meet with agents. Along with the children come their stage parents. If you are unfortunate enough to have to use the elevator during their peak hours, you are stuck. We were left waiting 20 minutes one morning and it was frustrating. We did find the staff to be helpful although when I asked for a late check-out (we are Hilton Honors members), we were told nothing past 1 as there was another large group of young models coming in and "we wouldn't want them waiting in the lobby for their room." Sorry Hilton but not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, expensive and bad value for money. Will never stay in a Hilton again.”
Reviews.Author: omg12341
Reviews.Content: Staff generally rude and unhelpful, charged extra for gym, charged extra for Wifi, charged extra for luggage storgae after check out, air conditioning in room faulty, no answer when calling reception or bell hop, cleaning staff very noisy early in the morning, no seating area in reception, misleading advice re booking tickets and shuttle - obviously aimed at generating commission. Our experience at this hotel was very poor. The name and the location mean they don't need to make any effort re guests. Try the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: R87J
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was very good and all the staff are friendly. The room was a nice size and comfortable for two peopl sharing. The location of this hotel was perfect for us, it was very close to Times Square and other sights that we wanted to visit. We didn't eat at the resteraunts in the hotel but they always seemed to be busy and the bar area was lively.

Reviews.Title: “Large but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fredpresto
Reviews.Content: If its personal and intimate this hotel wont be for you. However for a business trip this was perfect. I attended a conference that was at the hotel. To be able to escape to a comfortable room was refreshing. The room was adequate, comfortable and suited me fine. I couldn't have feather pillows and the night staff were quick to rectify this and replace with several featherfree pillows. Ideally located to central park, which was handy when I wanted to take a book, a coffee and chill for a couple of hours. Also well located for museums, fith avenue and time square. The rooms used by the conference were impresive and comfortable. Starbucks on site was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during a convention that we attended. The lobby area is clean and attractive. Both of the bar areas are attractive and they serve awesome chips to compliment their ridiculously expensive drinks! The room is a standard hotel room with very little worth mentioning. It was very dark in the room, even with all of the lights on. Putting on makeup is horrible unless you're in the bathroom! The wallpaper in the bathroom area was peeling off and yellowing. The beds, however, were wonderful and I slept well the entire time! Overall I would say it's not quite up to the Hilton standard, but it's really just in need of a renovation for cosmetic reasons. By the way, don't eat at the restaurant for breakfast! Total rip off. There are a ton of breakfast places in every block surrounding the hotel. Also, the Starbucks just a half a block away has free WiFi. It was a lesson we learned after paying for a couple days of Wifi!

Reviews.Title: “A typical chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: vveen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during a business trip for one night last May. The hotel definitely needs a facelift but it still provides guestâ€™s basic needs just nice. The bed isnâ€™t bad at all, the bathroom worked okay but the room service foods tasted nothing special. If youâ€™re looking for a place to stay where you want to stay close from Manhattan crowds (Fifth Av, Time Square & Central Park), this might be a good place for you. donâ€™t forget to taste the infamous gyro street vendor parked beside the hotel every night after 6PM! One of the best foods Iâ€™ve tried in NY only for $4 (so long Grayâ€™s Papaya!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TNConstanttraveler
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a chain hotel, be close to Times Square as well as great dining and shopping then this is a pretty good location. I've been to New York several times but this trip I found to be the best location wise. I wanted to stay longer just so I could try more of the numerous restaurants that were within a block or two from the hotel. The rooms were redone, with black marble surfaces. I found the pillows to be too hard, yet my business associate, in a different room, found them to be too soft. The bathrooms are nice but very small. There are glass enclosed step in showers though which is a huge plus for me (I hate bathtub showers). The two lobby bars are great and the breakfast buffet is plentiful (including bread pudding!!). The maid staff were the friendliest i have ever encountered in all of my travels. The always stopped to say hello, have a nice day, etc. Amazing. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSGurgaon
Reviews.Content: We started our USA vacation with New York and this hotel and what a wonderful start it was. Our flight landed early in the morning and though the checkin time was 3 PM, the front office staff let us checkin at 11 AM without any extra charges. The location is fantastic, a short stroll to Central Park and a subway station within 5 mins walk. The room was quite large by New York hotel standards, well appointed, very comfy beds. Bathroom was kind of small but then this is NY !! The hotel is oldish and has a slightly dated look but everything is kept in ship-shape order. All staff we dealt with were very helpful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. We were there on a weekend and there was a kind of flea market going on the road outside the hotel which we really enjoyed visiting. Starbucks is right across and several other nice restaurants at walking distance. Overall a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: GRIFFONEAGLE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night last August, and my experience was not that great. Upon entering, I found the toilet unclean. This has never happened when I stayed at a hotel (I have stayed at Comfort Inns that were nicer). Also, the staff was a bit unfriendly. Asking the concierge where to go for dinner, I did not receive a smile or a welcoming hello. While the hotel is suitable for large meetings or a quick overnight trip, I caution travelers to look elsewhere before selecting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel perfectly situated for the sights of New York.”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveller013
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is a large well run Hotel perfectly situated for the sites of New York. The Hotel has everything you need for a pleasant stay including a fitness area , Restaurants and two bars. The Hotel has recently been re-furbished and the rooms are very tastefully decorated with modern facilities such as a walk-in shower and a large flat screen TV. It is a very comfortable Hotel perfectly situated for the sights of New York. The only criticism is that because the Hotel is very large it can feel a little inpersonnel but the staff are very attentive and helpful. We were there celebrating our daughters 18th birthday and my wife's early retirement and they were presented with a gift of chocolate strawberrys which was a very nice personnel touch. We really enjoyed our stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: primocrisma
Reviews.Content: We took the family to NY for a week and stayed at the NY HIlton. The first night, we got in very late.... so we were stuck with the standard "we are full and there are no upgrades". On day two, we went to the desk ask for some help, we were upgraded to the 44th floor. Executive lounge and great rooms. It made all the difference in our stay. We saved over $100 a day on breakfast and snacks. If you can get to the executive lounge (Diamond level) it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service and noisy room next to the elevators / lifts!”
Reviews.Author: STEWART O
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend the NY Hilton after my recent 2 day stay. My room on the 34th floor was next the elevators / lifts which was noisy, I had to line up again at reception to get a key to the mini bar, a dirty hand towel placed in the bath for replacement was put back on the towell rack, internet access is expensive and there is no guest service book - you need to try and use the limited information on the television!! A call to guest services was answered quickly and transferred through to 20 minutes of Hitlon Hotel advertising - of course it achieved the desired result I hang up!! For a liitle extra money I will stay at the Novotel next visit which was very good on my last year's visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, old, expensive. But still a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: fbarros
Reviews.Content: We do like large Chain Hotels. We' kinf like Chain Hotels.So when we had to choose a hotel to spend a single night in NYC, we choosed this Time Square Big One. Actually, fit our needs. Convenient TS location, large rooms for Manhattan patterns, nice and clean wc. But too noisy, too many people walking through the conventions centers, expensive fees (parking, net, whatever). But this Manhattan, ok. But paying the price we did, I think we''d get s'thing better.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton NY is OK”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I don't know. I come to NYC fairly often (for work or fun) so I've stayed in a variety of hotels, in various locations. This was a work trip and we were all staying here. But it's just not for me. Like many NYC hotel rooms, mine was small -- not complaining about that, since it's expected. But it was just so generic-looking, very dated. Some people are OK with that, but I'd rather stay somewhere that has a little personality. Room was clean, as were convention center rooms (why I was there). I see they're starting to do the thing where if you check out and need to check your bags at the hotel for a few hours, you have to pay $3.50 per bag. I've heard hotels are starting to do this more and more -- yipee. Oh, and location is good. Would I stay here again? Eh, I don't know. Hilton New York was fine, but there are just too many other fantastic options in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but be Prepared for a Large City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carnage99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton NY a few times for work and it is perfectly fine in terms of location, cleanliness and safety. The staff are friendly and professional. I have sometimes had a newly renovated room and they are excellent. The other rooms are also fine. However, the hotel is large and it is very busy. You often have to wait at peaks times for up for 5 minutes or more for an elevator. Also, this time around, despite staying 5 nights, I was allocated a tiny, tiny room right near the maids room and their 4 or 5 trolleys were parked either side of the door to my room. My only other gripe is that you have to pay $3.50 per bag to store your luggage and you have to line up for the privelege. The charges are outrageous - how many other hotels do this? Not many, I think. Can you please change this?

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat Location”
Reviews.Author: Katcha2
Reviews.Content: First time to NYC and delighted at stay in hotel located in mid-town - a quick walking distance to Times Square, the theatre district and fantastic shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is one of those busy large hotels that manages somehow to make you feel welcome and that your business is appreciated. Pros: -Very comfortable bed -Quiet (yet effective!) air conditioning -Friendly staff (from cleaners, to concierge, to receptionists, ... every encounter with hotel staff a positive one) -Starbucks directly across the street (for us addicts) Cons: - Ok .. a big city corporate hotel ... the charms and character of a small boutique hotel are just not there - bathroom a little small; getting spoiled at hotels that have separate walk-in shower stall - Wifi is expensive Overall, when in NYC, location is most important aspect of choosing your hotel. On this basis, hard to beat Hilton on the Avenue of the Americas!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: realreviews_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here when we went to the Subway series. The hotel is centrally located. It is next to everything in the City. Its a perfect location. Subway nearby. Hotel is clean, staff is nice. Rooms are really small, but hey, its New York!

Reviews.Title: “Repeat business”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Hlton New York, and this stay was perhaps better than the last. The room was mostly clean, well appointed, comfortable, and relatively quiet. The only issues were a few dirty spots that the cleaning staff missed prior to my arrival (e.g. dirty toilet) and some issues with a neighbors TV (too loud and stuck on the Hilton Welcome channel for an hour at midnight). I was on the Hilton Diamond level, which seemed to have a little nicer redone look. The rooms were a little small, but normal for NYC. Even on the 31st floor I could hear the traffic noise pretty well. Otherwise, a great stay. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “well cared for!”
Reviews.Author: 25yearsmore
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hilton and from check-in to check-out were treated royally. The rooms were wonderful with a great view and the soft white, large bath towels were a treat. Had breakfast at the Market restaurant in the lobby and really enjoyed the large selection. love the location and the buzzing of the lobby at all hours. I'd stay here again and again! The only drawback is the parking situation-backed up when we arrived and back-up when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: trnt107
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton NYC last month during a business trip and was very happy with the stay. The staff greeted me kindly and the room was nice and large (by NYC hotel standards). The location was great which made it easy for me to get to work in the morning. Overall, I thought it was a good stay in which I ran into no problems, but it also was not over the top either.

Reviews.Title: “Back again to the Hilton NY”
Reviews.Author: prissyshay
Reviews.Content: My second stay two summers in a row. This time I had a refurbished room on the 21st floor. The room was very comfortable and the amenities nice, i loved the Peter Thomas Roth toiletries. The hotel was booked solid and i never had any problems with service, lines at breakfast or elevators or a feeling of overcrowdiness. Once again the price was ridiculously expensive, this is probably the most expensive basic room i have ever paid for $500 per night after taxes and fees and i have stayed at five star hotels all over the world. The Location is what i love the most, a few blocks from central park, a few blocks from times square/broadway, a few blocks from fifth avenue shopping, convenient to everything. I even enjoyed the frequent street closings in front of the hotel for parades, the president visiting nearby, there was always some activity going on. There's a starbucks in the hotel but 2 better ones directly across the street There's also a Landau jewelry shop and a gift shop...but you can buy cheap drinks for your room at the many halal carts and nearby convenience stores. Once again as i have complained at all my hilton stays...hilton honors members should be able to get free wifi sheesh!! Oh and for summer visits this grandiose hotel has no pool! Despite the price i will be back....at least i know what i am getting...

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimo!”
Reviews.Author: MelYoken
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member, and have just enjoyed yet another memorable stay at the Hilton in NYCity. This being the case, I would like to praise--and I mean PRAISE--two employees who go far beyond the call of duty each time I visit this outstanding facility. The first is Adrian Simpson, a young man who works at the front desk. He is always extremely polite, courteous and charming. The second is a man in the executive suite lounge--floor 44--named Jose who also possesses the aforementioned qualities. Succinctly stated, these employees are both the cherry on top of my personal Hilton sundae. The Hilton is my home when I am in NYCity, and has been for a longtime. I love it every time I go there. Bravissimo!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: LeftyaloneNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Great room, very large, wonderful staff! Walk to Broadway shows and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities & service but tired looking rooms”
Reviews.Author: dipset33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights in June 2011 for our 1 year wedding anniversary. The lobby is very nice, welcoming and busy, like the pictures. However, our room was tired looking so initially we were disappointed. It seems most of the other rooms would have been the same. Bathroom was also dated. However, the room was clean and fully equipped with all facilities, including coffee and tea maker, iron, complimentary water bottles. The bed was big and comfortable and the TV was flat screen. Room service also thorough. The front desk staff noted the reason for our stay and sent us strawberries dipped in chocolates to mark the occasion with a congratulations note. This was thoughtful and unexpected so a nice gesture. Location wise it is good but be prepared to do some walking! It's about 10 min walk from Central Park on 6th Avenue and 15-20 min walk from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: zoezimba
Reviews.Content: For the past few years I have selected this hotel when staying in NY. I was a little disappointed this time as I had a room with a soiled upholstered chair and spots in the rug. This was a surprise for me. I felt like I should have saved my money and stayed at one of the 3 star hotels. This was after I had asked for another room as I thought I had a better chance if I requested a more updated room. Then the toilet backed up. Even though the rooms are small I loved the new decor but after this stay I may venture over to one of the other surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: GTGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of women for a Girls' Weekend. We had 2 rooms booked through a deal prepaid on a travel website. We were a little upset that we did not get adjoining rooms as requested, but the hotel was very accomodating to get us as close together as possible. We checked in and within 15 mins, the people in the room between us complained to security about how "loud" we were (it was 4pm on a Thursday). So we went down to the front desk and explained the situation, and they not only happily moved our rooms, but upgraded us to higher floor and larger rooms. PROS Excellent location. Easy walk to Central Park, Times Square, Shopping on 5th Ave, Rockerfeller Center. Bar service was friendly and fast. Try the Long Island Mojito at the lobby bar. And complimentary yummy chips that the waiter kept refilling. Our 2nd room was spacious (corner) with a great view. Beds were comfy. Starbucks in the hotel was nice, although there is nearly one on every corner anyway! CONS Bathrooms in every room were TINY. Hardly any counter space. Elevators were a little slow. Not horribly. But a little. Starbucks employees (inside the hotel) were grouchy & rude. WIFI not free...nor was it cheap. Note: We did not use the workout facilities or eat at the hotel since we were out and about a lot so I cannot comment on those. OVERALL - I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. It was a great stay. I'll review the restaurants we ate at separately, but here they are in summary: The Eatery, Tao, Otto's Pizzeria & Enoteca. We also did the Today Show (Kenny Chesney concert) and it was really worth getting up at 5am. You do need to be there before 6am if you want a view, but if you don't, they also film from the back platform, so we got on TV anyway :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed Stay”
Reviews.Author: 54171Frank
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and this was the worst mattress i have been on in a long time,. I expected a good nights sleep in a Hilton? Rooms one the 24th floor need heavy renovation. Desk help mediocre and indifferent at best. Lobby bar excellent and staff very friendly. Location is excellent. No bell hop service. They control the AC to 70 and I like 68--Big difference at night!.$15 per night internet charge? Concierge are some of the best I have had! I stayed at the Holiday Inn Crown Plaza Time Square last time and all excellent?

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is literally close to EVERYTHING!!”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Mom
Reviews.Content: My husband travels to NYC for business every year, and me and the kids usually join him, so this was not our first trip to NY. We stayed in a room w/ two double beds, and the room was large by NY standards. The hotel is huge, and we only had to wait for the elevators once during a 5 day stay. We were able to walk to every destination, as the hotel is in the heart of midtown. The person that checked us in was very nice, and even though we arrived at 11 am (on a Tuesday), we were given a room right away and that was a very nice surprise. The housekeeper, seeing we had two boys with us, kept us stocked with toiletries and towels--she was also incredibly pleasant and greeted us warmly every day. The doormen were very polite and swift at arranging for a taxi ride back to the airport--he even handled the luggage for me and the boys. I have already told my husband that next year and every year he MUST choose the Hilton for our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: memphisgal
Reviews.Content: I went to New York for one day/night while visiting familiy for a wedding. This hotel is perfectly located to Centeral Park, Broadway, and 5th Ave shopping. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, but clean and updated. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Roger_dsg
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, nice sized rooms, very clean and we had a big confortable king bed, a most welcome courtesy of the staff since our reservation was for a queen bed only. The location is realy perfect a few blocks from central park, fifth av. stores, and a short walk from the theater district. Staff was helpfull and nice. The lobby area is grand with quite some options for a drink, diner or breakfast. I would really be back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: suecav2000
Reviews.Content: I took my aunt to New York for the night and we ended up at the Hilton. It is centrally located and it's only a very quick walk to coffee and cafes and just about anything else. The room (we had a 2 double bed room) was clean, although the bathroom was a tad small. There was a huge minibar, which we didn't use, and a safe. No more polyester bedspreads; just white on white bedding and lots of pillows. I needed a churchkey to open a bottle of Pellegrino and one was delivered along with 4 wine glasses inside of 10 minutes. I checked the moring of checkout to see if we could delay checkout a couple of hours and it was no problem. The only thing that's disappointing are the dining options. between 2 and 5 there is a dearth of options. Breakfast is in a noisy room, so we opted to eat at Lou's across the street (outside with delicious european style eats). Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location, I'll be Back!”
Reviews.Author: SRTS44
Reviews.Content: The New York Hilton is a wonderful hotel in an excellent location. Good service, quality food and you really feel like you are at the center of the World here. It's a large convention hotel, so it sometimes can be packed, but its service and the value you get for your money is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob60
Reviews.Content: We stay here several times per year. Huge, nice, busy lobby gives you that great NY feel. Great location to go to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, great dining and great shopping. Never disappointed here. Rooms are nice and a decent size for NY. I am very particular about parking my cars and this hotel has the nicest valets and take very good care of the cars. Never has any problems. I have never seen any bed bugs and I always check. I have always had great service here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: kpatters
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed at this hotel in New York. You can easily walk to most of the main attractions from here. The other option is to take the subway. Regular rooms are small but since we spent so little time in our room that was OK. Rooms are a little pricey but you are paying for location. I wish Hilton's would include free wireless access instead of charging $15 plus per day.

Reviews.Title: “One busy and expensive place”
Reviews.Author: GLMS-NC
Reviews.Content: I had an a very comfortable room and the location by central park is convenient. The room was modern with desk space, plenty of drawers and a very quiet and functional hvac system. The bathroom, why well stocked with everything you need, was small with tight quarters. The bathroom door barely closed without hitting the toilet. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Check in was prompt as was check out. Staff I asked questions to had immediate answers. My drawbacks were this hotel is not cheap. Additionally, there are people coming and going constantly. Elevators always busy, halls busy, and getting a car in and out is a real challenge. Breakfast restaurant had an ok menu. Service was good. Night security was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel in midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: There's not much to be said about this place - which is probably why I haven't reviewed it until now, even having stayed there multiple times. It's your standard business/tourist hotel in midtown Manhattan - comfy rooms, very crowded lobby, not much character.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: sandiegomom2011
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel about 3 times per year for business. It is a perfect location to all the sites of Times Square, but if you go a few blocks away from Times Square, you will find some wonderful neighborhood restaurants. Staff is always friendly at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Aggrevating for a Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Cyberworld Toronto
Reviews.Content: I realize that the property cannot do anything about the number of people it services at any given moment. However, my personal experience is that a number of the key staff is either incompetent in their positions or simply customer service ignorant. The Sunday morning VIP checkout was flat out rude. So was the executive lounge staff on Saturday. They treat their executive lounge like if it were McDonalds, having you stand in a line in the hallway near guestrooms to get it...and for no apparent reason. Madeline in the executive lounge screamed at me "Can't You Read the Sign" when I approached the lounge when there was absolutely no one at the door to assist. If this how you treat people that actually make up your core HHonors customer base and specifically pay for a higher room category? I woudl suggest more customer service training at this property. It's dreadfully lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Hilton”
Reviews.Author: wendyladyman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for the second time. This stay was from 30th May to 4th June 2011. We stayed last year and was so impressed we booked again this year. Our stay in NYC was for the purpose of getting married. We married in Central Park and had dinner on a boat cruise. Inbetween this I liaised with a wonderful lady who worked at the Hilton called Hope Boorojian. I wanted a relaxed couple of hours in the bar with our guests. The Hilton were so accomodating. I asked for a wedding cake and a few savoury nibbles and if the bar staff would mind hosting a champagne toast for us. Well what can I say but the Hilton went above and beyond expectations. On arrival at the Hotel we had champagne and strawberries awaiting in our large clean room. We then met with Hope who ran through a few things with us and was so lovely and listened. On the day of the wedding the Hotel sent flowers to my room. The pastry chef made the most beatiful wedding cake in Ivory icing and the inside was moist and light. This was placed on a huge silver cake stand and small tealight candles lite are reception area in the bar. On all the tables were nibbles and the most gorgeaous range of crudities and dips. The hotel had left us a gift and card on the table next to the cake. They had also provided lovely side plates , silver wear and good quality napkins. All these extras I did not ask for but were provided without charge. The bar staff kept our guests happy and we were kept up to date on the amount being spent. The final bill was very reasonable and I would recommend anyone wanting to marry in NYC contact the Hilton and ask for Hope Boorojian. A lovely touch was the General Manager coming and congratulating us along with the restaurant manager. Cant wait to go back . There is no were better to stay and to top it off the hotel is in the perfect location. Do not listen to the negative reviews. Make your own mind up as I chose it for my wedding this hotel is definately one of the best. We chose this hotel as last years stay was so wonderful we could not imagine staying anywhere else while in NYC. Friends who stayed at more expensive hotels remarked that the Hilton would be their choice on another visit to NYC. Everyone from the housekeeping to the check in staff were so helpful. I was very impressed with the comfortable beds and soft fluffy towels.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: htownog
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a wonderful stay here. The rooms were excellent. The space was just right, not small like we had heard about other hotel rooms. The price was what we expected for something nice. The location was great within walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center and Broadway. The beds were comfortable and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: solflower_80
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week in June with friends. I cant fault the location ! excellent and can walk to most places. I would comment that the beds were smaller than average double UK size, so sharing was a squeeze and the walls were very thin and heard everything from the neighbours! We seem to have a dodgy bathroom, where everything seemed to break. The service was very polite and dealt with any queries promptly. I would stay here again, mainly due to location

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: NTXTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton New York several times over the past two years. It is not inexpensive, although prices are comparable to other locations nearby. Pros: Rooms are a decent size, the hotel is relatively quiet for that location (the ones closer to Times Square tend to have a lot of unavoidable street noise), room service is good (but expensive), lobby is on first floor-no escalator to reach it, nice fitness center. Cons: Food is expensive (room service or dining), wireless internet is expensive. I like this hotel because the location is convenient and I don't mind going across the street for an inexpensive meal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine1955186460
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a fantastic location, found the hotel staff very helpful, Rooms were spacious and cleaned everyday with fresh towels daily we asked for extra tea bags in the room which wasn't a problem. Would recomend this hotel to friends, would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Luxory and Comfort in midtown nyc”
Reviews.Author: sliderTelaviv
Reviews.Content: i rencently satyed at this hotel with my father and brother and my mother, and this was my first time i was in hotel in manhattan because we usually seelp at my uncle's house. the hotel is half a block wide and has 44 floors on 6 ave @ 53d street. the lobby is very big and the hotel has direct elevators to te floors and the wait isn't long, the cheak is very fast and efficiant and even there is a confrence there. the rooms aren't big but much bigger then other hotel rooms in the city, from the windows you see the urban jungle of manhattan. i had a room in the 42nd floor and the view was amazing. the bathrooms are modern and have sunken sinks in marble tables, the batherooms are quite small. we recived an upgrade to use the lounge which is on the 44th floor which had amazing views of central park and the empire state building. with good breakfast and all day long hor'devoures the hotel has a big fitness center and an indoor pool but i didn't have time ot use them. the hotel isn't cheep but with good service and the fact that central park, times sq, the moma, radio city muisc hall, are 5 min from the hotel , it's worthwhile Thank you hilton for an amazing stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “below expectation”
Reviews.Author: Mansouras
Reviews.Content: although it's good location, i didnt like the rooms. it is expensive if you compare it to its prices

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time and dying to go back”
Reviews.Author: Glenda01_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful, the rooms, clean and when ever we needed anything the hotel was thrilled to provide us with anything we needed immediately. Staff friendly and go out of their way to help. Would run not walk back to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, CLEAN ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: klinks28
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and the hotel is in a Great locaiton. We stayed here for a week and found that it met all of our needs. The only down side was...on the last night someone checked into the room next door and it sounded as though they were in the room with us when they were talking, it did not sound as though they were using a louder then normal tone of voice so the walls in that area of the hotel must be very thin! We had a famliy member with us that stayed in a room a few floors above ours and she said that she did not hear any noise from the surrounding rooms. We were also disappointed to learn that you have to pay extra to use the exercise facilty- we were not told that there was an addtional charge for this when we booked the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: IamJ33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit to New York City because it is close to everything. We were not disapointed. This hotel has a large and very lively lobby. There was lots going on in the hotel during our visit, several conferences. We were greeted by the most professional and friendly staff ! Each time we needed something from the staff, whether just to ask a question or to cash travellers cheques, they were so nice and so firendly, always smiling and making small talk, & joking with us. Restaurant staff were also very nice, very friendly and top notch service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York for any reason, and I will definitley book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: goldarch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel given it's convenient location to Central Park and on 6th Avenue. We stayed here in the past and enjoyed our stay, so we thought we'd stay there again. The visit was marred by a rude staff, $51.00 a day parking (with also rude staff), and the hotel placed two expensive "holds" on my credit card that blocked me from being able to use my credit card. The hotel is extremely expensive for what you can get for the same money in Manhattan. I will not be returning and won't recommend anyone else do the same.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here everytime I am in New York!”
Reviews.Author: MissieMom07
Reviews.Content: This is where i stay regardless of the reason for the trip--business or pleasure it is in the best location. Just a 2 minute walk from shopping and Central Park you can't beat that! My only issue is sometimes I get a fully renovated room and sometimes i get an old outdated room in need of renovation. The rooms are small if you have only one bed but when you are in New York how much time do you really spend in the room? Comfy beds and adequate shower pressure make it a great deal especially for the price in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be my favorite place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: GoodFood88
Reviews.Content: I used to travel to NYC all the time, sometimes once or twice a week for weeks on end. When I did travel to the city, my number one choice was Hilton's flagship hotel, the Hilton New York. It has been about three years since I made regular trips to the city, so I have not stayed at this Hilton for some time. The years have not been kind to this property. It is still a great location for a lot of different things to see and do, this cannot be denied, but the cleanliness and appearance within the hotel has fallen off. First, I was assigned a non-smoking floor, which stunk of cigarette smoke one more than one occassion. Second, the hallways had broken wall sconces and trash in them. The room itself was fine, nothing extraordinary. This is the same hotel where I have had my biggest and smallest rooms in all of my many travels, so I have seen a lot at this property. The bathroom was not clean and the shower had a head which did not always work well and a tub which did not drain very fast, leaving you in a large puddle. I was going to give this a 3, but because of location and for old times sake, I will bump up to a 4.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: mwfiesole
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York has disappointed me even by conference hotel standards, which are fairly low. As mentioned by others this is a huge property with a lobby that Iâ€™d liken to a bus station. There is no relaxation space and the lighting is poor throughout the property. No quiet, calm place to sit anywhere. The rooms are reasonably clean and sized, however in my last two visits I have dealt with several service issues. Non working Wi-Fi for several days and atrocious cell phone signals. As a business hotel this is unacceptable, one can not get work done without these basics. Additionally, upon my most recent visit, the landline room phone was broken, there was black soot in the sink water, there was no heat despite cool spring temperatures, and my last day was met with a water shut off. Customer service is average, most of these issues could not be addressed with more than a â€œsorryâ€�, so I just got through it. But the visit was not pleasant. I am really hoping to avoid staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: NWLondonTravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a deal on the British Airways website that included the flights and accomodation with breakfast. The first impression of the hotel was very good. Our taxi drew up inthe carriage drive and a member of staff was at hand to open the door for us. The reception area is large and has a great bustling atmosphere. The staff at reception were very courtious and helpful. Our room was quite high up in the hotel and was really excellent. It was spacious, modern and very clean with a safe and flatscreen TV, kettle and ample wardrobe space. the bed and pillow were the best i have had at any hotel. The `basic` breakfast that was included in the deal was more than ample, offering bagels, bread, fruit, cakes, cereal, yoghurt and plenty of american extras such as cheese, smoked salmon etc., For 4 dollars you could upgrade to include hot food and the japanese bar. All in all an excellent good quality breakfast. At the end of our stay we were able to check in and print out our boarding cards from a machine in the reception area free of charge. I would highly recommend this hotel and we were delighted with our choice

Reviews.Title: “They really made it a pleasure. Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: SouthBeachLady
Reviews.Content: The staff was accommodating from the moment I arrived (early). Street fair in front of the hotel that day. They offered to store my luggage and provide me with a safe deposit box so I could go out and enjoy the City. Provided me with bus directions as I was off to the Met. I came back late (walkable from theatre district), & my room was ready. Bellman came right up. My room was large & well appointed with a lovely view. Great bathroom, good size closet, & a safe in room. With black-out curtains and a great King bed I wish I had more time to sleep! Or sit on the sofa and read the daily paper (no wkend paper), enjoying my coffee. But it's New York & the location was great & very walkable! Late check-out was not a problem as it is at many Hotels. When I was leaving the concierge printed my boarding pass. The doorman hailed me a cab immediately. I don't think $3.50 unreasonable to hold luggage. I was glad they slipped bill underdoor as there was an error which I brought to their attention & they said would be fixed. So from start to finish it was Hilton the way Hilton should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but "Tired" Rooms not up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: TeeP
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six days in an 40th floor executive floor room but were disappointed the quality of the room and the general upkeep which were below the standards of other Hiltons we have stayed in. Disappointing for the $330.+ per night room rate. The carpet in the hallway to our room was dark, old looking and worn with several large "bleach type" spots evident. The carpet in our room also had a 90's era look, was threadbare and lumpy and had a noticable black stain next to the bed. The bed skirt also showed soiled in spots, which was a turn-off. One part of our door night latch was missing and we had to request it be repaired. I kept thinking someone should have noticed this and corrected it. Although the bathroom had been renovated, the rest of the room felt dated and reminiscent of less expensive hotels with a '90's feel.. The photos on the Hilton web site were definitely not reflective of theis room so I wonder just how many rooms have been renovated. The Hotel is busy and the heavy traffic of people is evident in the waits for elevators and line-up's to get into the executive lounge for breakfast. The location is convenient and the common areas are attractive, but impersonal, reflective more of a convetion hotel feeling. I would not stay here again as there are better options in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: faffa252104
Reviews.Content: Hotel bedroom was spacious and clean but our main complaint was that our travel adaptor did not work. When querying this with reception we were told (in quite an offhand way) that we would have to use the Business Centre - I don't think they would appreciate my daughter using her hair straighteners in there! So we could not charge our cameras or phones either during our stay. Would also have liked more information regarding attractions etc in room, together with services and facilities in hotel. We also went to see the concierge one day and had to wait half an hour while the member of staff served another guest; surely a hotel of that size should have put someone else on the desk - there was a long queue behind us. We didn't eat in hotel so cannot comment there but all in all found the Hilton to be a good but average base from which to see New York (the city break itself was amazing).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: AmyGoes211
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel last week and enjoyed our stay. It was exactly what we needed - a place to rest our heads at night. PROS - *Everything is clean. The lobby is immaculate and very spacious. *The staff that we encountered (our maid and the front desk staff) were all very friendly. *It's a huge hotel! If you like being on high floors, you have a good chance here. We were on the 35th floor. *Location location location! Close to Central Park, Theater District, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. CONS - *The shower/tub combo was a little outdated. *The wait on elevators can be extremely long, even though they have different elevator banks for different floor ranges. *Wifi and fitness center have fees. I like it when hotels offer this for free.

Reviews.Title: “The secret to free Wifi at the Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Gorrgarr
Reviews.Content: WiFi is expensive unless you have a code. Go during a conference and then just ask at the desk for the conference wifi code. Either that or ask a delegate - hey presto, free wifi. The Hilton is immaculate and in a perfect location for: Central Park, Rockefeller Center, NBC Studios, MoMA, FAO Schwartz, Carnegie Hall, and a short walk to Times Square. Room service is mega expensive - like $30 for a sandwich - so get snacks and cheap meals from the delis nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, huge functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ARH500
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Rockefeller Centre, Times Square and Central Park. Rooms comfortable and as expected. Expensive WiFi especially after after other hotels n the same chain provided free WiFi. Check in was slow (10 mins) even in the HHonors line. Lobby not particularly welcoming - busy, staff functional but not friendly and overly helpful. We basically used hotel as a overnight base only as other services were uninviting.

Reviews.Title: “Colossal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diego_Caeiro
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very good, bit expensive though. Altough got a free upgrade to 40th floor. Hotel is huge but staff is very friendly and they try to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Breakfast at the executive floor (44th) was not good at all, it cannot be considered as a buffet breakfast as I was still hungry after breakfast. Good view and the room is very spacious, and the king size bed is very large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but uneven stay”
Reviews.Author: stever817
Reviews.Content: The Good: The staff, location, bed, room size is excellent. Within easy walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Theater District and all the great delis. The Bad; The rooms, the decor, the hallways, the room service and cost could all use some work. First the rooms...they are showing some serious signs of age. Sink was cracked, wall paper was peeling, carpet had wear marks. The hallways, chair rail was missing on one part of the floor I was on, the other areas the walls and rails were scratched. Room service...yikes. I was in a rush and needed to have a breakfast at a specific time, so going in I knew it would be costly, but honestly, $50 for their short rib hash and eggs and juice one day and $45 for scrambled eggs and juice the next was severely overpriced, even for NY standards. The hash was overcooked, the potatoes raw and portion sizes tiny... which was amazing for the prices charged. Eggs themselves were good. Overall...the room was dated, but the bed was comfy. Price..I think if you can get a room for a good price (under $200), it would be worth staying at, but do not depend on eating here nor expecting the Ritz..

Reviews.Title: “Better than the recent reviews stated”
Reviews.Author: Stephka
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a quick city break at the Hilton. Easy check-in, lovely comfortably sized room, great bed, couldn't be quieter on the 19th floor. Always a good location for business and the theater. Planniing our return!

Reviews.Title: “OK experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1168
Reviews.Content: The location is good, you can walk to 5th ave in 5 minutes and time square in 10. The lobby lacks character it feels like a bit like a subway station with lots people walking pass most of time. No sitting area at all. The suite we stay in is big enough for 5 people ( with a roll away). bath room is tiny and no exhaust fan. Breakfast in the executive lounge in the morning is a joke. We often have queue for 10 minutes before seated and have to split into two groups. Once we were asked by the waiter how much longer we going to be after 5 minutes into our breakfast. Unbelieveable!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great location,great service -can recommend”
Reviews.Author: janepetterson
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Easter Monday for 5 days with family. We had a suite on 44th floor with plenty of space great views. We did not hear any noise from other guests.The service by hotel staff was faultless, everyone was extremely friendly and helpful to us. The Executive lounge access was great for those with teenagers as my kids could use the computers and had an endless supply of fresh cookies and coffee which was great. It's in a good location and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Happily Return”
Reviews.Author: AniseIndianKitchen
Reviews.Content: My family and I go to New York almost every year and this was out first stay in the Hilton. From the moment we arrived the customer service from the doorman to receptionists to the concierge and to the room maids was exceptional - they made us feel very welcome. We were lucky to get a large corner room. We were surprised with the size considering we were in NYC, by far the biggest room we have ever stayed in. The room was perfectly clean, beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked. The location is fantastic for tourists, right in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. Located on 6th Avenue, it's a wonderful walk down to Chelsea/Tribeca etc.. if you can handle the blocks! We love walking so it was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any New York traveller and I'm sure we will book again. Thank you Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Abhijith_J
Reviews.Content: One place to stay which people should avoid in NY is this! The room service is terrible and the facilities are well maintained, but are limited in regard to access by all i.e. not enough for everyone. Food especially for vegetarians, it is a bad place to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Boston175
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Friday night, April 22nd. The location is great, easy walk to the the theatre district and walking back @ 10pm was no problem. Access to Starbucks and a great little grocery and take-out place @ 55th & 6th. Room on the 35th floor was clean and comfortable. I have to agree about the thin walls. Although my neighbors did not stay up late, I could hear their conversations and laughing quite clearly. All in all, I recommend this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Really "thin" walls”
Reviews.Author: minifish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights of this Easter weekend. I agree with some good things about this hotel: the room is big according to New York standard, and clean. What other reviewers did not point out, is how thin these walls can be. We were at the 31st floor, and we can literally hear every single noise made by our next door guests as well as their friends in the other room across the hallway: Loud laughters, chats, telephone rings, doors slammed open and close, knocks on the doors. I ended up calling security to help, because it continued past 2:30AM. In the past we stayed at Tribecca Grand, and other hotels in NYC. We never had problems like this before. There must be some activities going on during the weekend, because the lobby was filled with all kind of people, including many groups. For a while I thought I was not in a brand hotel, but on the streets at the Times Square. And the elevator was packed, and stopped at every single floor possible. If you check out in the morning, make sure you have enough time to wait for the elevator, or be prepared to walk down the stairs yourself. On the day of checking out, housekeepers were knocking our door loud around 8:30AM and about entering our room. I had to shout loud:" We are checking out today" before they went away. Apparently, they did not know that we were leaving, which is surprising given that this is a Hilton. When checking out at the front desk, the lady must had a bad day, because there was no friendly greeting such as "how is your stay?". The first thing we heard was coldly something like: "Our computer system is down, so we can only email you the receipt if you want one.". Well, I guess I have to return to Tribecca Grand or Westin next time I visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “A Long Time HiltonHonors Member - Never Stay at Hilton NY Again”
Reviews.Author: sammythetraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NYC on an Easter Weekend with the family to catch a show on Broadway. I am a long time, loyal HiltonHonors guest and this trip with the family was with 50,000 Honors pts earned over the past year. I chose this Hilton over the other Hilton Properties near Time Square (Doubletree, Hilton Time Square, and the Hampton Inn) mainly because of Nostalgia. When I was to work in Manhattan I used to stay at this hotel regularly when it was Hilton Rockfeller Plaza. Sadly, the Hilton NY isn't what it used to be - both in the rooms and the particularly this time around the service. I will NEVER return to this Hilton again when I visit NY for both personal and work trips. This I would have to say is the single worst experience I've had with any hotel as I was treated as a criminal (actually got the hotel security involved) by the overly obnoxious Bell Captain and the hotel security guard when I attempted to retrieve my belongings from one of his carts without his authorization (even though I had asked the front desk and they said it was perfectly fine). To keep it short, I did not appreciate being treated this way by a HOTEL I WAS STAYING at and it escalated into discussions with the front desk and manager on duty. To be fair, they were at least professional and accomadating and made every attempt to recover (including refunding my honors points). Sadly, though that really wasn't nearly enough to get over the fact that I was treated as a thug by one of hotels staff. And I probably would not have noticed the dingy, fraying carpet on the 17th floor, the lack of bottled water (which is provided to Honors members of status), the lukewarm water, and slow running toilets. To again be fair, I was told by the manager that I would be upgraded to the 13th floor which has been renovated and "much nicer". Maybe it was a just a bad night for the Bell Captain and the staff (it was extremely busy) but I cannot stop thinking that this was definitely NOT the great Hilton Rockefeller Plaza. Just another run down hotel with rude staff. There certainly plenty of these I could go before this one.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive rooms but great location in Manhattan, close to all the sites”
Reviews.Author: uktravailer
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly standard Hilton; they are all from the same cookie cutter mold after all. The main foyer is impressive and the rooms are a reasonable size, big even by major city standards. The bedroom was a little 'tired' and could do with a refurbishment: cracked pain and grubby around light switches and door handles, especially for $350+ per night, but then you don't spend too much time in the room in Manhattan. What you are paying for is location, and this is a well situated hotel. Only a few short blocks or Time Square, Broadway, Central Park, Saks, Macy's etc. Close to the bus routes for the open top tours of the city, the Empire State Building and the boat tours. The desk staff were courteous and the maid service very friendly. Basic WiFi internet is $14.95 - $19.95 per day, and there are 3 levels of service, although the basic service was adequate for our needs. Checked luggage was fairly expensive at $3.95 per bag checked. There is no pool, which would have been nice, we didn't use the restaurants but ate at the many varied establishments located nearby. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very "busy" ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: RieslingKing
Reviews.Content: Knew this Hilton would be a good location, halfway between Times Square and Central Park and right next to Rockefeller Plaza, but didn't realize how large the hotel feels and how busy it is. If you want a quaint, boutique feel, go elsewhere. Prices seem all over the map as my colleague booked a room just a few days after I did and payed $120 more per night. Still like accumulating my points as a diamond honors member and the rooms are good size for NYC, but I might look elsewhere next time when traveling on business. Very nice gym if you don't feel that all the walking is enough...

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for at least 10minutes”
Reviews.Author: Gringohdo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York on the 10th April, luckily for just one night, as i was flying out the next morning. When I went to shower there was no hot water, when I contact guest services I was informed, as a matter of fact, that the water needs to run for 5 to 10 minutes before it gets hot, well it took 12 minutes, and a whole lot of water wasted, before I could get into the shower. So if you shower in the morning I suggest a different hotel. Oh, they have a great gym, but it costs extra if you book with Priceline.......

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: GilMayor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, but you must check in at 3pm. I arrived earlier and the lady at the check in refused to give me a room or even to ask them to clean my room before 3pm. She said to me "you did not pay an extra day, so you have to wait" and "the room MIGHT be ready by 3pm". Anyway, too lousy a service for this kind of hotel. I could pay an extra day or they could give me an earlier room so that they would keep the client. It seems that they do not care. Do not recomend for families travelling with children and arriving earlier than check in hour.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way”
Reviews.Author: kidlaw89
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this great hotel. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. The staff is great from the moment you check in. The rooms are always exceptionally clean and the beds are very comfortable. Room service is excellent. The location of this hotel is the best in the city. It's a short walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Times Square. We will continue to chooseThe Hilton when we travel to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair Accessible, but why do they call it delux suite?”
Reviews.Author: spiderlily7777
Reviews.Content: I think most of the hotels are ADA compliant but Hilton is one of the few hotels in NYC with wheel-in shower, which is a must for my friend with ALS. Since we don't have many hotels/rooms to choose from in the first place, I can't compare our experience with other hotels. We booked a wheelchair accessible delux suite room. It was roomy enough for a wheelchair to move around but it was definitely not a suite. I have no complaint about the room itself but I just don't understand why they call it "delux suite". It was a clean, regular room with two beds. I've stayed at a suite hotel in Times Square area before, and it was a suite with a real living room with sleeper sofa, and a seperate, private bedroom. So when I heard "delux suite", I expected the same. We were expecting multiple visitors, planning to use the "living room" section for meetings. I also wish they offered a several types of shower chairs/benches to choose from. Every wheelchaired person has different needs and the one in the shower didn't fit my friend's. (It was a bench, while she needed a chair with arm rests to suppot herself in the shower.) My rating is not for the Hotel itself, but for the so called "delux suite".

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Katie346
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is on Avenue of the Americas within walking distance of Central Park and Times Square. Check in was fast and efficient. We utilized room service and the Marketplace restaurant. Prices were on par with NYC. Tony in the restaurant was very attentive and friendly. Viviene was very efficient at check out. The bellmen were very organized at lining up the guests who were waiting for taxis. A*** in the gift shop was the only hotel employee that we encountered that was not friendly and guest oriented. He never spoke. There was no greeting. He didn't even say the total of my purchase. I had to look to see the amount. The change was handed back, not counted back, silently. No thank you, good bye, or anything. Pay attention to the elevators. They are grouped by floor number, they do not stop on every floor.

Reviews.Title: “A home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MikiSMLA
Reviews.Content: For the past 10 years, my family and I have been staying in this hotel whenever we come to NY. It's pricey, but I suppose it's of value given the locaiton. Plus, the bedrooms and bathroom are spacious, considering it's in NYC. If you are a Hilton Honors member, you may be able to get free nights. I've only gotten the chance to review this hotel now, but it has been consistent over the years - clean rooms, comfortable beds and great location (walking distance to great attractions, landmarks and Central Park). A shout out to Sanjay, the gentleman at the front desk who checked us in after a 27 hour trip from Asia to the USA. Perhaps it's the (very tired) look on our faces, he went out of his way to look for an already available room for us to collapse in.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed and good location...but please fix the internet!”
Reviews.Author: panaguy
