Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member, I spend a lot of time in Hilton properties, and the Hilton NYC on 6th is my usual stop in New York. There's much to like - very clean, well presented rooms, and the staff at the Etrusca restaurant are always welcoming after a long day. Two negatives - there needs to be more seating in the lobby area and, my major beef, the internet service. Wifi standards have been dropping over my recent trips, and on my last stay it was impossible to get a wifi connection for more than 15 seconds before the signal would drop. For a business hotel that's just unacceptable. The Diamond desk said that a new wifi system was being installed - please, right away, so we can keep in touch with our clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nicely renovated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SingerEsq
Reviews.Content: We had to split time in NYC between a friend's apartment and a hotel. Got a great rate through a competing blind bidding website. Needed to check in early b/c we had an early enagement that afternoon / evening. Not a problem. We were in our room by 1:45, as opposed to the published 3 p.m. check-in. Our room was recently renovated according to the desk clerk who whisked us through check-in. Very good size room for NYC. King-size bed and a full sofa near the window, desk, armoire, etc. Very clean. All staff greeted us in the hallway with a good afternoon or good morning. Cannot beat the location. Stopped for breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Used to NYC prices, but $35/person for a buffet? Walked across the street to a deli for great breakfast for less than $5.00. Starbucks onsight, which is nice. Did not sit in the bar / lounge, but it looked nice with many people, but not crowded. Had stayed here about 20 years ago. The Hilton was just fine then, and probably even better now.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: 60745traveller
Reviews.Content: Went on an amazing four day short break, and this Hotel is ideal for everything. Shopping all within walking distance, subway almost next door, so are plenty of good cheap eating places. Staff always most helpful and friendly. I would never stay anywhere else in New York, and can recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: DDA6
Reviews.Content: Spent weekend (April 1st - 3rd) and found service to be excellent. We got there at 9:30 am and they allowed us to go directly into a room so we didn't have to pay to store our bags. We had a renovated room and it was clean and neat with a large walk-in shower. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly. We noticed Eastern European men cleaning the rooms - very friendly and maybe a sign of the times. No sign of bedbugs anywhere, although we did leave our clothing in plastic bags, off the floor. Easy to get cabs, subway nearby and in the thick of midtown Manhattan. Ate at Bagel and Bean a couple of blocks away and had a very good breakfast for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Hiltom”
Reviews.Author: iphonebruin
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the hotel in February for 4 nights. Ginny had never been to NYC and a colleague suggetsed we stay there. I hadn't been to that hotel in some time and was delighted with the look and feel of the lobby, the service and it's location. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and it was roomy and comfortable. I would stay here again and will absolutely recommend it. They should provide free internet in the rooms. I felt the $19 a day to too much. I've always stayed at the Sheraton just around the corner - this Angelino has found a new home away from home in NYC. One more thing...the buffet American breakfast included in our stay was terrific. A great selection of items and the staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: gjborrowdale
Reviews.Content: just got back from our stay at the hilton just one word to describe the hotel was FANTASTIC. be thank you to Kellie for making it such a wonderfull experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: maxthecat49
Reviews.Content: Staying at the New York Hilton was a wonderful experience. The staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean at all times. The New York Hilton is in a great location. It is minutes away from most attractions and close to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Quick check in with friendly service. We got a room on the 32nd floor. It was very small with only one queen sized bed. The room was very clean and nicely decorated and well lit. I am used to small hotel rooms in NYC but have never been given just one queen bed..usually two doubles or a king. The bed was comfortable enough with plenty of pillows. The problem was the noise! Even this high up we could here the door mens' whistles, traffic, sirens etc. The windows are definitely not air tight. There is also a lot of noise coming from within the hotel such as noisy pipes, water flushing, things dropping in next room, hall noise and a weird sound that kept coming and going that sounded like a truck going through a tunnel. I got a good deal on this hotel using a third party so I really can't complain too much. But the Millennium Hilton downtown is much superior.

Reviews.Title: “A surprise in New York”
Reviews.Author: BrendaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton, which was one of the host hotels for the NYC 1/2 marathon. The rate was reasonable for the very nice accommodation we had - not typical for that price in NYC. The corner room was quiet and well appointed. The 2 double beds were OK. I'm a sensitive sleeper, so I though tthe mattress could have been a bit firmer. The room was average size, very clean (except for the dirty hair dryer bag), and comfortable. Bathrrom was a little smaller than normal, but overall fine. We were pleased with this hotel and I'm very picky. It was also within easy walking distance of the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “i will never stay at another Hilton Hotel again after this experience”
Reviews.Author: citygirl28
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel simply because it offered twin beds. I did not pay much attention to the bad reviews thinking they could have been made up from a competing hotel. I thought you could trust a Hilton and couldnâ€™t go far wrong, having stayed at Hiltons across the UK. Thereâ€™s no way there would be a noise problem. I was wrong, I can assure you I am a real person relatively well travelled and experienced in what hotels should offer, this is one of the worst. When I arrived the staff were robotic they were unfriendly and couldnâ€™t be bothered to talk to you/serve you, there were a row of them looking at us waiting for us to choose who to go to (there were no other guests waiting)they couldnâ€™t be bothered or cared less. I was told my double room was ready I said it was a twin I booked. We went to our room and it looked nice tried to switch the TV on and there were no free channels which could be viewed. So it was basically a decoration. The bathroom was shabby and small and needed decorating. This wasnâ€™t the worst of it. (also they say they have business facilities but you have to pay to use a computer, even as a guest of the hotel. You also have to pay for use of the leisure facilities and everything else possible there are no benefits of teh facilities unless you are willing to pay a high price for them, others say great location but there are hundreds of hotels in the same area) We left the hotel to grab a bite to eat on our return I found I could hear the conversations of people in the hall passing by our room, word for word, and also those of the couple in the room next to us and the tv of the other room (including a telephone discussion the man was having word for word literally). The couple were arguing and there is not a word I could not hear, not mumbled but instead very clear. There was also the outside noise to content with, it sounded like I was trying to take a nap on the street on the pavement/sidewalk, in the middle of times square/fifth avenue. I called customers services and told them the problem they did not dispute it, as though they are use to this complaint and put me through to the front desk to switch rooms. This was done and I was told the hotel of over 1000 rooms was fully booked and couldnâ€™t do this, I was basically stuck there and I could lump it (unless I had a spare money to book another hotel, I didnâ€™t so I was indeed stuck and regretting booking it.) The funny thing is our cab driver who picked us up from the airport recommended another hotel if we werenâ€™t happy with the Hilton, its obviously a well known fact to New Yorkers that this hotel is not very good - i hope BA remove it from their recommended list of New York Hotels). I went back to customer services and relayed this saying I had a trans Atlantic flight and couldnâ€™t sleep with this sort of noise and considering I was staying for a few nights surely they should try and do something. I asked if I could speak to a manager, it was early Friday evening and I was told they were not around but would call me back. This never materialised. I called back the following day and I was told there was a different manager on over the weekend and I asked if I could speak with them and again they were not around nor did they bother to call me if they ever were. The staff were unhelpful/unfriendly they thought they were doing you a favour simply being there not realising they were being paid by the customer, which is why a customer should be valued. I have never experienced anything like this, the better hotels were cheaper but could not accommodate twin beds that weekend, even so I would rather pay a higher price for a suite at any hotel other than this one which is unprofessional and soulless because of its size. Also to note NATO sent around 1000 teenagers there for a conference on the same weekend, the hotel was actually busier than grand central station (I say this after visiting the station on the final day in new york) on the Friday and Saturday of my stay. It was a circus not a hotel if they cannot cope with the capacity and are unable to help their customers because they are preoccupied with babysitting then they should make a change one way or another. Furthermore most city hotels are sound proof what went wrong with this one? The problem is it doesnâ€™t matter how many bad reviews they receive they do not care and will not do anything about it because they think their name is enough to guarantee customers, well it is the worst Hilton I have stayed in (something seriously went amiss) I have stayed in better Premier Inns than this hotel, they have managed to deter me from ever staying at a Hilton again irrespective of the country, my friends and family will also steer clear. You need a lesson in customer service and i canâ€™t believe I am saying this to a hotel chain as large as the Hilton but there needs to be a serious review of what a hotel should be, privacy and not being able to hear everyones conversations around you when trying to sleep at least, is very important. Avoid room 3040 who knows the others may be better, but my friends family and myself will never trust a stay at a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: juanfleabonic
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here. What a huge hotel! Service was top notch, and I enjoyed the staff. Location was prime, right in Rockafeller Center. My room was on the 50th floor, and faced south, could see the lights of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCalGal
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, walked all over midtown, Central Park, quick response to any problem or question, the BEST breakfast (opt for rate which includes breakfast!), good restaurant, smallish rooms are typical of NYC but very clean and nice bath with large shower! Brought our granddaughter to NYC for her birthday and the trip was PERFECT! It even snowed on cue for her carriage ride through the park after birthday tea at the Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “wow what location!!”
Reviews.Author: takama
Reviews.Content: wonderful location! rockefeller centre and radio city music hall just outside. empire state building and chrysler tower nearby, times square and central park walkable, just can't beat it. very very small rooms but definitely comfortable and well equipped. the lobby and common areas look jaded and need some uplift. but who cares. you stay here for the location and just that!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average service.”
Reviews.Author: SittingbourneOwl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week ago for 5 nights, booked through Trailfinders, the location is excellent on 6th Avenue and only 4 blocks from Central Park, 10 blocks from Times Square(1/2 mile). Check in was quick but unfortunately given the wrong room with only 1 bed, this was corrected to a room on 23rd floor at the far end of floor. Room was surprisingly big and clean, bathroom was bijou, no noise from the streets, but could hear chat from neighbouring rooms. Didn't use the Restaurants as breakfast was $35, very busy for breakfast but quiet at dinner. There are better options for food close to the hotel, such as 7th Avenue, though it is pricey as this is Manhattan. Tip for cheaper food go to Chinatown at Canal Street or Flushing Main Street where breakfast for 2 cost less than $10 and dinner for 2 for $20. Had to use the hotel gym once when there was bad weather, it costs $15, don't be fooled by the photos, it is small so not enough equipment, a better gym option was the YMCA at Central Park West, 10mins walk away. The staff didn't smile much, you get the feeling you were just a number, typical of big chains, also opportunity to nickle and dime you, such as leaving your bags for storage, it is $3:50 per item. Surely this should be free, is it an American thing, Asian hotles look after your bags for free as standard. Big tip for travelling around is to use the Subway and buy a weekly card for $28, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NY, lovely rooms, service a little iffy”
Reviews.Author: NJNan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Christmas break with my husband and two young adult daughters. W had two very nice rooms that were a good size, very updated/modern, clean, comfortable -- had a very good night's sleep which isn't always easy if you're not used to the sounds of NYC. Was a very busy time to stay in this hotel and therefore we had to wait for everything: in line in our car to drive up to front door just to be told we had to go around the block to park, in line to park our car, not too long to check in, fortunately. Confusing check in as there were all sorts of coupons for water, $ off on breakfast (as a Hiltons Honors Club Member), etc. Would have been nice just to have some water bottles out in the ice bucket (not have to take them out of the mini bar and worry about getting charged exorbitant rates) for the guests. Had to wait almost an hour for our breakfast, in a huge line for the buffet. If we hadn't had the $ off coupons from the HH program we wouldn't have bothered as it was VERY expensive and not well organized or run. Waitress couldn't have cared less about us -- tables all around us were left unbussed (no wonder the wait was so long), only 1 chef making eggs/omelets/waffles for hundreds of people??, was not a pleasant experience and I consider it a missed opportunity for Hilton. Should be able to provide a reasonable price brunch/breakfast for their guests -- and could advertise same to other visitors in the area as there aren't a lot of places to eat. Heard from staff after leaving similar feedback with Hilton and they offered a free breakfast next time we stayed there? Really? We can't afford to stay in NYC during holiday time very often, it was a special treat. I'd probably stay here again, but not bother with the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton I've been in my life”
Reviews.Author: Bertrand_FRA
Reviews.Content: To start with service was abysmal, very common in the US. When will waiters understand that I do not care what their name is, I am not their pal and they are here to serve me an not sell a service, the minimum I expect from a staff is to be called sir (a good waiter is someone you do not notice). The hotel is perfectly located, the room was quite nice, I had lounge access, which to be honest was one of the best one I was able to sample (European lounges do not seems to be so nice). One issue is that the Lounge is big and only 2 computers to connect to internet were available. Now going down to the service: checking out and leaving suitcases to store, they keep talking together and do not even look at you? sorry no tip. at the bar, 5 TV showing basket ball, one showing golf, one of the person wanted as well to watch basket ball, I complained, but program was changed, I hope the waiter got the tip from the other client (because he did not get anything from me). Otherwise the location is very good, ant it seems that you got the best Kebap cart down the place, people queuing all night long. If the staff was not so arrogant will have ranked the place higher. till now the best staff I had in New-York were part time workers (students) from Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1995pixie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant for location, cleanliness and staff. After a horrible experience at the Sheraton a block away we checked into the Hilton. As soon as you enter the reception area it is absolutely wonderful, bright, clean and a lovely welcome from the staff. This visit was for my husbsnds 50th birthday. On check in we were given an upgrade to an executive room. This was beautifully furnished and a very good size. The bathroom was a good size and everywhere was exceptionally clean. We were also given access to the executive lounge which was lovely and a real treat. There are not many places where you can eat breakfast what looking over central park. A special thank you to Paul on reception who checked us in, he is a real credit to the hotel. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much. If you require a hotel that is clean, has good staff, is value for money and is in a brilliant location look no further than the Hilton. We will definitely be making a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Reddog4nffc
Reviews.Content: me and my mate went for new years eve 06/07 we arrived 27th dec 3pm new york time, 5hrs in pasport control, not a good start, got to the hotel after some very bad traffic at 11ish. they had give our room to someone else so had to share a bed with my mate, they gave us vouchers for a breakfast each and a dinner in the hotel. room was very clean, we got a paper for just 1 day then never had another 1 for the rest of the holiday, the hotel is in a good location, close to a lot of sights rockefeller centre is only a min walk, the only problem with this hotel is the price, we paid about Â£600 each just for new years eve and new years day, but we couldnt get in anywhere else so had to pay it other than that it was nice

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Helene2507
Reviews.Content: Hotel within a stones throw of Central Park and only 10mins away from Times Square. Staff are friendly and very helpful as well as professional and courteous. This trip was for my sons 21st Birthday and after emailing the hotel (when I had booked with BA within a package and was only offered a standard room) the Hilton upgraded us to the Executive Level placing us on the 40th floor with the most amazing views. The room was extremely spacious, 2 huge comfortable beds, coffee making machine, mini bar, iron, big TV with all the channels. We also had acccess to the executive lounge where we had a wonderful Continental Breakfast. On returning on our first night out, the Hilton put a bottle of champagne on ice AND chocolate covered strawberries for my son. We were very moved and thankful for their generosity and thoughtfulness. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as well as encouraging others to join the Hilton Honours to be able to take advantage of special offers that the Hilton offer. Thanks Hilton for making this once in a lifetime trip for my son sooooooooooo special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: playball1960
Reviews.Content: I fought to try and get something closer to Times Square but they were sold out. It turned out to be a great decision as the location is perfect - a 10 minute walk to Times Square yet avoids all the crowds and noise associated with staying in that area. Steps to Central Park and 5th Ave shopping. Deluxe rooms are great. Very clean and modern. This is a large hotel so if you want boutique this is not for you. Avoid breakfast here - better options all around the neighborhood. Full-service grocery store across the street. Also charge excessive rates for wi-fi use. Concierge desk was outstanding. They made great recommendations for dinner (and reservations too), I needed a specialty store for puzzles and they came up with a name. They were very helpful. Made for a perfect weekend. Thanks Hilton New York!

Reviews.Title: “What great staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomnj624
Reviews.Content: Having to narrow down all the hotels in New York City for one that wasn't too expensive or far from attractions or not child friendly was quite a chore. I read the reviews on many of the hotels and finally decided on the Hilton. The one thing that stood out was the staff. They were extremely friendly and accommodating (we had no shampoo in our room and a light was out---all rectified within a quick time). I highly recommend the executive level. My kids loved the breakfast in the morning. The evening was a bit more crowded but my boys, again, loved the cheese and crackers. And the cookies in between were a hit. My husband and I loved the all day access to coffee. Also our floor was very quiet. The only problem we encountered was the weather (warm one day, freezing the next) and the thermostat in our room left us warmer than usual. It finally adjusted our last day. We opened a window which let in all the city sounds. At times, exciting, but sirens blaring at 3 am kept me awake (my boys slept through it all!!). Really something out of everyone's hands, I thought. Didn't let it ruin the trip. Would highly recommend the Gazillion bubble show too. All in all a really nice place to stay...my country bumpkins probably won't be back for awhile, but it was overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great Location Great Price”
Reviews.Author: JAM02
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the convenient mid-town location, just a short walk to the MoMA, Broadway and Times Square, Rockafeller Center, the Carnegie Deli and Carnegie Hall. We stayed on a busy President's Day weekend and were surprised the room rates were so reasonable ($199) but we decided to pay an extra $20 for the deluxe room and were very impressed --it was well appointed, modern, comfortable, and clean. Great lighting in the rooms! Six different reading lights over the bed and and even little lights on the floor with motion sensors so you dont trip if you get up in the middle of the night. But this is a large and very busy hotel, so be prepared for the lobby to feel like Grand Central Station almost any time of the day. The buffet breakfast was better than expected, at a cost of $30 per person--but we noticed that many people had discount coupons that came with their room. Dont be alarmed if the line waiting for a table seems long--- the dining room is huge and the staff is very well organized in seating people and the line moves quickly. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but not Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: I_heart_passport
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New York. This hotel is in an excellent position, close to restaurants, central park, shopping etc. The service was good and the concierge was excellent. On the down side - The business centre was extremely expensive. My biggest problem would be the breakfast... the buffet is extremely expensive and the quality of food was not worth the money spent. There was very slack table service for coffee/drinks and we ended up walking out. Consequently we did not use the Hilton restaurants for anymore meals. Instead, we ate in the restaurants surrounding the hotel - which was a far better experience in the end. I would recommend this hotel to others purely for its location, rooms & service... but would suggest finding another place to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: waterloo65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights we could not have stayed in a better hotel the location was excellent and the staff were very pleasant. I would like to thank Kellie Cahill for her excellent customer service i emailed her several times with different questions and she answered me back in record time once again thank you. The room we stayed in was excellent very clean and lovely comfey beds. The location was excellent central for everything. Overall would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice access”
Reviews.Author: KumikoT
Reviews.Content: When I stayed under-reconstruction. I think renewal will be much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeSurrey94
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days in NYC and loved it.... hotel was great, rooms clean and comfortable, when we arrived the lady at reception gave us vouchers for a full breakfast every day so that saved four of us 140 dollars a day and it was a very good breakfast. The reception staff in my opinion were bordering rude and disinterested but this was the general feeling we had concerning customer service in general, having been before it was no surprise, just grit your teeth and accept it. The prices are sky high, a typical meal for 4 adults based on the cheapest wine and 1/2 courses in a standard restaurant came to around 250 -300 dollars and that was every night, you think Londons expensive well its not compared to NYC. Our final night we had a meal in Michael Jordons steakhouse NYC its in the Grand Central Terminal, highly recommend it, great location and good food. All in all a great trip, but very expensive to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously not the best Hilton, but outstanding for New York”
Reviews.Author: lovewell
Reviews.Content: To be clear, my ratings are for the Hilton New York as a Hilton Hotel in NYC. It is far from the best Hilton I've ever stayed at, its room sizes and decor can't compete with ones in other cities. But that being said, in the context of NYC this is probably my favorite hotel in New York City now. I've stayed in a dozen others throughout the city and I actually liked the Hilton Times Square as my previous favorite, but now that I've been here it will be hard to go back. I got a room upgrade because of status to the 44th floor with a Central Park view. The location is convenient to just about everything in mid-town, the upper floors are quieter in my opinion than staying further down in Times Square (although its still NYC never real silence). The only thing thats not the greatest is the elevators since there are only 3 per section of 10 or so floors so it takes a while and fills up on the way down. I definitely will make this my number 1 choice for NYC stays when the rate is good.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel - Fabulous Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ScottInToronto
Reviews.Content: What a delight to stay at the Hilton (Avenue of Americas) for 3 nights for our 10th anniversary. It couldn't have been better.Plenty of helpful staff for quick check in. A spacious modern feeling lobby including free access to airline reservations and boarding pass printout. Insightful concierge available for your request. Exciting lobby bar was a great place to watch the "big football game" Our newly modelled room with king bed was luxurious. Ultra comfortable bed with fresh linens every day. Cabinets and countertops a combination of light maple and black granite looked ultra modern. They continued the theme in the bathroom where they had high end bath hardware . Rooms were cleaned spotlessly every day with fresh lotions and soaps as well. All of this with the added benefit of the location. We walked everywhere. We walked to Central Park, Times Square, Rock Center,MOMA,Flat Iron even the Guggenheim.We didn't find out until later but there is a discount pass offered to see most of the sights on our list. Be cautious, not all galleries/antique shops are open on Mondays. Because of this locale, I'm sure we must have saved quite a bit in taxi/subway fares over the 3 days and got to see so much of the city. Great local spots for eating are Angelos Pizza, Radiance Tea Room, and Nougatine. You often wonder what concerns you are going to get at a large hotel in the BIG CITY but our entire stay here was a delight. Would stay here again and again in a New York minute!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near Central Park ...”
Reviews.Author: Bariloche-61
Reviews.Content: - walking distance from Central Park - walking distance from several excellent restaurants - nearby of several shopping locations - nearby entertainment locations - helpful concierge staff - large breakfast buffet During our stay several groups of young latin americans stayed at the hotel. The noise level when they were in the lobby was pretty high !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb service,incredible staff, awesome bed!”
Reviews.Author: knitdr
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and usually a room is a room. But the Hilton NYC on the Avenue of the Americas (6th Avenue between 53rd and 54th) is an incredible location. If you can't walk to it or take a short Metro ride to it from there-you don't need it! Shows, shopping, restaurants, famous sites are all close by. The Hilton staff are great-everyone makes sure to say 'Hi' or may I help you from the cleaning staff to the desk to the valets to the restaurant/bar staff. I kept thinking that I must be in a commercial for Hilton but the smiles and service continued for the full 5 days. My bed was a dream, which is saying alot since I have chronic neck pain. The rooms and facilities were always spotless, even during a snow storm. I will be sure to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not worthy of the name of Hilton, either”
Reviews.Author: serendipity794
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and it was a pleasant business hotel. No complaints. This time I saw the other side of the hotel. The first room they put me in was a "new room" on the 7th floor. It was, in my opinion, garish and tacky - cheap-looking modern furniture, color scheme of brown, bright blue, and lime green. I couldn't believe that was what they were renovating to when I'd liked all the other rooms I had here. It also had a chemical smell from all the new carpet/furnishings. They moved me to a room on the 19th floor and I immediately saw why they're renovating. Water damage on the wall in the hallway. Really "dated" decoration. But it wasn't bad enough to be the annoying guest and move again. Then I discovered that the walls were paper-thin. The first night I thought the yelling, laughing female voices keeping me up until midnight were just thoughtless teenagers. But the second morning I heard the news and every word of the conversation between two men on the other side of the wall. Also, it didn't matter what I set the heater on... it just kept on going. If the temperature started at 70 and I set it to 73 I would regularly find it had kept going to 75 or higher. The service to the room was not perfect. First they didn't replace the ice bag. The next day they didn't throw away the old one. I used the disposable coffee cups and after three days, the maids hadn't replaced them. So then I saw the coffee/ mini-bar guy in the hallway and thought, "Oh, maybe he's supposed to take care of that." So I told him my room needed service. Came back... still no coffee cups. Weirdest of all, every afternoon they knocked on the door to ask, "Was your room cleaned today?" Shouldn't they know that?! When I asked them why they do that, they couldn't even explain it except to say, "We have to do it." As I said, every other visit has been fine and I would have recommended it, but after this time, even though all the problems were small... go somewhere else. You can do just as well within a few blocks of this place for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel nice staff”
Reviews.Author: enzo360
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for business. The hotel is what you would expect from a business hotel, very clean and sterile. The staff was very nice offering some great suggestions for local attractions. I was a little disappointed that the wireless internet was $15 per day, it seems like it should be included. Over all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jeff1996
Reviews.Content: We arrived at JFK early in the morning and had requested an early checkin. Standard checkin time is 3pm but they were able to assist us and give us access to one of our connecting rooms. Access to the second room was ready for us when we arrived back from touring at the end of a days touring. From the time of checkin until checkout 5 days later, staff were at all times polite and helpful. The hotel is apparently one of the largest hotels in Manhattan but it runs like a well oiled machine. It is very well situated bieng 2 block from Rockerfeller Centre, a few blocks from Central Park, round the corner from 5th Avenue and not too far from the bustling Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but distinctly average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floridashire
Reviews.Content: Having been pestered outside the hotel for rides in a rickshaw and horse and cart to be pestered once again repeatedly by hotel staff in the foyet trying to flog timeshares on the premise of a free drink didn't fit with the reputation of the Hilton. The room was a standard room but still not cheap but the room was distinctly average and in our room one window was blocked out because it had previously been broken. The breakfast was very good although dont make the mistake of agreeing to it at the hotel it is grossly over priced. Either book it as part of the package or go down the road for a good breakfast at a realistic price. This trip was part of our 25th wedding anniversary staying in several hotels throughout Florida and culminating in a couple off days in New York before going home. The holiday started off with a high note in Miami and a distinct low note in New York i.e. we stayed in a Marriott hotel in Naples at 20% of the price but 200% better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vasily K
Reviews.Content: This is pretty expensive hotel with bad and not friendly service and cleanliness. The only good thing about this hotel is the location - close to Radio City and Broadway theatres. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent break”
Reviews.Author: Turnjules
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked to travel before Christmas and stay in a different hotel on Times Square. Unfortunately we were caught up in the snow fiasco at Heathrow and had our flight cancelled. We managed to rebook our flights with BA to fly out on New Years Eve and also booked this hotel as a package. The location of this hotel is superb and in hindsight Heathrow actually did us a favour by closing the runways! (Although we are still out of pocket - thanks BAA!) The check-in was really smooth and fast - considering we checked in on New Years Eve and the hotel was very busy and we quickly found our way to our room on the 28th floor and were able to join in the new year celebrations within about 30 minutes of arriving. The room was spacious and extremely clean. The bar service was excellent with a comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. All the staff are very polite. As mentioned previously the hotel is in a fabulous location - a short walk to both Central Park and 5th Avenue for the amazing shopping. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and will definitely use it again when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Our Room Came Complete With a Superhero!”
Reviews.Author: Parksy52
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived at the Hilton New York on the Avenue of the Americas at around 11am on a Saturday. Of course, the room wasn't ready, so we did a little sight-seeing. Upon returning to the hotel at around 3:30pm, I checked in and was given my key to my room on the 14th Floor. As is with nearly all hotels, now, it wasn't actually a key, but an electronic data card. I found my way to the 14th floor, followed the arrows to the correct room number, slowly inserted the card into the slot and removed it quickly. BINGO! I got the flashing green light which is almost like winning in Vegas. I gained access to my room on the very first try! I opened the door, dragged my suitcase in, and was greeted by a man in his underwear laying on my bed! In those few seconds, I actually thought I had entered the wrong room, but then it occurred to me that I had actually used a key to get in. Just then, Captain Underpants rolled over and looked at me. This is how the encounter went: Captain Underpants: "Hey... how ya doin?" Me: "I'm ok. (Yes. There's a half-dressed stranger in my room, and I tell him I'm ok.) You're in my room". Captain Underpants: "Yeah. I'm just waiting for my wife. We're actually staying on the 21st floor. I'll be out in like 10 minutes." Me: "OK." At that point, we ran out the door and down the hall to the elevators. I got down to the lobby, and even though there was a line, a staff member could tell there was a problem, so he took me to an available person in registration who was only supposed to be helping elite Hilton members. I explained to her that there was a man in my room. She asked me to be more specific, so I explained to her that there was a man in his underpants sleeping on my bed in my room. She excused herself for a second, and then returned to tell me that she would give me a different room. I responded, "Well obviously, but don't you think you should do something more? Like maybe find out WHY Captain Underpants is in my room?" After the girl behind the counter told us she would alert security, we got the key to a new room and headed back to the elevators. We pushed the up button, the doors opened, and who do you think appeared? Yep! It was Captain Underpants, but in his civilian attire. As we passed, he made some type of a complaint about the hotel and how there had been a big party in the room next door to his the previous night, and the hotel had given he and his wife a different room. My girlfriend didn't recognize Captain Underpants in his disguise, so she responded with "Well that's nothing! We just found a guy in his underpants in our room!" Evidently, the night staff switched the captain's room, and never told the day crew. It was a GREAT story to tell at the conference I was attendingt! The room was great, the staff was great... I don't want you thinking the hotel stunk. Completely the opposite. I just thought it was a fun story to tell.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel saved my holiday! Fact!”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay urgently after checking out of a flea pit (see my other review), this place was on lastminute.com so I booked... 6 nights for Â£750 (room 2802). Lovely clean hotel in a fantastic location, in fact the best location if your a tourist. Times Square is just round the corner, so is Central Park, Rockafella Centre is a couple of blocks away (thats the closest subway). The hotel is cheery, bright and really really clean... Only a couple of negatives: Firstly and this needs capitals..... THEY CHARGE $15 PER DAY FOR WIFI !!!!! Even the basic travelodge that I stayed in at the airport gave free internet and when you paying top dollar it would be nice to have the wifi thrown in? My room wasn't made up on the last day... I did have the 'do not disturb' sign on the door until around 11:30 but I didn't consider that too late? The sounds of the wind rushing through the building / on the street outside is annoying but this isn't the Hiltons fault, I guess all skyscrapers have this problem? Its hard to sleep with the 'whoosing' noise though! It was a bit of a nightmare trying to check out early tried doing it on the tv system which they advertise, then tried it on the machines in the lobby and finally after wasting all that time I had to just queue like everyone else and wait to be checked out my a human. 9/10

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I redeemed Hilton HHonors points here for a weekend trip to New York. I did not expect a boutique or intimate experience- the hotel is huge, and I was aware of that- but I did think that a flagship property would deliver a nice experience. Man, was I wrong. The wait to check-in, even in the Diamond lane, was 15 minutes. I get it- the hotel is busy- but you could not help but notice the expansive front desk with only 4 agents working despite a long line. The hallways are gross. Multiple tears in the wallpaper, stained carpet, ceiling tiles brown with water damage, worn signage. The lobby is in better shape, but has bland decor and barely any seating or work space. Sadly, the room was no better. It featured tired, out-dated decor, similarly scuffed walls and questionably clean carpet, torn lampshades, a non-functional internet connection, one broken phone, threadbare towels, scratchy sheets, and an uncomfortable mattress. Service was a mixed bag. After the long wait to check-in, I had a welcoming agent. But on the first morning of our stay, I got a call from housekeeping asking what time the room should be cleaned. I gave a time. 3 hours after that time, we came back to discover the room hadn't been serviced. I called and asked for 3 sets of new towels and was told it would be 10 min. 15 passed and I called again, at which point I was promised a follow-up call when housekeeping was on the way. No call. A few minutes later, someone arrived, but with 2, rather than 3, sets of towels. Concierge lounge was OK. Very carb heavy breakfast, but free and plentiful. Expect long lines for elevators. Overall, I was very disappointed and the unresponsive service and poor quality of the accommodations. This hotel is in serious need of a major upgrade/renovation and did not meet the standards I have come to expect from the Hilton brand.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the shadows of Pikes Peak
Reviews.Title: “Great location for the NYC Marathon”
Reviews.Author: CO-TriGirl
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC for the marathon and spent 5 days in the City. The hotel was a perfect location for the Times Square shuttles (only a few blocks away). The elite runners were also in the hotel and I was able to shop at their store rather than dealing with the mobs at the expo. The hotel is nicely renovated and did a good job everytime we encountered/requested a service. NO BED BUGS! Whew! We stayed on the top floors and was worth every penny. The executive lounge food is just ok, but their service is great! We made several special request from the staff and they were always able to help! Also, there were several movie premiers across the street from the hotel while we were there. We saw Russel Crow at one of them! I am not much of a star struck person, but it was a neat experience! I receive a massage after the race and the hotel does a good job staffing for that day. The therapist was great with deep tissue and worked out all of the kinks! However, I wish they had a hot tub! The walk to Times Square is quick and interesting. The food along the way is fantastic - however, I would highly recommend taking a cab or the subway to little italy! Well worth the trip! Lastly, there is so much to do in NYC. It is hard to pick a favorite. However, do book the crown package for the statue of liberty! We didn't know you needed to book several months in advance and would have liked to go up to the crown! All in all - we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CorndogCorndog
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hilton. The location is fantastic. Close to Central Park, St. Patrick's Cathederal, Times Square, theatres, and many fabulous restaurants. I arrived 2 hours before check in time, and was given a room immediately. The hotel lobby was very crowded and noisy, but the room was very nice. The fitness facility is absolutely fantastic. Probably 20 treadmills and the same number of elipticals. Each of the machines are new and have their own tv screen. Very nice weight machines and dumbell sets. I highly recommend the hotel and will use it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience”
Reviews.Author: Cmonica
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four nights in the new York Hilton as part of a Christmas treat.it did not disappoint.we enjoyed every moment of our stay.the room was spacious and clean and the beds were so comfortable.the staff were very pleasant and courteous.it is in an excellent location for walking to times square,Rockefeller centre etc.although the lobby was quite busy due to various conferences this did not.affect or detract from the sense of peace and calm in the rooms.we really enjoyed our experience and hopefully will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mad4rda
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel 3 hours before check in. The lobby was packed (there were a couple of conferences going on) but I didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes before being seen. The receptionist was very friendly and assured me that it wasn't a problem that I was early. He noted it was my birthday and then promptly upgraded me to one of the larger refurbished rooms! The room on the 16th floor was clean and well set out, the bed was very comfortable and I didn't hear any noise. The staff were efficient and exceptionally polite. No real wait for the lifts, etc. Location wise, it was perfect for Central Park, Times Square and the museums. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and the one morning I ordered room service, it was delivered within 15 minutes!! I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will certainly stay here again. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service”
Reviews.Author: strudledoodle
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the 36th floor and had good views King size bed with double sofa bed,it was so hot during our stay we had the windows open so we could hear the traffic but as soon as the window was closed there was silence resulting in very peacefull nights sleep.you would never know you were in the heart of manhattan,we walked everywhere as the hotel is very central.food in the hotel was good but a little pricey but there are so many restaurants and delis around we only ate in hotel once.Staff friendly and being a honors card holder I felt like royalty as everyone was amazing! its the second time I have stayed in this hotel and planning a third trip soon

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice....Just will nickel and dime you a bit.”
Reviews.Author: LiftingIron
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very clean but they wanted to charge to hold the bags...$3.50 a bag! + tip. Bag storage should be free for guests. We decided to take our bags with us and ate lunch at Faces and Names ( Down the block on 54th) while they got our room ready. It was before check-in time so this was ok. Once we got done with lunch the room was ready...early, but we had to inquire, they didn't text us like they said they would. No big deal...The room was super clean. We didn't get cups in the room the second day and called to have them brought to the room. The cups arrived quickly and we even received a follow-up phone call. A very nice hotel near much of the New York action. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: CindyLewWho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton from December 28 to the 31st. The hotel was ideal to walk to anywhere. Great restaurants close by and the bus and Times Square were a perfect distance. WE did not want to rent a car and this hotel was in the right location. The hotel itself was very clean and we really enjoyed our stay. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home - stayed many times at this hotel, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: NokiaGirl43
Reviews.Content: Stayed many times at this hotel over the last 6 yrs, either with our teenager or family. Each time has been a comfortable pleasure.Staff friendly, helpful and good food with huge variety to suit all tastes and Nationalities! Fantastic location, great bar with the best bar staff. Fantastic 'members' lounge with happy hour and canapes every night, stunning views of New York. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mcamm1
Reviews.Content: There were a number of hotels that I could have stayed at but I tend to stay at Hiltons since the quality of their rooms and their service is usually excellent. The New York Hilton did not disappoint! Parking was directly connected to the hotel lobby and was competitive with the rates changed in the other nearby lots. The check in at the lobby was smooth and quick. We were given a lovely room that was a good size and was reasonably priced. The room looked out onto 54 street which provided a great view as well as less noise than the 6th avenue side. The room had comfortable beds, flat screen TV and a VERY clean and well appointed bathroom bathroom. The hotel has room service and a nice restaurant. The hotel also has a fitness centre that is unbelievable! It has more elliptical machines and treadmills than any other hotel fitness center that I have ever seen! It was a pleasure to workout there. The location of this hotel can't be beat. A short walk to central park, 5th ave, radio city music hall and times square. The concierge was very helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations and also provided info on how to obtain show tickets from the booth in Times Sq. I would not hesitate to stay there again. In my books the New York Hilton was a 10 out of 10 experience for myself and my family. Its a great place to stay in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “dirty room and worst bathroom”
Reviews.Author: popoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: quite disappointed after stayed in ritz carlton cancun we arrived in this expensive business hotel it was just ripoff and the worst they tried to overcharge me the gym and mini bar didn't believe me and off curse no thanks you at last......

Reviews.Title: “crowded hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: silviags
Reviews.Content: A very large hotel, crowded pros excellent location a couple of blocks from central park cons gym is not free, wifi not free should be. crowded restaurant for breakfast (maybe because itÂ´s holidays) parking really expensive, not queen beds they are double ones. clean beds, good pillows and sheets. friendly staff in the floors

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY... FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Houstonhowler
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a six day stay in the Hilton New York, paid a little extra via Expedia to upgrade to an Executive Floor, arrived early afternoon and proceeded to the Exec check in desk, where I recieved prompt and attentive service, waited no time to be issued keys and was on our way. Having read numerous reviews re busy lobby and pushy Hilton Honors sales person was more than surprised to experience neither. Stayed in room 3924 older decor but very clean well presented and more than adequate. Following morning had breakfast in Entrusia on the ground floor as exec lounge being remodeled. However the quality of continental breakfast was supberb, the waiting staff also were more than helpful and very pleasant. Plenty of choice for our two son aged 15yrs and 11yrs..... enough to fill their hollow legs. When exec lounge reopened the quality was as good but the icing on the cake as far as we were concerned were the great views to Central Park, and down 6th to Radio City, 30 Rock and the Empire State. Evening hor d'ourves were plentiful and warm, bar area clean and serving staff great. OK at busy times there was a queue to get seated for breakfast, and of course the lifts/elevators get busy..... use the stairs or the service elevator at busy times between floors or to get to the lobby. In the size of this hotel, 2200 rooms it can only be expected. The concierge staff in main lobby assisted with all requesrts, booked us an SUV to get to the airport and at all times were pleasant and efficient.... never had to wait more than a few minutes to recieve service. While on trip booked NYC citysights holiday lights tour..... not worth the effort or wait..... guide was interesting enough but you can see as much as the tour provides by spending an hour walking round the main attractions, as opposed to sitting in mid town traffic getting very cold then being whizzed past certain locations in order to comply with the traffic regulations. Overall NYC at Christmas does not disappoint .... the atmosphere was great, yes it's very busy but you can always find a quiet space to sit and recharge before the next expedition to Macy's or Bloomingdales for those essential last minute Christmas items... Hilton New York was located in the ideal spot to take full advantage of the Manhattan attractions..... don't forget to go ice skating in either Central Park (expensive but stunning in the winter sunshine) or Bryant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location now matched by excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: CaptBill2
Reviews.Content: For 20+ years I have stayed here on business trips and for an annual convention in early December. If you want intimacy or a quiet lobby this is not the hotel for you. During our trade show the lobby is packed with nervous business reps hoping that their next appointment will show up on time, meanwhile shaking hands with almost anybody. In the past the hotel's brusque service matched the relaxed charm of my fellow conventioneers. But that has changed. This year I saw a new attitude. I went to the package room to retrieve an item after their closing time. A management guy who was standing around called security to open the room; he then helped me find the package. I had a minor problem with the sink stopper in my room. A maintenance person quickly came to fix it. I called someone when the TV went blank. She promptly called me back to say that the entire system on my floor was being maintained. After the TV service was restored she called again to ask if I was satisfied. I ordered room service twice. In both cases it arrived warm, at the time promised and served by great old time waiters. Other reviewers have commented on the old rooms that still remain. I agree that the hotel should have completed their renewal years ago. The updated rooms are excellent and very quiet. Another important plus for me is that windows in rooms can be opened for fresh air.This is not the norm in today's hotel environmant. If this is important please confirm that your room will have these windows. I also agree with another reviewer who commented on the unnecessary doormen who take tips for opening cab doors. They do not go out on the street to find taxis; they only open doors of cabs that have been lined up. I go on the street to find my own taxi heading in whatever direction I want to go. The good news is that the area usually seems to have cabs available. The coffee shop has excellent breakfast and lunch buffets but no dinner service. However the neighborhood has many eating places including a great halal meat stand across the street which always has long lines. The location remains incomparable in my view. A short walk to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue , Central Park and the Theatre District. Also subway stations very nearby and car rental companies within a block. Like any hotel it has its pros and cons but it has improved noticeably within the past year.

Reviews.Title: “The staff here saved our day!”
Reviews.Author: sevenseat
Reviews.Content: We had just arrived in New York when our pre-teen daughter had an accident that wiped out much of her clothing and required a shower in order for her to comfortably make it through the day. We weren't even staying at the Hilton on this trip, but whenever given the chance for work, I will choose a Hilton hotel. The Hilton was nearby, so my wife took her in to the hotel and asked if they could get access to the gym's showers while I went to the Gap for replacement clothes. The woman at the front desk was very sympathetic and gave my wife a day pass for the gym. My daughter got cleaned up and changed and we were on our way. The staff here saved what would have been a ruined day.

Reviews.Title: “RIDICULOUS PRICES AND INADEQUATE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: MrsCToronto
Reviews.Content: There really arenâ€™t door attendants - just a tag team taxi summoner couple. If you delay long enough one of the bell men will eventually come out to help with luggage. The lobby is a maze of people hanging about for god knows what. They ceiling is too low for this type of milling around to be anything other than mass confusion. There is a lot of walking from the front door to check in and then the elevators to your room - a lot. If you wish to see a play and you wait in line at the always busy concierge desk for 20 - 30 minutes and get the one pleasant concierge woman and not one of the other very abrupt and rude ones you will find that you have just wasted your time as they donâ€™t book theater tickets - thatâ€™s done at a desk at the other side of the lobby which is the width of a full city block. Want your hair done? Forget it, they donâ€™t have a hair salon or barber shop. There is a lovely coffee shop on the premises with adequate food at semi-reasonable prices which closes at 3.00 pm - 3.00pm! why? After 3.00 if you want a bite to eat, you must parade to the outside wall of the hotel where there is an access to a Starbucks or fight for one of the far too few tables at the noisy lobby bar. Ugh. The rooms are nicely appointed if way too traditional and stuffy (tassels - really?). The bathrooms are clean and adequate if small and lacking in counter space. On the plus side there is the fact that the hotel is smoke free and the beds are comfortable and the room temperature is easily controlled. Also, the glasses are brought in fresh each day and not washed with your dirty towels as per the 20/20 expose scandal. In addition there wasnâ€™t a bed bug to be found!. On the negative side there is way too much for such a pricey hotel. Upon arrival in our room there was a huge wine stain on the carpet, the desk phone didnâ€™t work, the safe was locked shut, no robes, no makeup/shaving mirror, no hotel directory, no room service menu, no writing paper - unless you count three sheets of a post it sized pad by the non functioning phone. One of my favorite luxuries is room service. Not here! The prices and service take all the joy out of it. I ordered buttered toast with jam and a pot of tea. They took their time and brought unbuttered toast and no spoon or knife with which to spread the butter for myself. I discovered this after having been asked to sign the bill and the additional space where, if you ever read the fine print, you are allowing for a 15% tip. Although they corrected the error and canceled the tip at my request, no complimentary allowances were made. Everything at this hotel is average in quality and vastly overpriced. If they are going to charge ridiculous prices they need to hire another general manager with a better eye for customer service and detail.

Reviews.Title: “patchy is the only way to describe this hotel - 3 star not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: z6666
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member so as you can imagine I stay in a lot of Hilton hotel rooms in a year - and this has to be one of the worst. Bits of this hotel are great - the room service staff, the porters, the maintenance guys are all really friendly and helpful. What is not so great is the hotel itself. On check in we were given a room ( a deluxe king) where the shower/bath fitment leaked, bulbs were out, there was still rubbish in the room from the last guest, the chair was broken with dangerous bits of plastic sticking out. We were offered a room swap but not until the following day, and we had to get our bags back down to reception and then re-checkin that afternoon ( they said they couldn't move our stuff for us, we had to do it) The new room was a lot better - everything worked for a start, but housekeeping in this hotel is shocking. We left a plate with an apple core on it by the bin and housekeeping didn't remove it as part of the room clean, nor did they restock the bathroom with toiletries or replace the sodas or water from the mini bar we consumsed the night before. When we rang down to guest services they got some sent up but ended with the phrase " I will put a note on the account that the room should be checked each day" as if she was doing us a favour! -Damm right it should be checked each day - this is meant to be a five star hotel not some roadside B&B. The Executive lounge is ok - but vastly inferior to any other Hilton Exec lounge and the food in the breakfast restaurant is nice, if a little expensive. The lifts are appauling - you could be waiting up to 10 minutes to go up or down from your room - I started using the service elevator in the end! Room service menu is limited and stops at 1am ( no 24 hour options) and they automatically charge you for a morning newspaper unless you "opt out" Overall this place feels like a tourist hotel where they really dont have to try too hard becuase of the location. If this hotel was in another city where the demand for hotel rooms was a lot lower it would have lost the Hilton brand name years ago..... Very very avererage. If you get quoted more than $200 a night for a room here then look elsewhere - its not worth it ( and I am saying this as someone who used hilton honours points for the booking so got it for free - I feel I have wasted points on a level 7 hotel that should have been a level 5 at best)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but can do with better concierge service”
Reviews.Author: TSESingapore
Reviews.Content: Was kind of disappointed that the hotel wasn't able to put me on the executive floor as the main reason of me choosing the hotel was the possibility of upgrade because of my Gold VIP hhonors membership. Would be better if check-in staff were to inform me that hotel wouldn't be able to accommodate my request rather than I had to request for the upgrade and to be turned down because hotel was full. On the positive side, staffs were very efficient with check in and check out. Concierge was bad though. No one answered the phone and when I bothered to come downstairs to talk to them, they were unfriendly and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnneCumbria
Reviews.Content: Originally thought we were staying at Hilton Times Square but when seeing that hotel we were pleased that we were at this one. The foyer was large and the reception staff pleasant and helpful. We were in a double double room on the 32nd floor and found the room large and plenty of space for clothes and extra shopping. We did not eat at the hotel but had a few drinks in the lounge which was comfortable. Good place for people watching. The hotel is in a good location opposite and near to Rockafella Centre, Central Park and plenty of good restaurants. We enjoyed Rosie O'Grady's but our favourite was Tony's on 43rd Street. Had great food and great drinks, the belini's are wonderful. Comfortable beds and pillows, slept well and it was well needed with all the walking to do. Would definitely go back to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bed bug hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: maripf
Reviews.Content: both my client and I got bitten by bed bugs after staying there for one night. my client called them to inform and they just answered they would take care of it. will never stay there again in my life! it felt dirty and unpolished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for fun when business is done”
Reviews.Author: jkc804
Reviews.Content: This Hilton was very nice. It was clean and close to MANY places to eat, Times Square and Central Park. Food in the hotel was pricey but just outside the door were many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: GMeyerOmaha
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a 3-star hotel, not a 4 as it is listed by most websites. The room, while reasonably comfortable, was small and felt like it was in needed a makeover--i.e. fading wallpaper, smoke detector hanging off the wall, and permanently hazy window. I've stayed at nicer Hiltons in a number of cities, including Salt Lake, and Washington, DC. We purchased our room through a Priceline bid, paying $206.00 for the night (taxes included). For the money, I was satisfied, but if I'd paid the retail rate ($300+), I would have felt I did not get good value.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ThomasB
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at $35 seemed a bit steep; not surprising the room was mostly empty at prime time. Other reviews captured the rest - good location, reasonable rooms, expensive internet, not much personal service - but good functional place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, shame about the staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: dione22
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing service for such a well known name. Have travelled significantly and was appalled at the check in service, check out and concierge. Plus, as one of the most expensive hotels we have stayed in found it astounding that it was the only one that charged for the use of internet.

Reviews.Title: “You miss Asian quality service standards but get a decent share of American functionality”
Reviews.Author: RoadwarriorS25
Reviews.Content: You can get through a full stay in this hotel without having to speak to a single hotel staffer. Check-in kiosks, express check-outs, machine / factory-like service, convenient location in the heart of Manhattan, this hotel is a good business stay destination. They can do with a bit of personalized assistance and support. The hotel is HUGE, and therefore, do not expect Indian-style service (for example, delivery of a fax received could take ages - no assurance you will get served quickly at the business centre, which you have to visit, to get your faxes). But if you are a self-sufficient business traveller, this is a nice place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: happytrip0949
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from new york,stayed in this hotel,excellent for sightseeing,shops etc all within walking distance. room clean and towels and beds changed daily.all staff very polite.would stay here on further trips

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Karenbob
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel. This time we stayed in the regular hotel room. I think everything could use an update, but as far as cleanliness and location this is a great place to unpack your suitcase. It is so close to Central Park and all the great shopping. There are lots of great places to eat within walking distance and the subway stop isn't far if you need it. Broadway is more of a cab ride for those dressing up and not wanting to walk that far. There is a ticket booth located in the hotel. We have purchased last minuite tickets there...you do pay about $50 more per ticket. It's pretty hassel free if you decide on something last minute. They also arrange tours and cars. We didn't do much but sleep and dress here so I can't really comment on the rest of the hotel. It's in a nice

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sherita1023
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Hilton New York on 11/12-13. We arrived at the hotel around 11am, several hours before check-in. The hotel allowed us to leave our bags there, and gave us coupon so we would not be charged to leave our luggage. I've been to NYC several times and stayed at numerous hotels, and this is the first time I wasn't charged to check my luggage. The location is absolutely excellent. The following locations are no more than roughly 3-4 blocks away: Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and Central Park. There are also several subway stops close by, and taxis were never hard to get. We stayed in a non-smoking room with two queen beds. The room wasn't huge, but we also had plenty of space. In addition to the beds and nightstand, there was an armchair, desk and chair, and closet. The bathroom was decently sized as well. Regarding service, we never had an issue. One friend became ill and stayed in the room all day, and we left the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Housekeeping called that afternoon to double-check if we needed our room cleaned. At another point, we called Housekeeping for more towels. They were delivered quickly, and we received a follow-up call to ensure that the towels were delivered. Because our trip was booked on Priceline, I can't say for sure if it's a good value off the regular booking price. But if you can get a great deal, I definitely recommend staying here for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Big,Busy and central but missing the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: senejay
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Hilton for the duration of a conference held at the hotel in october.Checked in after staying in a long Q. Rooms were as advertised nothing more nothing less. Disappointed about the choice of brand and quality of tea. Breakfast in the 'Market place' was exactly it to the letter. Busy.impersonal,regimented(i did not see that even in Beijing) The strawberries and pineapple on day one was Sour(having stayed at similar hotels during previous conferences i knew that this was not due to sheer volume of people present). Only one member of the staff understood what was essential to make a good cup of tea.But the choice of food was good. Lunch was over priced. The Lobby bar was great.There was a better choice of food and more attention. Location was ideal for sight seeing and enjoying New York shopping including a visit to the Apple cube at night.We had a great time enjoying the food and wine from many nearby and not so nearby restaurants in the evenings.The Russian tea rooms and the club 21 was commendable.(i had the best cup of earl grey tea ever at the club 21. Of course after many good wines) Big and busy cannot mean you lose the personal touch especially at the Hilton New York. The missing ingredient in an otherwise OK hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ended up staying here by accident”
Reviews.Author: louiebmayer
Reviews.Content: I came here after a bad experience across the street at the Sheraton. I walked in got a room that I wanted right away after being on a red eye flight. They honored my corporate rate and were very professional. The laday at reception Delores was so nice and kind she called house keeping and had a room ready in no time. Sometimes people working at hotels forget that they are in a service industry . They did not at the Hilton, I would stay here again and recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central midtown location...average hotel with high price tag”
Reviews.Author: Iggyhawk
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the New York Hilton as part of a conference. I have no major complaints, but would not choose to stay here again. The location on Sixth Avenue is right in the heart of the action, within walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, the Theatre District, etc. Also good subway connections to go further afield. The rooms were a reasonable size but the soundproofing was really poor. Overall, it was expensive for a big, impersonal hotel with dated decor and you even had to pay $16 per day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Empire Suite - beautiful; Housekeeping - awful”
Reviews.Author: emmaly2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Empire Suite and attached 2-bedroom suite with my family the night before and husband night of my NYC wedding in June 2010 after touring suites in several Manhattan hotels. Wanted to have a large space to dress in and that would look nice for the pre-ceremony pictures. This was definitely the nicest and largest space for the money in Manhattan. The suites we used were well appointed with plenty of space - including one and a half bathrooms in each. However, since we were in the room getting ready until about 2pm - we requested that housekeeping come back mid-afternoon. My husband and I were SEVERELY disspointed/shocked to come back on our wedding night to a room that had not been cleaned (literally nothing touched - our room service food from the morning still there, the beds not made, glasses from champagne toast not cleared). The executive level manager was well aware of our occasion and for the money we spent to have one of the nicest suites in the hotel - we were shocked that this rather obvious service was not performed.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD EXPERIENCE--DON'T BE PUT OFF BY THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTraveler1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton over NYC Marathon weekend because she was running in the marathon and the Hilton was one of the runners' headquarters. I had read some of the negative reviews and didn't have high hopes for the hotel. I was VERY pleasantly surprised. Our room (4148), which was on one of the Executive Floors, was nice-sized, clean as it could be, and and absolutely bedbug-free. It even had a reasonably good view. The staff was never less than professional, and they often went out of their way to be helpful, even though the hotel seemed to be almost completely booked. And the location is absolutely unbeatable if you want to be in midtown. Two things that may be minor points but that I especially liked: the bed (including pillows) was exceptionally comfortable, and the water pressure in the shower was great. I will say that the walls were not the most soundproof I've ever experienced, but that wasn't a problem because the people in the next rooms weren't all that loud and didn't keep odd hours. So, at least based on our experience, I would say don't be put off by the negative reviews. We had a great stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Too old, too big and too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bettinasgranddad
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to AACAP yearly conference in NY, venue Hilton New York. Me and my wife have come to like Hilton hotels, not this one , though. There were a lot of nice and helpful staffmembers: for example: we stayed a week and at least 4 times per day we were asked to join Hiltons latest investment programme, som kind of "timeshare" Roomservice was good, but very expensive. Rooms small and clean but quite exspensive: dollars 499/night. The lounge for executiv guests was like a mall on first salesday. The beds, in contrast were very, very good, so sleep quality was exellent. Another good thing is the location: first class but.......................

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: peter0001
Reviews.Content: Prior to a trip to NYC in October, I called the Front Desk Manager of the New York - Hilton and asked if there were any reports of bed bugs. I was told that there were absolutely no claims and that the hotel is completely free of bed bugs. I am returning to NYC in December and again have a reservation at the NYC - Hilton on Ave of the Americas. I just referred to a web site - bedbugregistry.com, looked up the NYC - Hilton and to my great dismay found numerous postings of bed bug issues. I called the Front Desk Manager, Mamood, on November 7 and asked him why either he or his colleague, lied to me about bed bug reports when I called prior to my recent stay. He claimed that some of the reports of bites are food allergies. I then asked him if all of the reports on this web site were false and he said that he couldn't say that there were no bed bugs. Hence, I was LIED to by the staff at the NYC - Hilton and I am a Diamond member staying 75 or more nights per year at Hilton properties. Does any one want to make a bet on whether or not I keep my December reservation? Secondly, does anyone want to wager on my future loyalty to Hiltons?

Reviews.Title: “Hellish sleep deprivation, filthy carpet and other not fit to print- beware metropolitan doubletree."”
Reviews.Author: EnceladusSam
Reviews.Content: Plumbing noise. Dirty carpet. Items of personal clothing under bed. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not sure I would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Traveldaithi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York from the 25/10/2010 until 30/10/2010. The location on 6th Ave if fantastic, just a short walk from nearly everything. The downstairs lobby area of the hotel is busy but very nice. Upstairs however the corridors and rooms are very dated and in need ot a serious make over. They have renovated some of the floors but the floor I was on was a bit shabby. Drinks, and food in the hotel are also very expensive and the service at breakfast was patchy, long queues to get a table and long waits to get juice and coffee from servers, the rest is a buffet which was very good, which it should be for $32! I don't think I would stay at the Hilton again, you can get the great location by staying at another one of the hotels on 6 Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Almost Compensates For Problems.”
Reviews.Author: CaseyMD
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton as we were attending a conference, but I filed the review under leisure rather than buisness because of all the fun we had in NYC too... but I think I can probably speak to both. Chose this Hilton as that is where our conference was, and the conference rate of above 300 a night was still better than anything else we could find in the area. That being said, it was definitely too much money for this quality of hotel. It is advertised as a 3 and 1/2 star hotel, and I see how that could be true. The lobby is large and open, looks pretty nice at first impression. We got a room on the 28th floor, which was nice. But it had two double beds, and I requested a king-- though I didn't ask to change because I was happy with the high floor. At first the room seemed okay though dated, at least the TV was a flat screen and the beds looked well made. Well, the beds were very comfortable, I slept great, and no signs of bed bugs. Everything else seemed not very good at all. Nice TV, but the remote was broken. The bathroom was small but typical for NY, but the mildew on the shower curtain was gross. Nice big towels in good shape, and they had decent soap/shampoo/conditioner/lotion. The room was not well cleaned on further inspection, either. There was an empty water bottle under the nightstand, for example, with dust that looked like it hadn't been touched in a long time. I know that in NYC things tend to be pricier-- but somethings here at the Hilton were ridiculous. The bellman charged you to hold your bags, $3.50 per bag per day not including tip. I have never had to pay for this service before--- the line to pick up and drop off was huge, and seemed to run efficiently enough. Internet at the hotel is 20 bucks a day, which seems excessive too.
