Luckly our 3G service seemed to be just fine in the room. The location was excellent, close to the E station, so easy to take public transit from JFK. But I think that for the $ we would have been better off at a boutique hotel or another option nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good but with a few recommendations for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ijs2010
Reviews.Content: First, they upgraded us to a beautiful room on the 43rd floor. Great view and they added breakfast to our package - very nice. Room was gorgeous, huge, and very clean. No bed bugs as we keep hearing about. Pillows were comfy! Location was awesome! Lobby staff were friendly and courteous. We usually stay at high end hotels - we don't travel alot and we like to splurge. So based on other hotel features, I would make these minor complaints. The shower curtain was a cheap plastic snap kind that kept unsnapping and falling into the shower. The bathroom was small and counterspace too small - this was a suite so assuming more than 2 people are staying in it. The closets were huge but no light in them so couldn't see in your suitcase. I would probably stay here again because location and service were so good.

Reviews.Title: “They should request a refund for the refurb job”
Reviews.Author: cardio-2
Reviews.Content: A Hilton that doesn't meet Travellodge standards! They claim to have undergone a 118 million dollar refurbishment, but our room certainly didn't reveal it. Furniture beaten up, walls dinged, air conditioning that didn't work. Small bathroom with no room for wife's "stuff". Shower without hot water some mornings and no water at all from 11pm to 5am our last night. Wireless service at 19.95/day!! that didn't work and never worked despite talking to their IT specialists multiple times. Food from room service was terrible. After 11pm you have to show your key to the gestapo like guys guarding the front entrance, whom were less than helpful if you misplaced it in your handbag (no, driver's license won't do it, no you can't go to the desk to get another key??)

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were hoping for....”
Reviews.Author: andreacmiller
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel during our weekend in NYC Oct 22-24. I got a great deal on Priceline for a room, but was concerned because I had read some negative reviews. For the price, it was perfect for my 10-year-old daughter and myself. Comfortable bed, clean room, great location and great price for midtown Manhattan! Nobody bothered us and it was a nice quiet room. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay - great location, so-so rooms. It's a pretty efficient machine.”
Reviews.Author: esheng
Reviews.Content: I have no major complaints about this place but I wouldn't gush about it either. The location is good - convenient for business travelers headed to one of the many nearby offices, and also good for tourists who want a good base from which to check out midtown. The place was packed when I was there. Always lots of people in the lobby. Despite this, service stayed pretty efficient. Our room was cleaned, room service was super quick, we had no problems with check-in or check-out. The restaurant downstairs was super expensive, but at least it was fast. My biggest complaint would be that the room could be cleaned more thoroughly. There were bunches stray hairs here and there, on the desk, on the toilet - that were definitely not mine. The carpet felt like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. Other than that, free wifi would have been nice. Also, I was a bit put off by having to pay to have the hotel store my bags for a few hours after check-out. Other than that, this place is what it advertises itself as - about a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdalbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York for 2 nights in October 2010 for a seminar that was taking place in the hotel. The location of the hotel was great... Across the street from Radio City Music Hall and within a few minutes walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. I was impressed with the lobby and the service was fine upon check-in. The room itself was nice albeit not overly large (although for New York standards it was more than adequate). The bathroom was a bit small but the walk-in shower was huge. Comfortable bed and flat-screen TV. There was a bit of noise from outside but again, given that the hotel is in New York this was not a big surprise. The only complaint I have is that there aren't enough elevators for each section of floors and there were times (particularly in the morning) when the elevators would be so packed that people couldn't get on.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: gallfour
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean. Beds were spotless and extremely comfortable. Breakfast at the Marketplace offered a wide selection, quite good. Walking distance to many Broadway shows and good restaurants and pubs (Gallagher's Steak House, Rosie O'Grady's). Just a few blocks from Central Park. Was a bit surprised at the $20/day charge for (broadband) Internet access, though. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: msgc2010
Reviews.Content: The rooms were okay and the bathroom is too small. Beds were comfortable and the room was clean. I expected more for what we paid but after staying at another hotel I'm assuming most hotels in NYC are like this.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vronsky41
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a dozen hotels across New York. I am a Hilton Diamond and generally get a decent experience from them because of my Hilton level. On my first stay at this hotel, staff went out of its way to aggravate me. 1. the cost. Room was $500/night and mediocre at best. 2. the desk in the room was abysmal. Please, a little renovation goes a long way. 3. Packages. My office sent a FedEx to me. Aside from the fact no one would deliver it, I had to find the "Package Delivery Center" and then get charged $4 for picking up my own package. I think this is where I lost it. I have never had a hotel anywhere charge me for picking up my own package delivered to their hotel. Bad form, Hilton, bad form. 4. Business center is a joke. I had a 9 page document, no color, that I needed to print. For the first time ever, I was told the cost was $2/page to print a document. Unbelievable. Bottom line- you do not have to pay for this nonsense- even in NYC. There are much better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not ready, No AC, reeked of smoke, no help from Hilton”
Reviews.Author: locolacanian
Reviews.Content: Booked my room in advance, and Hilton required I pay the first nights fee. So I did, more than a month before arrival to "guarantee" my reservation. I arrived at 8:30 pm, wanting to do nothing but rest and change out of the clothes I'd been wearing all day. the guy at the desk says my room's not ready. Housekeeping hasn't finished it yet. I ask when it will be ready, he told me to try back in an hour!! I mentioned I wanted to change my clothes, and he told me there was a bathroom downstairs I could use for that, and I could check my bags, but he fiddled with something, because he had to make sure they didn't charge me for checking. I told him I wanted my room. He suggested I get dinner. When I explained I'd had dinner about an hour before, he suggested that I have dinner again. Around 10 pm I got my room. I went to get my checked bags but the baggage area was closed for the night. someone got security, then someone else, and my bags were finally retrieved. I went to my room, and it was noisy. Maybe the noisiest hotel I've been in in NYC. My room reeked of stale cigarette smoke. This is a nonsmoking hotel, but it was a smell that hit you when you walked in. I then tried to sleep. I was tired. Finally fell asleep, and then woke around 3am. The room was hot. I turned on the AC, and the room just felt like it was getting hotter. I called down to the front desk and asked how to get it to work. She said it wouldn't work, because they were no longer running AC since it was October. They were heating the rooms now. I asked what to do to get it cool, she said there was nothing I could do. I fell asleep around 5:30. Next night, same thing happend - the room got super hot in the middle of the night, and the story was the same, there's nothing we can do. I think if you have a reservation the room should be available upon arrival. If you have a reservation, and you've paid the first night to guarantee the room, it absolutely has to be available on arrival. Hilton would not waive my first nights charge, and did not seem to care that the room was hot. If you get a better room the location is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect CHoice”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for tourists. It is centrally located with a quick and convenient cab stand out front. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. It is rated as a 3*, but I felt the quality was at least a 4*. I would definitely stay here again. It is good value compared to a lot of other NYC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Book the two bedroom suite!”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2010 for a long weekend trip with a 1 year old and a 16 year old. The 2 bedroom suite that we booked was not available online and had to be booked directly with an employee at the hotel. It was expensive ($1400 per night) but turned out to be a great option for an extended family group. To put it into perspective the standard Hilton hotel room was $450 per night that weekend. Normally we stay at the Four Seasons but they were charging $1000 per night for a standard room with no view. This suite was a budget based decision that paid off. First off there were NO BED BUGS ANYWHERE! We talked to some other guests and they had no bb complaints either. The layout was great. The suite was a combo of 4 hotel rooms and was set up with two open middle rooms that comprised of a living room, dining area, full bath, and a wet bar. If I understand correctly they are located on high floors (ours was #42) and in tier's 27 and 29 or 31 and 33. The bedrooms included a king master and a second room with two queen beds. The decor was Omaha, NE 1985 and did not resemble anything close to a NYC penthouse downtown cool vibe at all! On the positive side the room was very clean and the hot water and a/c worked perfectly. The maid service was also excellent! The exec lounge was included in the price and had morning continental breakfast and a nice selection of snacks in the PM. The location was perfect. I'd stay here again. Make sure to get a Halal at the street vendors across the street. Worth the ten minute lines. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, could not be better!”
Reviews.Author: Alibri1968
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms standard, clean and tidy. Could maybe do with updating but for the time we spent in them it really didnt matter. The hotel bar provided us with some lovely cocktails in the evening although the tab soon added up!! Would stay at this hotel again without a doubt in the future.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL-BEDBUGS AND SMELLY DAMP ROOMS- HOTEL UNHELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: Selmah46
Reviews.Content: AVOID-damp smelly bed bug infested overpriced rooms with poor view. Hilton deny everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal, very crowded, but good value”
Reviews.Author: BridgenutMumbai
Reviews.Content: The Hilton has a great mid-town location and is excellent value by New York standards. Service is impersonal, the rooms mid-size and the staff highly overworked. The lobby is like the entrance of an upscale mall and the rooms could benefit from some thoughtful renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, centrally located hotel that was clean and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: lalloyd
Reviews.Content: Central to everything. A great place to stay. Very comfortable and staff was very helpful with answers to any questions. Beds were very comfortable and views were great. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: EmsmomColumbus
Reviews.Content: My husband had to travel for a conference to this hotel so I spent a lot of time on my own sightseeing. It is close to everything and a very convenient spot for tourist activities. The room was not terribly small, but not huge. It was cozy for two people. The fixtures in the bathroom were old and the lights buzzed and flickered. The only other problem we had was the elevators. We were on the 14th floor and had to walk down the steps one day b/c the elevators were not working due to some fire emergency. Normally this would not be a problem, but when you are 6 months pregnant, it was not fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shandong
Reviews.Content: This is a large and sophisticated hotel; you would think the staff might be a trifle stand-offish. NOT SO. From valet car parkers to doormen to bellmen to check-in staff everyone was helpful and friendly. The rooms are nice sized for NY and immaculate; beds are heavenly, there's in-room coffee and tea. There's even tv in the elevators. With its great location, it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for New York city break”
Reviews.Author: stuc1981
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here earlier this year and having both been to New York before I think it's safe to say we agreed this was our best hotel experience there. The hotel is situated within walking distance of Central PArk, Times Sqaure, Broadway and 5th Avenue and is therefore for tourists a pretty much ideal location. However it is also far enough away from Times Sqaure to be too loud at night. On arrival the hotel staff were very polite and we were able to check in with the minimum of fuss. The room was a very generous size for New York, with a large bed and a fairly nice view from what to a Brit is the dizzy heights of a 26th floor window. At times you do have to wait for lifts but if you can avoid using them at the beginning and end of the working day when the conferences in the hotel take place this problem can largely be avoided. As for the rest of the trip, well it was New York, certainly our favourite city in the world and I needn't really say more!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal placement”
Reviews.Author: debiscott
Reviews.Content: This hotel on 6th Avenue (The Avenue of the Americas) was lovely. Very comfortable, lovely rooms and staff were friendly. It is in an ideal place for most attractions and ability to get around the city. Just six to ten blocks away from Times Square and ideal to get on the subway and the open top buses. The room was excellent, roomy and the beds very comfortable. The bars in the hotel are quite expensive so it is worth going out to get meals and drinks. Quite reasonable value considering - everywhere is quite expensive due to the system of tax and service tax. Ideal placement for any one including families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: ellabelli-41
Reviews.Content: The Hilton NY's location is the best. It was walking distance to Central Park, Radio City Music Hall, TImes Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, 5th Avenue....all the major tourist sights. It has a Market Place where you can have either a buffet meal or something to go. There's also a Starbucks on site. The rooms are on the smaller side - we had 2 double beds in our room. The one bed was comfortable enough - the other bed had a stain on the sheet so we didn't use that one. And the washroom - I hadn't even stepped in and there was hair on the floor and on the counter. It wasn't cleaned well at all. So overall, cleanliness was an issue for me. Room service menu was limited and very pricey. The buffet breakfast offered at the Market Place came in 3 "levels". The basic one which included only cereal and granola amounted to $19 and if you wanted to have eggs and sausages you would have had to pay more. Pricing was not reasonable at all. So if you're looking for a place to say with great location, this hotel would be it. If only they could get the rooms cleaned well.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: connor200
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in June 2010. I've stayed in quite a few Hilton Hotels around the world and this was by far, the worst I have ever stayed at. Obviously, this hotel is all about the location which really is perfect in midtown a few blocks south of Central Park. Arrived in New York from LA in the early evening and a cab from JFK cost about USD $60. You can do the public transport thing for way less but you know, so annoying with luggage. Check in was fairly easy as I had advanced purchased online. Process was easy and we were given free access to the gym with my HHonours status. Can't remember which floor the room was on but it was fairly high up, maybe 20-something. Entire floor was tired and screaming to be renovated. This I don't usually mind so much but the room was small and not as clean as it should have been. We had trouble with the TV system during our entire stay, the remote didn't work, there was no room service menu (this was supposed to be on the tv) and repeated calls to the front desk got us nowhere. Perhaps we weren't tipping the right people... The in room wifi was also unreliable and ended up getting refunded twice as the service would just drop out and not come on again. Ended up leeching wifi from a hotel across the street which worked 10 times better than the Hilton's. Like I said, the location is great but there really are much better hotels nearby without such a hefty price tag for very, very average service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible Service..it is a self service hotel”
Reviews.Author: suneha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I moved here because of the location and since we had a corporate deal with the hotel. The location is unsurpassed....right in the middle of all the action, Theaters are walking distance, High fashion on 5th avenue, Heaps of good quality restaurants, and most other places a short metro ride away with most stations within a couple of blocks. The rooms were business standard and functional but they scrimped on most simple items - there wasn't even any stationery and they were charging $50 to clean out the bar (we did not require the bar), internet was chargeable even though the rooms were a staggering $500 pn, and even the Gym was chargeable at $45/- per week. Housekeeping continued to get it wrong - we kept having to ask them to put extra tea bags instead of coffee...on a weekend, we asked for extra tea bags and after 2 complaint calls and a final exasperated call to the manager we finally had them after 45 minutes. We wanted to change our room we were told they were qued up and no one could help us for the next 3 hours. We ended up moving the bags ourselves. However, the hotel is a standard western style business hotel. Comfortable and well located if you are content with getting your own food from outside and did not require any personalised service aside from having your sheets turned up each night. We enjoyed New York and the hotel with the terrific location. Check out was very smooth - done from the room with no personal interaction required (pity as it was an opportunity for the hotel to get some feedback on the stay and do something to improve).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly poor service from a well known hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: HeatherJD
Reviews.Content: â€¢ The entrance lobby is like a railway station, not welcoming or comfortable, very few seats to use if you were waiting for someone. â€¢ The queuing system for Reception was unwelcoming â€¢ Soon after we arrived a member of staff tried to open our room door to check the use of the mini bar by the previous residents. This should have been done before we arrived. â€¢ We arrived after a long journey to find no cups in the coffee maker and had to wait some time for any to be delivered. â€¢ On a further 2 occasions we returned to our room to find no coffee cups. â€¢ Despite asking, we never received a room directory. â€¢ The room wasnâ€™t dusted properly around the base of the television unit. â€¢ The toilet was far too close to the wall. â€¢ We had the continental breakfast the first morning of our stay. It was overpriced (we paid $65 for the two of us) and we had rock hard bread rolls and the cereal was served in a paper cup. For the price charged we expect our cereal to be served in china bowls not some cheap packaging that you would get from a fast food store. After paying so much for a very mediocre breakfast we had breakfast elsewhere for the rest of our stay. â€¢ Neither concierge or gift shop had any maps of Brooklyn or the Bronx and made no apology for lack of this information. â€¢ The Theater booking desk took about 10 minutes to process a credit card payment for a tour as they told me their system was old. This generated unnecessary queues for customers. â€¢ Outside the lift on the 9th floor ( and maybe other floors but I didn't check) there were dreadful cheap plastic flowers. It would be far better to remove them and have nothing there at all. â€¢ Our initial bill was incorrect; we had been charged for use of the mini bar but hadnâ€™t used it and there was a charge for a telephone call we hadnâ€™t made. These mistakes were rectified but they shouldnâ€™t have happened in the first place. â€¢ We were charged $14.37 for a short telephone call to New Jersey which seems excessive as it is so close to Manhattan. â€¢ We had a discounted rate ($213 before tax) for staying in the Hilton as my husband was attending a conference there, but even so we thought the cost of the hotel room for the mediocre service we received was too high. Overall it was an expensive stay for the mediocre customer service we received . We would not go there again nor recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “There is much better in NY”
Reviews.Author: Francois-Serge
Reviews.Content: I was there for two weeks. Our room on the executive floor was very small - we were told they were all the same on that floor, which is a lie as we have seen bigger rooms. Internet connexion does not work properly in the rooms, and the heating system seems inexistent - we had to ask for a portable heater (same problems for my colleagues on a different floor). The front desk staff is almost rude and unhelpful. Breakfast on the executive floor is nice, but expect to wait to get a table between 8:00 and 10:00. My recommendation: go to the Waldorf Astoria if you want a decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nworker
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean. With the bed bug scare, we were nervous so we checked the room thoroughly lookin in mattress seams, wall paper, pictures, under bed, , etc. We did not find one bug. Neither of us were bitten either. Very clean. Staff was friendly. Nice location to everything we wanted to go to. Spa massage was wonderful. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It all about the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Lolo-NM
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in a few different rooms...don't ask, not the hotel's problem. But I did get to see rooms in a few different floors and with different layouts. Yes, the executive rooms are better but some are really small but the breakfast is nice. Then there are the newly remodeled rooms and the not newly remodeled rooms....which does make a large difference. Finally the view, in NY, it makes a HUGE difference in the coolness factor. The location is great but in Manhattan, there are few locations which are not great.

Reviews.Title: “another Great NYC hotel !!! Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoviFan
Reviews.Content: I stay here at the Hilton in July 2010 for 3 nights - clean and great size room - comfy beds - no fridge tho. Location is amazing - easy walk to Rock Center, TS, etc.... Staff always helpful- nice lounge area. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: biggabro
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, service so so! If you want top service in a top New York Hotel get the Waldorf..

Reviews.Title: “Great From Executive Floors Up”
Reviews.Author: Deb0na1r
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the excellent Times Square Hilton previously I was happy to be booked into this Hilton closer to Central Park for a different perspective. The room we stayed in on the first night was not that big and we could constantly hear the lifts travelling up and down the shafts. After explaining to a receptionist that this was our honeymoon (genuinely was!) we were moved to the 34th or 35th floor where we had a lovely suite with larger bed, desk etc. just like we had at Times Square. The reception area was always busy as other reviews mention (except after the ash cloud when no-one was booking in!). Also sometimes a bit of a wait for a lift. If you got the right person at reception they could be very helpful, we were offered a fixed rate and a room for every day we were stranded due to the ash cloud. The lady from Madrid who dealt with the safety deposit boxes was a wonderful lady. To summise I would say great if you get one of the better rooms from 34 or 35th floor up.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: carelbotha
Reviews.Content: stayed here 12sept and enjoyed the location and space of the room...really big with the 2 double beds, desk and loungechair. Had a 2 double bed room with a nice view on 6th ave side.(the better side) Service is professional and not over-friendly. don`t expect the bellhop/doorman to open the door for u here..nothing major but some would xpect that. hotel lobby is huge and kinda like an airport arrival/departure terminal....very busy at times.Had a beer/burger at the lobby bar and it was value for money.Literally around the corner from MOMA and i could see RADIO CITY M/HALL from the hotel. All in all i njoyed my stay here and would return. If location is important this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: jjnyc26
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel almost every month, and have for years. I stay there for location right by my office, not service. Service is hit or miss, but the most annoying thing is that the bill is usually wrong, specifically they charge for internet even though its suppose to be included, or things from the mini-bar that you did not use. When you call down they usually tell you to come and visit the front desk which of course is very crowded in the morning with checkouts. I suppose they figure once you are trying to leave you wont bother standing in line.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the room you get”
Reviews.Author: Trvlguy83
Reviews.Content: Boy - what a mistake this was - I booked on priceline thinking i'd get a 4 star room. I think if you stay on Floors 2 - 15 they are the old rooms - because my room looked no better than a Travelodge. Floor was dirty, Bathroom was way TINY. The room desperately looked tired. The Hallways were dingy, - I was on the 5th floor. I didn't feel like I was at a Hilton - especially in New York! Bottom line is if you stay here, request a renovated room only - because if you don't this place is no better than 2 1/2 stars -

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rip off prices.”
Reviews.Author: fair_valueMK
Reviews.Content: If planning a family trip to Manhattan I would recommend to avoid this hotel. After paying 400$ per night for a room, WIFI is 20$ per day, breakfast 35$ each and bag storage 4$ per item. Lobby and bar is noisy and full of conference participants. Disable bathroom design is unusable due to flooding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price, perfect weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Pretty29
Reviews.Content: We decided to go away for the weekend to celebrate our 1st anniversary. Neither of us had ever been to New York. The Hilton is located very close to many main attractions. It is also very close to the subway. Attractions within walking distance include Times Square, 5th Avenue stores, Broadway, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Wax Museum, Ripley's Believe It or Not, Empire State Building and St. Patrick Church. We got to see all of this in 3 days. We were tired but wanted to take advantage of the perfect location. The first night we paid $100 at TGIFriday's. Since we traveled on a budget we were worried about food costs. To our surprise there are food carts all over NY and all around the Hilton. We tried a couple of very cheap dishes but the best one was located right next to the Hilton (on the right side). Their chicken salads and gyros are amazing. Great meals for $5 or $6. The room was small but I hear this is very common in NY. Overall, the room was spotless and comfortable. We only slept and bathed in here so the room worked for us. The concierge was very nice and is always willing to give directions. The best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jaws2fan
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is the most amazing buffet i have ever seen it has every food you could want. A very good Hotel Location is the best you can walk into times square!

Reviews.Title: “It was worth it and the service was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: pam059
Reviews.Content: Located at the right place, near central park, time square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: phillyvisitor
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms here have been renovated. Unfortunately I was not in one of those. The rooms are small, but what you would expect in NYC. Nothing special, pretty standard. The bathroom is small and has very little counter space. There is a mini bar and coffee maker in the room. The fitness center is pretty nice: several treadmills, ellipticals and bikes. Free weights and a stretching area too. All Precor equipment. Its $15/day or $45/week unless you're Hilton Gold or higher. This hotel is huge and the lobby and elevators are full of tourists. If crowds aren't you're thing, don't stay here (and reconsider your trip to NYC). The location is nice because you're not right on Times Square but a few blocks away. I was on the 19th floor and only heard traffic a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a wonderful stay with a view of Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Bubbly_B
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is expensive, we were attending a conference in the hotel and decided to pay the extra and stay here for sheer convenience. We Stayed a total of 7 nights (3 conference days and 4 personal days). We chose to stay on the executive floor as other colleagues were and we were under this "illusion" we could have a more private area to eat breakfast and mingle before starting the day. This was not the case. The executive floor lounge was so busy you had to wait in line to be seated. Some people waited up to 15-20 minutes. Breakfast was a selection of cold pastries, 2 fruit choices, yogurt, cereal, cold boiled eggs and toast or bagels. Not a bad selection. When making the reservation we requested an early check in of 8am. We were flying from Australian and after 22 hours of total flying we arrived at 6am and were told housekeeping don't start until at least 10am so the earliest the room would be ready would be midday but most likely 1pm. So we were told to check back every hour to see if it was ready. We were given a key for the executive floor lounge so we could have breakfast and also to the health club so we could freshen up. I was a little annoyed, I understand early check in is not guaranteed however it is not even possible at all at this hotel due to the late start of the housekeeping staff so I don't know why they have the option on their booking system. The room we stayed in was 4147 and it was a lovely room. The decor was very nice and everything was lovely and clean with no noticeable wear and tear on the room. We were very impressed. We had a lovely park view and could see Central Park from our window which was a lovely outlook. Service was good, housekeeping and reception staff were friendly. Room service was TERRIBLE! My husband and I eat a little room service when we travel. Some days are so busy we find it easy to eat in our room, but everything we ordered from the menu was terrible and extremely over priced! The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Central Park, 5th Ave shopping and Times Square. Overall it was a great stay. Would I stay again? Probably not, it's very over priced and I would rather stay a few blocks down at the Marriott Residence Inn where we stayed last time (larger rooms, small kitchen, sitting area in room etc. and much cheaper!) Must Do's In NYC - This was our fifth trip to NYC and honestly we never tire of it. Here are the Must Do's In NYC - * Statue Of Libery * Ellis Island * Top Of The Rock (much better view than Empire State Building which you can see from Top Of The Rock) * 5th Avenue * Central Park (you can't do the park in one day! Save 2 days at minimum) * Times Square * Century 21 (discount shopping next to WTC site) * Broadway show - Wicked, Chicago, Hairspray etc. * Greenwich Village - food, shopping and beautiful brownstones! * Peter Luiger's and Juniors in Brooklyn (best steaks and best cheesecake on the planet!) So much more but they are the must do's!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: easternowl
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel on 8/22/10. We live in NJ so when we travel to Manhattan we normally take the train home the same day, but since it was my daughter's birthday and she begged, we found a great rate for this hotel (about half price for NY rates) and were very happy to be able to relax after a day of fighting the crowds in Times Square in the rain! The clientele were mixed, some business travelers and many European visitors from what I could tell. We did not stay long enough to meet many fellow travelers but the hotel did not seem overcrowded and everyone was extremely friendly. Very convenient to Penn Station, Times Square and Central Park. Check in was very pleasant and took five minutes flat. The room was larger than we expected with a great view and lovely decor. We were on the 28th floor and it was extremely quiet. We did not visit any of the restaurants because the prices were exorbitant, we ate dinner at the diner on 55th which was fine because my eight year old is not in to fine dining. The beds were extremely comfortable and the decor was very nice. The linens and towels were very clean, and what you would expect from a Hilton hotel. I would not say it was 4 star because it is an older hotel but I have stayed in cheaper hotels in Manhattan before and had huge issues with the room, so I would say it's worth spending the extra money and book a better class motel to avoid unacceptable issues. Also wanted to mention we visited the popular Halaal cart at the corner and got the chicken and rice as other local people had recommended it - it is GREAT and although there was a line I'm very happy I tried it!

Reviews.Title: “Noise reminded me of a college dorm”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this property. My first impression was the lobby with so many people I thought I was at the airport. My room was on the 19th floor and the street noise didn't create a problem but the noise from other rooms and the hallway was the worst I've seen. The drain in my tub didn't close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but horrible service”
Reviews.Author: memsh
Reviews.Content: This is on eof the most centrally located hotels in midtown yet consistently has haphazard service. The desk personnel checking me in were absolutely surly. No welcome, no how was your trip in, not even -how many keys would you like. Then our room was adjacent to a supply closet where at 7am each morning all the housekeepers promptly gathered for loud chit chat and stories. The interior both looks and smells old. At 300 a night, there are many new competitors on the block w newer facilities and actual service! Not going back to Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, decent, if average hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveloverNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in July 2010. You can't beat the location! Very close to subway stop, Central Park, shops. The hotel isn't very close to alot of great restaurants, we found ourselves heading over to 42nd St area for something decent to eat after 9pm. Lobby was busy, decor is nothing special. Only 2 agents working the front desk, surprisingly since hotel was quite busy. We stayed in a newly "renovated" room which was very nicely laid out, beds were extremely comfortable. My only complaint was the bathroom size, no room to put your toiletries around the sink area, and door JUST about closed around the toilet. The shower, suprisingly, was very nice sized!!! But no tub, so that means no place for us ladies to rest your foot to shave your legs! We put a request in online BEFORE we checked in for extra towels through Hilton website, and of course, never got the extra towels, and had to request them at the front desk again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & location but NYC priced”
Reviews.Author: Traveler-from-USA
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with nice rooms and beds. Location is great at 53-54 on 6th Ave35. The rooms were clean and roomy. Two nights cost over $530 with a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaHoney2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York for 4 nights. Husband was bitten by bed bugs. Have contacted Hotel, who is ignoring the issue. Very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy - not much sleep”
Reviews.Author: mcbride_david
Reviews.Content: I like Hilton hotels but I doubt whether I would stay in this one again. It was clean and in a good location - the staff were always helpful, but there were some big drawbacks. Firstly, it was massively busy as it was convention time, this led to some areas of the hotel (like one of the bars) being shut off to guests unless they were part of the convention. So I had to go to the other bar, where beer costs over $10. Breakfast at $35 was also expensive I thought. The biggest problem though was that I was near the elevator and could hear the machinery all day and all night - sometimes waking me up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in NYC”
Reviews.Author: guarros
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a bunch of places with in NYC - and this hotel had a great location, outstanding staff - as in fantastic, nice, top NOTCH! I was in town for a conference and as overwhelmed as I was - this hotel and it's staff stayed friendly, calm and wonderful through out - and I was by no means the only one that felt that way. It's not so much the accommodations, so much as it is the people interaction that makes my stay. That said - the accommodations, specifically for NYC are wonderful!!! In other news / and also important I lost my camera while there - and while I don't know who returned it the staff there were extremely helpful in finding my camera and returning it! Great team!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: PaulaKrapf
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Manhattan, the hotel has small rooms but they are very cosy, comfortable and quiet (important when you consider the hustle and bustle of NYC). The location is perfect for getting around the city. The staff is experienced, well trained, helpful and efficient. I have stayed at this hotel for two conventions - which can be challenging for any hotel to pull off - and they do a superb job.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, excellent food”
Reviews.Author: CelesteLindell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and attended the BlogHer Conference there and was beyond impressed by the friendliness and attentiveness of every staff member I encountered. They kept the conference area, rooms and hallways spotless and were always happy to help out when asked. I was similarly impressed by all of the meals. The variety and attention to different dietary needs was amazing and I very much enjoyed everything I ate while at the conference. If there had been just a little more seating in my lobby, my experience would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: austin_res
Reviews.Content: I was in New York July 30 - August 2. I shared a room at the Hilton NY with a friend and we were very happy with the hotel. It is in an excellent location in midtown Manhattan - walking distance to subway stations, Central Park, 5th Ave shopping, Times Square, Whole Foods for grocery shopping, Rockefeller Center, etc. We had a comfortable room on the 30th floor with a flat screen TV and black granite counters. The room was very spacious especially for New York. I liked the way the hotel set up the elevators: one set for lobby to 15th floor, one set for 15th to 24th floors, one set for 24th to 34th floors, and one set for 34th to 44th floors - it cut down on the waiting time and reduced the number of potential stops. Hotel staff professional and knowledgeable about sites in New York. I would definitely return to this Hilton in future trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a grand location”
Reviews.Author: Foggy23
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this massive hotel at a very busy time but staff did their best to check us in promptly. There was a beauty and talent conference on in the hotel and it was bustling throughout our visit. The room was clean, fresh and smart with a great view through the sky scrapers to central park. We were given vouchers for complimentary breakfast which was good quality and appreciated. Hotel could not be better located with most must sees being in walking distance.The gym seemed very good but there was a $15 charge per visit and I didn't feel I would get my moneys worth so I gave it a miss. Shame! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a first visit”
Reviews.Author: thox
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 23.15 after a long journey from the UK to be told( after a wait while the receptionist disappeared out back) they didn't have a room ready and offered either a room elsewhere just for one night or a free dinner while waiting. After electing for the second they realised the restaurant was shut and then suddenly a room was ready after all and we were offered $100 room service compensation so we were mollified. Room on 17th floor clean, quiet, comfortable with all amenities and view of office block opposite. Ordered room service and used half of the money but had to query with customer service later in the week as the front desk said we had zero left. This was rectified and we used the balance up. We were then asked to pay for the second order on departure but quickly withdrew this when I queried it. I wanted to make a local call from the room but was unable to do this as they didn't have my credit card as we'd paid for the hotel in advance.Also the front desk failed to give me our breakfast coupons on arrival which we apparently needed each time we went for breakfast so that was a bit embaraasing on the first morning in the dining room and I was sent out to the front desk to get them. Frosty receptionist handed them over after I explained they were included in our package and she had consulted her computer to check, So apart from those few annoying problems with the above we found everything else fine. Impressive lobby and hotel frontage. Continental breakfast included in our package was excellent and the restaurant staff exceptional. Also the machine in the lobby allowing us to check in online for our return flights and print the boarding cards was brilliant. We didn't use any other facility as we were out exploring when we weren't sleeping, Convenient location on the corner of 53rd on 6th ave so able to walk to a good many of the attractions and near subway As a hotel receptionist myself in my youth I would recommend the ones at the Hilton smile more as they are the first impression the client gets of the hotel and apart from the one we met on arrival, the others seemed very aloof,

Reviews.Title: “Ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: bikaBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and loved it. Was given a newly renovated room which was large and nicely decorated. Bed was comfy, linens were spotless, and temperature management was great. Staff was fast and pleasant. Check-in/out superfast. Neighborhood and hotel environment both extremely safe for solo traveler and families. One small feature I thought was cool was that the doors shut silently. At first I had to go back every time I left, to ensure that it had closed correctly, but I appreciated not having to hear doors slamming all night.

Reviews.Title: “Getting very old, but good location”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm spoilt by Asian style hotels, but the Hilton NY is in definite need of renovations. Rooms were of ok size for NY (definitely bigger than the Hudson!), but felt old and musty. Good things: 1) Location is great for tourist who want to explore midtown. You can walk to many Broadway theatres (we watched Wicked at the Gershwin Theatre) and also to 5th avenue stores and Central Park. There is also a decent supermarket jsut across the road 2) Breakfast buffet was quite good, and even had a lot of Japanese style items. I think many Japanese businessmen stay here (we did see a few) Bad things: 1) Rooms and hallways definitely need a refurb. Starting to look their age...probably from the early 90s is my guess. Rooms are ok, definitely not large. 2) Floors in the room felt damp and musty, so it didn't feel that clean. Keep your slippers on Would I stay here if I go to NY again? No...since we have since found a great hotel in Trump Soho (read the review!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: dawnpaco
Reviews.Content: We go to New York each year in May to see a Yankees game. I always try to pick different hotels in different locations so we get to explore new areas. This is the hotel we will pick for all future trips. The location was great. Our room had plenty of space for two adults and one child. We were on the 34th floor and could see down to Central Park. Within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. The hotel lobby was very nice and everything was very clean. The hotel was completely full during our visit but never had to wait for elevator and check in and check out was very easy. We were able to check in a few hours early. They do have kiosks set up in the lobby where you can print boarding passes for certain airlines. Very easy to get a taxi and close to a subway station. Very happy with this hotel and highly recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel I will EVER stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: idanbergman
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We stayed in the executive floors just as a fluke, and it was the best choice of our trip! The executive lounge is totally worth it. Although there are sometimes line ups to get in for breakfast, it is totally worth the wait! The lounge is complimentary with the room, and the breakfast includes: strawberries, cupcakes, bread, butter, apples, tea, coffee, water with lemon....There are also two plazma tvs, and the chairs are very nice. It seemed really exclusive to us! Stay in the executive and you will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mezo98
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great area. Blocks from southern central park, walking distance to 30 Rock. Always stay there when I go to NY. Thouhg rooms on small size, hense NY. Great clean rooms, confortable beds. Quite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: klaw92
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC to celebrate my son's 5th birthday and this was our 2nd trip to the Hilton New York. Once again, they exceeded my expectations! Not only were we able to check-in to our hotel earlier than the 3pm check-in time (at no extra cost), but we were also pleasantly surprised when Room Service called that they had something for my son. As a "birthday gift" to him, the front desk had Room Service bring up a tray of cookies, 4 pints of milk on ice, and a slice of cheesecake with fresh fruit on a plate that had "Happy Birthday" written on it in chocolate around the plate -- WITH a candle that we could light so we could sing to him. I have to say the Hilton outdid themselves! This will be my hotel of choice from now on when visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service - not tipical Hilton Service”
Reviews.Author: BusinesWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hilton located in Ave. of Amercias. This hotel very busy and have many rooms. The building is very old and the rooms are not renovated. For New York standard it is a very poor hotel for the price charged. Service is terrible. Staff is not kind at all with guests. I arrived late with lots of luggage and nobody came to help me. The bed was confortable as Hilton standard but that was all I had as good experience in this hotel. Would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “So New York, heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: Ludovica40
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for the location and the buzz. It's big, a little outdated but you get the feeling of a cosmopolitan, busy, intercultural place. Right in the middle of everything: 5th ave and the shops, the rockfeller centre, the museums, the park, broadway theaters, are all at a walking distance. Although there are certainly more elegant, updated and opulent hotels, when I go to New York I like to go back to this hotel for it's so New York to me. Furthermore, I never had such a good quality of sleep anywhere else. The bed, mattress and pillows are the softer, most confortable ones ever. So much so that I even tried to buy the same ones for my home in Rome. It would cost a fortune but that quality of sleep is priceless to me. Unfortunately the company that produces them don't ship to Italy. There are various types of room, quite classic in style. the single standard is rather small, but still has the wonderful beds and pillows. Executive are larger and the suite (can't remember the name of it) is actually an apartment. No opulence but sobre, classic elegance. It's not cheap, but for a New York experience and a golden sleep I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - worth the price”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth57Elkridge
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is also a busy hotel but you cannot beat the location. The concierge desk is very helpful. YOu can walk to all Broadway theatres and don't need to take a cab. Sometimes the elevators bog down because of all the people. Starbucks is right there. Occasionally I get concierge floor privileges which give you breakfast and snacks in the afternoon, early evening. THe staff up there is wonderful, and they must enjoy their jobs because we have been seeing the same staff for several years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Chechin
Reviews.Content: We have our rooms in the executive floor, with access to the Lounge. The rooms are great, big and with all the amenities that are required. The Lounge is OK but the breakfast is quite poor for this level of Hotel, also the LOunge is not big enough to acomodate all the passangers in this time of the Year, the a long qeue it is expected in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler443
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay here. Staff was friendly and the rooms were comfortable and clean. Had 2 connecting rooms on the 40th floor, which was considered an executive floor. This gave the privilege of free continental breakfast and evening snacks. My family enjoyed the evening snacks and beverages but the breakfast was very weak. We ended up buying breakfast at the Starbucks downstairs. Also made use of the computer in the executive lounge and the airline check-in kiosk in the lobby (both free). Parking of course was a fortune but expected in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable introduction to new york,we will return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ravens06-10
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever trip to New York and it fast became an unforgettable one!!.From the checking in clerk,to the waiters at breakfast each day,to the cleaning staff,everybody was super friendly,helpful and efficient>Thankyou for making our week in New York an exceptional experience,the location was also perfect,we will certainly return.A perfect holiday in every way!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Shirazle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip recently. This hotel is clearly in a great location, but it's a bit of a big cattleyard and it has well and truly seen better years. The rooms are very, very basic and the air con in this place is just awful giving me quite bad eye irritation. The air quality is better outside!! No free wifi here either. Won't be stayling again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Wonderful Stay except”
Reviews.Author: 11messiah
Reviews.Content: this time. I have stayed at the NY Hilton several times over the past few years and have always been satisfied with the room. This year my husband and I stayed for a weekend. We arrived on Friday at 12 p.m. and our room was all ready for us to check in. The staff was quite noisy in the morning and woke us up at 7:30 after a night of partying- ugh! This happened both mornings, so for the first time in years we did not leave a tip for the staff. Not sure if I would chance this again, I would need furhter assurances that it will not happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, bland and boring”
Reviews.Author: LDBLady
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton New York and were disappointed in the indifferent staff and lack lustre service. Room was OK and location was perfect for us as we caught the Queen Mary 2 from Pier 90 the next afternoon. We planned to eat breakfast ion the hotel but thought it was very expensiuve so went elsewhere. For the price I think you could do better!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Avenue of the Americas - good location, adequate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: FCSX
Reviews.Content: Had a room for 4 nights at Hilton, 1335 Avenue of the Americas, New York. Its a huge hotel with adequate accomodation. Its decor is dated but clean and good shower. Check in and check out was easy. Starbucks in the reception area. The best thing about this hotel is its location. Near Central Park south, near a subway, short walk to Rockerfeller Centre and Times Square, Madison Avenue etc and other great attractions. I booked as part of a Virgin Package so can't comment on the rates/value for money. Would go back purely as the location was so good for us. Hopefully next time our neighbours will not be so noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: MaineMom1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night o see a Broadway play. We were given a 'deluxe' recently renovated room, which was very spacious and really nice. Extremely comfortable beds. The worst thing for me was that I could hear the people in the next room over who must've come back around 3 or 4 a.m., and they were fairly loud. The lobby was too busy for me - felt like we were in an airport - but the elevators are separated by sections, and I didn't feel that the wait was very long for them. I thought it was tacky that they allowed smoking right outside the door of the hotel - you almost couldn't help walking into cigarette smoke on your way into and out of the main doors. I also thought the staff was a bit cold - the biggest difference between this and the Hampton Inn we stayed at in CT was that the staff in CT looked you in the eye. In NY they barely acknowledged us. I liked that it was on 51st, which wasn't a bad walk to Times Square but far enough where the pedestrian traffic wasn't as bad. All in all, very nice hotel, pricey but in line with other NY hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the Hilton, make sure you are in a deluxe (aka remodeled) room...............”
Reviews.Author: mdhotelier
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in the Hilton since 1985, and I would say the best. Seems from reading the reviews that the reason I was so pleased with my stay is because I was in a deluxe room, which means you are on one of the floors that had been recently remodeled. The only slight complaint was the bathrooms, which are not large enough to get in and out of without doing a dance with the door, but the living space in the room is far more than ample. Water pressure was great, tubs are the wider, almost soaking tubs, curtain rod is rounded out making for more space in the shower. Bedding was fabulous, towels were great. Had no problems with noise in the hallway. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and fast, and rooms were spotless. Do be aware that the elevators can be lengthy waits, so just plan for 5-10 minutes to get down to the lobby, worst case. 10 minutes only happened to us once, because one of the three elevators was out of service, and every car that stopped on 29 from above was already full, so we needed to wait for 3 cars to come before we could board. Again, that was an exception, there was a 6000 person convention in the hotel, and it was right before a big kickoff meeting. Once the 3rd elevator was back in service the next day, our waits were minimized. Would highly recommend the 29th floor. There was always a cab waiting for passengers in the queue out the front door, and you're one avenue away from the thrills and fun of walking the amazing shops of 5th avenue. Times Square is about a 10 min walk in the other direction, but trust me, that's a good thing. I much prefer this location to staying in Times Square and walking out of your hotel into a mob scene on the street. :)

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been More Perfect”
Reviews.Author: nkotberin
Reviews.Content: I could not have picked a more perfect hotel to fit our needs. We were impressed from the moment we were dropped off at the front lobby. The staff greeted us with a smile (amazing and very helpful staff) and quickly checked us in. After the long trip, we were extremely pleased with our room; very comfortable! The location of the hotel could not have been more convienent, as we were attending several concerts at Radio City Music Hall. We were basically right next door and it was wonderful. I can't wait to get back to the Big Apple. I already know exactly where I will be staying. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Size”
Reviews.Author: prissyshay
Reviews.Content: I'm a very picky traveler. I dont do quaint and charming and old smelly tiny rooms with their history...seems like lots of NY hotels fit this bill. The Hilton was modern enough but not overly trendy, very clean. Location was fantastic, walk to times square but not in the middle of the lights. Huge hotel, lots of people going in and out, didnt bother me much concierge was available to answer questions, google directions and a cab line right outside, subway few minutes away, Famous Halal cart across the street. Starbucks inside the hotel and lots of other amenities. Bed was very comfortable and my double room with 2 queens was very roomy, quiet and clean, what more can you ask for! Well i would ask it wont be over $300 a night..but this is NY what can u do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: karansingh
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights, we had a fabulous stay here. Very cosy and peaceful, in beautiful surroundings - a perfect place if you staying in NY. The food in the restaurant is really nice too and staff were always very very helpful. Make sure you ask about all the facilities though if u're up for a bit of fun, try the central park ride by bicycle. A nice way to see park at your own pace, and some lovely stop offs on the way. Take a picture and soak in the views. We also took a day trip sight seen . A nice easy going day out, nice place to stay very close to time square in fact just 2 block from times square and few block away from shopping ..,u get good street food just out side the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ryguy2008
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows that there are many hotels available when booking a trip to New York, but for some reason this hotel seemed to be the best choice. We were a group of 3 friends from Canada, on our first trip to New York. We booked over 3 months in advance through Expedia.ca. At the time we booked, it was only $40/person extra to be on the Executive Level, and it was definitely worthwhile. CHECK-IN: When you enter, there's a huge reception area on the left, which could have lines at times. However, on the right there's a small desk for Executive Level check-in. Even though check-in was 3 PM, when we arrived at 1:15 PM, our room was ready and we were on our way to our room in less than 5 minutes. LOBBY/ELEVATORS: I read before our trip some people complaining that the lobby is too busy, or the wait for elevators is too long. By being on the Executive Floor, which is the top floor (44th) of the hotel, you get access to 3 quieter elevators. To access the 39th-44th floor, you must use your key card to gain access. Therefore, we never waited more than 2-3 minutes for it to come. As well, the lobby was busy, but we were never bothered by any timeshare people or anything else. ROOM: Our room, on the 44th floor, was very nice. 2 double beds, with a desk and a night table. As well, there's an alarm in the room with some preset radio stations. There's a full bathroom, with bathtub/shower, as well as a small counter for your belongings. We found the usual hotel amenities in the room, including shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, etc. There's a nice blackout curtain in the room. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable, and we all slept well. There's a minibar in the room. You're offered the key at check-in if it interests you. It had some alcoholic beverages, chips, candy, and so on. We didn't take anything, but it's there if you get hungry. One of the perks of the Executive Level is you get bathrobes. We noticed we were short a bathrobe, and short towels. On our way out, we stopped at the Executive Level reception in the lobby to ask for some more, and by the time we got back, we had more than enough towels and enough bathrobes at our disposal. There is a safety deposit box in the room, which is free to use. You program the code when you enter your room. As well, there's an even more secure one in the lobby if you want to use it. EXECUTIVE LOUNGE: At the end of the hall, there is the executive lounge. In the morning, there's a continental breakfast including bagels, yogurt, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, coffee, etc. Never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes to be seated. As well, between 5-7, there's hors d'euves available. This included stuff like little spring rolls, pieces of meat, some vegetables, and more. Definitely useful if you're planning on eating dinner late, and want a quick bite. Outside of these hours, there are fresh cookies and fruit available along with coffee and tea. As well, there's free wifi and computer access available in the room. We didn't try the other places to eat in the hotel, but I did see a large Starbucks on the ground level. There is a fitness center available, but we didn't use it. LOCATION: This hotel is only about 15-20 minutes walking from Times Square, and is very close to many popular attractions such as the Rockefeller center, and more. As well, the staff at the door always keeps a steady flow of taxi's coming into the hotel, so you never have to look hard to find one. Taxis in New York are very inexpensive, and are really convenient to use. ISSUES: We found the hotel to be very responsive to any requests. When you call, they already knew what room you're calling from, and they have your name and info on their screen. Our second morning there, around 6:45 AM, I found the room next door to be very noisy, which woke me. They were having a very loud conversation. This is beyond the hotel's control, but I ended up calling the front desk, who informed me that they'd send security up. It seemed to get a bit better shortly after. As well, I used the bathroom on the ground level late our first night there, and it was rather gross. There were no paper towels left, clogged toilets, and a large puddle on the ground. This is a maintenance issue though, and overall, didn't detract from our impression of the hotel. CHECK-OUT: Since we booked through Expedia, we had nothing to pay upon check-out. It just involved giving in our keys at the Executive Level reception, and that's it. We were able to store our luggage for $3.50/item during the day, since we had a late flight. As well, we used the lobby safety deposit box for our passports, which was free. We didn't use it, but I spotted a machine in the lobby that even lets you check-in to your airline from the convenience of the hotel. OVERALL IMPRESSION: This hotel is big, but shouldn't intimidate anyone from booking here. The Executive Level is definitely worthwhile, and allows for a more personal, and enjoyable experience. Being at the top floor, we wouldn't hear people in the hall that often, or the elevator all night. The staff were always all friendly and willing to please, and clearly enjoy working at this location. The food available in the lounge was decent, and allowed us to start our day much fast than at a normal sit-down restaurant. For our first trip to New York with friends, this hotel definitely helped ensure our trip was such a success, and I would definitely consider going back. If you have any questions, feel free to message me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: KJPink
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic, right in the middle of everyhting and only a shore walk to Time Square, Cnetral Park and lots more. One block from 5th Avenue. It is an extremely busy hotel, the lobby was one of the busiest I have ever known. We had an Executive Suite on the 43rd floor. Room was very big with lots of storage. Our daughter had a fold away bed in the lounge which was quite comfortable if a bit squeaky!Downside was the bathroon which was very small but the shower was very good. Staff were very polite and friednly. As we were on the Execuitve level, we had a complimentary continental breakfast which set us up for the day. As it was such a busy hotel, there was sometimes a wait for a taxi but you could always walk to the street and hail one if you prefer. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Depending on the room you get, the room can be very tired or nice”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1199
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days. The first night I was put in a room on the 5th floor which was quite poor. It was in desperate need of a makeover. It was very small, with a miniscule bathroom, with no room for toiletries and peeling paint and an ancient bathtub. I tried to change rooms that night but couldn't do so as the hotel was full. The next night I was moved to a room on the 29th floor. It had clearly been remodeled and was much nicer. It was more spacious, had an updated bathroom (which was still very small and awkwardly set up with not enough space for toiletries but had a modern shower) and a generous workspace. The fitness room also has a decent selection of equipment. One other annoyance, it costs almost $19/night for high speed Internet access; that seems a little steep in this day and age. The primary benefit of this hotel in my opinion is it's location. If you go, make sure to request a remodeled room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location... high price”
Reviews.Author: fcbenni
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is located in a great area in mid-town Manhattan (51st street/6th avenue). Prices in mid-town are very high so that you can expect high costs for laundry, food and drinks (although Manhattan in general is pretty expensive). The hotel rooms are nice and comfortable but the hotel does not have too many king beds. It is often sold out so that an exact reservation should be made in advance. The hotel does not offer free internet so that a daily charge of 15 USD is made. The hotel facilities are good, the fitness room (if you have access) offers a variety of stuff. The breakfast in the executive lounge does not offer a great variety though. Other hotels like Starwood do better here. The hotel offers a lot of small shops in the basement and a huge bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smcb1305
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to NYC and we were expecting a closet for a hotel room. We were very pleased with our room at the New York Hilton. The room was very spacious for any city. The staff was friendly and pleasant to deal with. The location is across from Radio City Music Hall but very convenient to Times Square. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced food, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: travelnmomdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton overnight for a wedding. The check-in was great. There are check-in booths in the lobby that are automated, so we were able to quickly and easily get up to our room. The room was average, with a comfortable bed, but small size and unattractive decor for my taste. We spent a minimal amount of time at the hotel, but my experience with staff was awful. The worst was at the breakfast buffet. There was a cook making omelets. I waited in line to give my order. I was the only person left in line (it was a line of two people) but the cook stuck a sign up in front of my face that stated that he was no longer cooking. It was extremely rude as he had seen me standing there for five minuteswaiting to give my order and he could have had the courtesy to say that his shift was about to end, instead of wasting my time by having me stand there for no reason. Then, on top of it, the breakfast was $30 per person. With coffee it cost my husband and I $75 for a bad breakfast that left an extra bad taste in my mouth due to the ridiculous behavior of the cook. The fitness center also had a $15 fee. I have traveled a lot and most hotels do not charge extra for use of the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel! Great location & Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirlinParis
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's first trip to NYC and since he's not a big city person, I was definitely hoping to impress him. The Hilton NY did not let me down!! I'm always traveling for work and so my standards for hotels are probably higher than that average vacation traveler. I will definitely say that this far exceeds my expectations and I would recommend this to anyone!! I am a Hilton Honor Diamond member and the wonderful experience started at Check In. Anna was absolutely amazing and very friendly! We had an upgraded room and although it was not huge (most rooms in NYC are smaller, so don't expect an enormous 2000sq ft room) it was immaculate, clean and remodeled. We felt extremely comfortable and had a desk to work and a nice couch as well. We had asked about a refrigerator and internet, which are normally additional charge as with most hotels, but we were able to get both at no additional charge! This was excellent because my husband had some work that he was concerned about finishing. Finally, we were given coupons for breakfast which could also be used in the Starbucks.....AMAZING!!! The restaurants were nice and quiet and the staff was very nice! The location of the hotel is perfect! We walked everywhere and it's close to Times Square but out of the crowd. Rockefeller Center was just around the corner and the metro was also close. Central park is a very very short walk as well! The area was very safe and I even walked down the street alone to Radio CIty Music Hall (barely 2 blocks away...you can see it from the hotel) at night alone and did not feel a bit worried. Bottom line, I would stay here over and over and I would recommend it to all of my friends! You should also follow the Hilton NY on Twitter and Facebook if you use either...you can get some great information there before your trip! Thanks, Hilton NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO”
Reviews.Author: AK62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Hotel for 8 nights during the volcanic disruption and i have been charged over $600 for expenses made by somone else because when you buy any meal at this hotel you sign and put your room number.Apparently there is no check to see if your signature matches the name on the room and someone signed for meals to my room and i have been charged. They did not charge me on the day i left they charged my card after that date. Shame on you Hilton Hotel, This Hotel has no regard for who and what they charge so BE WARNED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit in Six Months!!”
Reviews.Author: TheGil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in January and just returned for a weeks stay. Check in was quick and the bellmen got the bags to our room in a timely fashion...and were very friendly. We stayed in room 3341, which has a good view of Central Park. It was a nice room with a king bed......which was fantastic! Great mattress. The room was very clean and each morning the housekeepers were friendly and quick. We spent alot of time at Central Park and on Fifth Avenue, so location is fantastic. I always feel safe around the hotel and in NYC in general. Police are everywhere and I have always found the people pleasant. It may be awhile before our next visit, but when it comes, we will be staying at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and cold room with inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: vinonino
Reviews.Content: 1. Room was next to the elevator shaft. The noise was loud and incessant, even in the middle of the night. They shifted me to an adjacent room which was no help as the elevator noise was still audible. 2. Thermostat was ineffective. Even when the thermostat was set at its highest, cold air came out of the vents. It was the same for my colleagues in three other rooms. Seems like cost cutting measures at the expense of paying guests. 3. Bathroom mat went missing for a day 4. Newspaper was not delivered one morning and not sent to room even after informing guest relations in the lobby. Overall, poor sleep quality, which was bad for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Committed to Service, Busy Busy,”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights June 2010. It's a excellent location, far enough from the craziness of the Times Square area, but near enough to get there. Near many of the theaters, not far from Central Park. The room I had was an upgrade, being a Gold Level Hilton Honors member... not the highest, but nice perks. It was bigger than most you will find in NYC. Nicely appointed... just some wear (some flaking paint in some corners..) You receive a certificate for $19 worth of breakfast in the Cafe downstairs as a Gold level... which believe it or not, was not enough for a buffet breakfast... I used it for the alternate use, fruit, coffee and if you want, a pastry at the Stabucks on the 53rd St side. The hotel is very busy... traffic through the lobby is akin to a train station.... BUT, if you wanted peace & quiet, you wouldn't be in NYC... I will say the rooms were quiet... though I was on floor 44. Overall, a good place to stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the NY Hilton several times mainly due to its great location. The hotel is completely competent, but this time I noticed the wear-and-tear more than usual. I am a gold honors member, so we assumed we were offered one of their better rooms. For the record, my wife was just fine with the room and the hotel. She is not as picky as I am. While to hotel is certainly okay, it is just too worn to merit a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Good Rooms, Lousy Internet”
Reviews.Author: sbalch
Reviews.Content: I was staying for a conference and was upgraded (Hilton Gold) to one of the upper floors. Room was spacious (bathroom small) and very clean. Air conditioning worked great. Elevators were never a problem. Got a credit toward breakfast and it was also very good. Everyone was very nice and accommodating. My one big issue was the wireless internet service. Being part of a conference I got it for free, but if I had to pay for it I would have been very disappointed. I was dropped constantly and so were my colleagues. They need to address the signal strength and peak usage. Otherwise, a positive overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our New York Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NCStocker
Reviews.Content: Recently took our 2 college age daughters to New York for a family vacation for 5 days. I was thrilled to find great airfare, but shocked when I started looking at hotels and prices! Location, reputation and a fresh designed hotel were our priorities. Upon checking in our hotel & room we were quite pleased. Front desk and concierge were adequate and average. The room was newly updated, very clean and fresh and great size (for a NYC hotel room) to comfortably accomodate our adult family of 4. Within 15 minutes housekeeping knocked on our door to check if everything was satisfactory and immediately brought some additional items we requested. Bathroom was average size and could have had more shelf/storage space. Double beds (not Queen) were comfortable. Biggest negative was walls are thin and could occasionally hear people talking in the next room. (that's why I bring earplugs on trips) Hotel is not known to have extrodinary window views of the city. Location was excellent, only a few blocks from Rockefeller Center, Central Park, shopping & Times Square. Great vacation and nice contemporary hotel, but expensive. My Hilton Honors got us free use of their great exercise facility each day, but Internet was ridiculously expensive ($1 a minute!!) FYI not all rooms have been renovated at this time, so make sure you ask for an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel when it's on someone else's dime”
Reviews.Author: hoyvenon
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: Met up with my brother (for Yankee game, etc), who was attending seminar in Manhattan, so his company paid for the room - $269/night. With that said, here's my feedback. Nice location, not far from subway access. Staff was very pleasant. Room was adequate size. Beds are quite comfy. 27th floor view is pretty nice. Nice TV, but had to jiggle the power cord a few times to correct reception. Bathrooms and overall room was very clean. Attaching pictures. Downsides: For some reason, could hear elevator humming sound during evening, even though I thought we were far enough away from elevator. Not sure why hotels feel the need to charge you $14.99/day for internet access when you're already paying $250+ for room - your $100/night hotels in other cities offer it complimentary. Beer at hotel bar was $9/glass and parking in hotel garage was something like $40/day (for my brother, although normally when he has time, he finds a nearby public garage to save a few bucks). But as a native NYer, I'm well aware of the price of "the City".

Reviews.Title: “good location, noisy, poor service”
Reviews.Author: liketravel101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in May. The location is great, you can walk to lots of attractions such as centra park, 5th ave, time square, etc. The room is clean, size is ok, not spacious, but decent in NY. The air-conditioning doesn't seem to work, no matter how high you set the temperature and it only goes up to 23.5 but it actually feels much colder.
