Mattress is too saggy, and water pressure is too low. Very noisy, you can clearly hear the noise made by your neighbours. Service is really poor. One day the house keeping lady forgot to give me new coffee bag, I called the service line asking for it, the person I talked to to told me he would have it sent over soon, but I waited for an hour and nothing came. I called the line again then nobody answered at all. I suspect the person can tell the room number and tried to avoid me on purpose. And then I went downstairs to talk to frontdesk, they promised me the same thing. Guess what, I didn't get coffee until the second day after the house keeping lady cleaned the room and restocked tea and coffee. I was extremely disappointed and totally felt the staff were very snobbish and indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Good old Hilton standard.”
Reviews.Author: LuizAlf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week. It is a very big hotel. So, if you do not like huge hotels, avoid it. The hotel follows the Hilton style. This one is very comfortable, but not posh at all. Rooms are middle size, with all the facilities that one can expect. Good mattress, good space and nice bathroom. The only disadvantage is the TV set. As a matter of fact, this kind of hotel should have Led TV set or something similar and not the old TV set that I met in my room. The main advantage of this hotel is the localization. It is very near Time Square, but it is not in the middle of Time Square. So, you are on a walking distance from Time Square without being in such a noisy and busy place like that. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place but pricey”
Reviews.Author: KevinLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in June, great location, good hotel but expensive. Rooms were a good size and in decent shape, bathrooms were quite small. The hotel is about two blocks from Radio City.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good NYC Option”
Reviews.Author: GraftonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here with my wife and young son. The location is convenient to Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave. The hotel is clean and our room was large for NYC. The price was also large but that is standard in the city and given its location it was worth it. The desk staff were not at all friendly but they were efficient. Valet parking was convenient. The breakfast buffet was outrageously priced so eat elsewhere. Definitely popular with the business travelers. Overall it was a pleasant experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveller70
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for four nights last week. We had an amazing room on 26th floor with a view of Central Park. The best view I've ever had while staying in NYC. Staff very friendly. Our room was not ready but we were happy to go for a short walk to get out bearings. The room was always spotless. Hotel is in an amazing location easy to get to a major sights. There was one slight cause for concern the cleaning trolley vacum cleaner and cleaning fluids were perminently directly outside our door in the corridor when not in use. The reason why goodness knows.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: bkafrick
Reviews.Content: It was one of those nights. Didnt expect to spend the night in the city, but needed a place to sleep at 1am. Used my blackberry to search hilton hotels in the city, and they were all sold out except the New York Hilton. Their website said $429, and it was a saturday night, so i figured what the heck. Drove up there, and parked ($40/night) and went into the lobby where the desk clerk proceded to tell me they were sold out. I showed them my blackberry and they said there was nothing they could do. I spouted off about being a Hilton Diamond Member, and they got the manager who opened up a Suite on the 42nd floor (maybe it was 22, whatever the highest floor was) for $479. For $50 more than the website said, i figured what the heck. We got to the room, and it was enormous. Easily 900 square feet. Living room, dining room, kitchen, and bedroom, and two bathrooms. Decorations were typical of Hilton, but nice nonetheless. I love the Hilton bedsheets, so comfy. Bathroom was amazing. One of these shower stalls with 6 jets that sprayed you from all sides. Incredible water pressure. I was way impressed. Got to the Diamond Members breakfast a bit too late to eat, and the manager gave us some coupons for the buffet downstairs. Went downstairs and the buffet was amazing. It was $7 to "upgrade" to the full buffet. Well worth it, as the buffet regularly costs $38 or something. Very good food. Very impressive. Well worth $7 !! Was just impressed from the start to the end of this experience. Spent less than 12 hours in the hotel (and $600+ after taxes/parking/etc), but heck, this is NYC and it was worth it. Kudos to the Hilton New York staff for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Many sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Dan34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times. Usually, I don't sleep because either 1) there is a party in the room adjacent to mine...or a couple fighting or 2) cars and taxis are honking their horns all night. The windows in this Hilton should have been replaced years ago. One time I did a test: I listened to the sound of the traffic down below with the windows opened and then closed them to see the difference. There is none! I know NYC is the city that never sleeps but there are hotels right on Times Square that are quieter. When I need to be in NYC, I know stay at the Westin near Times Square. A bit more expensive but it's worth it. On the positive side, the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location, don't believe the negatives!”
Reviews.Author: HonestWayne
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from New York after staying at the Hilton New York Hotel for one week. I am an average middle class family man expecting high standards in Hotel Service, Cleanliness and Food. This hotel has them all, don't believe any of the negatives. We arrived on Friday afternoon around 3pm and flew through Check-in. Our room was ready (Deluxe with two Double Beds) and was clean and tidy. The staff at Check-in were polite and helpful as were the Ladies that did the maid service in our room. I tipped them $10 every couple of days, and our room was always clean and tidy when we returned from a day out. On two occasions we required help from house keeping both were delt with quickly and efficiently. The first was that we decided that it would be better if my Son slept in his own bed, so we had housekeeping put a rollaway bed in the room, which was as good as a single bed. The second was a slight defect with out plumbing, which again was delt with quickly and effeciently. We had prepaid for breakfast for two adults at the market place (on-site dining area), and at the time of booking were told that we could pay for the children on a daily basis ($9-99 each). However, when going in for breakfast we were only charged a daily service charge of $10, basically the children were free. The breakfast service and choice was excellent. Everything you could want from full cooked american style, to fresh fruit and pastries. My children enjoyed getting freshly cooked omlettes and waffles from the counter chef. We had such a good breakfast, that we found ourselves only having a cake or baggle at lunchtime. The hotel location was excellent, being basically opposite the Rockefeller centre, a short walk down to Times Square, or up to Central Park. Being a couple of blocks north of Times Square, it was ideal for sight seeing, but not in the madness or hustle and bustle of Times Square itself. Yes the lobby area of the hotel is busy. But apart from Check-in/out when you might be there a bit longer, you only spend a few seconds there passing through it in the morning and evening when you go out or come back. This hotel might be a little more expensive than some in the area, but it is of a very good standard, and believe me we saw several hotels, that we considered, while we were out and about, and were glad we didn't! If you are using this as a base for bed and breakfast for a family sightseeing holiday, you will not be disappointed, in fact it will only add to your enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: That's really the only reason to stay here. For $300+ per night (plus $15/day for the least expensive wired Internet access,) I had an adequately sized room with poor water pressure and drainage. On the morning I checked out, I heard maintenance next door roto-rootering something. Unfortunately, whatever they did caused black water back up through my bathtub drain. Suffice to say, I wasn't going to shower that day. I've stayed here before and it was always pleasant. Never a bargain but fair for NYC standards. But I'll look for nearby alternatives before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a perfect location and I recommend the executive floor option for better value for money”
Reviews.Author: wilsonretriever
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Hilton New York two days ago the hotel is best described as a 'good standard and clean' hotel. It is certainly not wow out of this world, nor what I would deem 5 luxury. There are different standards of rooms, the standard rooms are stock standard or basic, deluxe rooms have been recently renovated and the executive floors which in my opinion are great value for money. These rooms have access to the executive floor where breakfast, evening canapes, coffee/tea biscuits and fruit are complimentary. WIRELESS access is free in the executive lounge also which is a large saving and you have somewhere to kick back after a day of touring - ie with great televisions it is certainly like your lounge room. The location of the hotel is fantastic and the rooms quiet. As someone whom travels alot and has stayed at many hotels worldwide this on is a safe option for business or leisure. Our room was a typical standard size per Australian standards and certainly not small as other reviewers have stated. The executive rooms have not been upgraded but are of a higher standard to begin with. Other reviewers also noted the lifts as being an issue - we have not found this to be a problem at all. Other reviewers stated the Hilton Club issues in the lobby - we were asked nicely if we wanted any information and would not consider it pestering or over the top. The gym is amazing, but suggest if you want to exercise take a jog around central park for an experience to remember - only two blocks from the hotel. Staff were courteous and helpful. Good safe option but unrenovated rooms a little bit tired. Enjoy.....

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night for a convention at the hotel. Overall, a decent place. Nice lobby, room was clean, quiet, comfortable. Near NBC and Radio City Music Hall. Room rate was reasonable (conv rate of $300/night) but everything else on site was very expensive, even by NYC standards. Had a conf call in my room so I had to order room service. In addition to high price, $5+ service charge PLUS tip not included. No in-room coffee (unless you want to pay from the mini-bar) and my room had no bath towels (only 2 hand towels - probably an honest mistake). Would probably stay here again, IF I knew I would have time to leave the hotel for better food & beverage options.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Noodlebrain
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, friendly staff, who needs location! Actually, there is a manned cab stand at the front entrance and for $6-12 you can get anywhere in town from Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill to Hell's Kitchen. A ten block walk to Times Square will teach you to depend on cabs. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tivmamtv
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walking distance to Broadway Theaters. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, quiet at night. Rooms could use some updating. Management responsive when problems did arise. Annoying time share desk in lobby. A nice deli across 53rd Street for cheaper food options. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: domer2007
Reviews.Content: I would never say that the Hilton New York is a luxury or spectacular hotel. It is, however, positioned in an excellent location for visiting New York's major attractions. I stayed at the Hilton over Memorial Day weekend on a Mother/Daughter trip to the city and we were very pleased with our stay. The room was clean and fairly large for an NYC hotel. We had space to stash our suitcases and the various purchases we made throughout the weekend. The lobby is often a bit crowded but it's roomy so moving through there to the elevators is not difficult. We were out and about throughout the island for most of our four day stay so if you're simply looking for a good home-base from which to depart for sight-seeing, shopping, dining or threatre, I would highly recommend the Hilton New York. Since we did not take advantage of the hotel's many additional services, I can't speak to them. I did think the gym access, internet fees and mini-bar prices were rather steep but a smart traveler can simply walk the ten feet to the sundries store downstairs to obtain most necessities (water, soda, wine, snacks) at a much cheaper price and I used my Palm for any of my internet needs while at the hotel. (Business travelers who's companies often pick up expenses like internet access shouldn't mind the associated price tag - it's competitive for what you might expect to pay in a large NYC hotel.) We had a smooth and quick check-in process, our room was always cleaned for us when we returned each day and the few requests I did make of the hotel staff (wake up calls, late check out) were taken care of efficiently. Bottom line: this is an excellent location and a clean, lovely hotel for your visit to NYC. Quick Guide: estimated walking time at a SLOW pace... Rockefeller Plaza - 5 minute walk Times Square North - less than a 10 minute walk 5th Avenue Shopping - 5 minute walk Times Square South - 10 to 15 minute walk Central Park - 5 minute walk There are also excellent connections in the area to the Subway system and we had no problem catching a taxi at any time from the hotel's front door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtino
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while in NYC. Centrally located, spacious rooms. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Free Room upgrade, nice. Three annoyances, though.”
Reviews.Author: giantboy
Reviews.Content: Second trip to NYC. Hotel is in Central location which is fantastic. Staff are great. Concierge was fantastic for infomation on babysitter, subway access, etc. Three Annoyances: ONE: We were touted in the lobby to join the NY hilton club - or a timeshare club. Actually I had no idea what it was for. It was not appreciated. Came for a holiday. Did not want to go through 90 minutes of incentives about club 57.We didn't participate. TWO: I had to screw back on the shower head before we could use it. Figured it was quicker to do this than asking for it to be done. Why was it so un-screwed off in the first place I don't know. Also, the steel caddy for soap etc, was barely recognisable as there was metal prongs sticking out from it - or missing. A bit dangerous and not what I expected to find in the Hilton! The room was a recently rennovated room. But it still was tired in places. Given the room rates there is no excuse for tiredness in furniture? THREE: Internet access $10 for 10 minutes - rediculously dear. Go to "smilies" (I think that's its name) near times square and you can go upstairs and get internet access for about $5 for 20 mins. San Fran Hotel - Americania had the internet for free. Which is a great idea! I won't come back to the NY Hilton. I think I would like to make my $ work harder for me by either going for a cheaper (but no-less tired) hotel, or a newer (same price bracket) boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel - Not for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed (several times) that various basics were chargeable, given the price we were paying for the room: $5 for a tiny bottle of water in the room; Â£17 a day for wifi; $10 minimum charge to access the internet in their business centre(and $1 a minute thereafter); then $1 per page to print something out. All plus tax of course. We wanted to go online to buy four tickets for MOMA, and were charged about $15 for the privilege. The hotel was well located. The rooms were clean. Staff were friendly. But everything was clearly geared up to snatch of a few dollars more from each guest whenever the opportunity arose. Fine if you're expensing it. I've had more accommodating stays at cheap B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive, small rooms; great location”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: The location is close to perfect, but at a price. It's very expensive, proably over priced. The staff were friendly and helpful, but the room was very small. Mine had no place to put a piece of luggage. I think they gave me one of the middle rooms, near the elevators and stairwells, that are smaller than normal, but the other rooms didn't look much bigger. The restaurants are very very very expensive, and the room service is crazy. No printed menu, cause they claim they are "going green"... menu is on awkward t.v. screens. Also no in room stationary, no guide to the hotel service, etc... all on the awkward t.v. Maid service wasn't that great. Business center never had working computers, and couldn't print from wifi paid for in room. You had to be charged a second day to print from the busines center computers, at an extra $15 fee, plus $2 per page... but it didn't matter, cause it was never working. But it really is a scam to get you to pay twice per day. It was going to cost me a minimum fee of $15 + $2 = $17 to print out a single confirmation. No nearby internet cafes. There was a 24 hour deli across 53rd street, which had great hot and cold fresh food, 24 hours a day, at reasonable prices. Has big indoor and outdoor seating areas too. There was an expensive Starbucks adjacent to the hotel, and it's about 8 minutes walk to Times Square. It's sort of a "no frills" Hilton. Bedding was very comfortable, and rooms not in the middle of the building have good views; otherwise, you look into the next building, like a wall. I still think it was overpriced, but you can't beat that location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RobIles
Reviews.Content: A Fantastic hotel with a great location only a few blocks from; Times Square, Central Park & The Rockefeller plust clost to the subway for access to the rest of NYC. Managed to get an unpgraded room on the 33rd floor it was very spacious and nicly decorated. The service in the hotel was excelant and the staff very friendly and helpful. With regards to wait for lift and at the check in desk we had no such problems at any time although they seemed quite busy. Would Def stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: boydtrans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 8th May and thoroughly enjoyed the whole New York experience. The reception staff were very helpful on the few occassions we needed to ask them anything. The housekeeping staff were very pleasant and did a terrific job. Our room was on the 13th floor (unusual for a hotel) and was perfect..great sized bed, lovely shower room and good big tv. View from room was great and no noise disturbance from streets below. Perfect location with most places of interest that we wanted to see within walking distance or with Grand Central Terminal being just a 5 minute walk..subway a real experience worth trying out! Fabulous hotel..fabulous location..fabulous holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathrynS
Reviews.Content: You couldn't have a better location really! Its about 2 blocks (5 minute walk) from Times Square, but far enough away to be away from the noise & bustle of all the tourists, its a 5 minute walk to 5th Avenue shopping paradise, and a 5 minute walk to Central Park. There are lots of cafe's and restaurants near the hotel, as well as a subway station. Perfect location! In terms of the hotel itself, it was gorgeous, a huge lovely reception area with a fairly helpful concierge. The room was huge and spotlessly clean. All the amenities you could need - mini bar, huge TV, air con, good hairdryer. The beds were so comfortable...we had a queen bed each! I loved it and would definitely stay there next time I go back to New York. My one, and only one, complaint was that on the day we checked out we wanted to leave our cases at the hotel between 12pm and 4pm, and we were charged $3.50 per item, which we thought was a bit of a rip off...I've never been charged to leave my case at the hotel before, and I would have expected better service after paying quite a lot to stay there. But thats just a small point - overall, superb location, fab hotel...I'd be surprised if you could find better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: nvrhme
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at the Hilton when I visit NYC. It is in midtown and you can walk to most places within minutes. the MoMa and Ziegfeld Theatre are literally across the street. The prices are moderate to high, but quite reasonable for a hotel in the city. The rooms are nice and comfortable. As I love my Starbucks it isI nice having one right downstairs. I wouild hovever if you can go to the one directly across the street. The Starbucks in the hotel cost more than then the stores. I paid $5.12 for a grande latte in the hotel and paid $4.30 at the one acroso the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..decent service..a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: seabreeze_1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Checked in at 3.00, very pleasant and efficient, went up to the room and noticed a strange rattling noise every few minutes. Rang customer services who said it was the elevators so asked for a different room. Was allocated a new room straight away. So stay away from the rooms near the noisy elevators and try and get a corner room, very spacious and better views. Stayed in a refurbed room which was nice and modern. Nice lobby area, lifts were fine. Overall rooms are clean, corner room was bright, quiet (was on the 15th floor) but one thing the bathroom was not so clean, stains on the toilet seat. Always take disenfectant wipes with you. The location of the hotel is great, a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square, 5 minutes away from Central Park. Subway 2 minutes away. Fifth avenue is a 5 minute walk away. Basically you can walk to a lot of popular locations. Value for money, for what you pay for this hotel you would expect at least some complimentary bottled water in the room. Would not recommend the breakfast at hotel, plenty of cheaper and tastier alternatives outside of the hotel along Sixth Ave. No magazines in the room eg. Time Out New York or a City Guide, you can find an ok guide by the concierge desk. Internet access is not free however you can print your boarding passes for the airport for free from the main lobby in the hotel. Its an expensive hotel to stay in, there are cheaper hotels in the area and worth checking them out. If you are looking for good location then this is central, If you have extra money then check out The London NYC. Same location as Hilton. Staff were helpful except the middle aged blonde woman at the theatre, excursions desk, who was rude and gave me wrong information. Speak to one of the male staff instead. When changing currency in NY, stay away from the Travelex exchange in Times Square. Use Chase bank, just by the hotel. They take a charge of $5 but still better rates than Travelex. Overall the hotel is good, friendly service, bathroom should have been cleaner! I would probably check out another hotel next time I stay in NY to see if I can get better for money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: natt8
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hilton new york, and my stay there was okay, nothing spectacular. However, when I get home, I find that I have huge extra charges on my card. I call to find out what happened, because I left the room in fine order, and it turns out that they made some mistake when I checked in, and I had been charged incorrectly, and that I will be refunded in 1 to 2 weeks. I had to talk to 3 people to get this information. The first woman I spoke to was so rude, I can barely believe it. She claimed there were no charges, even though I was staring at my bank statement which shows that there were. When she finally looked up my information and saw that there were, she claimed they had already been refunded. Another lie. She refused to give me her name, and also refused to transfer me to someone else. I finally got transferred to a manager, who found the real problem and put in the request to fix it and refund my money. He apologized. Great, except for the huge hassle of spending a night on the phone trying to figure out this mess, and the hassle of my account being overdrawn. The hotel is already overpriced as it is, I wouldn't ever stay there again after having so much of a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyespyIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel to stay in and is in a great location in the city. The bedroom was spotless and very comfortable. We found the restaurant kind of expensive so chose to eat out a lot of the time, it was also good that there was a starbucks just off the restaurant. Overall it's a great place to stay and will hopefully return some day.

Reviews.Title: “and then the complimentary gift arrived...”
Reviews.Author: Baudelaireshuman
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is perfectly located in midtown Manhattan a few blocks from Central Park near Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue and Radio City Music Hall. We could see Chef Gordon Ramsey's restaurant London NYC across the street from our room and down the street we could see the Oyster Bar. When we checked out the Oyster Bar we discoved that the Carnegie deli is just down the block. We had wanted to go to the Carnegie deli during our stay so it was great that it was so close by. Our room was small but very nicely appointed and the king bed was divinely soft and comfy for sleeping. We were very surprised when after a few hours of checking in there was a knock at the door and one of the wait staff walked in with a tray of chocolates and a bucket of ice with cold bottled water. I had joined the Hilton New York page on Facebook and exchanged messages with someone there before our visit. There was a note from the sales and marketing director welcoming us and wishing us a great stay. To say we were shocked and delighted would be an understatement. It was my birthday so it was especially nice. Our visit to NY was planned to attend the Metropolitan Opera. We saw the last performance of Franco Zeffirelli's production of La Traviata. It was a beautiful day in a beautiful hotel. The one fault I could find was that I had trouble adjusting the heat and fan and we had cold air blowing on us. It was a nice room temperature for sleeping during the night but was cold during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Leave extra time for the slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoredeb
Reviews.Content: Hey, are we in Vegas or what!? Vegas hotels is what this Hilton hotel reminds me of. Very crowded lobby filled with tourists, three elevator banks that take FOREVER for the elevator to arrive, and in great location since it's within walking distance to a lot. I actually think the tourists beat out the business travelers at this hotel. It is a typical Hilton except with less HHonors travelers who spend a ridiculous amount of time at reception trying to angle for anything that a HHonors member may receive. No free wi fi and after paying the $16.99 rate, it was so weak that I couldn't even do work through my company's firewall. The entire basement is for conferences and meeting rooms. Room was pleasant but make sure you get a high floor so you don't hear midtown traffic all night. There is a Starbucks downstairs as well as a few overpriced gift shops. Taxis are always pulling up so it's easy to catch one in front. At night after 10pm they actually block off the entrances and only let in Hotel guests, and you have to show your card to get in! Check out time is 12:00 noon. If you ask for late checkout they will extend to 1:00pm. Any later and they charge $27 per hour! Baggage check I think was $5 per bag. If I didn't know any better, this all sounds like Vegas to me....

Reviews.Title: “Bite the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Gundlach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with our teenage daughters to NYC for a long 4 day weekend. It was our kids first time to NYC. We chose Hilton because of their impeccible reputation and our continued excellent experiences with this brand worldwide. We had a late check-in - no problems, asked for an upgrade and got it (42nd floor wth view of Central Park) - was willing to pay extra, but didn't need to. The room was average sized and we knew we were going to be bumping into each other with one room and a 13 & 16 year old, but it wasn't that bad at all. The housekeeping staff was excellent, and the room's facilities adequate. We drove and parked our car at the garage affiliated with the hotel, whose staff was also excellent (up/down 3X) as was the front desk, bellmen, et al. I am not sure about negative comments, it is amazing to me how people will hang on to one little thing and make a big deal about it - this is a stalwarth hotel right dab in the middle of midtown manhattan with a gibbillion rooms - so whoopdy doo you have to wait for an elevator now and again - what an excellent opportunity to say 'hello' to someone you've never met or strike up an interesting conversation - lighten up! Everything can't be perfect all the time, but one thing is for sure the staff and human interactions you will encounter will be above average and make your stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lllisag
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe room and it looked exactly liked in the pictures. It was spacious, modern and beds were very comfortable. The rooms were quite and the hotel is located within walking distance to Times Square and 5th Avenue. Would definetly stay there again. Unlike some other reviews we never hd to wait lng for the lifts.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for families in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMomHighland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. It is clean and it looks clean. We stayed on the 37th floor and the maids were heavenly. They replaced every ammenity we used every day. They readied our beds for us in the evening. Happy hour was scrumptious with hot and cold foods, beer and wine. They also had free breakfast but we were on California time and never got up in time to have breakfast. The dining is excellent and room service is pretty good too. The exercise facilities are great. This hotel is located in the perfect spot. If you are not lazy and can walk a mile or so you can walk to Central Park. Macy's, Top of the Rock, Rockafeller Plaza, Tiffany's, or Broadway. If you are lazy there are cabs to be had for about 5 dollars to any of these places. The security is excellent and I never feared for our safety or the childrens. There are movie premiers across the street from the hotel and we have seen famous people evey time we go to the New York Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special....”
Reviews.Author: panixxxx
Reviews.Content: I arrived before 3pm and was checked in straight away instead of left waiting which was a welcome surprise. However upon arriving outside the room door, I found it was left ajar which I thought was strange. The room was immaculate, high floor, a good size, a comfortable bed. However I noticed many hairs left in the shower and WC. I called housekeeping to re-clean the bathroom. I was a little disturbed disturbed by this for any hotel nevermind a Hilton. I would not stay there again but the location was very central to Columbas Circle and Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Abercrombie and Fitch store! Note that like all chained hotels they are very busy, so prepare to wait for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: sarchie0703
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried at first about booking a family vacation with Hilton New York due to the mixed reviews, but from my first hand experience, I would definitely stay there again. The staff was very friendly and we never had to wait in a long line for check-in or for the elevators. Our room was a corner room on the 30th floor with a great view of the city. Housekeeping came everyday to clean our room, and a newspaper was delivered to our room every morning. Since the city is seen better on foot, this hotel was within walking distance to everything...Times Square, Central Park, MoMa, 5th Avenue shopping, and the subway. Everyone's experience is going to be different, but after seeing some of the other hotels in the area I could've chosen, I'm glad I chose Hilton New York. Just relax and enjoy your stay in New York. It is a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - Improved since last visit”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Last time I stayed I would have rated one star due to awful service & terrible housekeeping. But company & location had me there again. This time was better. Very clean & service was fine. Location is convenient - for me that is biggest draw. I was "upgraded" to a recently remodeled room - which for the most part was quite nice. Paint in bathroom was peeling though. Huge hotel & busy/crowded. Overall, its an ok place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YupiYey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a great new york spot. Just 2 blocks away from Time Square and 3 blocks from Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “I'm through with this hotel (Diamond Member)”
Reviews.Author: LeavingOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past but I'm finally done with it. The property is simply too big while the staff and services have been cut to the bone. The elevators are a confusing nightmare The rooms are a baffling array of styles and standards - all very hit-and-miss. Diamond members are lucky to receive any special consideration. The Executive Lounge serves a very poor selection of food in a hurried, cramped, chaotic setting. A small glass of wine cost at the bar cost me $16.50 - this proved the final straw - I'm moving to the Hilton Times Square....just so much easier to navigate

Reviews.Title: “Such a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: getawaygator
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we needed. This hotel is may be a bit more than some others closer to the airport, but it is in the middle of NYC surrounded by many desirable destinations. Viewed Contral Park from our window, MOMA is across the street, subway a few blocks walk, 5th Ave. shopping within a short walk, and the hotel gym has all the ammenities you would find in a high quality fitness facility. Be aware that high speed internet access costs a significant amount to access it through your room or the business center. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Almondbutter
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. We stayed here for 5 days and really enjoyed it. We had a deluxe 2 double beds room and the view was really nice. The room is spacious compare to NY's hotels in general. In opposite the bathroom was tiny. Location is great which is very convenient. Beds are good and it was pretty quiet even if it is right in the centre. Staff were just ok, nothing spectacular, but it is what you expect in NY. The down side to it is that everything you do is a supplement. I wasn't expecting that from that hotel. You have to pay for internet in your room, or in the business centre $18.99 a day, the worse was to pay the GYM $15 a day( I've never seen that before). For 30mn run you can go to Central Park which is close to the hotel. It really feel like flying with a cheap airline.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome NYC Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: klaw92
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! I've stayed in a few NYC-area hotels in the past in various mid-town locations (Times Square, etc.). This by far was my favorite hotel!! Check-in process was smooth, room was clean and updated, bed was comfortable, etc., etc.! Although we did not take advantage of many of the things this hotel had to offer (restaurants, etc.), we had a wonderful visit and this hotel is on my list of places to stay again next time I visit NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault our stay there”
Reviews.Author: otw_dive_team
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good value for money. We went for a long weekend for a friends [**th] birthday the hotel was a good base and most of what we wanted wasn't too far away. There was a great choice at breakfast and the beds were very comfortable - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern room”
Reviews.Author: paulieuk
Reviews.Content: At check-in I was told that this particular hotel doesn't offer Hilton HHonors gold guests the usual benefit of a subject-to-availability executive floor upgrade, that they only offered to diamond members. Strange there's no mention of such a unique opt out of corporate policy on the hotel's page on the Hilton website. After a little polite questioning about this, and confirming I was happy to take a room with two beds instead of the one king I'd reserved, I was granted an executive room. It might have been the only one on that floor if the different door design betrays which rooms have been upgraded or not (the room opposite with an older door certainly wasn't updated inside), but my room definitely had been updated and it was great! The colours, design and furnishings were crisp, contemporary and smart. The room was a decent size and everything worked well, including really strong effective air conditioning. Noise wasn't a problem and a great night's sleep was easily enjoyed. The bathroom was newly refreshed too, although oddly, the shower rail was clearly too short for the job as it was screwed to a couple of wooden blocks on the wall (see photo). The executive lounge itself was sizeable, but still pretty busy at breakfast time, with some people having to wait to enter. The staff there were all friendly, helpful and approachable. Wifi is offered free in there with a password, and there are a couple of desktops to use too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RainbowsCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the city and although we had read many hotel reviews and pored over maps of the area, we weren't sure how our hotel experience would go. We were pleasantly surprised with our room; it was spacious for four of us (two adults and two teenage boys). Although we would have liked queen sized beds, the doubles were perfectly adequate and very comfortable. Linens were clean and there were extra blankets and pillows available in the room. The room was clean and well appointed. They made good use of the space available. We were on the 11th floor which is apparently one of the recently renovated floors. If we had one complaint, it would be that people are noisy in the hallways, forgetting how loud they sound be to others who are trying to sleep. Fortunately, they weren't late into the night and we were able to get good rest otherwise. We were also not bothered by traffic noise at night. The location was great for getting around on foot, subway or cab. Many tourist attractions are very close and easy to get to. The concierge was helpful in helping us get to a location in Brooklyn and advising us on the best way to get there. The restaurant in the hotel is pricey so we were happy to find Toasties which serves breakfast and lunch fare at very affordable prices (located near St. Patrick's Cathedral). I would definitely return to this hotel, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel - Better Ones in the Same Area”
Reviews.Author: KitchieKai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York for two nights for the first and last time. The stay was awful. There are hotels (like the Sheraton or the Le Meridien Parker) in the area that are the SAME price and orders of magnitude better. Here are the specifics: 1. Room smelled of food when I entered. 2. Old, run down rooms. Old worn bed linens that also had a lingering odor. 3. No towels in the bathroom. The housekeeping lady says that the day before they had "run out of towels". What kind of hotel runs out of towels? 4. The TV remote didn't work. I had to call that in several times before someone would attend to it. 5. Shoddy housekeeping. The first day I arrived, the bath mat was slightly damp (it was gross). 6. You can hear EVERYTHING happening in the adjacent room. You'll have to pray that you don't have noisy neighbors. 7. They charge you for using the gym ($15 per visit). The whole experience has been completely unpleasant. This hotel is in desperate need of refurbishing but there's nothing they can do about the bad service and awful quality of the experience in general. There are much better hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Fivez
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by this hotel. While the lobby is cold and large and I didn't particularly want to spend any time in it, the room was large and freshly redone. The furniture and decor was modern, the bedding was super comfortable and the arrangement really maximized the space. This was definately one of the larger sized rooms I've had in NY. The only caveat was the tiny tiny bathroom. I stayed here for a conference and found the conference food quite good. Plus there' a starbucks inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Suzpol
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in Feb 2010. It was my 2nd trip to New York and I was impressed with the huge size of the room - for a New York hotel. We had a double bed each and a great bathroom - again with plenty of room. The location of the hotel is fantastic - you can walk to most places or catch a taxi from directly outside. We usually ate out and about but did eat in the restaurant and the bar on a few occasions as it is just so easy. It is not cheap but the food is lovely and perfect if you just want to relax after a hard day's sightseeing! I would stay at this hotel again as it didn't feel like a dated, tiny city hotel - the only down side is how busy it gets and sometimes it is hard to find somewhere to sit in the bar/public areas. There are a lot of conferences being held here. However, once in your room, you do not hear a thing and we slept really well every night in the comfy beds. Would definitely recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at NY Hilton”
Reviews.Author: snookie_d
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in March. Arrived at 1pm and was able to check right in to our room. Lobby was busy with tourists, however, check in when smooth and quickly. Room was nice, clean, and quiet. The location of this hotel is awesome. Only several blocks from Central Park and around the corner from Rockefellar Center. The hotel does have storage for your personal items. This costs $3 per bag but was worth it because we had the opportunity to stay in the city for the day after checking out with out carrying our bags. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last month on a business trip. The visit got off to a less-than-stellar start when I approached the elevators only to find two of the three going to my floor blocked off by cleaning staff. When I reached the room, I found water pooled on much of the bathroom floor. Lots of noise from guests (mostly kids) in the hallways--not much the hotel can do about this, since it's such a big tourist hotel, and excited kids are that way. A bit of a hassle getting from where I stayed to the lounge for breakfast. Had to go down one bank of elevators and then up another. And the breakfast spread itself was probably the most minimal I've seen staying at all sorts of Hilton properties, including the budget brands. There's more, but the bottom line is that while the location is good, the other aspects of the hotel leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were rude and room smelled of smoke”
Reviews.Author: rob123456789abc
Reviews.Content: Upon entering our room no. 2538 on 25th March the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming - the staff did bring an ioniser but this was taken away a few hours later when we went out. The attitude of the man on the ticket desk behind the lift was appalling when we thought we had not been given our tickets. Dont go there and yes there is a tour cheaper then they recommend. Unless they dont know they lied. The Big yellow taxi trip is $30 dollars cheaper and is a one trip ticket, what we asked for but were told did not exist. Beware of the checked bag charge of $3.50 after you check out. At the bar opposite reception at 4pm on sunday 28th march I asked for a cup for a cup coffee but was told it was not available as the kitchen was grinding it. It never turned up. This said same waiter was very rude as we were waiting in this bar for our taxi to the airport not only did he ask us how long we intened staying, we had been there for approx 15 minutes - there was no other place to wait but when one of our party got up and the waiter pulled the chair away and put it at another table. Everyone else in New York was fine especially NYPD who were helpful and hilarious especially the cop from Hampstead in the coffee shop by the WTC site who belongs on the cast of Ugly Betty. Will we return to NY - yes but NOT to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacklbarnhart
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to hang your hat in New York, the Hilton New York is it. The location is great. The rooms are small, but comfortable. For a large hotel, the rooms are quiet. You are walking distance to everything. You could pay hundreds more, but why?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, property in need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: Jgoldscher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on business. Good: location, room size. Bad: central air kept blasting heat all night, room was dingy and in need of a makeover, TV was from 1997. If priority is price and location, great. If you want a unique NY experience, I would probably pass.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Fantastic weekend @ Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Mogambo1
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel i have ever been. Nice hospitality...great view from rooms. The staff is so friendly & helpful to assist you whenever you want. Without giving a second thought you could book this hotel & enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “No Attn to Detail: Poor Housekeeping, No Management Follow-through”
Reviews.Author: DrandMrsFunk
Reviews.Content: In town for a conference at the Hotel with spouse. The nicest thing we can say is that the rooms were large (for Manhattan). Prior to arrival we used Hilton's online service to add additional pillows and towels (and received a confirmation number indicating they received the requests). Upon arrival: the room was missing the "Do Not Disturb" sign, one of the phones did not work, the remote did not work, neither the requested pillows nor towels were in the room, there were hairs in the tub, and there were used condom wrappers in the bedside console. We called customer service, and they said they'd send someone and have a manager follow up. Later we received pillows and towels and the phone was fixed. But then... The next day, after housekeeping visited, still no sign and a non-working remote, the previously supplied additional towels/pillows were back to 2, and the WRAPPRS were still there! We called AGAIN, and were told a manager would follow up with us. A few moments later housekeeping arrived and removed the offensive garbage and repeated that a manger would call. We requested towels and pillows on day one, two and three, and only received them on day one. Why do they supply a confirmation number, if even they are not going to pay attention to details. No Manager ever called or followed up. Nothing was done accomodate us. The only person to apologize was the housekeeping woman who removed the offensive garbage. For the price of the hotel, it is offensive to be disregarded. We put more time into resolving the issues than we wanted to to begin with, so we just let it go. We were very glad to check out and will not stay at the Hilton NY (on 6th) again. Additional notes: 20th floor room had street view and view of office building next door; expensive wifi ($20 in room for 24hrs or $1 a minute in the business center); Bathroom counter space is severely limited; hotel charges more than $3/per bag to hold bags; no welcome magazines ( e.g. Where, Front Desk, etc as found in many other hotels). Easy to get a taxi from hotel. Room has refrigerator, but only for mini-bar. They are happy to charge you for bringing you an additional fridge, if you request one. We have stayed at many Manhattan hotels - this was by far, and significantly, the worst hotel experience. Just not what one would expect from a Hilton - but they're too busy and they don't care. There is better value and better service elsewhere in Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “A curate's egg - good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: The positives - location excellent, check-in fine but impersonal and management attentive and apologetic when problem encountered (offered generous compensation although none had been asked for). The negatives - concierge uncontactable by phone (hung on for 10 minutes then gave up), bathroom tiny (not enough room to swing a mouse let alone a cat). Maybe the bad bits are unusual and I was just unlucky on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: PATONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, good staff, No problems! 5 - 10 minutes walk to Times Square and Cenral park and 5 minutes to the Carnegie Deli! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: sevenstates
Reviews.Content: For the same price that I am paying for a room in Danbury CT, I got a great room at the Hilton. It was a prepay special and I was upgraded when I checked in. That was a great surprise. I arrived late and was happy to see that room service was still available at 12:40am. The food was expensive but the service was good. The elevators were slow but that did not bother me because I was not in a hurry. Check in/out was speedy. Would definitely stay there again. Forgot to mention that a security person was checking room keys at the entry late at night to make sure no one entered the hotel who was not a guest.

Reviews.Title: “To Hilton or not to Hilton? That's the question...”
Reviews.Author: HyfasBigB
Reviews.Content: It's big, lots of rooms, long carpet corridors and a never ending people arriving and leaving at the same time, all the time. But still remaining clean, comfortable and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Atravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights on business. We arrived at 11 am and our room was ready. The front desk staff were pleasant and welcoming. The room was large and clean and the bed extremely comfortable. As noted by others, the lobby stays very busy but we did not have the delays waiting for elevators noted by previous reviewers. We did not eat in the hotel as there are numerous choices close by outside. The only complaint was difficulty in regulating the temp in the room. The location is excellent. Getting a taxi was easy throughout the day altho there were some waits in the evening. Would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york - fab location”
Reviews.Author: phil081
Reviews.Content: close to Central Park, within walking distance of Times Square, vey confortable...quite expensive...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JosephMTL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of it's central location and the room was on sale. I only ended up on the 6th floor which meant I didn't have a great view but that's fine with me. The biggest gripe was the $15/day internet which I didn't end up paying for since I was able to catch free WiFi from a nearby hotel. They let me check out 2 hours later at 2pm which I really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on a slow weekend (snowed in ny). The lobby was not as busy as the last time, and we were able to check in easily requesting 2 beds. Note: each set of elevators goes to certain floors so you need to stick with the same ones each time. We got the 8th floor (HHonors), and the room was a renovated one. The decor was nice, bathroom was clean, bed very comfortable, 27" LCD tv and safe in the closet. They offer Crabtree & Evelyn prods: shampoo, conditioner, body lotion & shower cap. They even have these adjustable lamps on the headboards of the beds for reading. They have a starbucks inside the hotel and a regular one across the street. The restaurant has a nice looking bar but we did not dine there. Plenty of banks around the area, too: Chase, Bank of America, Wachovia etc. Times Square is less than a mile from the hotel. I won this hotel on priceline for $115 bid. After my bad experience at Intercontinental Barclay, I decided to never include Midtown East as an area to stay. Plus it's more convenient since we were seeing broadway musicals for both days of our stay. The hotel is close to the orange and yellow lines, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, MOMA. We got back late from eating after our evening musical, and it felt safe walking from the subway stop. This hotel does not offer complimentary internet, nor free wifi in the lobby. Our tv stopped working the next day (sound but no pic), but I forgot to report it to the desk when I checked out. I'm not sure if it was due to the slow weekend, but we won the lottery drawing for $25-27 seats to Hair and In the Heights (certain broadway shows have these lottery drawings 2 hours before showtime - show up 10 minutes before the drawing to put your name in the bucket).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive room service”
Reviews.Author: NCLimey
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at this hotel at the beginning of 2010. 1 week in a north facing room, 1 week in a south facing room - I got nicer photos/views from the north facing room. The rooms themselves are decent, though not all of those on the hhonors floors have been revamped - the one I got on floor 27 had a much more dated feel to the one on floor 31 the week after. I paid about a thousand dollars per work day week. (4 nights). My biggest issue was the pricey room service - A greasy cheese steak cost and a coke cost about $45 after charges - Against recommendations, later in the week I ate from the street vendors that are just outside and the chicken and rice cart gets some long lines of people waiting in the cold and is a great, tasty meal for $10 - the hot sauce is very hot tho! As mentioned, the lobby is very busy, with people pouring in and out in all directions and usually nowhere to sit. I highly recommend visiting "30 rock - top of the rock" within walking distance at 50th street. The rooms can be a little noise polluted (though it is NYC) apart from the sirens and horns outside, other guests coming and going at all hours with slamming doors is ever present. Over priced wireless internet (why isn't this free for all paying guests in this day and age?) though other, neighboring hotel networks are both free and accessible. Consider crossing the street for Starbucks and a decent grocery store, rather than buying onsite.

Reviews.Title: “New York Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JoanO2
Reviews.Content: close to Central Park, within walking distance of Times Square, beds were comfortable

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience i have ever had”
Reviews.Author: tonyainutah
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I have never written a bad review before, but this hotel was the worst hotel I have ever dealt with. I am pretty easy going, but enough is enough when it comes to this hotel. I will NEVER stay here again. I to this day can't get my issues resolved and it will never happen. I paid for a suite at $600/night because we had 6 adults on our "girls trip". There were problems after problems, but I will spare you the small stuff. The biggest problem is that we were supose to have a suite with 2 beds and a pull out couch (for 6 people). Well the couch was broken, and the staff was not willing to help AT ALL! I would call and get transfered to houskeeping every day and still nothing would get done. My mom and I slept on the floor for 2 nights before finally getting some matresses that we could just throw on the floor. Every day we were told it would get taken care of and every night we would come back it wasn't. It was the worst stay I have ever experienced and mostly because I felt like the staff could care less what was happening. It litterally ruined my entire trip, and when I got home my husband called hilton to complain and they wouldn't even talk to him because he didn't stay there, so I had to call in. I told them everything that had happened, and after months of arguing with them on the phone (because I thought the fair thing was to refund the 2 nights I had to sleep on the floor) which they would never do still nothing happened. The lady that was supose to call me back never did and when I called back in again I got the run around again. After almost a year I finally got someone who I thought was willing to help me, only to find out that all they would do is give me a few few nights at a hilton hotel. I was tired of arguing so I said fine to the deal. Then the certificates arrived and they were for a hampton hotel, not the hilton hotels and they had an expiration date on them. I called back and talked to the lady who said if I paid to fed ex them back to them then they would send me the hilton ones...yeah right...like I believe that one. It has been since fall of 2008, but as you can see I am still bugged by the fact that neither the hotel or hilton themselves would ever make good on this problem and I will never stay there again. Other things that were small details were things like we had a room for 6 people who showered every day, yet they told us it was impossible to leave 6 towels because they only leave 4. if we wanted more we had to call in an ask for more. So every day we called and asked for 2 more towels. Our shower was moldy and the room had a weird smell to it that we never could figure out. It was also so noisy every night on one side or the other of us. People partying until 3 am, others fighting next door. Security was called once by us and other times not by us, but we heard them come. The party would get quiet for 20 minutes and then start again.etc. etc. etc. Oh and I almost forgot my room bill said one amount and when the cahrge went through it was $400 more than what it was supose to be. If you want a good hotel stay at the hampton times square north they are fantastic to deal with and the beds are comfy and the staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverparakeet
Reviews.Content: I went with my family for 3 days. Even though it is towards the end of the strip, it was a great experience. The hotel was clean and the lobby was a very clean. Overall, the experience was great!

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: hgnono
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel in a great location. The size of the hotel creates a few problems: - The lobby is a zoo - full of people and very loud - Lines for check-in & check-out - Long line in front of the hotel taxi stand - Lines at the restaurants, executive lounge, and elevators - Each floor is slightly different, probably to ongoing perpetual renovations (again due to the size of the hotel). Rooms are good size, but high-floor doens't necessarily mean better quality room Overall, this is a good location if you like to stay at the Hilton chain, but don't expect anything close to a "boutique" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: swtheartmb03
Reviews.Content: Happy to have stayed at the Hilton New York! I had a great rate. Thought the hotel was it a pretty good location. Starbucks line was super crowded every morning so we went to one across the street. Front Desk and bellman were very helpful and quick. Rooms were a great size. Did not have a great view, but we were never in the room so did not matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, overall a great value”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The room size was fantastic. It was "American" sized rooms. Unlike most New York hotels (which have room sizes like that of Europe), the Hilton has nice big rooms, relatively speaking. It was an excellent bed, with great comforter. The room was clean, and the bathroom was in great shape. Maid service was punctual and quite good. Overall, it was a great deal, and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tapas2
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via Priceline blind bid, but was completely satisfied. It is 3 short blocks from Rock Center, and an easy walk to several theaters, central park and lots of restaurants. The lobby is classy, staff friendly and the rooms are large, quiet and nicely furnished and decorated. I really had no gripes and would stay there again anytime. Hotel parking was steep at $48 a day, but thats NYC. Parking rates are much better at garage on 52nd bet 6th & 7th.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: LouNI09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel whilst on an extended business trip with work friends, we had been in NC and decided to take a trip up to NYC for a few days. Two of us had been in NYC before and two hadn't, so this hotel was perfect location and amenity wise. It was a very bust few days sightseeing, and as we were on an executive floor we had access to the lounge for breafast and nibbles at night, this was very handy and as we had only paid $199 per night, it was a total bargain by NYC standards !!! The rooms were large (by NYC standards) very well presented and clean, while the lobby and public areas were lovely. The only complaint I would have is the price of drinks, 3 Corona and 1 baccardi and diet coke was $50 CRAZY! Nevertheless if you are looking fr a very well located, well presented and reasonably priced hotel this is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Teal7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel a group of friends having been advised that a 2 double bed room would be fine. The beds were actually only 3 quarter beds and so after much discussion they did bring us a camp bed for the room - not what you expect to be sleeping on when you are paying that much. With the exception of Matthew on the front desk and one of the duty managers Krysten everyone else we dealt with didn't seem that bothered and treated us like we were a hassle. It was my friends 30th and they were advertising in room massages but when we called we were told they were not available in the rooms. We wanted to use the gym but that was $15 a head per visit and when we came to leave our luggage they charged $3.50 per item. Twice they did not make all the beds up in our room and when we queried it the reason was that we had left personal belongings on the bed and it was their policy not to touch personal belongings (which were PJ's and a book!) There was nowhere to just sit in the lobby comfortably unless you bought a drink at the bar. In summary we chose the Hilton because generally have found them good in the UK but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, beds could have been more desireable”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary in New York (first trip). Initially I was planning to spend a lot more on hotel, but I decided at the last minute to priceline a hotel. I made a bid of $125 per night and got the Hilton New York. Initially I was a little scared because of the "average" reviews that I had read. However, we had a wonderful time there. Location: Perfect...Within walking distance to tons of things Hotel: Checkin was a breeze. Lobby looked nice. Room was nicely decorated (appeared to be recently remodeled). The beds were a tad on the soft side (and springy). We were on the 6th floor and did not hear any noise from street. Value: Great value for a midtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: c10vrlf
Reviews.Content: We've always stayed at the Marriott Marquis - but this hotel is just as convenient without the noise and crowds of Times Square and was less expensive. Our room was on the 40th floor - and had not been renovated, but was clean and quiet. It had a connecting doorway to another room and those guests were smoking in their room - though it's a non-smoking hotel. Called to complain as the smell was significant in our room. Was transfered 3 times and got the impression that hotel staff didn't really want to attempt to do anything. As this happened on the last night, we did not follow up any further. Also, the "smoking area" is just outside the hotel entrance and every time you enter or exit you must walk through a haze of cigarette smoke. Since we were on the Executive Level we had access to a complimentary continental breakfast and found that to be very convenient. Beware that high speed wireless is ~$18/day, which is annoying. Even with the petty complaints, this Hilton was a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ClipperJon
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the Hilton when I discovered a bagel inside the nightstand drawer. Otherwise, the executive level double bedroom was ok but the executive lounge was not. The lounge was packed - it was difficult to locate seating. The food was awful - the pastries were dry and lacked any flavor. I have stayed here before - but not on an executive level floor - and I don't think it was worth the extra money. As others have commented, the bathroom was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Windermere65
Reviews.Content: Wanted to say we just returned from a stay at this hotel and our accommodations were lovely. The room was very clean, spacious,pretty and had comfy beds and when we requested additional towels, the staff was knocking on our door in less than 5 minutes. The entire staff was helpful, courteous and friendly. The food and drinks were a bit pricey, but we were pretty much out of the hotel most of the time. It was a nice place to return to every night.

Reviews.Title: “We just slept in there”
Reviews.Author: natzoe
Reviews.Content: It was great. Perfect location. Close to the Time Square and Central Park. But we just slept in there, so I'm not familiar with the rest of their services.

Reviews.Title: “great location but poor service and so so room”
Reviews.Author: wyranger
Reviews.Content: stayed one night. assigned a room next to electrical room (some noise). Kind of small even for a standard room... For some reasons, the staff is not very friendly (always in a hurry to get rid of you). Will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed very happily at Hilton hotels in Germany - there they are very good value and good quality. This Hilton on 6th Ave & 53rd St is really designed for the conventioneers who stay here and use the bars and conference facilities, not for individual travellers. The lobby is like Grand Central Station - in early January it was 5 times as crowded as the streets outside! Therefore it took 10 minutes to queue to check in, and I did not feel like trying to eat any meals in the hotel, as the restaurants & bars were always packed & very noisy. My room was quite nice if very, very small - though I understand this is normal for NYC. It was however very cold (this was midwinter). An engineer came, took off the plate of the air conditioning fan & found a big crack to the outside, which he shoved a towel into to try & block it! After that it was warmer. Also when you need to leave your bags in the bag room for the day, before your evening flight, they charge you $3.50 a bag. I have never had to pay a hotel to put my bags in a room before - anywhere! The location is great, there are lots of diners on 7th Ave where you can have breakfast - my friends & I had dinner in Carnegie Deli on 7th by 55th St. If you eat there please remember that 1 meal serves 3 people - unless you want to take home a doggy bag! Manhattan is wonderful - great shops & museums all year round. I will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location!!”
Reviews.Author: Coco_Princess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the absolute perfect location if you want to be within walking distance from Tomes SQ and 5th, but still want a bit of piece and quiet. Make sure you ask for a refurbished room when you check in, as we had one on the 32nd floor, and it was amazing. Very good size, large enough for a King bed, sofa and a huge table. Room were not cleaned very well at all, coffee mugs left dirty, coffee not replenished, etc. The Concierge staff were useless quite frankly and if you would like to go and see a show, DO NOT BOOK through the hotel, go directly to the ticket office, as the hotel rip you right off! They were going to charge me a extra $60 per ticket for a Broadway show, but I saw sense and stopped my bf from handing his credit card card over â€“ we went to the theatre and bought the tickets directly â€“ much cheaper option! Also, do not use hotel WIFI, go to Starbucks across the road and use theirs for free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tptravelenfun
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Mid-Town is in a great location. It is close enough to walk to everything or walk most anywhere but yet not in the middle of the chaos that is going on in TImes Square (only a few blocks away.) My friend and I were there Halloween weekend which was also coincidentally the weekend of the NYC Marathon. We still enjoyed the hotel, thought he staff was accommodating and liked our room but then again we were not in the room that much. The best discovery is the gyro food cart on the corner of 53rd across from the hotel. The food from this cart is awesome. We did also have a drink or two at the hotel bar before heading out and had fun with the bartenders. Billy Elliott is a fantastic play, go see it. We also enjoyed a tour of Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Overpirced even for NYC, Small Rooms, Smaller Baths”
Reviews.Author: PanamaElite
Reviews.Content: I guess i have been spoiled after living in Dallas for 5 years. I spent 3 days here and booked through priceline at nearlt 1/2 only $180 a night for total of $651.96 for 3 nights. But I guess I still expected a higher quality hotel than this for $651. The lobby is nice and it is directly accross from MOMA but this hotel just did not cut it for me. Im a native New Yorker but I feel there are better deals closer to Times Square or in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but they nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: abs30s
Reviews.Content: for the most part the Hilton New York was a good choice. the location is excellent. i got a great deal on Priceline for $120 a night. however, i was supposed to get a king or 2 double room. somehow i ended up w/ a queen; hence, the room was really small. at least the bathroom was recently renovated; it looked nice although the inside of the door needed cleaning from the makeup smudges. i was next to the ice machine room so it was loud at times and the housekeeping closet was in the same short corridor as my room so that was also annoying. the room didn't seem like it was dusted or picked up very well. i was sneezing and got stuffed up. i found someone's hair band next to the night table. there's only 1 wastebasket in the bathroom, not another by the desk. the dresser drawers were hard to open/close. all in all, the room was fine. not as nice as i would expect from a Hilton. they have a recently renovated fitness room. it was really nice, but apparently you have to pay a $15 fee to use it. it doesn't come w/ the hotel stay, nor does internet. that was another $15 per day. there wasn't any information binder in my room so i had to find out these things on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WWWBL
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a wonderful trip to New York, made even better by our stay at the Hilton Hotel (Hilton New York). The location was amazing (6th and 53rd), a walk away from Times Square, Central Park and the shops. The hotel, though very big, was staffed by very friendly people and the concierge couldn't have been more helpful. There's a Starbucks within the hotel at the back which was a great asset. The rooms were very spacious, so clean and well stocked. A good tip is to join the Hilton Honours before you go, we got our requested rooms on a high floor. Don't be sucked in to the 'free gift' offer when you check in, yes, it's a Time Share offer! The only annoying thing is the $10 minimum charge for using the internet in the Business Centre, it should be free for guests. 6th Avenue (also called Avenue of the Americas) is lovely and wide and you get used to the perpetual car horns sounding day and night. If we ever go back to New York, it's the Hilton New York for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TheFamilyTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 stayed at Hilton NY near 53rd and 6th in Midtown Manhattan. Pros: located almost right in between Central Park and Times Square. Easily accessible to Columbus Circle, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, Carnegie Hall and Radio City Music Hall. Hotel was clean and had a great view on 33rd floor (ask for a renovated room when booking). Quick check-in and check-out. Cons: water (tap and shower) smelled funny in room, remote didn't work very well (like every hotel room in America), and concierge staff provided no more insight than we could have found on a map or a restaurant guide.

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: AishaF1
Reviews.Content: it was a great stay. personnel was very helpful. in and out was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all, even for a plain old Hilton”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: I don't generally expect much from business-class hotels like the Hilton, but I had hoped for at least pleasant service. At check-in, the front desk person would have been a perfect cast in iRobot. Not even a hint of a smile. No empathy. No anything. Front desk personnel are the face of the hotel. In this case, it was a very unsavory face indeed. Fine. So Mr Personality doesn't give me any indication my business is welcomed. Such is life. At least we got rooms next to each other (we have two rooms). Oh, but not connecting, even though the floor map looks like there are connecting rooms. Ah well. The room is small. Maybe not tiny by NYC standards, but I am glad we have 2 rooms. Bathrooms are small too. Only 2 bathtowels. The heat/AC is one of those prehistoric ones controlled by the hotel, it seems. Either A.C or heat. It is December, so only heat, even though it's really warm. I even opened the windows as far as they would open. Set the thermostat to the lowest, and yet the room never got below 74 F. Not even in the middle of the night! Housekeeper did not even leave paper and pen in the room. How nice. The iron in the room kept leaking water. As Gold, I thought some kind of upgrade might be available. Or at least free breakfast. Well, I got 2 bottles of water and a coupon for a mid-size drink and a breakfast pastry. And a room 10 ft from the elevator on the "HHONORS Floor." I can see Hilton really appreciates my business. I knew there was a reason why I chose to make PLT at SPG and Fairmont, and settled for Gold at Hilton. This stay just reminds me the reason why.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: BearTavern
Reviews.Content: The Hilton offers a comfortable room in Midtown, close to major tourist attractions. We stayed for two nights during the Christmas season. The room was $125 from Priceline. Comfortable, good service, safe--they ask everyone entering after 10 pm to show their room key.

Reviews.Title: “very disorganized and unprofessional as your needs are ignored”
Reviews.Author: rodrigoNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Luxury suite was not anywhere near where we requested 3 months ago at reservation time. I confirmed 3 times getting yes sirs every time. However at check in I was looked at oddly and given what was " available". Poor treatment at arrival and throughout stay. No clean towels provided, had to ask and view was poor for what we paid and requested specifically. The hotel is just that and service is critical but we were meant to feel like lower that the staff. No hellos or even a Merry Christmas and the breakfast was bad, hard rolls and muffins, no hot breakfast staying in a luxury suite. The hotel was a disappointment and for 600.00 US a night I'll stay somewhere else in the city. The Hotel was outdated and needed upgrades. Finally, the elevator system at the hotel was the worst we have ever seen. Plan to spend 20 plus minutes waiting for an elevator, sure did add to the bad taste already lingering about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad would not be happy”
Reviews.Author: findsthegoodspots
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Thanksgiving and experinced what so many have reported, overpriced room - got a small 1bedroom with furniture that looked like they got it at a garage sale. Old & used.The $500 room entitled me to use the executive lounge ,that was packed as nobody was monitoring who was coming in and out . Service was slow to non-exsistent . I am a Hilton Honors participant and always get a follow-up email to insure my stays are enjoyable....not this time because I think they already know...

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luck-o-the-Brirish
Reviews.Content: During the course of my three week stay at the New York Hilton I developed a "love/hate" relationship the hotel. I love, love, love the location. The quick access to Central Park and 5th Avenue shopping was wonderful and definately made my trip more enjoyable. However, the time spent in the property was average at best. Overall the property just feels old and dated. My room was relatively small compared and simply appointed. I realize you're paying for the location, but I still don't like paying luxury price for an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: xcoaster1
