The Marketplace for breakfast is nothing special, but hey... u r in NYC, step outside the door and eat ANYTHING!!! The location is obviously PRIME. Getting a cab wasn't always so easy because we were competing (at times) with 4,000 other people there for same convention. The lobby is lovely, and the employees are always very nice and helpful. We did switch rooms after 1 night because the heat is on (obviously) for the hotel and we couldn't cool the room enough. So we moved to a room across the hall where we could crack the window just enough to be more comfortable. We stayed at the Sheraton on 7th last year.... YUCK!!!! We love HILTON!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, we had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: trishwall
Reviews.Content: Although the Hilton is an older one in New York, it is kept remodeled and well furnished. The amenities are extremely nice and the service staff beyond reproach. It was a great place to "come home to" at the end of a tiring day of siteseeing or night at the theatre. This Hilton is my favorite in all of New York...and I've stayed at the posh Waldorf and the very modern Millenium. (In fact, my daughter became very emotional at the Millenium because it overlooks Ground Zero.) This Hilton is smack dab in the middle of Manhattan near all the theatres. And we got a very good rate booking through Broadway.com while purchasing show tickets to Wicked. Love it, love it, love it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Mediocre/Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tootee
Reviews.Content: On the day we were to travel to New York for Thanksgiving, we learned that we could not stay with family members due to an illness. We thought it would be fun to stay near the Macyâ€™s parade route and take our 2-year-old to the parade, so we chose the Hiltonâ€”which would also put us in a central location for visiting scattered family members. The location was great; we walked out to the parade, visited the Central Park Zoo, and took quick cab rides to other locations. The hotel itself, however, was mediocre and overpriced. Upon checking in, we were told that we had received a free upgrade. We were baffled by this information when we saw our tiny room with one queen bed (upgraded from what??). I had requested a crib for our son, and I phoned a few minutes before our arrival to ask if the crib could be ready for us, since it was around midnight. After some back-and-forth, the clerk said we were â€œall setâ€�. Of course, there was no crib in the room when we got there, and it took about half an hour longer to arrive. There was barely enough room between the bed and the wall for the crib. Throughout the night (every night), a mysterious rumbling noise kept me awake (unseen freight elevator, maybe?). Our room rate included free American style breakfasts at the Marketplace restaurant. This was decent enough (except for the terrible coffee), and included things like bananas, yogurt cups, and small boxes of Cheerios that I could pocket for my sonâ€™s snacking needs. However, the stated value of the free breakfast was $30 per person, on which the gratuity was calculated. While I fully expect to tip the staff at a complementary meal, the price was ridiculous. On the 2nd day, the breakfast went from â€œdecentâ€� to â€œdisappointingâ€� as my husband got a moldy orange. These things happen, but again--$30 per person?? We skipped the breakfast on our third morning. I had been using the roomâ€™s minibar fridge to store milk for my son. The fridge door was crooked, and each day Housekeeping would apparently open the fridge, fail to close the wonky door properly, and leave the fridge cracked open. For $350-$400 a night, can my minibar have a door thatâ€™s not hanging off? Regarding the lobby and elevators, I chalked up the crowds to the holiday weekend. I see from other posts, however, that the long wait for elevators was not unique to Thanksgiving. We enjoyed being in midtown, and didnâ€™t encounter any major horrors with the hotel, but I would try someplace else if I stayed in midtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as Always”
Reviews.Author: tenismom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Traveling with 3 teenage girls. Checked in from another hotel (Doubletree-bad stay). They upgraded us to the top floor with an awesome view of the city and partial of Central Park. Our room was a deluxe and extremely roomy. Oversized for New York standards. They gave us complimentary full breakfast each morning. Clean and helpful. Could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and within walking distance of many restaurants, stores, and events. The hotel room is ok...nothing great. The bathroom is extremely small with absolutely no counter space. The room is small as well but about average size for NYC. The bed was comfortable and the room was acceptably clean. The hotel is very busy and crowded. We waited up to 20 minutes on multiple occasions for an elevator. Since we were on the 16th floor it was a little difficult to take the stairs each time. The check-in staff was very average...not pleasant but not really rude. There is a Starbuck's in the hotel but the line was always too long. We ate one time in the restaurant and the food was very mediocre and overpriced. They do have two nice bars. One is great for people-watching and the other is a perfect escape. Nothing about our stay was outstanding but we would probably stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: StillDreaming
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel close to everything. there were lines at check in but they had a Hilton honors line. That line also had a couple in front of us so a gentleman told us to go over to the Hilton diamond desk. We were checked in promptly to executive level floor 39. In previous reviews there were concerns about the elevators and the wait time. The longest time we had to wait was approximately 2min. I didn't feel the elevator was an issue at all. They have executive level only elevators, so you can by-pass the first 33 floors. The complimentary breakfast and evening snacks were OK. There was nothing hot in the morning just carbs (cereal , breads and fruits). The evening was good but not outstanding. I guess I would not do the executive level for the lounge. For the extra charge per room you felt like you really needed to utilize it and there are so many better food options in New York city. But an argument for the executive level is the wonderful view, Awesome!!!! We had a peak of central park and the river. The room was very comfortable similar to other Hilton's we have stayed at. We had a wonderful time and enjoyed all the people we encountered, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful - Overpriced & Lacking Basic Business Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Ambers_view
Reviews.Content: This was a really disappointing experience. My colleague and I spent nearly a week there for work and could not wait to leave. Our main issue was that we paid a signficant room rate (nearly $600 a night each for an Exec Floor room) and got none of the basics we expect. Our main issues: 1 - It was far too busy so we felt like we were in a railway station all the time... it meant no-one helped us with our bags and everything from the lifts to checking in was slow 2 - Excessive charging - eg, desktop net access in the business centre ($1 per minute), $3.50 per bag for storage which was on a lower floor meaning we had to lug our bags back up to the foyer on departure. Really galling given the room rate! 3 - Inconsistent service - especially in the bar and in housekeeping 4 - Lack of consistently available wireless net access 5 - The food was inedible... my colleague tried the eggs benedict in the restaurant early into our trip and was unable to eat any of her meal.. I tried it and understood.. eggs drowned in a bitter cheesy processed sauce... dreadful given the price. We did have reasonable views uptown to Central Park, but that was about the only positive comment we would make. We have learnt our lesson.. next time we will go boutique hotel and forgo the brand-names as clearly they don't mean quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit busy”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel around 11AM and despite a top-tiered HHonors member, I was unable to check-in as my room is not ready until 3PM. Later in the day, I came back and a newly furnished room was ready for us. We were given vouchers for continental breakfast at the Market Place restaurant. The Hilton New York is quite a busy hotel with lots of guests check-in. The lobby sometimes feels like a zoo. Although the lifts are separated by levels, they are small and crowded at times. The twins room that we had was surprisingly large and bright. In addition to the bed lamps, we have 2 overhead bed lamps and a LED reading light per bed. The room is completed with a armchair and ottoman. The desk also have place for a 32" Phillips LCD TV with integrated Nintendo 64 game console. The twins bed are comfy if not a bit on the soft side. The bathroom is not huge but is a good size and does not feels claustrophobic like the other NY hotels. The CrabTree & Evelyn amenities are again ever present here. The Market Place restaurant breakfast is a bit pricey at $24 but if you have a Continental voucher, you can upgrade to the full breakfast for $7. If not, there is a Starbucks right inside the property. The location is not as good as the W or Westin Times Square but still it is a short walk to the premise if you like. However, it is a few blocks from Central Park so that you can get a little fresh air or have a picnic lunch. The Hilton is a good hotel if you can score one of the newly furnished room. A much better choice then the Sheraton Hotels and Towers nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: FlossyMoffit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York for five nights at the end of October and I really loved the hotel. My friend and I shared a room with two double beds and found it to be very spacious - the beds and linen are amazing and if you are in NYC as a tourist you will do a lot of walking, we were really busy every day and getting into those beds every night was amazing - coming home my own bed seems quite disappointing. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurants or the breakfast - the location is just brilliant so there's no need to breakfast at the hotel, and there is a fab place across the street (Lou's place) that had a really good selection, inc veggie. (my favourite breakfast was at Cafe Bari in Soho - highly recommended) Check-in wasn't very informative and I didn't really like check-out as the bill had been put under our door in the morning and our credit cards already charged - obviously I'm British so this isn't really considered polite service and i would certainly prefer to confirm the bill is correct before it is charged. On that note be aware that there are three different taxes on top of your room rate and a daily room cleaning fee that we were not aware of - this added a lot to our bill (400 GBP) so you should check your total rate at check-in. I found the concierge and the doormen and security all to be fabulous. Security is good, we felt very safe at the Hilton, you can't get lost, it's easy to find, you're not far from anything, so while it isn't cheap i would pay the price again for all of the benefits it provided. It's great to walk out and be in the middle of everything whilst avoiding the madness of Times Sq) I couldn't have had a better holiday in NYC and can't wait to get back there! Some of the reviews I'd read before going made me feel very uncertain about my hotel choice - having been there now I'm not sure what people expect from a hotel in the centre of a large city - the rooms were spacious, the hotel very clean, the beds very comfortable. I don't go to a hotel to sit in the Lobby and don't time the elevators, and don't care how many people are staying there as long as they don't bother me. Of course if you want personalised service, and staff to know your name, a quiet lobby to sit in and talk to other guests, you should probably go to a B&B - you might find that NYC is not the place for you at all as you won't get friendly attentive service anywhere you go and you will feel quite anonymous - all part of the thrill of a city which I totally loved! In relation to comments in other reviews - we had wonderful weather so I didn't get the chance to ask the front desk for an umbrella!!! To summarise this hotel compares well to any central hotel of it's class in any of the capital cities I've visited and the rooms were far more spacious than is usual.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: wigan1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed three night at the New York Hilton on 6th Avenue. This was my second visit to the Hotel having visited five years earlier. The hotel is in a fabulous spot for sightseeing and for getting around New York. It is close to Times Square and Broadway and all the main attractions. The hotel represents excellent value for money. The rooms are spacious, very clean and of a high standard. The restaurant serves wonderful breakfasts and overall the service was of a very high standard. I would highly recommend this hotel for familes as well as couples.

Reviews.Title: “Service is THE WORST”
Reviews.Author: jpcata
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fine but the service is truly awful. I ordered a single glass of wine and had to wait a full hour for it to arrive. When I called after 40 minutes to check on it I had to wait on hold for 5 minutes to even speak to someone. When I called the manager to complain I waited forever on hold after asking the front desk to speak with one and no one ever picked up. This hotel is huge and impersonal, but also seems severely understaffed. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else - you can find a much better hotel for $400+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Thought It Would Be!”
Reviews.Author: ladhaa
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I was quite nervous about booking here, especially if I didn't get the guarantee that I'd be getting an renovated suite. I booked directly though the Hilton site and left a comment in my reservation that I wanted a King suite that was newly renovated (at the time of booking, all that was available was a Queen). My husband and I checked in on Fri. Nov. 2, the weekend of the NYC Marathon, and although the lobby and streets were RAMMED full of people, I was swiftly checked in, and placed in a renovated room (3202). Very very courteous and friendly staff. The room did not disappoint, superb quality, flat-panel tv, softest bed, clean linens, great Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries. The highlight of the trip was checking out on the Sunday...my husband and I had done a bit too much partying the night before and we wanted a sleep in, so we didn't want to check out at noon - we called the front desk, who told us we could check out at 1pm with no extra fee since it was the Sunday when clocks went back, and a lot of guests experienced confusion. I told the front desk we'd probably end up checking out later than that, and they told me I'd have to pay an hourly fee (which was fine). We finally checked out at 3pm, and they didn't charge us! They said "don't worry about it, have a great day"!! AMAZING! Oh, concierge staff are excellent - I told them I wanted to eat at a Thai place in the East Village, and within seconds I was recommended an amazing place. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Neilzonwheelz
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in the evening the lady at Reception was perfunctionary = efficient and I was i my room in no time. I was somewhat woried after reading some reviews, bu I was very happy with the room. Almost as spacious as the Conrad in HK. All the ammenities were spot on, flat screen was clear and crisp, room very clean and the bed just snugled me up. The bathroom was a bit dated, but everything worked fine and immaculate. I never notice the noise the 5 days I was there, great base for exploring the area. I never tried Concierge other than for a free map or any of the other facilities. Really loved my stay & would even stay here again. I stayed at the Millenium Hilton several days later but this one was better, the room anyway. The hotel is very busy, the Reception desk etc.. is busy, but I never had an issue with it, just one of those things.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past and it has never been wonderful. The elevators are awful - slow and you wait forever. As a Hilton Honors member I should have felt more special and there was nothing done to make me feel this way. The room is a typical New York hotel room with a small bathroom. While the location is ok there are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: DanfromLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not too bad but the lifts are a nightmare. Takes too long to get out of the floors. The housekeeping also seems too eager to earn a tip, interrupting to come into the room , cleaning the room when you asked them not to. But overall, I found it a good location, and the traffic noise is minimal, almost nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - IF you get one of the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-regular at this location for business. I wish I could write 2 seperate reviews - one for the newly renovated rooms, another for the older ones. I can't, but I will split it up here... OVERALL HOTEL (outside of the room): --Good service --Very nice workout facility - best I think I've seen in a major chain hotel --Lobby and common areas are nice --A few good restaurant choices --Location is fantastic, right on 6 av --Its pricey, of course, given its location - but not out of line with the neighborhood, and sometimes even surprisingly underpriced ROOMS - RENOVATED FLOORS: --Very nice rooms, if you get on these renovated floors --Comfy bed with a variety of pillow types, and nifty reading lamps built in --Great lighting, including motion-activated night lights --Nice workstation including a fancy ergonomic desk chair --Very nice bathroom --Not huge, but big enough, especially in NYC --Overall great room ROOMS - UNRENOVATED: --Same size as above, otherwise totally different... --Furniture is old and run down --Carpet is coming up --Beat up old bed --Scary-dirty bathroom --Overall pretty bad room Basically, if you can get on a renovated floor (usually easy to do if you are any level of HHonors VIP), or if you can wait until they are finished renovating the whole hotel, you are golden. Its pricey, but for the good rooms, its worth the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: iarp
Reviews.Content: Hitlon NY is a city landmark. Huge, sofisticated, VERY well located, nice restaurants and a fantastic structure for business. I have only one, but important, complain : the front desk people. I've never seen nothing like that before. The lady (if I can really call her like this) who take care of my check in was probably trainned to be so unpolite. That behavior could not be natural. After 10 hours flying and a couple of others waiting for immigration, customs, shuttle, etc, I was expecting some human heat at the front desk. Sometimes, as like other huge chains, stay in a giant hotel is an advantage and a problem. You are just a number. That's what that lady and some other people from staff made me fell like : a number.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: DRingham
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience in a 3* NY hotel a few years ago, I vowed to always pay to stay in a 4* or higher. Hotel itself was okay. Decent location not far (but far enough!) from Times Square and Central Park. Room spacious for NY standards with decent bed and space for suitcases. Bathroom tiny - took a while to find the flush as it was located under the sink! Standard of room itself was only average - door so scratched, it looked like a Uni hall of residence room, quite tatty bathroom decor, thin walls so could hear neighbour trying to opera sing at 11 at night! Ask for a room on a high floor, we were pretty high up but could still hear traffic, so lower floor would be a nightmare. I know NY hotels are supposed to be tiniest and priciest anywhere, but did feel little cheated having just come from the stunning 5* Bellagio in Las Vegas and had to pay more for the NY average Hilton! The constant taxi horn blaring drove me insane after 4 days. Would try and stay nearer Greenwich Village if went back, as seemed to offer a little more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - especially for NYC”
Reviews.Author: memsh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in mid-town Manhattan. Large rooms by NYC standards. A little on the pricey side but you can't beat it for location and convenience. Rooms were very clean and service good. Taxi lines during peak times are a nightmare as with most larger hotels. Will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: prance
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row we have stayed here as a family while I attended a medical meeting. If I go to this meeting again I will stay off-site. The room was average, I was able to get a rate of $399 since I am a Hilton Honors member, but I could have gotten a better rate at a hotel more central to Times Square and at a better rate (i.e. Hilton Inn Times Square). This hotel is a major ripoff. There is a $14.95 per day charge for wireless internet, most hotels are giving it away for free now. My teenage daughters did a lot of shopping in New York; I attempted to take a luggage cart from the lobby to our room to take all the bags downstairs, unfortunately, I was accosted by a bellhop who said I could not take it upstairs, only a bell hop could do that. In it for the tip of course. The elevators took forever, as I have seen on other reviews. The meeting room was terrible; there was so much noise from the room next door I could not hear our speaker. The location is really great, I must admit, it is quieter than Times Square, and nice for an evening stroll, but I must say it is overall a rip off. The hotel is living off the Hilton name but not living up to the reputation. Look for something in the same price range, but someplace else; I'm sure it will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Prices, Extremely Impersonal Service”
Reviews.Author: bob987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton New York one night of a two night weekend trip to NYC in April for my birthday. At the last minute we decided to stay the second night and the Hilton was booked, so we ended up staying at The Fitzpatrick Grand Central (Loved that hotel, staying there again this December for Holiday trip). At the Hilton the front desk is EXTREMELY impersonal, really seems in a rush to get through you to the next customer (there was NOT a long line, maybe 2 or 3 other couples behind us). They didn't even make an effort to see if we wanted someone to help with our bags, point out where the elevator was, etc. I would not stay here again simply because of that type of service. The Fitzpatrick is MUCH more personal, polite, etc, as is The Hyatt by Grand Central where we have also stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel and were pleasantly surprised by the rooms which were immaculate and sound proof ,the beds which were very comfortable ,the breakfast which had a great choice and was reasonably priced ; of course the hotel is not exactly cosy and service is not very personal but hey it's nyc remember!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, "big" room by NYC standards”
Reviews.Author: Gabriella620
Reviews.Content: I was here during Christmas time this past year in 2006 with my boyfriend. This hotel was a huge step-up from the Sheraton where we had previously booked, but had to leave b/c it was completely horrid! We had booked the Sheraton as we thought it would be reliable and we liked the location - not so. Location good, hotel no. How exactly does it work out that a breakfast for 2 is $60 and it's just an ordinary buffett with mostly cold items?! It's not like it had framboise crepes with fondue and strawberies or anything. In the end, we ended up leaving and going to the Hilton, which lucky for us happened to be just around the corner. For one the room at the Hilton was much bigger, cleaner and more comfortable, a better use of space in general. It was on a high floor so it wasn't so loud and the decor was modern. I liked the automated lights at the bottom of the bedside tables that lit up when you walked into the room or got out of bed and it was dark, that was cool. The bathroom was clean and well laid-out. And the hotel staff was also very sweet, they upgraded us at no additional charge. Another plus as far as the amenities go was the gym. It was new, modern and had good air circulation so you weren't dying of heat. The ladies shower/locker room had everything you needed including shampoos, conditioners, moisturizers, hair dryer, robes, slippers and even an array of assorted fruit juices. The location was so central, a few minutes from Rockefeller Center, the MOMA and lots of shopping. The breakfast was pricey but good, alot of selection. I would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was great realy clean”
Reviews.Author: JENNYSCOTLAND
Reviews.Content: stayed here the begining of september for 3night. should have stayed longer. Realy clean hotel staff very helpfull.Carolina on the desk realy helped us when we had problems with a taxi driver[they where on strick at the time]and helped us get to the theatre on time to see the show we had pre-booked.We are already planning to go back in 2009.We are also telling all our friends that if you are going to New York you must stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here at least 20 times”
Reviews.Author: Oktober690
Reviews.Content: I have stayed that the New York Hilton at least 20 times over the last 10 years for business. I did not have choice on the hotel to stay at as it is booked by my company. Although I agree with many comments on here about the interior needing updating, I have to say that this hotel has treated me very well over the years and during some trying times at that. I was stranded in NYC during the blackout of 2005. Even though the lobby looked like a refugee camp and there was no rooms left, they held my room for me while I tried to get a flight out from the airport. I came back to my room, 5 hours later and it was still being held for me. This may seem like standard service, but in a crisis, it's nice that they honoured thier promise when it could have been just as easy to pass my room along to any of the hundreds of people in the lobby. On the day of the crisis, to get to our rooms, the guests were walking up the stairs (for me that was 71 flights of stairs) Every couple of floors, they had water tables set up so people walking up a long distance could stay hydrated. I thought this was terrific service. All in all, for the many times I have stayed here, I have never seen a bug or any vermin at all (which you can get in many hotels in NYC), the room service is always good and fast. I have been through alot with this hotel and would recommend it as a convieneint, clean and helpful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton great Manhattan location, large rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: TDNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two girl friends for a party in September. We were shocked by the $300+ per room rates this time of year (even the trashy Ramada New Yorker was $287!!) so we booked the Hilton. We figured if we were going to pay top dollar for one night we might as well stay some place with a good name and solid reputation. We weren't disappointed. I have stayed in several New York City hotels, and have found all of them to have extremely small rooms. Not that it is usually an issue for two travelers, but with three people we couldn't stay in a room that only offered one bed. The rooms at the Hilton were perhaps slightly smaller than national average, but they were extremely large for NYC standards!! With our two double beds we had plenty of room to move around the room, and the bathroom was large as well. As for location, the Hilton was perfect for our needs. One block from Rockafeller Center, one from Broadway and a few more down to Times Square. We couldn't have been happier to be in the middle of the action. Best of all with our room- the beds were SO comfortable! It's no surprise they offer to sell you the mattress, pillows, etc. Very comfortable. Only negatives- the housekeeping room was outside our door. At 7am all of the cleaners gather outside of that room and throw some kind of a party. Pretty noisy! Also our flat screen tv was fuzzy. Not acceptable for top-notch technology. Aside from that, we had a great stay at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Gold, Schmold”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hilton because it was the site of a meeting I was attending and Hilton usually dishes out nice perks to Gold HHonors members even though Gold status is pretty easy to get. Typically, you get an upgraded room with Lounge access or coupons for free breakfast when you check in. I got neither. My floor was labeled â€œHilton HHonors Floorâ€� but there was no lounge and the rooms were pretty normal-looking. Since it wasnâ€™t an Executive Floor, there was also a charge for Wi-Fi: $14.95/day. (Unlike many hotels, it was not free in the public areas or the meeting rooms, either.) Room upgrades are at the discretion of management and usually hard to come by, so I didnâ€™t push for that. I also didnâ€™t bother asking for the breakfast coupons since I had breakfast meetings both days of my stay anyway. Ah, but the room key had a message that I should check at the Hilton Club desk for a â€œComplimentary Welcome Giftâ€�. What was it? Cookies? Bottled water? No, it was 500 HHonors points in return for being told about the Hilton Club theyâ€™re building- basically a Vacation Club. Conveniently, my husband was not with me but I was offered a bargain rate for 2 nights, plus a $100 AE Gift Card, if I brought him back so they could deliver the hard sell to both of us. Thanks, but no thanks. I was not told when I made my reservation (called the hotel directly) that the Fitness Center was closed for renovation. I happened to notice the announcement on the Web site when I was checking on my reservation, but there was also no mention of it when I checked in. The â€œreplacementâ€� was free use of Goldâ€™s Gym, a 5-minute walk away. Well, I guess if you want exercise, an additional 5-minute walk each way is OK. I just ran in nearby Central Park instead. (Can't argue with the hotel's location; great location.) A colleague with allergies requested a feather-free room when she made her reservation. They gave her one with feather pillows. It took her 3 calls to get it right- one to call it to their attention, one discussion with someone who took down her requirements, one to take away the feathered stuff and provide a substitute. My room was decent- for $300/night it should have been. The bill for 2 nights came to about $100 over that thanks to taxes (including a daily â€œJavits Center feeâ€�) and one dayâ€™s Internet access. They find a way to charge for everything- I was going to drop my duffel bag off with the bellhop for 15-20 minutes so I could find a deli and pick up lunch before I headed for meetings in Westchester after I checked out. The posted sign stated that there was a charge of $3.50 per bag. I hefted my bag onto my shoulder and walked to the deli. Sure, my boss would have approved the charge. I just resented a mandatory charge for something which should be provided for an optional tip. Despite the fact that I heard languages other than English nearly every time I was in the elevator or the lobby, all signs were in English and nothing but English. The attitude of this hotel seems to be, â€œYouâ€™re in the greatest city in the world. Youâ€™re gonna pay for it. You got a problem with that?â€�

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive renovation”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the downtown Hilton Sept. 14-18. Booked a standard queen non-smoking room and as expected in NY City the room was small. However, it had obviously been recently renovated which more than made up for the size. All the new furnishings were of high quality and well-designed to take advantage of the smaller space. There was even a night light below the bedside table that came on automatically at night when getting out of bed in the dark. A small but very handy feature. The bathroom was also small but very well-designed to take advantage of the limited space. No tub, but a large glass enclosed shower with excellent water pressure. Housekeeping was excellent with the room being serviced by noon each day. Enjoyed room service a couple of times. Expensive, but delivered quickly and very good quality. Overall, I would highly recommend this property now that the renovations are completed and having seen what a superb job they did on the whole project.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but I expected more from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bwco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a Saturday night. We got a great deal on our room through an online site. The room was very clean. I disagree with what other reviewers wrote about the location being convienent. If you are going into NYC for the theater, the hotel is a considerable walk from the theater district. There are other hotels that are a comparable value closer to Times Square. I agree with what the previous reviewer wrote about the mini bar prices. I know this is a Hilton, but $7.75 for a beer from the mini bar? Are they kidding? I know that there is going to be a markup on liquor, but lets be reasonable. There is liquor store on 54th street between 5th and 6th. Additionally there is a small deli about 2 blocks up on 6th or try the grocer on the east side of the street. We stayed on the 6th floor and the ice machine did not work. If you are staying at a Hilton, you should not have to go from floor to floor to find a working ice machine. We also had a problem with the door card not working. We had to go down to the front desk and get new ones made up. We got a good deal here. We got more than what we paid for. However, this is a hotel that bills itself as a 4 star hotel. If I were paying $300 or $400 per night, these items would have been unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need remodel and enlargement!!!”
Reviews.Author: paimcw
Reviews.Content: Myself and my teenage son were there for a 3 night stay, Thurs-Sunday. Our room was on the 'Executive' level, 44th Floor. If this was the executive room, I am unable to fathom the rooms below the 44th floor. This is an old hotel and begs for a modern interior designer. The window draperies look like they were snatched from a southern plantation. The A/C and heating is one unit below the window with unreadable knobs for the fan and temperature. Of course, the higher the fan, the louder the rattle from the unit. To get between the bed and TV armoire to see out the window, we had to turn sideways. The size of this room may have been adequate in the 1930's, but surely not for the 21rst Century. I cannot even begin to describe the bathrrom. Suffice it to say that the 70+ year old, painted-over rusting vent above the bath speaks for itself in more ways than one.(rattle, click, etc.) If your suite/room is even half way down the hall from the executive lounge, get ready to be awakened by the long line of talkative people waiting to be seated in the lounge. You can insist on a coupon to have the same continental breakfast at the Marketplace on the main level. When we arrived in our room, the lidded ice bucket was full of water! This about states it all for room cleanliness. I wanted ice in my glass and found an UNwindowed heavy metal door with an ice sign on it--This is a huge housekeeping service room with stacked dirty room trays, hanging Hilton robes, as well as many other housekeeping supplies. There is also as elevator for staff use. As a single woman, I felt very unsafe in this utility/housekeeping room. Anyone could have been waiting in there or entered and accosted me. I should have tried the elevator in this ice/utility room for easier access to the main level. There are a total of 6 guest elevators in the hotel, 3 are for the lower levels, 3 for the higher levels. Take a magazine to wait for the constantly operating rides. The elevators do have a small TV with CNN on it which you may enjoy when the elevator door closes and then you figure out it is not moving and you cannot get out immediately! The next day there was an out-of-order sign with caution tape on it. There are no vending room amenities here, just room service and the stocked in-room bar. For $3.75 you can get a 1.5 oz Kit Kat Bar, 6 Oreos, 2.07 oz Snickers, 1.75 oz Chex Mix or the big one---3 oz of Planters Peanuts for $4.75! & 1.5 oz Pringles $4.25. Single serve Poland Spring Water $4.75, Heinekin $8.00, 1/2 bottle of Kendall Jackson Chardonney $25.00. You can request a small room refrigerator but be sure to go to the ice machine room and get cleaning supplies for it because ours was filty inside and out and it looked like they dropped it from the 5th floor! Well I guess it was to fit the ambiance of the room? The in-room movie selection had way too many porn-lover selections. If you have kids, there is no video/arcade/gaming room here either. The exterior of this Hilton LOOKS magnificant; they spent mega-bucks for the first few levels of the exterior. The first few levels above the lobby are set-up for convention type arenas. The lobby also looks grand but apparently has no housekeeping staff assigned to it on a regular basis. At times the lobby is like a mini Penn Station. There are retail stores lining the corridor, along with a few, priced higher than others, restaurants and tons of fellow travelers everywhere. Walk less than a block up 6th Ave & on opposite side is a grocer, get a room refrig. and endure. Hotel is within walking distance of subway, 1/1 1/2 blocks. This hotel is obviously geared toward the 'convention' business crowd. Hundreds of people trying to get on/off the elevators at the same time, etc. then hanging out and getting obnoxious in the bar off the lobby. If you are going with your family for a short holiday/vacation, believe me, you can do MUCH better. The only good thing about this Hilton is its' location. This is the 2nd worse Hilton I have ever been at, the 1rst one being Hilton Heathrow/London!!! Good Luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-Town Location”
Reviews.Author: TTYSE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business on September 5th and 6th, and stayed two extra nights to enjoy NYC with my boyfriend. I had a one bedroom with a king bed on the 22nd floor. The room was large by NYC standards, and was clean and modern (though some of the lower floors appear to not have been updated). The hotel is huge and very busy, but is in a great mid-town location - walking distance to Central Park, the MOMA, Radio City, Rockefeller Center and shops along Madison and 5th. The staff was generally very helpful, and the concierge was great at booking a dinner reservation. It was expensive and next time I would probably choose a smaller boutique hotel for the $, but I had a really pleasant stay. As an aside, I was there during Fashion Week and saw a ton of celebrities in the area around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An average and anonymous 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for a conference and experienced no major problems during my stay but would probably not stay here again during my next visit to New York. On the positive side, the location of the hotel is superb, the staff was forthcoming, and the room was excellent. However, probably due to the sheer size of this hotel, the place had quite an anonymous feel and the level of service provided was not what I would expect from a hotel in this category. My most important problems with this hotel during my stay were the following; 1) The huge lobby was dirty with trash piling up around sofas and tables without these areas being cleaned. 2) I had to wait way too long for elevators of which there are not enough. 3) When it was raining outside, the hotel was not able to provide me with an umbrella, something, which has never happened to me before at a 2*+ rated hotel. 4) The wireless internet service is not only ridiculously expensive but also ridiculously slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Mhhzc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a 1 bed suite on the 43rd floor. The room had a great view of Central Park and access to the Executive Lounge. The room seemed dated but OK. There was a catalogue of mainly small problems which highlighted the poor service offered by the staff at this hotel. We had to request a crib but it took three phone calls to housekeeping. The in room safe did not work so we had to use the safety deposit at reception. We used the sofa bed but could not find any spare sheets despite us being a party of five. This time only two calls were needed to housekeeping. Not a big deal but you should not really need to ask for the same thing more than once. The biggest problem was coming back to the room on the second day and the keys did not open the door. I got new keys cut at the reception but these did not work either so had to go back to reception (which takes some time as there are too few lifts). It turned out that the door lock had broken and it needed a locksmith but being Saturday night they could not get someone until Monday. The security guard suggested we call security every time we needed to access the room! He said he would get someone to call us to organise a new room - of course no-one called us. After complaining at reception we were moved the next day. I suggested to reception that we had a few glitches and it would be good if the manager could call us so that I could share my comments. I was not surprised when the manager did not call. If I had tried two or three times maybe he would have done. Having said all of that the location was convenient. It was only one of a handful of hotels that could accommodate 5 in a suite (at a non-stratospheric rate) and the executive lounge facilities were pretty good. However, as a result of the low levels of service it is not a hotel I will be returning to in a rush.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: CathyWhittall
Reviews.Content: We booked a two room (non Smoking) suite for 4 nights for our family of 5 as part of a holiday to US, taking in Las Vegas, New York and Boston. The hotel room was dated, needed renovation, and worst of all was extremely smoky. They couldn't give us the rooms they promised us, and we then the five of us spent the next 4 nights crammed into a small standard room. There are only 3 lifts up to the executive floors, which are full of angry people pushing into the lifts. Not a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton = Nondescript”
Reviews.Author: Krista_E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in August, and was once again impressed that Hilton hotels, no matter where they are located, are incredibly nondescript. I had no real complaints -- the room was nicely decorated, the beds and bedding comfortable, the bath clean, and the TV worked. Internet is available but expensive (more than the going rate of $10 a day -- why it is usually free at cheaper hotels, I have no idea). The room, a double on the 18th floor, was small. Not much room to move around the two beds, small desk and side chair. I didn't use the dining, except the Starbucks that was located downstairs and competitively priced (for New York) and a lobby bar. My companion ate at the Marketplace Cafe in the lobby, and spent over $30 for a breakfast buffet she found unremarkable. In general, the hotel was fine, but unless you need to stay there, or are seeking an entirely undistinguished stay, you can probably do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, ok everything else”
Reviews.Author: laleitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the hotel for 5 nights, and I loved the location. Honestly though, for the price everything else was mediocre to no-so good. The rooms were what you expect from a hotel of this class with well appointed furnishings and comfy beddings. The hotel bars/restaurants were ok but overpriced, as were the other services offered including internet. My major problem with this hotel came when we turned the air conditioning up at night (for some reason the room always got stuffy at night despite digital temperature controls). In the morning we awoke to giant disgusting dust bunnies all over a chair, part of one bed, and some of our things. When we called the desk to complain, they said they would send someone up to clean it. Only the usual housekeeping came, and they didn't do much to clean it up or to make sure it wouldn't happen again. As I packed my things there were still some dust bunnies around. I was too exhausted from conferencing to argue with the management to have them actually DO something about it- one call should have been enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location !”
Reviews.Author: Lindak1221
Reviews.Content: The greatest thing about this hotel is location. We walked everywhere: maybe 5 blocks to central park where we rented a bike & ran, 3-4 blocks to broadway shows, 8-10 blocks to the river, shopping is also close, and a starbucks on every block, not to mention the street vendors with fruit, bfast rolls, etc. We loved our visit to Manhattan. Prices were costly there, but they are everywhere in NY. We didn't eat in the Hilton restaurants but had drinks in the lounge bar and the big bar (they both give you nuts/pretzels with your drinks). Our view wasn't great. The room was adequately sized and the bathroom was clean tho small. Becuz of construction our windows wouldn't open. The gym was also closed due to construction, so we went to central park to exercise. Fluffy towels, comfy bed, big screen tv, shelves in closet. I LOVED our weekend in Manhattan. We were so busy doing stuff that we didn't spend much time in the room, but I would recommend this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: traveller19526
Reviews.Content: Quite disappointed with this hotel. Room clean and nice but windows did not open because of some work being done to the outside??, small bathroom, staff at reception not friendly apart from one, absolutely overpriced in everything: internet $15.00 a day, breakfast too expensive and it cost $3.50 per bag to leave in luggage room when checking in or out of hotel. Gym was closed for renovation. Overall not up to Hilton standard and would certainly not go back. Very average

Reviews.Title: “Really good midtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: camnyc
Reviews.Content: Great location in midtown: right by the MoMa, central park, shopping on Madison Ave, Rockefeller Center, subways, etc. I have stayed here several times, and compared to other hotels in the area, the rooms are an average size, seem very new and very clean, are quiet, beautifully decorated, have extremely comfortable beds, gorgeous views and a very clean bathrooms. Doormen are helpful hailing cabs for you, carrying bags, etc. I very highly recommend this hotel to any tourist or business traveler visiting NY. Out of the dozen or so (non-boutique) hotels in this area that I've stayed in, this is the absolutely the best.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more...”
Reviews.Author: islebutterfly79
Reviews.Content: Here I expected the Hilton New York to be this grand, wonderful, elegant hotel with the finest service....I was wrong. My poor experience may be due to the fact that I'm not a New Yorker and infact had never been to New York before. Just getting to the hotel was an adventure. My taxi driver didn't speak English very well but miraculously seemed to know all the words to the Britney Spears song that came on the radio. For about 3 minutes, we both sat bobbing our heads to the beat, it was very amusing. When we got to the hotel and I tried to pay him with a credit card, his demeanor changed from funny cab driver that sings Britney spears to mean driver who doesn't take credit cards. He gave me a big ol attitude, even though I was putting the card away and grabbing cash. I paid and he left. Interesting. The Hilton hotel check-in lady was extremely unhappy with her life and just couldn't break a smile for anything. Even when I flashed a bright smile asking "is this where I check in?" Stupid questions will get you nowhere in New York apparently. I got my room key and was directed to a specific set of elevators that would take me to my floor. I got to the room and was pleasantly surprised to find how comfy and cozy it wasâ€¦especially compared to the check-in lady. My room was super cool. The bed was the softest I'd ever jumped on and the mini-bar was fully stocked. The view from my room was neatâ€¦all sorts of tall buildings. I had the window open to hear the bustling of the cityâ€¦meaningâ€¦car horns. =) The TV. in the room was HUGE; I really liked that. The bathroom was pretty, but very small. There are three restaurants in the hotel, but thank god I'd managed to find a starbucks in the lobby. Who needs 10 oz. steaks when you can get a tuna sandwich and iced coffee? Iced coffee please. I decided to brave the city that first afternoon which then quickly turned into late evening and I hadn't eaten dinner yet. My feet were sore, so I decided to order room service. I ordered the Pappardelle Pasta with Meatballs, tomatoes and basil. It cost me a whopping thirty bucks! But you know what? It was brought to me by a well-mannered man in a nice suit, the table was set quite nicely and it just made me feel special. The room service guy pushed the table right up to the bed in front of the T.V. He was very polite, nothing like the check-in lady, and so I tipped him well. At least I hope 6 bucks is well. I delicately laid the napkin on my lap and dug in. There were more meatballs than I could handleâ€¦.which says a lot about this dish. It was deliciousâ€¦.not quite 30 bucks delicious, but delicious none-the-less. A word of advice on room serviceâ€¦.I learned this while making my orderâ€¦when you're perusing the dessert menu and it says "New York Style Cheesecake---$11.95", they mean one sliceâ€¦not an entire cheesecake. Overall, my stay was not wonderful...but ok. I thought I'd get better treatment from the check-in staff. The room service guy was the only one who smiled at me. My opinion is the Hilton New York isn't worth what you're paying per night.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: Runningmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of six booked a suite at the Hilton New York. We had two Queen beds and a pull-out sofa, which was perfect for the family. Overall, we found this hotel to be excellent. Although this Hilton seems to be primarily a business hotel, we found many families there as well. The location in mid-town is great - convenient to Times Square, shopping, Central Park, Rockafeller Center, subway stops, etc. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and professional. After 10 pm, guests are required to show their room cards in order to get into the hotel lobby. Our suite was on the 43rd floor and we had access to the lounge, where we had a complimentary breakfast daily. Breakfast consisted of bagels, cold cereals, sweet pastries, and fresh fruit, as well as juice, coffee and tea. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little expensive at times”
Reviews.Author: RawwDogg
Reviews.Content: Located in midtown, so for business its perfect. Otherwise the trendy parts of Manhattan are a taxi/subway ride away. The hotel has 3 restaurants, the main one is too expensive, the middle one isn't good, but the bar is pretty decent. The gym has every you would need for a weary business travelers and the rooms are bigger then most New York hotels. If you can attain some status in Hilton Honors you will usually be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: woofoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on priceline for $100 a night by naming our own price. Granted this was in 2003, but I'm sure you could still get a good price today. The hotel was in a great location near subways, Radio City Music Hall & Rockefeller Center. The room was very nice and clean and roomy. Our view of course was sensational. The lobby was very nice and so were any employees we ran into. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “hated it! They treat Diamond Members like doodoo”
Reviews.Author: rbars
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for over 2 weeks and should have checked out after the first day. My room was so HOT! When I called to complain- they told me to open the window! In New York City with all the street noise, I don't think so. The elevators are so slow that the average wait was literally a full 5 minutes. I asked for a newspaper to be waiting outside my door- they told me where I could buy my papers. As a Diamond member, I hope to better, I can't imagine what the average unexpected traveler would be treated like. If you enjoy being ignored, small rooms, small showers and lots of crowded elevators-this is the place for you.I'll stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pretty decent stay”
Reviews.Author: drw_ok
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights on the executive floor. The room was nice and clean, although like most NYC hotels not that big. We had a family of four so we reserved a room with two double beds. The beds are small, and there is no extra floor space, but it was certainly adequate. The hotel is in an excellent location. Very central to any part of midtown. When we arrived, the employees were in the middle of a union related work stoppage. I have to give credit to the hotel management for bringing in staff from other hilton properties to keep things going. There was really no impact to the guests because of this. The stoppage ended shortly after we got there without incident. I will second the previous comments about the elevator situation. When the hotel is crowded (which it was every day we were there), it sometimes took up to 15 minutes to get an elevator. This is a BIG hotel, and there are alot of people going in and out. We chose not to eat at any of the hotel restaurants. The prices are way too high. Also, keep in mind that within an easy walking distance there are at least 100+ of some of the best restaurants in the country, many of which are quite reasonable. Perhaps the best place to eat is the gyro cart stand right across the street on the SW corner of 53rd and 6th avenue. Sometimes there were 30 or 40 people waiting in line. Overall we had a pretty good stay. I would have no concerns about staying here again. Although the next time we stay in this area I will probably try some place smaller as I typically like small hotels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: traveling-family36
Reviews.Content: This is a big, busy, hotel, but you can't beat the location. Great views from some rooms, very convenient breakfast on the executive level. Rooms are very comfortable and very clean. The only problem is the busy elevators - just allow extra time in the mornings. One of our best stays in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: mrspodge
Reviews.Content: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin - the location is central for most things to see and do on Manhattan, the lobby/reception is fabulous, the staff are all very polite and efficient, the room well equiped and modern and with the most comfortable bed (essential after walking miles daily) and a clean bathroom. Even better on the morning of our departure, we discovered we could check-in on-line for our flight from free kiosks in the lobby area....! Fantastic idea - saved us time and aggravation at the airport and gave us precious extra time in NYC! This hotel is not cheap by any stretch of the imagination, but we felt it worth every penny, for the comfort/quality it provided. BUT, the cost of eating at the hotel is outrageous, we did try the breakfast buffet one morning, but at $26 per person we expected a greater choice than we got. However, it does have an extensive Japanese buffet choice, so if that was your breakfast of choice then you may feel differently. Rather than opt for breakfast here again, we went to a previously visited diner - Burger Heaven, which offers a good choice of menu and a more 'authentic' NYC breakfast! If it is was a toss up between staying here again and another similar hotel in the same block, I would probably say go with the Sheraton, but only because they do have a fantastic breakfast buffet and isn't breakfast supposed to be the most important meal of the day!?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I didn't expect it to be as nice when seeing it from the outside, but the room was great, I'm wondering if it was recently remodeled. A good size for a NY hotel room, and I've been in quite a few now. Very good for travelling with children...we had a 16, 13 and 7 year old and they accomodated the 5 of us very well. Central to many NY locations, Times Square, 5th Ave Shops, Central Park, great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “31st Birthday in New York”
Reviews.Author: nathe1
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in New York for holiday. This hotel is a busy hotel close to the South side of Central Park and Rockerfeller Centre. Can walk easily to the 5th Ave shopping area and Times Square. The hotel itself was very good. The main receptiion area was always busy as you may expect for such a large hotel. There are nice bars but very expensive. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going on holiday purely for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: manilow
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Radio City Music Hall, within a few minutes walk - just sorry there were no concerts on when we were there! Central Park just minutes over the road. The hotel itself was fine. Very busy with lots of conventions and business people. Check in was as you would expect from New York. The room was quite small - there was a sofa situated at an angle, which was strange as it took up lots of room - probably best without that and just a chair instead. Bathroom looked new, but again very small. We tried the restaurant for breakfast on the first morning - you learn by your mistakes - it was very expensive - and confusing! From then on, we tried a cafe to the left of the hotel - excellent breakfast and very reasonable. Overall, a nice hotel, but maybe a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: ackz
Reviews.Content: Our party of eight (four adults, four kids ages 9 - 12) stayed at the Hilton New York from June 28 - July 2 and had a very nice experience, overall. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and were reasonably large by New York standards. Check in was efficient, extra towels arrived promptly, daily housekeeping was very good. The only real drawback was the elevator service. Four elevators service the 24th - 34th floors, and at busy times it took us as long as 15 minutes to get to the lobby from 26. As a party of eight, we began squeezing into already packed elevators two at a time, or going up to the 34th floor to go down to the lobby (a strategy adopted by a lot of guests). The location is great! There is a grocery store and a Duane Reade one block north on 6th Ave, which allowed us to avoid the overpriced hotel sodas, water, coffee, snacks, etc. The Astro diner, also one block north, was a great place for an inexpensive breakfast. If you are traveling with kids, be aware that drinks are not refilled for free - something we learned when the bill reflected $24 for 8 ojs! We walked to many attractions and were easily able to get a cab at the hotel when we needed one. The Broadway and Lexington subway lines are also easliy accessible. I would absolutely stay at this property again, particularly with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Liskas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and Times Square. I stayed here with two friends for three nights, spacious room with two double beds with the most comfortable mattress toppers, pillows and duvets. Plenty of storage space and an abundance of clean towels and lovely Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom products. We had a great view from the 21st floor, our room was on the corner so we could see up to Central Park! The continental breakfast was really nice. Plenty of fresh fruit, yogurts, cereal and rolls with jams or my favourite, cream cheese and smoked salmon. The staff were really polite and helpful. You will get a taxi outside the Lobby within seconds. I am a fussy traveller and I highly recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Artistseye
Reviews.Content: Boy do I second that! We're almost at the end of our week long stay at the NY Hilton - it's our first and our last. I will say first that the best part of it all have been the bellmen. They have been super! The rest of it though has been a bad experience. We were gold when we got here (now finally diamond) and of course no upgrade but we were reluctantly given the free breakfast coupons for the continental breakfast when my husband requested them. But boy you get what you pay for! The service in the restaurant is terrible! When they see your breakfast coupons there is a noticable sneer. There are no clear boundries between continental and full buffet... and believe me they watch you like a hawk to make sure you don't get the wrong items. I erred one day and had a nice $11.95 upcharge on my ticket. Today was the worst... had to ask repeatedly for coffee initially, then beg for refills... never did get a juice refill, didn't bus the table... lots of waiters just kind of wandering around. The room itself is acceptable though we have some kind of utility closet in front so it's a weird shape. I'd think that even gold status would garner a better room but it seems not. The decor is nice, good Hilton bedding, nice artwork are the big pluses... but don't outweigh the minuses... closets that are too narrow to close with a suit hanging straight inside, paper thin interior walls, room service trays with funky food sitting in the hallways for 18 + hours.... The business center is more like a NON business center. Nothing is self serve so you wait in line, then find out you can have copies made or send a fax but don't even think about asking to scan a document! (this has been our experience at other Hiltons as well but just not delivered with quite as much attitude as at this one). I was also badgered by the slick little sales weasel trying to push the Hilton Club crap... I try to be polite but finally just turned and walked away because he kept giving me the hard sell under the guise of a free gift card. If I wanted the timeshare pitch I'd go to a free resort... not a $299/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KatGayle
Reviews.Content: This hotel I was not fond of....My room needed a major renovation...esp. considering the price. The sink had tape under it connecting the sink to the drain...not a nice view from the bath. The employees were not friendly, with the exception of the ones that were selling something...A cup of tea in the restaurant was $5.00...Had a much better and more comfortable stay at the Westin last year, the staff their was very friendly and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “New York Girlfriend's Outing”
Reviews.Author: Mamamerk
Reviews.Content: Luckily, one of our foursome had enough points to redeem 3 nights at this hotel. It is expensive. The bar is expensive as well. Go outside to one of the street vendors for soft drinks, bagels, or bottled water. Also, go outside and make a left and you will come across some small bars. The Hilton is in an awesome location. You can get to anything you want from there. You are a couple of blooks from Central Park, 5th Avenue, Broadway. In fact, if you are a walker, you can walk down to Ground Zero (it is a hike though). Check in was very good. Easy and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you'd expect from a mega convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: ne2momo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at the New York Hilton with a group of 42. Since this was part of a package connected with a performance at Carnegie Hall, we were'nt given a choice of hotels and the New York Hilton was chosen for us. I've been a fan of Tripadvisor for several years, so I immediately checked out the hotel on the site. I must agree with what most have said - the location is perfect. Very convenient to just about everything. One thing to be aware of is that some of the rooms have been updated and some haven't. The first room we were given was on the 6th floor and had furniture that was rather dinged up and no room safe (they do offer free safes in the lobby, but what a hassle). I requested a move due to needing a safe and they moved us to the 17th floor. Along with the safe, this room had much nicer and newer furniture. One strange thing is that the 6th floor room had a flat screen TV and the 17th floor didn't. So I'm not quite sure what the plan for updating is at the NY Hilton. The restaurants within the hotel are rediculously expensive and obviously just for those traveling on an expense account. I didn't dine in any of them but can't imagine them being worthy of the prices they charge. There are many better options in the surrounding area. One of my favorites is Angelo's Coal Oven Pizza on 57th. We ate there a a group and the food and service were wonderful (great salads and pastas as well as their famous pizza) and the prices are fair. Maid service was a little spotty - we had to ask for coffee twice, and the bolster pillows were left off the beds after the first morning. But nothing too drastic. There are so many great hotels in Manhattan and this one is quite expensive. I'd probably stay somewhere else if I was booking my own room. But if you find yourself at the NY Hilton, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: edelmacd
Reviews.Content: just stayed in the hilton new york on 6th and 54th great location walking distance to almost everywhere cabs are cheap to anywhere from here! there is a cab stand outside the hotel so you never have to wait for a cab the check in staff are not the greatest if you are lucky you will find a helpful one. the concierges are great very helpful we stayed on the 21st floor in a deluxe double double which was very spacious and newly decorated it had a flat 30" LCD TV no noise from traffic really because you are so high up rooms are air conditioned which is great rooms were spotless and were cleaned every day the internet wireless connection is very unstable i wouldn't recommend it and it is very slow we got a cab from jfk which cost about 50-55 dollars including a tip and back again very simple mode of transport i would recommend this hotel and i have high standards!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Binkette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 sisters and Mum for a birthday trip to new york. We all stayed in 1 room with 2 double beds. The room was a grand size, spactious, but not large. This hotel is a very busy, 'business' hotel with a lot of traffic going through the hotel each day. its a good hilton hotel, but too busy and train station like to receive a personal service. what is great about this hotel is the location. Its right in the heart of things, so for shopping, sight seeing, eating out and visiting shows, its all on the door step. i would recommend this hotel for a sight seeing / shopping trip to NYC - it is not for those who want real luxury or a romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York - Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: mrmatt07
Reviews.Content: Check-in: The line was fairly short, and the enormous lobby front desk assures that anyone who needs assistance will be quickly helped. The room was pretty small, but that can be expected for a New York hotel. (Note: we had 2 double beds, so our room probably had less floor space compared to others). Our view was okay, we looked out onto the roof of the lobby and 6th Ave., and could see Radio City down the street. The room was not spacious but was well equipped. The location was the best part. We were just minutes from the Rockefeller Center and Times Square by foot. Would recommend this hotel to families, since that's who I went with. There's also a small Broadway ticket box in the lobby that will assist you in finding and buying tickets, even to sold-out and hard to find shows (just be prepared to pay extra sometimes).

Reviews.Title: “Central business hotel giant”
Reviews.Author: M747
Reviews.Content: Stayed here toether with 5 collagues for a business trip. This is one of the larger hotels in New york and really nothing to complain about. My room was rather small but absolutely ok. I have stayed at this hotel previously and at that time the rooms were much larger. Then I was HH Gold but now I have been sowngraded to Slver so prehaps htat eas why. I usually prefer the Times Square Hilton to this one, It has larger rooms and amore personal tuch. The internet service is terrible, I also remember this from my last stay here, It is slow and very unstable

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: marycbyrd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at this Hotel. It was in a perfect location to just about everything, walking a must, cab service was always available. The night staff in the Market Place Restaurant (ASK FOR SUSAN, SHE WAS THE BEST) was very friendly and prompt, even going in at closing!! Great desserts. Breakfast was pricey, even for kids. Elevators extremely slow, you can't be in a hurry especially late at night. I did find that the walls were a little "thin" we could hear everything from the room next door, we were on the 23rd floor, street noise was not a bother. Careful at the lobby bar, they ARE NOT friendly and expect great tips for lousy service. I did request the bathroom to be cleaned each day, it never was. Comfortable beds and nice bedding. Don't hesitate to use the concierge service, they were always helpful. Stay away from the magazine recommendations in the lobby, remember they are paying to be in those "highlights". We were there with 29 teenagers and all was fine. Check in and out was pleasant. Would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: denverista
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in early June 2007, after much research on Trip Advisor and other sites and was not disappointed. Booked a deluxe room, on 30th floor, well above most traffic noise. The room was spotless, with everything in working order, very comfortable bed, and good ventilation (even if the windows are closed). Used the kiosk in the lobby to check in, and the zip check out on the phone to check out, thus avoiding lines at the desk (which didn't look long, actually). Easy 1.5 block walk to MoMA and Folk Art Museum. Ten dollar cab ride to the Metropolitant Museum of Art. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, including Bobby Flay's Bar Americain. Food at the hotel is pricey-- 18 bucks for a burger-- but there are smaller spots for breakfast, lunch right across from the hotel. The fitness facility could use a rowing machine, but has plenty of newer treadmills and ellipticals, as well as free weights and a nice locker room.

Reviews.Title: “I recommended!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kissbay
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel and great location. The room was super clean and it smells like brand new very modern and the concierge desk staff know everything we asked them the kind of food we wanted to eat and they gave us directions to the restaurant they were all walking distance the staff was great!! It was the best hotel me and my family ever stayed at and we travel 3-4 times a year for pleasure it was the best!!!!!! now if you have more than four people in your family its hard to get a taxi, or to get a horse ride around central park everything is 4or less even a hotel room the hilton was the only hotel that accepted me and my family we were a party of 5

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel Will Return”
Reviews.Author: BostonRae
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in NYC. The Hilton New York was my 2nd choice of hotels. I had wanted to stay in Times Square, but after reading the reviews here, decided to give the Hilton a try. I still like the "glitz" of staying in Times Square, however this hotel lived up to reviewers comments. I requested a renovated room on a high floor as was suggested here on Trip Advisor. I would suggest doing the same thing as they are much nicer rooms. The beds were quite comfortable as were the pillows - if you didn't like the 1st one, there were 4 to choose from on each bed! The room was big by New York standards, with a 30" wide screen TV. Our remote had a mind of it's own, and it was my fault for not asking for another. The outside wall is all windows which is quite nice. There is a small ledge around the windows that you can sit on. The windows were sealed shut while we were there since they were doing some work on the outside of the building, otherwise they would normally be able to be opened. I saw that another reviewer complained about this, but there is a sticker on each window of the room explaining and appologizing for the inconvenience. The view was not that great as you are surrounded by other large buildings and a Sheraton across the street from our room. We had a small slice of 53rd and 6th from our room - 3331. However this is pretty typical in a city of very tall buildings. The bathroom is very small. Only 1 person at a time, and in order to sit on the toilet, you have to close the door unless you want to straddle it while on the pot. The countertop and sink area is also quite small. However, the shower had very good pressure and the shower head was very large making showers very nice compared to many other hotels. Amenities included shampoo, moisterizer, a shower cap (does anyone really use these??) and 2 small bars of soap. The bar we used at the sink, did last the whole trip. However, if you like your own bar for the shower/bath, bring your own. My only complaints are small, and again, I didn't bring them up to the hotel. One of the garbage cans was not emptied one day, one day we were not given clean glasses and the soap dish was never cleaned. New bars of soap were not provided. Our room was always cleaned by late morning (we left the room by 9:00). We always had plenty of towels. The front dest wasn't real quick at check-in. There always seemed to be a line by mid-morning and through the afternoon. Being a Hilton Honors Member, I was able to by-pass the long line. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be close to many attractions and just a bit off the "beaten path". Times Square is a 10 minute walk, Rockefeller Center is 5 minute walk down 6th Avenue as is Central Park just 6 blocks north on 6th. Broadway and the theatres are a 15 minute walk. There were many near by subway stations to choose from. You can always get a cab at the hotel. There seemed to be a constant line of cabs on the street, waiting to be signaled by the doormen. Note - if you are looking for directions, stop at the Concierge and they have preprinted instructions for getting to the WTC, Little Italy and Chinatown. They have what trains to take, which ones to transfer to if need be and where to pick them up. I'm sure they have instructions for other main areas of Manhattan as well. I booked our room directly with the property for variable rates of $299/269/249 a nite over Memorial Day weekend. I looked at 3 Travel sites, but the best rates were through the hotel directly. (plus you can specify what you want when booking direct. ie: high floor, renovated room, a view) Considering the location, size of the room, quality of the room, and the property, I'd say it was a decent price. Another plus is there are 3 kisoks in the lobby from which you can check in and print your boarding pass for most major airlines, for free. The rooms did have TV internet access, but we didn't try this and I don't know what it costs. If you are looking for a place to eat close by, the Stage Deli on 7th has excellent corn beef sandwiches that are absolutely huge (2 people can easily share 1 sandwich). If you like seafood, McCormack and Schmick's on 52nd and 6th is very reasonable and very good. An added plus; they have outdoor seating as well. Lindy's on the corner of 53rd and 7th has good quick food. I'd stay away from the hotel restaurants as they were quite pricey as was room service. We ordered 2 appetizers (buffalo wings and chicken fingers) and a coke. With tip, the bill was $57.00! There are many great small eateries in the nearby area to choose from. Nothing is cheap in New York, but for the most part, you get decent size servings, but be prepared to pay a bit more than you're used to. I would definately return to this hotel in the future. I think I would try to get a higher floor, and a room that faces 6th Avenue if possible for a little more of a view.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite New York hotel - Especially when I use points to pay”
Reviews.Author: Statmans
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of NYC hotels. For my needs, the Hilton on 6th and 53rd is the best location in the city. Close enough to the park, times square, 5th ave shopping, subway lines and everything else I need. However this place is EXPENSIVE. If I were paying for the room, I might go on priceline or some other discount site to find more reasonable accomidations. But I travel alot for business, and always stay at Hilton value properties (Hampton Inns, Homewood Suites, etc) to accumulate points. Then once or twice a year I cash in points and plan an NYC trip. As a diamond member of Hitlon Honors, I accumulate points fairly quickly. And I also don't have to worry about long check in lines. I use the diamond desk and am always on my way within a few minutes of check in. This time the room wasnt ready - no biggie - its NYC. Plenty to do. The luggage check room said $3.50 per bag, but if your checking in they dont charge. There wasnt room at the executive floors (I dont know why - I reserved 6 months ago and tried to check in before 11) but other than the free snacks, I got the better end of the deal. The rooms on floor 30 were just redone, and were terrific. If you get a deal on the hotel, use points or feel the location is worth the cost, you cant do better than the Hilton on 6gh

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: aytu
