Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent room, excellent location Ä°t was our first time in this hotel and we were very happy to see more than what we expected. Congratulaions, The reception was very noisy but good service Ä°f 'll return to ny Ä± will certainly stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not Disclosed: Windows don't open on half the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpvanlee
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Hilton member, and after multiple stays in the NY area, this is the WORST. First, no where on the website is it disclosed that the windows on one side of the hotel don't open. Every time I stayed here before they did. There is some type of renovation going on, so they literally screwed the windows shut on half the side of the hotel (ASK when you reserve so you know which side if that is important to you). I called the front desk as soon as I got to my room, and some guy named Charles was a total [---], told him I was Diamond, and asked to change to the other side of the hotel, he said the hotel was booked solid. Now I know not too many people really care about an opening window, so I told him (since it was about 9 pm) just put me on the other side since I had not used the toilet, bed, etc. He said no way. Well I was tired from a long trip so I decided to just make the best of it. This hotel advertises itself at the BIGGEST in New York, yet when I went downstairs for a cocktail (Sunday Night), the Bridges Bar was closed for the day, and the other one shut down at midnight. This is a complete joke. If this is supposed to be a prime hotel in a prime area, what is management thinking that in the Big Apple that you can't get outside your room past 12:00 am for a drink or food, except for room service.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: phillyrx
Reviews.Content: As all other reviews, I'm extremely particular and reserve the 5 rating only for amazing places. The Hilton New York was not too far from that. If there was a 4 1/2 star, I'd give it that. The service: The staff here was great! From the people outside to the front desk and maid staff, everyone was extremely friendly. I booked the room through priceline and got a great deal. Then I found out the room was for a standard queen, so I asked if I could change it to a king being that it was our honeymoon. The lady at the front desk put us in a deluxe king...very nice! When leaving for the airport the guys outside hailed us a cabby quickly and put our luggage in... The room: After reading some of the previous reviews I was a bit concerned. However, the rooms are beautiful. They had a nice flat-panel TV, comfortable bed, good couch, and well-appointed amenities throughout. The lights by the bed were quite interesting...a bit hard to describe but the first I've seen of it's kind. The bathroom wasn't the most spacious, but good enough. I especially liked the shower. There aren't many places that put the floor at little slant so the water drains easily. Overall, I thought the rooms were great. I would definitely stay here again, esp if I get a good deal on priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Another good visit”
Reviews.Author: w2889nj
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here multiple times. You really canâ€™t beat the location. Our room on the 43rd floor was on the small side but comfortable enough for my son and I. The hotel is within walking distance (or short taxi ride) to everything. Parking isnâ€™t cheap but Iâ€™ve paid more at other NYC hotels. If you want an inexpensive (i.e. â€œnormalâ€�) breakfast there is the 6th Avenue Deli, half a block past 57th towards Central Park. If you want something nice, â€œRue57â€� at 6th & 57 is worth a look. Since we were on the executive floors, the continental breakfast in the executive lounge was more than sufficient. The personnel I encountered were all pleasant and helpful. My only gripe (and minor at that) is the size of this particular room and bathroom (considering the price) and that the bathroom door was reminiscent of one you would see in a seaside motel â€“ paper thin and scratched up. Even the main door to the room had traces of oil stains on it from the closing mechanism. Other than that, the room was clean, quiet and comfortable. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: OmaGijsie
Reviews.Content: One of the loveliest hotels in Manhattan. The staff was gracious and helpful. The beds are luxurously soft and with extra pillows, extra comfy. Rooms are adequately sized and very clean and, of course, should be for the price. With all the groups of teens in the place there must be a discount somewhere I wasn't getting. Hotel is convenient to everything, theatres, stores (especially the American Girl Doll Store so it was really nice that the hotel staff was so nice to my granddaughter too), Rockafeller Center, the park, and St. Patricks, and I recommend the hotel for families as well as for business clients. I requested and got 2 double beds, no smoking. Great concierge service. Wonderful place to stay. The parking fees are ridiculously high though: $17.00 for an extra hour over the 24 even though we had been guests at the hotel was unbelievable. Still I plan to go back and stay again. Just make sure I watch the clock a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “all-around very nice”
Reviews.Author: rnjak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 05/05 to 05/07. This hotel is recently remodeled and is beautiful.Rooms were a good size. Every staff member was awesome. We had lots of towels each day for the four of us. The bar was nice, with expensive, but VERY tasty drinks. The waiter was GREAT! I would not recommend the Market breakfast buffet. It was outrageously priced for what you received. 17 or 18 dollars continental and $26 for the whole buffet. RIDICULOUS for a breakfast buffet. There are lots of other places to eat in NY for less.

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay at Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Keithowen
Reviews.Content: Was a very pleasant stay. Some reviews had me concerned, but quite honestly, the room and service was very good, the price was good, the amenities were good, and I didn't experience any rude, unfriendly employees. I was really blown away by how some of the reviews were so much different than I experienced. Guess their are people who expect more than I do, but I was treated very well. The room wasn't a remodeled one and had some age, but was very well kept. Couldn't ask for more than I got out of a 3-4 star hotel in NYC. Convient, clean, loved the Executive Club and for my family, saved us $30-40 a day in breakfast. Huge selection of muffins, crossiants, fresh fruit, cereals, juices, bagels, etc. Rated the stay an A.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: chicagolandgirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several hotels in NYC and many have been old and with very small rooms. We were very pleased with this hotel. It has a large lobby, hotel bar, and dining. The rooms were large for a NYC hotel, had a king size bed, desk, and couch. Bathroom was very update, very large shower with glasses doors. Only thing there was no blow dryer in our room. Great location, very close to theatres, central park, etc...Bed was very soft and comfortable. Will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Sadie_NB
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at our stay after reading some reviews. We arrived at 11:30 am with two young children, with the hotel check in time being 3 pm. While I gave my car to the valet, my spouse asked if we could check in. She was told our room wasn't ready. I travel for business frequently, so when arrived at the front desk, I asked someone else. He called up to housekeeping and found us a suite that was available on the 44th floor. When the incredible friendly bell hop got us to our room, I was happy to see a very large suite that fit two double beds and two cribs. The room was typically furnished for a Hilton. Absolutely fine. The doors on the rooms on the 44th Floor have a soft close. You can't slam these doors. Although the hotel was busy, I did not hear anyone else in the hallways or next door. The executive loung was very nice and better than most concierge lounges I have been in (though the drinks during cocktail hour are expensive). The continental breakfast was very good. Lots of fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, cereal. Get there early to get a table. We went to the marketplace restaurant. The service was very friendly and they catered to our children. The children menu was reasonably priced, the regular menu was overpriced. Bassed on our experience, I'd go back. We stayed at the W Union Square without kids last month and the Hilton was much better. When we left, I did see a long line at the check in or check out counter. Also long lines for taxis. Fortunately, we did not experience lines at all when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but front desk needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: monocle
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong: I like this hotel and will probably stay here again. The deluxe double room was great--spacious, well appointed (the lighting is particularly nice), HD tv, nice toiletries. However, the front desk is extremely slow moving. When we checked in at 9:30 pm on 4/21/07, only two people were manning the front desk, and many people had to wait too long to check in. For a hotel that costs $400/night, checking in should be a bit more expeditious.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine...”
Reviews.Author: Sweetshe
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Hilton. The location is great. I know everyone says that but if you stay even 2 blocks east or more, it's gets very tiring when coming "home" after a night of broadway, dining or shopping after being on your feet all day. When we arrived at 11am, our room was available. It was a non renovated king on the 27th floor. The room was fine, roomy, comfy bed, not too far from the elevator. The room itself did not smell, the bedspread was already folded at the foot of our bed which I liked since we automatically take them off when we arrive in hotels. It was very quiet except that I woke up in the middle of the night and was able to hear someone in another room snoring, but that was the only noise I heard. My only problem was the bathroom. It had a musty smell and I saw a hair in the tub but since we were only there one night, I did not plan on using it. The staff was very friendly. It is now $3.50 to store luggage but I hear that a lot of other hotels are now doing this. There is also a coffee place across 53rd street for morning coffee and a drugstore up 2 blocks in case you need anything. The grocery next to the drugstore is open late and will probably have everything you need (forgot a few things so we had to go around 11:30pm). I

Reviews.Title: “A far better experience than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: athensmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York April 13-16 (during the "monsoon"!) and had a very good experience. The hotel lobby is very nice, large and usually extremely busy. However, our check -in on Friday afternoon at 4:30 PM was very efficient, taking no more than a 10 minute wait. I had gotten room on Priceline and been guaranteed a non-smoking queen room (run of house). I called the Hilton the day prior to arrival and requested a KIng or 2 double bedded room. At check-in I again requested this and we were given a room with 2 double beds, handicapped access on a non-smoking floor (1420). The room was large, with large bathroom (as I have found most handicap access rooms to be), very nicely decorated with black "marble" counters, a flat screen TV, an easy chair, extremely comfortable beds with white striped duvet covers, and a large shower. The only thing missing was a tub (had shower only) because it was a handicap room, but this did not bother us. Everything was very clean--spotless bathroom with no mold anywhere. It was not a connecting room and was very quiet our entire stay, even with the housekeeping office across the hall. I am not sure if it was a renovated room or not--it was so nice that it appeared renovated, but the drapes were showing a little wear if you looked closely at them. At night, if you returned to the hotel after a certain time, the lobby was cordoned off to allow entrance into one door only and a security guard checked room keys as people entered--a nice service which made us feel safe. I was very happy with the Hilton New York and would absolutely stay there again if I could get a good price on Priceline .

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Tupelodan
Reviews.Content: If you can afford it, the Hilton New York is well worth it. I'll admit, we used my Hilton points to pay for 3 of our 4 nights, and I'm glad we did. The rooms are very nice and very comfortable -- and the best lighted room (lots of lights, lots of options) I've ever stayed in. The restaurant food is above average, but the best part of the whole deal is the service: it's the best I've experienced anywhere. We'll stay there on our next trip, even if I have to pay cash money.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at Hilton New York and again very good!”
Reviews.Author: Dutchnatasja
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed in the Hilton New York. The first time was in May this year and now in December (Dec 19th â€“ Dec 27th). The arrival in the hotel was good. Because of our VIP Gold HHonors membership we were allowed to check in at the special desk for diamond and gold members. After check-in we got up to our room and I was a little bit disappointed of the room. It was very small; smaller than the room we had in May. This room wasnâ€™t renovated, which it wasnâ€™t a big problem because it looked all so clean. There was also no in-room safe. We were staying for 8 nights and there for we went back to this front desk. We asked for a change of room if this was possible. Well, she looked into her computer and finally gave us a renovated room. She was so friendly and she changed the room without any fuss. For a few minutes we talked about our country, because she visited The Netherlands in the past. Let's talk about the room: Room was spacious and refurbished. The bed was comfortable with white linens. What I liked the most was the lighting. You were able to make the room cozy, just like home. There was a sofa, desk with a chair and a flat screen TV. The shower doesnâ€™t have shower curtains, but a door of glass, which makes the shower more spacious and comfortable. The bathroom had a hair dryer and toiletries, like shampoo, conditioner, soap, mouthwash, and lotion. The bathroom has a large shower, but not a tub. I didnâ€™t mind that at all, because I prefer a shower instead of a tub. I have one major fault to the room; It was very warm throughout the night. Only the heater is working during the winter months, so no air-conditioning. We opened the window very often to cool down the room. We ate breakfast (complimentary) in the New York Marketplace at the hotel. For a few days itâ€™s OK, but not for a whole week and more. Every day the same food, no change at all, was something I didnâ€™t like. There was always a long line for breakfast. This wasnâ€™t the case in May. If you only want a cup of coffee, Starbucks is attached to the hotel. Location: Finally letâ€™s talk about the location. The location of the Hilton can't be beat! Wonderful location in the middle of tourist attractions like 5th avenue, MoMA, Times Square, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center. Overall: Well, we experienced this hotel during the summer and the winter and we had both times a wonderful stay. Itâ€™s clean, itâ€™s spacious, the rooms are very nice and as a HHonors member you have some privileges. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: MTLMOntreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton New York for 4 nights over Easter weekend. We were with our 2 children and we had a blast! The hotel is very well situated; walking distance to times square, the theatre, the David Letterman Show, 5th avenue shopping etc..The room was very clean and spacious - we had ample room for a roll-away bed. The beds were very comfortable! The complimentary full american breakfast was super and the waiters were very friendly and accomodating. I would defintely stay there again and it's a great choice for kids!!

Reviews.Title: “worn out”
Reviews.Author: travelllers
Reviews.Content: good location for carnegie hall or central park. Gives impression of old old worn out big Hilton-Factory. Service ok, too big for feeling cosy. Cheching out in business hours very slow because there are LOTS of people in such a hotel... Many conventions etc.

Reviews.Title: “No heat; no respect”
Reviews.Author: Viageiro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in New York City three nights in January. The first room they asigned me (in the executive tower) had a broken heater, yet they refused to move me to another (fully booked, they calimed). I shivered and froze all night. The next afternoon they moved me to another room, but it wasn't inf the non-smoking sector of executive tower (as I had paid for and had been promised). The tower rooms include breakfast, and the front desk staff promised me that, regardless of my floor, I would be entitled to this perk.. Yet, upon showing up for breakfast the next morning (reeking of second-hand smoke), the clerk denied me entrance because my room number wasn't in the tower. I insisted that she check with the front desk, which eventually confirmed my entitlement. This process took ten minutes while I stood around being treated like a deadbeat interloper, instead of like a valued customer. Who needs this treatment? Outrageous. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton in Manhattan- great location”
Reviews.Author: Ricinatlanta
Reviews.Content: It has an amazing location, is clean and safe. The beds are amazing. It is not cheap--rather expensive in fact, but that is typical for Manhattan. I recommend staying here if you can get a good deal. I saw Bill Clinton and Kevin Spacey in the bar! Celebrities frequent here a lot!

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay.”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: Good location, average rooms, can be noisy if on the lower rooms, NYC trash collectors are the noisest I've ever heard! And they start very early, so beware. Room OK, clean, very small bathroom!!

Reviews.Title: “Echos of the rest”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Although I got a pretty good Priceline rate for this property, I'm still going to judge it as a regular Hilton stay. Check in could have been better. I was the only one on line and it seemed like there were a bunch of people working registration doing a whole lot of things other then checking people in. Room was fine, a bit narrow though. Bed was fine. The vaccum job could have been better. Bathroom small but totally functional, the amenities including soap were missing. This is annoying in these days of not being able to carry your own in moderate quantites. I'm sure a lot more of us are relying on hotel bathroom amenities for short trips. TV checkout was not working when I checked out. The TV was fine, flat screen and an appropriate size. I can definately recommend the in room movies. The selections they list as still in theaters really are still in theaters, and at $10.99 plus tax are really worth taking advantage of considering the size of the flat screen and the price of movies in a manhattan theater. My only complaint echoes the rest, you WILL know your neighbors just from hearing them. Where they are from, why they are in the hotel, what they have planned, etc. There were two teenagers in the room next to mine. They were by no means obnoxious or rowdy, but they did chat about everything constantly and I knew all about it, even with the TV on. If noise is one of your pet peeves, make sure you ask for a corner room or one of those tiny rooms tucked in a corner with noone around you.

Reviews.Title: “Small but well appointed and good location”
Reviews.Author: SneakerMatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the new year. The location is first class - near to central park and times square. In terms of the hotel itself we didn't eat there so cannot comment on the food. The room was clean, modern - with a flat screen TV and the best bed and pillows I have ever slept on - really made a difference. Only downside was the small size of the rooms but in new york you onoy really need a hotel for the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York - Decent, but could be improved”
Reviews.Author: marcgr
Reviews.Content: This could be a great hotel, but I'd say it's about average for a Hilton. The Good: Location is great, walking distance to Broadway and Times Square (South) and Central Park (to the North). MoMA is 1 block away. Our room had a large, flat-screen TV. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. Nice linens, expected at a Hilton. Gold/Diamond staff very helpful. Breakfast room staff friendly. The not-so-good: The plumbing is loud and the walls are very thin, can hear ordinary level conversations in the next room. The exterior hallway smelled strongly of smoke (on a non-smoking floor). The hotel has no pool. They need to re-think the elevator policy, elevators were very crowded with long waits. There are better places for breakfast. One morning they were out of baked goods; the next, they were out of cheeses and meats. Both days I asked staff in that area to restock, both days, if it happened, it wasn't while I was still in the breakfast room. I had some free vouchers for breakfast, but if I didn't, I would have been disappointed paying for the continental breakfast. Taxi lines could be long at times. Overall, a pretty decent stay, would consider it again next time I am in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Large Conferences”
Reviews.Author: KPTHEROCKET
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the New York Hilton. We had a one bedroom suite on the executive level. Having an executive room entitles you to complimentary breakfast and afternoon snacks in the club room on the 44th floor, a nice room with views over Central Park, separate check-in, a bar, T.V. and free WIFI. Everything worked out really well for the first 2 days, and our family enjoyed some downtime there between sightseeing trips. But then on the Tuesday we had the invasion of the art teachers, who were having their annual conference there. They seemed to be everywhere, confering with each other all over the hotel, including the club room. It was impossible to use the room any more - either you couldn't get a seat, or if you did, the level of chatter was so extreme as to be just too irritating to remain there. Be warned, before you book a stay it may be advisable to check if they have any large conferences scheduled at the same time. In my experience it felt very overwhelming. There was a huge difference between the first and second halves of our stay. Based on the first two nights I would have recommended the hotel. However my experience on the second two nights means I would not choose to stay there again! Also note: The room had two double beds and not two queen beds. If you have an executive level room do not wait in the lobby line to check-in, as you check-in on the 44th floor

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Paper Thin Walls !”
Reviews.Author: SleepyEurope
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights and have to change room several times.One night I was woken up by noise from, a male and female in the room next door around 1 30am (there was an interconnecting door that allowed noise to travel easily).At the same time the people on the other side of my room had their clock radio (beside the bed in every room so watch out for this !) switched on and were playing music - the walls are so thin everything couldf be heard - even with my own headphones switched on - I could hear every word from both rooms! This was the case when guests turned on their TVs etc on other nights.The 14th floor which was refurbished was better decor (my first floor 12 was very shabby and poorly decorated).The bathrooms were badly designed so you had to close the door everytime you wanted to go to the bathroom otherwise you couldnt sit in the bathroom comfortably ! at $ 300 a night I ve had far better value at much more upscale chains like Ritz Carlton = the staff were friendly but this is a huge hotel that trades on business/conference/vacation short stops ! I urge you to try somewhere else if you want a peaceful nights sleep ! Having to pay $ 15 to use the gym at this rate is unaceptable especially with no breakfast.Doors slammed loudly on the corridors with guests leaving and arriving at their rooms at diffrent times.You could also hear the drapes being opened and closed by guests in adjoinig rooms ! sleep well I hope if you stay there !

Reviews.Title: “No No No”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife1
Reviews.Content: Front desk reception was far from friendly. The outdated dorm-style furniture was worn. Televisions with bad pictures, telephones that did not work unless the cord was wiggled just right and a highspeed internet connection that cost 10.00 per day because at 500.00 a night, you shouldn't expect a free internet connection--right??? You can do better than this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gilbertsrn
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was the main reason for booking it. All in all, it was an average experience. There were a few rude employees (at the Hilton Diamond member desk of all places and the luggage check area). The lounge was excellent with a friendly and witty bartender. We plan on staying at this hotel this December when we bring our children with us.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosiehola
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic 3 day stay in New york staying at the New York Hilton. We had a room on the executive level, our room was on the 40th floor with great views over the city. Having an executive room entitles you to complimentary breakfast on the 44th floor with views over Central Park.Everything about the hotel was great from an easy check in to aneven easier check out. I will definitely be returning to New York and the New York Hilton. Enjoy your stay if you are going there because me and my family certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 1St time NY experience”
Reviews.Author: roxygirlCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton 3/1/07 thru 3/3/07. We arrived at noon on Thursday expecting our room not to be ready because we knew check in was not until 3:00, but it was and our room was perfect, but we did pay for a deluxe king. And it was worth it, spacious and a comfy bed. The view was ok and the noise level was low. The Deli across the street was opened from 6:00am until 8:00pm and had the BEST food really cheap!!!!!! Walking distance to everything!!! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: amygt1104
Reviews.Content: Yes, one of the best locations in the city! You can't beat the convenience of where you are when you stay at the Hilton New York. I did not have a renovated room but it was nice. The walls are paper thin I was awaken at 7:00 am by laughing and conversations next door. But, at least is it wasn't at 4:00 am. The big downside is the charge for internet access--we live in the age of technology and you have to pay $10 per 24 hours. I would stay here again--no major complaints. There are always good things and bad things with any hotel. But, I really don't have anything that would keep me away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff; Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: psu0904
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 2/24/07 to 2/27/07 (39th floor) while attending a national education conference. When I first arrived at about 2pm (2/24), my room and that of my colleagueâ€™s were not available for check in. Check in time is officially 3pm and given that they were hosting at least one large conference, I guess this could happen. They did store our luggage for free (the normal cost is $3.50/item stored). Also, when the time came for check in, we had some of the best service I have seen and experienced. The staff at check in and throughout my stay in every area of the hotel (including the restaurants and housekeeping), were amazing. I want to also want to mention Arnold (do not know his last name) who provided us with some of the best check-in service I ever experienced. This hotel is located within walking distance (about 15 or so minutes) from Times Square. Also, great amenities such as restaurants, ice cream and chocolate (yes, ladies, chocolate) store, and a grocery store are within two blocks. In terms of the room, I had a king room, which met the expectations for the price of the room. Another note especially for the ladies is that the bathroom lacked vanity space. I mean, very little space, some of which is too close for comfort to the toilet. I actually resorted to spreading a towel on the bathroom floor to store my toiletries while using them. I would rather do this than have my stuff land in the latrine, which would be quite gross. When they were not in use, I kept toiletries in my suitcase. I usually store these on the vanity during my other hotel experiences. My colleague had similar vanity space issues in her room. On another note, I have to wonder when these hotels â€“ especially these high-priced properties â€“ will update their tv sets. The old crappy Phillips tubes just donâ€™t it for me and is an insult at this price point. Also, be warned about the price of their internet service. It is $9.95/day (billing period is from 12pm); however, while in the lobby, I also noticed a $9.95/hr price tag. Crazy. Still, I had a very pleasant stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Central, relatively affordable - good choice for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Mgz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton several times over the years, most recently this past month. In a city where hotel rates are consistently among the highest anywhere, the Hilton usually has affordable-for-NYC rates for the level of quality and amenities. My floor was recently updated, which I understand has happened to much of the hotel (but not all). I was bumped up to a better room as a result of my "standard room" not being available and after refusing to go to another hotel for one night and then come back. Do people actually think this is a reasonable suggestion?) PROS: Rooms are confortable, typical Hilton - desk, newer "comfort sleep" bedding, decent size room and bathroom. Good for one or two people, but you'd be overcrowded with 3 or more. Also, the hotel is 5-10 minutes walking distance from many subway lines, and has easy access to taxis (of course, a NYC trademark). It is also close to the Museum of Modern Art and perhaps 10 minutes from the heart of Broadway (though a couple of theaters are very close). If you need quiet to sleep, ask for a higher floor. Noise levels above floor 15 or so are reasonably low - not silent, but low. Of course if you want absolute quiet, you probably should stay out of NYC :-). There are 2 bars at ground level. Drinks are very good, but expect NYC prices ($7 beer, $10-$15 martinis). If you need a rental car, Hertz is across the street. CONS: I found it amusing that the undercurrent of the front desk was that I should be grateful for the upgrade. Needless to say, warm customer service is not exactly a trademark. The Hilton's lobby can often be clogged with travelers, and they don't always seem to staff for demand very well. Further, both at the desk, bars and througout the hotel, there is a definite lack of outgoing customer service. You get what you ask for, little else, and with little of that positive customer attitude you'll find at higher end, customer-focused hotels. I find this endemic at Hiltons, so clearly they are not focusing on customer service. That said, staff is not mean or rude, just disengaged, so get your key and enjoy the stay. I'll return because of location and price, and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst guest service ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MML2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton New York last Saturday night and were appalled at the lack of guest service. We arrived at 11:00 a.m. so we didn't expect our room to be ready but decided to check just in case. After standing in line for 20 minutes, the stone-faced woman at the front desk shoved a form at us to take to baggage storage and said the room wasn't ready. We asked if she could tell us when the room would be ready and she shrugged. We asked if there was some way to pick up our key later to avoid standing in a long line again. She snapped at us and said that we would have to stand in line again like everybody else. I said that I didn't think it was right that we should have to spend another 20 minutes in line and she shrugged and said that there was a manager's line (which we never found). We stored our bags and went to take a walk. We came back around 2:30 and tried again to check in. After spending another 20 minutes in line, a different woman snapped at us and said, "the room's not ready. Check-in is at 3." I saw all 10 people ahead of me in line walk away with keys so I was a little frustrated. We paid extra for a Deluxe room so I expected to be treated a little better. The woman said that Deluxe rooms are always the last to be cleaned and that our room might actually be ready but housekeeping hadn't entered it into the computer yet. I asked if she could call housekeeping to see if it was ready and she said, "Yeah, at 3." I used to work in the hotel industry and whenever people tried to check in early, we blocked rooms for them and called housekeeping and had them clean those rooms first. Obviously this hotel doesn't care enough about their guests to do this. My husband and I went to the lobby bar and had a couple of very over-priced drinks while we waited for our room. Finally at 3, we got back in line (with at least 15 people ahead of us and only 2 front desk clerks). I saw a woman walking around who looked like a manager. I was just about to walk over to her and ask if she could help us when she asked if anyone in line was just waiting to pick up a key. We raced over to her and she directed us to someone who actually gave us a room key. We booked the Romance Package which included a bottle of sparkling wine and breakfast. We had to ask about how to go about getting the wine and breakfast. We were told to call Room Service to have the sparkling wine delivered. We asked if we needed a coupon for breakfast and the front desk clerk advised us that all we needed to do was order breakfast in the restaurant and it would be deducted from our bill. We asked three times to verify and each time we were told we didn't need a coupon. When we went down to the restaurant in the morning, we told the waiter our package was supposed to include breakfast and he asked for our coupon. We told him that we hadn't been given one so he had to call over the restaurant manager to look into things. The restaurant manager was the only friendly person we encountered in our visit. He did some research and came back with the coupon we should have received at check-in. The room itself was adequate, but certainly not deluxe. We didn't have much of a view and we were close to the elevators. The bathroom was small and only included a shower and we found a few hairs in the shower. There was really nothing special about the room. The hotel was crowded at all times. There was always a long line at the front desk and we had to wait for several minutes every time we had to take the elevator. There were always several employees milling about the lobby but nobody ever greeted us or offered to help us with anything. With the exception of the restaurant manager, everybody we encountered at this hotel was rude and unprofessional. I expected a lot more from a Hilton. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Busy Hilton”
Reviews.Author: wategos
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the very large foyer of Hilton Hotel. Very impersonal and clinical. Waited in a short queue and given room allocation. 26th Floor unrenovated room with view of Central Park. The room was very nice. We had requested and paid for a king bed but only two doubles available. The shower was a bit tempermental. We were staying for seven days. One morning awoke to the sound of jackhammers above, and burst water pipe. We were then 'upgraded' downstairs to a renovated room. The room was very new with plasma t.v. large shower etc. Ordered room service one evening and were very impressed how prompt the service was. Many conferences going on in Hotel, so lifts were full to overflowing all the time and foyer constantly crowded. Once in room of hotel it was very quiet and staff were prompt to respond to requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs soundproofing...”
Reviews.Author: UKholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the start of February. As a Hilton HHonors member we were put on the 17th floor in a recently renovated room. The hotel room was spacious for new york, and the location cannot be faulted. However...the walls are seriously thin. We could hear people wandering back to their rooms at 1am, we heard our neighbours alarm clock every morning, and we could hear taxis honking their horn. I appreciate that its New York and that's what taxi drivers do, but I have stayed in other hotels in New York where this has not been a problem. I would say go - but take your earplugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Hilton during a long weekend in June. The hotel is very well situated for all the sights in the city as there is easily accessibility by taxi or subway. However, be warned that during the hours of 6:00pm â€“ 7:00pm the taxi queue at the hotel is very long and you may wait a long time to get a taxi. Keep this in mind when planning your departure times. The hotel is very busy and there are always large crowds in the lobby however on this occasion it did not cause us too much trouble and we were able to check in easily. We asked for a change of room while checking to something as high as possible and this was done without any fuss and we were given a room on the corner which was good as we then had two windows â€“ also we were on a side road so the noise from the outside was not a problem. The room was nice and well decorated with a small bathroom. There was nothing special about it but it was clean and well maintained. We unfortunately did have noisy neighbours who insisted on shouting and talking loudly to past 1:00am. We called downstairs and asked for them to be stopped and security must have done something as eventually the noise decreased. We did not use any of the restaurants, room service or gym as there are plenty of restaurants in the area so cannot comment on these amenities. We did use the concierge to arrange for a car to take us to the airport and that was done quickly and efficiently. The hotel was nothing to write home about but it did provide us with a decent place to stay in New York city at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising great”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times in the past and it was adequate but on this trip I stayed part of the time in one of the new renovated rooms. Incredible, actually spectacular. The only complaint I had, if you could call it that, is the lack of robes! The bed is amazing, the decor is modern but warm and the big flat screen tv really is great. It also has lights on the bottom of the side tables that go on when you walk by so you can see i the dark. Make sure you ask for the renovated rooms when you book here, you will be amazed. And the service has really been great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Irishman_27
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline to secure a room at the Hilton New York back in March 2006. What a great location and a great hotel! Just minutes from Central Park, Time Square, great shopping, etc etc. Hotel was sophisticated, very clean and overall a fabulous experience. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.. especially at the rate of $120 USD per night we got on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: wendy1068
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving and had no problems. Our room was spacious and that says alot for a NY hotel room! It was extremely crowded due to the holiday but the service we received did not reflect the fact that it was. We are planning to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Hilton”
Reviews.Author: fromhere2there
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, awesome atmosphere, close to everything, centre of Manhatten, We organised a suite for, 2 adults and 2 children ages 9 & 11, not many hotels in New York really cater for the children, however the Hilton 6th and 53rd does.

Reviews.Title: “business at the Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: mylabrat2002
Reviews.Content: Was in NYC for three days on business. Liked the location. Lots of choice of activities after a day of business and choice of foods nearby was good. Never did find a soda machine in this hotel, though and the Starbucks closed at 6pm which I found frustrating as even the little "gift shop/store" didn't have either coffee or sodas. Their store is grossly overpriced. A bottle of water I could get at home for 89 cents was nearly $3. I drank tap water all weekend. The staff was very reserved and almost stone faced. Not very welcoming for a southern girl, but I look over all that. I'm not there to make friends with the staff, but if you're looking for a "friendly face" at check in, you probably won't find it. They are efficient, though. That said, this hotel was good for me. The rooms are small (but if you think you'll find a huge spacious room in NYC, get over it). Clean, quiet. I was on the 40th floor, so above the street noise. My favorite was the 44th floor executive lounge and continental breakfast. For business travel, it was nice to be able to go to breakfast and look over the days agenda without the army of undisciplined children climbing over everyone and screaming. It was also nice at night. Cash bar up there, but I didn't use it. Data ports available, easy checkout, and I could print my boarding passes for the airport from their lobby which saved me a great deal of time in the long run. I would absolutely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: BedouinGal
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful and very comfortable -- but I needed to either be on a higher floor than the 10th or have earplugs. The street noise is significant. And I have never heard louder hotel employees in my life. The hallways were a big down-home reunion with no consideration to those who might actually be sleeping. Food in the hotel was lousy at best.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Diamond Member--BEWARE LATE ARRIVERS”
Reviews.Author: kiddogo
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member who has stayed at this property about 10 times over the past couple of years. Primarily because my business meetings are 2 blocks away and I am a fequent traveler. Have had mostly positive experiences but this last visit was my last at this hotel. I arrived late at 11:30 pm finding the kioks out of service and the diamond desk closed. The queue for a desk agent was about 10 deep with 3 agents working all with very visibly frustrated customers. After waiting about 10 minutes in line with no movement, the night manager came out and yelled to everyone in line that the hotel was overbooked, Hilton was moving everyone, Hilton would pay for the room, please be patient. 30 minutes later, no line movement. So I called the front desk from my mobile phone and asked to speak to the manager. He started yelling at me to be patient. When I told him that he had a diamond member in line for 40 minutes with no movement---he hung up on me. So I have a number to HIlton Diamond Customer Service and ended up speaking to a Hilton Executive at home (I think he was sleeping). The Hilton Executive told me that he would immediately get the root cause. Withing 5 minutes about a dozen people came out from behind the wall, including the night manager and each person received personal attention. I asked for the night manager. He apolgized and then gave me a corner suite on the 44th floor at no charge. Hilton has follow-up with me and indicated that changes are planned in at the hotel......they are needed.....BEWARE of late arrivals

Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: Gristle
Reviews.Content: The place was very busy with conventions. Room was small and not very nice - showing its age. For vacation, preferred staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Would totally recommend!”
Reviews.Author: kerriejo
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here, I was not looking forward to our check-in so I was most pleasantly surprised to find no queue at all. The person who dealt with our check in (Jason) was fantastic. We asked for a change of room type and it was done instantly with a smile and no fuss whatsoever. Our room was lovely, I couldn't tell you if we had a refurbished room or not but we had no complaints whatsoever. We found the cleanliness to be of a very high standard, and all the staff were wonderful. We used the concierge to arrange a town car on two occasions. Once was to take us out for dinner, so we were over the moon when we came downstairs and it wasn't a town car but a limosine! It made the night magical. I was worried that as the hotel is mainly business users, it would not be the best choice for a romantic trip but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic for most sights and shops, I would totally recommend this hotel to other users.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: EKErnst
Reviews.Content: Our family went there expecting a nice experience. The service was terrible. We called the concierge and all we could do was leave a message to which they NEVER did call back. We never recieved the extra towels and sheets that we requested prior to check in. Overalll I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: nishnish2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. As a diamond member you will be able to get a higher floor. In addition, got the romance package which included room-service breakfast, it was awesome. so much variety. great presentation, paid attention to detail. Location is okay, if you prefer the midtown area, this is a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “I Hate This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fpauto
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 15 years. Why? Because my company refuses to book another hotel. Here's what's wrong: Too expensive for what you get relative to other midtown hotels. Almost always have to endure noisy construction going on in a room near yours. At least 1 lamp and/or appliance not working. Ridiculously long lines at all hours at the front desk. Finally, as if that isn't enough reasons to avoid this place.. BED BUGS.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, customer service”
Reviews.Author: taraship
Reviews.Content: As many people on here, I got a great rate from Priceline. The hotel has so many rooms that, if there is no conference in town, they go empty. For the money, it was an amazing hotel. We were helped immediately upon our arrival since the quick check-in kiosks were not working with our reservation. The lobby is somewhat elegant but not overdone and the rooms were clean and nice. The furniture is old, style-wise, but in good shape. I was really content with the hotel. Security is stellar, requiring all people entering the lobby to show their key in the evening. I wouldn't pay more than $175/night for the hotel and we paid considerably less than that. Overall, it was clean, friendly, well-located and worth the money we paid. I was content. Oh, and great water pressure in the shower! And the beds were extremely comfy. Flat screen tv in our room with a great picture. No bells and whistles but a solid, nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: This is a good convention style hotel. It is in a good location with a lot of the ammenities that you might expect at business style hotel. I also think that the rooms were updated since the last time I stayed there, they seemed similar to the rooms at the Hilton dowtown. I didn't have anything to do with breakfast and didn't charge anything to my room. There is one little pet peeve that I have with this property and that is the fact that they charge to store your bags. It is 3.50 a bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jlpsu
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed here for a mother/daughter weekend from Jan 5-7th. I wanted a hotel within walking distance to many different sights and activities. We were not dissapointed! We were able to walk to times square, theater district, rockafeller center, the American Girl Store, 5th Avenue, Central Park, FAO Schwarz, etc..... It was a PERFECT location. The hotel was clean, the people were friendly, the staff helpful. I have really only two complaints. One, room service was VERY expensive. Now, I know this is New York - so what do I expect? I don't know. But I paid $50.00 for my daughter and I to get dessert via room service. The hotel charges a $9.00 room service fee to deliver the food - and then I was reminded by the waiter that gratuity is NOT included in that $9.00. So, I gave a tip too, so by the end - I paid $16.00 more just to get room service. Next time, I'll walk down to the restaurant or get ice cream to go at one of the many restaurants nearby. Second complaint - the breakfast buffet. My entire meal was cold and I could not get the waitress to bring our check to save my life. It was frustrating. But, I also will admit that it very well could have been simply an "off" morning for both the waitress and the restaurant. Our trip was fabulous, however, and I would most certainly stay here again. The location could not be beat. We also booked via priceline and we received a rate of $150.00 per night, which for the quality and location, could not be beat. On a side note, my daughter and I went to see "Hairspray" at the Neil Simon theater, and to say it was FABULOUS would not be giving it enough credit. Best show I"ve ever seen, hands down - and I've been to many broadway and off broadway shows. If you get a chance, GO. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “too busy”
Reviews.Author: LMParis
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hilton for New Year's Eve. We booked via American Express and were disappointed. The hotel has been refurbished but apparently not all rooms. We had a King bed Deluxe room which was very nice. Natural colors, flat screen, excellent beds and sheets. The problem of this hotel is the hotel itself : we asked for a king bed and we had twin beds, the hotel was fully booked we couldn't move. We made a request 3 months ago for a corner room, of course we didn't get it. We asked for a plug adaptor (as we are french) but the Hilton does not have adaptors for their clients. You have to buy one and the shop of the hotel had no stock left. No service, when you ask for something you better do it by yourself. Too many people, you have to queue to take the elevators. The reception is more busy than Grand Central Station at pick time. Cleaness is moderate in the room, very poor in the hotel. There was a small bottle of ketchup and jam in the corridor which stained the wall and it remains during 2 days, whereas the housekeepers saw it. Even this Hilton isn't a 5 stars hotel, you should expect a minimum of service when you go in a brand hotel for more than 400$ per night.You can go there if you have no other choice, it is not awful, but we won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here..”
Reviews.Author: benaus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights recently. We paid additional for a Club Level room...we had an unrenovated room which had a foul odour emitting from the bathroom (let alone the yellow stained shower curtain). The staff were not really interested in helping or wanting to make your stay more positive. The room service staff were pushy over tips (although a reasonable tip was given) and quiet rude. We had an additional night booked at the hotel after visiting Washington, however cancelled it to stay at the Westin Times Square which made the Hilton look like a highway motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location!!”
Reviews.Author: jae_mye
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the perfect location! We had a very speedy check-in and check-out. The only major fault to this hotel was that the room was very warm throughout the night. When we complained that the room was uncomfortable, we were told that only the heater works during the winter months, but we could open our windows. We opened the windows, but then we had to listen to the horns blowing throughout the night. Overall, the hotel was nice and it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Bertie1411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton over Christmas and for the first few days all was fine (although as with another reviewer the whole breakfast/coupon thing was not explained which lead to some issues). Then, after boxing day the hotel got busier and things weren't so good. Some mornings there were queues of 100 people waiting to get breakfast. I've never seen the like! We ended up going out for breakfast even though it was included in our room rate. This place is fine of you get a good deal ($250 or less per night) and the location is great. However, if you go when it's busy expect to queue for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: Jbinknox
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 months in advance for three nights beginning 21 Dec 2006. We had to have a friend cancel the first night as our flight was cancelled out of Amsterdam; the hotel was understanding and cancelled without a fee. Our check-in on the 22nd was fine although the desk clerk failed to give us the correct number of breakfast coupons (we had breakfast included as we stayed for the Bounceback weekend promotion). The hotel is in a great location only 10 short blocks to Time Square and 5 blocks to Central Park. The hotel room was too warm and thus uncomfortable to sleep in although we did not complain since we find this common in most hotels in the winter. The towels in the bathroom were big and fluffy but found lipstick/make-up on one of them that the person before us wiped her face with and the staff did not change out. Also there was hair in the shower and a pair of shoes behind the curtains that nobody ever found. The floor was not vacuumed well. The breakfast was excellent although I am glad it was included in the Bounceback Weekend because the bill was $106.00 for 2 adults and 2 kids ( I paid only the $12.00 tip). Starbucks is attached to the hotel but only opened at 7 a.m. Overall the hotel was very pretty to look at but missed some of the important things like housekeeping. I expected a cleaner room for $675 for two nights. I will look around next time for maybe a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: NewLondonCTAdrift
Reviews.Content: Our usual Hotel was quoting a rate $200 higher than Hilton. The reviews were mixed but we had little choice since we were coming in during the holidays. We had a good stay. We checked in quickly, the elevators were punctual and I liked that they had a TV with CNN on it updating us on breaking news while riding up and down. We had a nice breakfast buffet. The staff was very attentive and professional, the cozy room comfortable and clean. The walls are a little thin and we could easily hear conversations in the adjoining room. The is a lot of street noise after midnight due to deliveries and trash pickup but that can't be helped. The Hilton is convenient to all mid town attractions and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent midtown location”
Reviews.Author: worldhoppers04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton NY over Christmas weekend. The Hilton is a very large and crowded hotel, but since we arrived very late in the evening there was no problem checking in. In fact, the front desk was nice enough to upgrade us to the 41st floor which allows you complimentary access to a very good continental breakfast and afternoon hors d'oeuvres on the 44th floor. The room was cozy, maybe a bit small, but very comfortable; excellent Queen-size bed with comfy linens and comforter, nice view of the City, and plenty of hot water. Some others on this site complained of thin walls, but we couldn't hear anything from the room next door or the hallways. But thankfully our room didn't have a pass-thru to the next room which can allow noise to filter through. Only glitch was that the free breakfast can get very crowded and the line was so long the first day, that we had breakfast across the street at the coffee shop. It seemed that people from the non-executive floors were also taking advantage of the free breakfast. The second at third mornings were much better and they were checking the room numbers of guests more carefully. The location of the Hilton can't be beat! Near pretty much everything, especially during the holidays! 5th Ave., Rockefeller Center, Times Sq., Central Park, MOMA, etc. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “lovely!”
Reviews.Author: farmerjones
Reviews.Content: we booked the hilton because you know what your getting! We thought the hotel was perfect for our needs. Great location, modern spacious rooms. Very helpfull concierge service! Quick check in and out. Very busy lots going on! But thats what you want when you go to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “$680.00 per night - bad value”
Reviews.Author: np8by
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel on a one night business stay. I could not find a decent hotel any where in New York at a cheaper rate at this time of the year. I booked the Hilton thinking that I would get what my money was worth, but how wrong could I have been. My company paid $680.00 per night for an executive room, the room was big but it was very dated and in need of modernisation. The furniture was old and needed to be replaced. The morning of my meeting I woke up to find my shower was not working. My husband had to call twice before anyone came up. This hotel is very busy; the reception area is full of business travellers. There are also lots of conferences going on at this hotel. I missed the complimentary breakfast in the executive lounge but my husband said that is was pretty bad and not even worth eating. The hotel is in a very good location and that about the only good thing. Overall the stay was ok but I would have expected more for the money my company paid!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: caz0610
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a surprise for my 40th birthday and stressed on the booking form that it was a special occasion - this I may add made no difference whatsoever. Although classed as a double room, the room was very small - only being able to get out of one side of the bed !!! We took this complaint to reception only to be greeted with a shrug of the shoulders and told this was the room that was allocated. We found their customer service in this regard disgraceful. Considering the room rate was over $400 per night, the attitude of staff was extremely disappointing. Glasses we had used were not lifted by the cleaners on two occasions. For a hotel of this standard and charging the prices they do you would expect a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lorrayne G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a four night break in New York (Nov 24-28 2006) staying at the New York Hilton on Avenue of the Americas (also known as 6th Avenue). The hotel was absolutely ideal for our trip - we were looking for a good quality hotel in a fantastic location and it scored maximum points on both criteria. Overall Hotel: This hotel is huge! It has everything that you would expect from a 4 star Hilton hotel in New York - large reception area, bars, gift shops, restaurants, concierge etc. However, I know that Hiltons often have a reputation for impersonal and sometimes even inefficient service due to the size of the hotel - not this Hilton. Everybody we came into contact with at the hotel was lovely - friendly, courteous and professional. If they said they would do something, it was done and done on time - they even did a little bit more when they could. For such a large hotel in such a major city I think this is a big deal! Room: The hotel is currently renovating some floors and unfortunately our room was on a floor that had not been renovated, so although it was fine, everything worked - it was getting just a little bit tired. I'm happy if a hotel has a nice bed, a good bathroom with a fully working shower and a minibar and it had all three! Believe me, I have been to some grand hotels that didn't have ticks in all of these boxes! If we had stayed in a room that had just been renovated I am sure that this hotel would have scored maximum points in all criteria - but because the room we had was a little tired (and the air conditioning smelt a bit funny) I need to mark the hotel down just on this bit! Location: This was the best bit! It would be hard for a hotel to be better located in Manhattan than the Hilton New York. 2 minutes walk to your left when you leave the hotel gets you to Central Park and 10 minutes walk in the other direction brings you to Times Square. Another 2 mins walk straight ahead will get you to Fifth Avenue and Rockerfeller Center - who could ask for more than this?

Reviews.Title: “We felt like cattle”
Reviews.Author: lvmtl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really huge and the only way they can operate is to treat their guests like cattle. Compared to other hotels in this price range, the staff and was rude and dismissive. The lobby was chaotic, noisy and crowded. The room rate was astonishing and they still found it necessary to nickle-and-dime us for every little extra. For example using the fitness center was $12 and checking our bags for a few hours on the way out cost $3.5 per piece of luggage. After two nights, i moved out of the Hilton and switched to a nice boutique hotel on the upper west side at 3/4 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!! Would stay there again. For sure”
Reviews.Author: Keebles
Reviews.Content: Terriffic, clean rooms!!!! Very comfortable beds!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mslove
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is a very nice hotel with 4 star amenities. Unfortunately their staff is at best uppity. When I arrived at the hotel after a red-eye flight and sitting through traffic for an hour and a half, I was told they had no payment information for me on file. Apparently they lost the payment information my company had sent them (which they had confirmed receiving over the phone prior to my departure) and instead demanded payment for my stay up front. Considering I was there for a business conference for several days at nearly $400 a night, there was no way I was going to shell over that much just to wait for reimbursement. So instead of helping me get the payment issue straightened out, they told me to step aside so they could help other customers "who were prepared". Fast-forward 90 minutes later after several calls to my company and faxing payment information 8 separate times to their fax machine that was "apparently on the fritz", I finally got the keys to my room. After all this travel and dealing with unhelpful staff, all I wanted to do was take a nap. Laying down, I was greeted to the sounds of hammers banging from a nearby room. My stay from that point forward was decent. But mainly because I never had to deal with a staff member again. The hotel itself is 4 stars, the staff is a 1.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: There are better places to stay in New York than this Hilton. Like other reviewers I had to queue to book in - for about 30 mins and there was a very long line behind me. The room was very average (not as nice as the Millenium Hilton rooms) although the bed was comfy. The bathroom was small - the length of the bath, the TV had patchy reception, room service was decidely average (as was the food), the bar area felt like being in a mall food court, the lifts were slow and the whole hotel felt shabby. As I was here on business I was surprised that the internet connection had a cost associated with it. The concierge always had a queue and it was also long wait on taxi's. I stay elsewhere now.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite NYC Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaTravler
Reviews.Content: I have finally found a hotel in NYC t hat I would return to. We go to NYC about twice a year and have stayed all over the city in various 3 - 4 star hotels from $200 to $350/night . For the price, this is the place. The location can not beat, close to everything you come to NYC for. This was one of the quitest hotels we have stayed in. Our Deluxe Room was large with a small sofa, flat sceen TV, incredible lighting and a wonderful bed. The Congierge was most helpful. Skip eating in the Hotel. NYC has too many great restaurants and deli's to enjoy. The bathroom was small with a large shower but not a tub. Really surprised that this hotel is not higher on the list.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try - but could do much better”
Reviews.Author: Rambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in October 2006 for a short vacation in NYC (3 nights). We have stayed here on two previous occasions on the 'executive' floors. This hotel is in a superb location. Easy walk to Central Park, Rockerfeller Centre, 5th Avenue, Times Sqaure and Theatres. The executive rooms have access to a a lounge on the 44st floor which has views to the Empire State to the south and Central Park to the north. There's complimentary soft drinks, breakfast and evening snacks and it is the best way to start your day or your evening. However - the 'executive' rooms are that in name only. Wallpaper coming loose, a heating unit that looked vintage 1970's and poor bathroom products left us thinking we'd paid quite a lot for a nice view at breakfast. Room size was ok but I recommend you book a double:double room. They're the same price as a double but normally bigger in floor area. This hotel has spent a lot of money refurbishing some of the lower level standard rooms and installing a 'club' (timeshare) on some floors. The other areas have been neglected. Incidentally,if you're a gold HHonours member, don't think you get an upgrade to executive level at this hotel. The website reads that way but after we had argued with the duty manager for several minutes at the front desk - it wasn't going to be. [This was after I had phoned the hotel twice pre-arrival to confirm our room]. It's still a busy,bustling hotel with a good bar scene at night and great views and location. If you haven't been to NYC before - you could do a lot worse. But Hilton - you could do a lot better (and be a little more friendly with it!).

Reviews.Title: “Added to our NYC Visit”
Reviews.Author: rtayloe
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment set up four days in NYC. The New York Hilton was simply perfect for what we needed. Located near all the spots we wanted to share with our 8 y.o. son, the hotel and staff added to the enjoyment of our stay in the city. Thanks, NY Hilton for helping us make the most of the time we had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Poor Sound-proofing, Usual NYC Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: NeilHW
Reviews.Content: Location: great - only 3 blocks from Central Park, the MOMA is 100m away and 5th Ave shopping and the Rockefellar are less only about 300m away. Rooms: good - we had a refurb'd Deluxe Room and it was extremely well furnished and not too small for a NY hotel. The building: not good - we had to ask to move rooms because some inconsiderate resident woman (steer clear of room 2208 if you are staying in the next month or so) played her TV all night. This wouldn't be a problem but the hotel has paper-thin walls. Service: great - the staff helped to sort us out with a new room and they also delivered a cake to our room since it was our 10th anniversary. Dining: below average - breakfast good (expensive) but dinner was worse than a TGI's. We only ate there once as a result - if you have kids, make sure you go to the Jekyll & Hyde Club just up the street! Value: poor - just like most NYC hotels, they are a rip-off. I would pay about $160 for an identical hotel in SF or LA. Becuase of the poor value and bad sound-proofing I am only giving this hotel 3 stars, if it was sub $200 it would be 4 or 5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Britnole
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay in New York City and was extremely pleased with the Hilton New York, on 6th Avenue between 53rd and 54th Streets. I have only been to NYC as a child, so this was a big trip for me and while I was shocked at the price of the hotels (we paid $375 per night including taxes), I don't think we could have made a better choice. The location was perfect for a person new to the city as it was located within walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park and Times Square. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable and we had a great view of the city from our 35th floor room. We used the conceirge service twice and was very pleased with the restaurant recommendations they gave. Check-in was simple with the availability of an automated computer screen, thus no waiting in lines. The only minor criticisms would be the elevators were too small and crowded, there was no fan in the bathrooms which became steamy and, of course, the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BGI99
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York was a comfortable place to stay. We checked in without any hassle, and when we pointed out the rate was incorrect they changed it without any fuss - just double checked which is fair. The rooms were small compaired to other rooms that i stayed in NYC. They were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I also found the room a little warm. express checkout is a dream. All in all I would reccoment this property at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sheri678
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Fast check-in, although was told that the king beds I had booked for two rooms was unavailable...and instead got 2 double beds. The rooms were clean and a decent size for NYC. The only bad thing about the rooms were you couldn't get them cool enough. It was about 50 degrees outside, yet inside it was about 75, and even after putting the air on cool, it still stayed warm. The elavator on our departure date took 10 minutes before we could get in to go down to the lobby! And the wait for our car was ridiculous...good thing we were parked close and could see it! We were able to load up and get our car out on our own..this saved A LOT of time! Basically, this was a nice stay and I would stay again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Clean Room!”
Reviews.Author: Dave/Kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton - New York for 3 nights in early October. I was very impressed with the check-in - we arrived at 10:00 a.m. and our room was ready for us. We were on the 36th floor and paid $329/night for the room (I'm sure that I could have done better through priceline, etc., but too scared at what they would give us in New York) This seemed reasonable (?) for the location. Location was fantastic - close to the subway, Rock Center , shopping and a short walk to Times Square. Room - very clean (I'm very picky), clean sheets, bathroom (except for the mold on the tile of the shower) - I''ll bring some tilex the next trip. Staff - helpful, but we didn't have any real problems. Breakfast - $25 buffet (way overprice for the buck) - but it's New York Bar - Very expensive ($10. beer) - but it's New York Gym - Very nice, clean and good equipment I will stay here again if I ever visit New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms are Very Nice-- What an improvement”
Reviews.Author: shvtraveler
Reviews.Content: I had last stayed at the New York Hilton in late September 2006 when they had their linen fire. I was very pleasantly suprised at their newly renovated rooms that at this point appear to be given namely to Hilton Gold or Plat members ( I am gold) -- much nicer than the old rooms. Staff was very nice, except for a woman that would not let a friend of mine connect to the free internet on the 44th floor in their Executive lounge, that we had done on Saturday. Location, Location, Location is really the big advantage to the New York Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Surprisingly Good Service for a Big Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here very last minute - the day before arrival and had a great experience overall. THe man behind the checkin desk, Adel, sang "My Way" as he checked us in! He was very nice and asked where we were from and how was our trip, etc. The room was very nice, not real big, but had everything we needed. THe windows don't open so you have to rely on the air conditioner/heater to get the room to the temp you want it to be. It wasn't a problem for us. Our room had an in-room safe in the closet. We didn't watch TV or use the mini bar so I can't comment on either of them. The room had one double-sized bed (may have been a queen but I don't think so), one desk with a chair, one easy chair, a dresser with the TV enclosed, a mini bar witha nice granite counter top and a nightstand next to the bed. The bathroom had a hair dryer and toiletries - shampoo, conditioner, soap, mouthwash and lotion. Water pressure was good and we didn't have any problems with hot/cold water bursts. The hotel had a large bar area and lots of computers for internet access. The fitness center was nice too - lots of treadmills for running. Check out was extrememly fast. THey have these machines in the lobby that let you checkout and print a boarding pass (if you're flying) all at the same time. Then you just drop your keys into a lock box right next to the machine and leave. It was great - no lines, no waiting. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tmw017
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in the morning to drop off my luggage, the desk told me they had 2 reservations for me. I told them there should only be one. I asked them to check the address on both to see if they were the same, and the clerk said they didnâ€™t have addresses, and she was going to leave it alone. Check-in didn't go smoothly. When I returned in the afternoon, (with plenty of time to freshen up for our dinner reservations), another desk clerk saw the 2 reservations but said they were different people, as the credit card numbers were different. (Why the first clerk in the morning didn't tell me this, I don't know ). She then sent me up to the 22nd floor. The key card did not work; we went back to the lobby, and they gave me the wrong floor number and room number, so they sent us to the 32nd floor. This time the key card worked. We went into the room to change for dinner, something was not right. The beds werenâ€™t made, and there was luggage on the floor, a laptop on the desk, and used toiletries and razors in the bathroom. They sent me to the other personâ€™s room that the 2nd reservation was for (person with same name). This room had a plasma TV and a room safe. I phoned the desk from this room, and then back down we went. During my encounters with the 3 different desk clerks, none of them were friendly, and only one said we are sorry the mix-up. It was now the time I had reserved for our dinner reservations. On my 3rd trip up to the 24th floor, they gave me a room at the end of the hall. I opened the door, room looked OK. No Plasma TV or safe. I walked into the bathroom and there were golden yellow stains all over the inside of the tub. I was going to go back down to the desk and demand another room for all their mix-ups and for the stained tub, but my friend said we donâ€™t have time; only our feet will touch it. Needless to say, we were a half hour late for dinner, and were told it would be an hour and a half wait, so we had to find another restaurant. In our room, the vent in the bathroom did not work; the hairdryer looked about 12 years old, with white stains all over it. The TV was not secure on the slide-out tray of the armoire. I think it would have fallen off if it was slid out. On the good side, when returning to the hotel after 10:00 pm, you have to show your key card to security to enter the hotel. The bed and pillows were VERY comfortable. It was one of the best nightâ€™s sleeps Iâ€™ve had. I feel I received the below average check-in courtesey and got the room I did because I did not book through the hotel, but through a website bidding for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Additional Comments”
Reviews.Author: jaybee99
Reviews.Content: I would just like to add a couple of comments to my review dated Sept. 17. About the long lines for check-in, they do have a special check-in desk for Gold & Diamond Hilton members. As gold members, we received a lovely refurbished room, and access to the members lounge. We found all the staff we encountered to be very friendly and helpful. The 5 nights following our stay in the hotel room, we were in the Hilton Club residences, which differs considerably from the hotel proper,

Reviews.Title: “NY Hilton...WOW!”
Reviews.Author: jaybee99
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be an excellent location, and a beautiful hotel, as well. It's situated at W. 54th St. and 6th Ave. a block from Rockefeller Center, the Museum of Modern Art, 3 blocks from Broadway, near Times Square...right in the middle of exciting happenings. One block away, you can catch the hop-on, hop-off buses to sample various areas of the city. The hotel proper has a Marketplace Cafe, for informal dining, offering continental, or full breakfasts,as well as Japanese & other international foods. It's open for Breakfast, Lunch, & Dinner. We didn't sample the Etruscan Italian Restaurant, also on-site. We also enjoyed a Harbor Circle cruise, which lasts about 3 hrs, with spectacular views of the skylines, and a lot of information. The hotel has a fitness center, wireless internet, and airport check-in kiosks. It has recently had an 85 million dollar refurbishing, and our room was beautiful, and the beds are truly heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: johnnyfivelivers
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for two nights during August 2006. The room was clean and spacious. As a diamond Hilton Honors member I spend a lot of time in Hilton Hotels and this a typical one except for the Reception area which is a Cattle Market with long queues to check in and out. There are people everywhere,its very noisy and busy. Unless you're loaded don't use the internet in the business centre or buy a drink in the Bar. I spent the previous two nights in the Times Square Hilton, if you have a choice , stay there instead. I think they're roughly the same price.
