Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tellingitlikeitis
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great location. We stayed in room 2505 for 3 nights. Very good impression upon entering the room which was a good size and had a bay window with a chair and side table. There were triple sheets on a comfortable bed and no dirty bedspread. The mirrored closet door was a nice, convenient touch. There was a safe in the closet, La Source toiletries, nice towels, an iron and ironing board, a mini bar and coffee maker. CONS: The shower head had a lot of black mold (gross) which I removed as best I could. I did not expect that in a 4 star hotel. It was extremely difficult to get the shower to work; it kept switching back to the faucet. The sink was clogged and there was a little door under the sink that would not close. There was also a leak that could be heard very clearly behind the bathroom wall. There was no curved shower rod, which would have been nice to keep the shower curtain as far away as possible, and there were no bags in the garbage cans. Despite the cons, I would recommend this hotel and I would return; the pros outweigh the cons, some of which could be unique to room 2505.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel (thin walls!)”
Reviews.Author: mgoebel
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I spent one night in midtown at this Hilton. The location is excellent -- quick access to the subway, midtown shopping, times square, etc. The hotel itself, however, was disappointing. First, it's absolutely huge and you can forget personalized attention. Or good service, for that matter. (For example, we waited ten minutes for a waiter in the bar before we finally gave up and walked up to the bar ourselves.) Our room was on the 20th floor and I really hope that it was not an "updated" room, because there were some clear deferred maintenance issues: the wallpaper was peeling, the toilet seat was not firmly affixed to the toilet, etc. (The bed was very comfortable, though.) Upon check-out, they charged us $3.50 for each piece of checked luggage; I go to NYC a couple of times each year and have never had to pay a fee to check luggage before. The biggest problem with the room was the paper-thin walls -- on Sunday morning at 8:00 am, we heard the wake-up call for the room next door. The occupant soon preceeded to make several loud phone calls, and I heard every word on his side of the line. I also heard other people's conversations in the hallway. To me, thin walls are a deal-breaker at a hotel, and I won't stay here again. Also, I'm a Hilton Gold member and felt that the status was not really appreciated at the hotel. We did get the coupons for the complimentary breakfast, which was the best part of the stay. However, I got no room upgrade, and no front desk staff acknowledged the Gold status in any manner. I didn't receive or hear about any of the club-level amenities that so many others on this website seemed to experience. Perhaps since I was just there one night I didn't rate the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nurse87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nites here. I always book my hotels on Priceline or Hotwire.I called ahead and requested a non smoking king room. When we arrived ,they gave us a non smoking queen room.They said that it was due to Labor Day weekend.They did upgrade us to executive level on the 39th floor. We received free continental breakfast every am and some other perks.The breakfast was actually very nice and plentiful.But, I still would of preferred a king bed.I guess that I am spoiled because this is the first time that I had a problem with my request even though I used a discount booking service! Idid not ask again for a king room or offer to pay more for one.I met someone who paid 2x as much for the same room that we had.I have to say that the room was very lovely.The view was awesome.The area was quite and serene.The bed very comfortable.The bathroom was quite small but the amenities were excellent. They use Crabtree and Evelyn.The hotel is very busy. The lobby is packed at all times. I did not eat at any of the restaurants. There are so many nice restaurants near by.The best thing about the hotel is the location.So close to everything.We saw 3 shows and walked to them easily.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Staff were first class!”
Reviews.Author: Milo19
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Tues 29/08 until Wed 06/09 - And to be fair it was fantastic. We got there, and we had a few problems checking in, but this was down to our travel agent booking the wrong room, 1 double for three blokes! Anyway, having spoken to Jonathon on the front desk, he was very helpful and moved us to a triple room on the 28th Floor, this guy was superb! Fantastic room, although TV didn't work, called recpetion, they had an engineer up there within ten minutes and basically when the TV has been cleaned, one of the cables had come lose. No problems, it was fixed within 2minutes!! On the 5th day, our safety deposit key wouldn't work, it was stiff to start with, but eventually gave up. We had to wait for security and a lock smith to drill the box, about 30mins but the manager sorted us out with a 2 course lunch at the Market place restaurant! Excellent food there, and particularly recommend the buffet breakfast, although a little pricey! Seriously though, you could not go wrong when staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but impersonal”
Reviews.Author: JudyIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on 6th Ave with our two kids. The location is New York is great for almost everything. Facilities are as you'd expect, good, clean, etc. The hotel is large, so it loses out on any personal touches, if that's what you like. We booked a "Broadway at your Door" package. It includes some discount vouchers for tours and restaurants etc., just ok. Hotel is not bad for families as it has two restaurants, one of which is fairly kid friendly (Marketplace). The room service menu was relatively reasonably priced, (kid's meal around $9). Drinks in the lobby lounge were over-priced for NY but probably average for Hilton. ($8/9 for a beer). We were up-graded from a standard room to an executive room due to lack of availability - a slightly nicer decor and toiletries! Internet facility in lobby quite expensive (about $1 per min+ $1 per printed sheet). Most staff members were polite and professional, but not over-friendly. Rates seem to vary a lot, so check around.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: sethy
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk told us that the parking was included into the room rate, but when we arrived we found out it was't. ($160.00 suprise) We stayed in room #745, the room was hardly large enough to contain our bed. In fact, we had to relocate the furniture so we could both watch the TV together. We also found stains on the bed skirting like another tripadvisor reviewer. The drybar was making a noise that was loud enough that I had to unplug it each night so I could sleep.The hotel location was very good, close to all the things that we wanted to see. Upon leaving the desk clerk offered us a deal on a future stay with parking included, I told him that I wouldn't fall for a second offer of free parking. We dined at Spark's Steakhouse and found it to be expensive, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JarodTX
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York is a great place. It is exceptionally clean and very well located. I stayed there four nights in June for a conference that was being held at the hotel. It was my first trip to NYC so the location was great for me to get out and sightsee. It's in a very nice neighborhood and I would have no problem staying there with my 4 month old daughter. When I search for a hotel my biggest concerns are 1) Safety of the surrounding area and 2) Cleanliness. This hotel was perfect in both respects. I interacted with the staff on a few occasions and found them to be polite and helpful. I greatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly redone, great location”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeIn
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Hilton had recently been redone and was nicely appointed. It was on a Hilton Honors floor. The Hilton is large convention hotel but in a great location within walking distance of Fifth Ave. shopping, Central Park and Times Square. The only complaint we heard was about the slow elevators. We ate at Swifty's on Lexington when we walked to the Frick Museum, Town (very good and within walking distance) and Blu Fin (in Times Square) before we went to the theater. All our meals were excellent and I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: prmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 4 night stay at this Hilton hotel and it was a wonderful experience. Our room was very clean, and the hotel staff was very polite. One of the staff informed my sons that the LA Angels were staying there as well (we are big baseball fans) and we were able to get several autographs which made a very nice bonus to our trip! The hotel is in a perfect location. A five minute walk in one direction will take you to Rockefeller Center, and a five minute walk in the other direction will take you to Central Park. There is a subway stop right around the corner. Radio City Music Hall is just across the street. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families and we would stay there again. The location and the staff were both great.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, must be better hotels in New York”
Reviews.Author: Jedfromtheneckup
Reviews.Content: We have stayed before and we have had issues, this year we booked up well in advance[9 months] asked for adjoining rooms.Late arrival 11pm, no adjoining rooms but on same floor, then the rooms were King beds, when you have two grown lads they do not want share same room, we did ask for one King and two doubles. We said that was not acceptable, asked to see the night manager, his attitude was terrible. Could not care less, said we would be moved the next day as there was a lot of free rooms, never happened. In the end we stayed on the 44th Floor and my family stayed on the 15th, two lift rides to see them The year before I said never again, this year has confirmed it. Oh and i got my loyalty statement this week and after telling the clerk the number, I had lost my card, he did not enter my loyalty number so I have lost my points. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: strayhorn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is convenient to MOMA, shopping on Fifth Avenue, and the theatre district. The place is big, which is a drawback. But we had a good stay there. If you can get a good price on it, I would recommend it. It is not luxurious by any stretch, but we found it clean and comfortable. We managed to get one room key that did not work. We noticed that one of the complimentary water bottles was open as was the mouthwash.

Reviews.Title: “Not usual Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: taupoali
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 days here and regretted booking it on day 1. The big problem was the staff. A bell man let a door slam in my face, the receptionist didn't give me any hotel information and just tossed the room key across the counter at me. I am friendly and polite and to be met immediately with rudeness was very odd. Room service menu was very limited and I had to ask a room service staff member to get out my room as he was complaining he didn't get a big enough tip! Its not worth paying more for an executive room, they are small. The executive lounge is very noisy and big, the main restaurant is better. Overall, not what you would expect for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rinkrat03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York over the weekend of July 28-30. We stayed on the 21st floor with a King size bed. The room was recently renovated and it showed. The bathroom was smaller than expected and consisted of a shower stall and sink with toilet, there was very limited counterspace. The layout of the light switches took some experimentation and exploration to find all of them. The bed was real comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel - very busy - well run and very central location”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: Stay here for a conference every year (SIA Show) held in the hotel convention centre. I find this hotel to be very busy and big and well run as well. It has a great central Manhattan location if business and shopping is your game. Decent sized rooms for Manhattan, comfortable beds, reasonable noise proofing, good exercise area and bathrooms with some room to move around. The decor is up to date and the rooms are well kept and clean. A good property to stay at - there are decent sized check in and check out lines - fortunately I am a Hilton Gold member and have a private check in desk. Recommend others to stay there if business or shopping is prime goal and you do not mind big hotels

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kev'smom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton New York with my 12-year old son this past weekend, July 14-16. After reading many reviews I sent an email to the hotel about a week before our stay requesting one of the renovated rooms. We arrived at the hotel just after 11am on Friday morning and were able to check-in immediately. We were given a renovated room on the 11th floor, which had apparently just been completed a week earlier. What a beautiful room. Even my son was impressed. Very elegant yet comfortable. The beds, down comforters and pillows were wonderful. We had no problems with noise or slow elevators. This hotel is in a great location. Rockefeller Center is about 5 blocks South and Central Park about 5 blocks North. Also, Times Square and the Theater District are within easy walking distance (we walked to "The Lion King" on Saturday night). I had looked at a few of the hotels on Times Square itself but was very glad I chose the Hilton. The Sixth Avenue location is very nice. I found the hotel staff, from the front desk, concierge, maids and bellman (who we didn't use but did ask for a coffee shop recommendation) to be friendly and helpful. We ate one breakfast at the hotel (International Marketplace) and it was fine and actually cost about the same as the other breakfast we had in a coffeeshop. (Overall I found food in New York to be on the expensive side.) Check-out is at 12 noon but since our flight was not leaving until the afternoon on Sunday I called the front desk on Saturday and asked for a later check-out and was given it without hesitation. I checked out using the T.V. (flat-screen!). Very easy. I booked my room online several months ago and paid $202.00 per night and really feel like I got a good value for my money. I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, good stay”
Reviews.Author: emmajane7
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a long weekend, and got a Priceline rate (a week before our trip) of $132 per night. I called the hotel before arriving and requested a king bed, non-smoking room. When we arrived around noon on Friday, we were told that a queen room was all that was available, but since I'm a Hilton rewards member, they upgraded us to the 40th floor. The room was smaller than many on the floor, but perfectly adequate, with a view out toward Central Park. Bathroom fine. Bed quite comfortable. Location of hotel can't be beat for going to Lincoln Center and other theaters. Although we tend to prefer smaller hotels, we believe we got a great deal at the Hilton! The housekeeping staff and the reception staff we encountered were all very helpful and friendly--this is not always true in large hotels, and we tipped accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: guej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go into the city at least once a year for a quick getaway by ourselves without the kids. Each year we go onto Priceline the week before our planned trip and bid about $125 for a room. Twice now we have gotten rooms at the Hilton Towers. Our last stay was the weekend of July 8. We had a great experience and very few complaints. First, the location is fantastic. We spent one day downtown, and there are plenty of subways within a short walking distance from the hotel. Central Park is a quick 5 minute walk from the hotel, which worked out great for a Saturday morning run in the park. The next day we spent walking around the Upper West Side. Again, a very easy and enjoyable walk from the hotel. The room was fine. It was small, but so what. It had everything we needed and we basically only slept in the hotel. I believe you can ask for a small refrigerator for the room, although we did not. There was a mini-bar in the room, and we did splurge, out of desperation, for the $7.50 can of Heineken while we were getting ready to go out! Check-in took less than 5 minutes. The check-in area was well-staffed. Check-out was a breeze as well. We will definetely go back, and wouldn't hesitate to take the kids in for a weekend and stay there. It was very convenient, clean, and hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “New York Hilton - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mkleadrs
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Hilton New York and had a great experience. Family of 4, 2 double beds..plenty of room for all of us to move about in the room. Comfortable beds and pillows. Small bathroom, but nothing we couldn't deal with. Good housekeeping service. Asked for a floor that had been remodeled and away from the elevators...we were on the 25th floor in a corner room. No noise. We didn't eat at any of the on-site restaurants - though there are a few. We did arrive in the morning, so we checked in and had our bags checked($3.50 per bag) until we could check in our room. We just went sight-seeing until after 4 p.m. We were also allowed a late check out - 1 p.m. The kids loved the hotel. We enjoyed it, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Questionable Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Tripper200607
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid my experiences with the Hilton chain never seem to live up to the standards that one would infer from their notional market segment placement, and this example was no exception. The sad thing is the critique (poor customer service, slightly shabby rooms) would be much the same as I'd apply to other less-than-ideal Hiltons. So whereas there's not enough grounds to strongly recommend against, I'd have to say this a locale to use only if (a) something better isn't available when you need it and (b) you can get a sensible room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value in NYC, great location, very nice hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cruzzza
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hilton New York. We got a great deal on Priceline, but that wasn't the only great thing about my stay here. The lady at check in didn't mention Priceline and we even got a small upgrade! Although my room was only on the 18th floor, I had a view of Central Park! There wasn't even a building outside my window! Perhaps my only complaint was that the bellhop bringing our luggage to our room was very rude. I tipped him an appropriate amount, or so I thought, but he didn't even acknowlege me with a "thank you". The rooms and halls were quiet, except for one night when someone had music turned up very loud. Security dealt with them swiftly! The hotel itself was very nice. The lobby was very spacious and easy on the eyes. It provided a nice welcome compared to the busy streets outside. The halls and carpeting were well kept and nice. The rooms were awesome with very nice furniture and luxurious fabrics and draperies. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was fabulous with granite and a full sized tub and shower. Thank goodness they also had a hairdryer! The room was on the small side, but I think that is standard for NYC. We brought four large pieces of luggage and had plenty of room for the two of us and our things. One of the best features of this hotel was that it had a covered area for loading and unloading. Taxis were always coming through for pick ups and drop offs. We never had more than a minute wait and didn't have to fight for them. And, we didn't have to unload and load our baggage on the side of the street, like so many other NYC hotels. I may be mistaken, but I think that the Hilton is the only Manhattan hotel like this. The location was wonderful. It was an easy walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and a slightly longer walk to Times Square. I wanted to be in Times Square, but I am so glad that we weren't. The hustle and bustle there was overwhelming. I would imagine that you'd have to stay very high up to have a quiet evening in a hotel there. Not to mention the difficulty hailing a cab there. It was so easy to come and go at the Hilton. I would give this hotel 5 stars easily!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: About what I expect from a Hilton. Very nice lobby, however I used Priceline ($110) for this room and the self check-in didn't work for me, however a staffer then moved me to the front of the line and checked me in no problem. Room was OK size for NYC, no problems there, everything was clean and in order. Nice location, I usually take NJTransit into NY and the E train ran pretty close by the hotel so it was easy to find. The street vendor out front sells fantastic Gyros, he's always got a 10 deep line after dark, so if you feel like taking a risk, try it out! Otherwise, good stay, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlvr97
Reviews.Content: My friend and I got a good deal on the hotel through Priceline. The woman who checked us in was quite rude. I believe for no other reason except we were "Priceline shoppers". My friend had called ahead to asure that we were to have 2 double beds in a non-smoking room. The woman at the desk promptly informed us that only customers who are from Hotels.com, Trevelocity, or Expedia were allowed to pick what type of room they wanted. She made a phone call after we told her we had called ahead. The next thing we knew we were upgraded to a nicer room. From the pictures that I viewed online from another responder, the hotel is in the process of renovations. We obviously had one of the newer rooms. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel bar closed at 12:30 on a Sat. night, which I thought was odd. They were understaffed but friendly and appologized about being slow. We had the brunch buffet in the hotel on Sunday.....EXCELLENT. It was a little pricey (I believe $23/person) but it is NYC and we thought it was worth it. We didn't have to eat the rest of the day. Close to shopping, theatres, Times Square......it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: hhefzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hilton new york for 2 nights when I went to NYC in june for a weekend getaway with my mom. Compared to other hotels i have stayed at in NYC, the hilton was much much cleaner. We needed a sewing kit at 9 am and within 5 minutes it was slid under our door so that we wouldn't have to open it. The concierge new EVERYTHING about the city. the view from my room on the 36th floor was AMAZING. The bathroom was very big compared to other NYC hotels and there was actually a tub not just a stall. The bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel was perfect, right at the corner of 6th and 53rd so everything worth seeing in manhattan was basically walking distance. Because the rooms are so high, noise is not even an issue. I got an AWESOME rate on priceline (120/night)- the hotel normally goes for 250+/night for the basic rooms. I go to NYC every few months just for a change of scenery and I will DEFINTELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCrawley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Hilton on an extended weekend trip. I had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean and bright with all the amenities. I was very impressed with the beds. They are the best of any hotel I had ever stayed with. The hotel has an impressive staff, which were both friendly and informative. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Following a very reasonable Priceline bid, I secured the Hilton New York. Leading up to our stay, I was a bit hesitant given some of the negative things I'd read about other users' experiences at this property. That, and I attempted to secure a non-smoking, king size bedroom the week before our stay and was told that the hotel couldn't make those sorts of concessions/guarantees to a Priceline user. However, my wife and I checked-into the hotel by noon; we had a lovely non-smoking room with a king-size bed, and enjoyed our stay immensely. The room was immaculate, well-proportioned, and featured a comfortable bathroom--all characteristic of any four-star property. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of most mid-town attractions--Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. My wife and I comfortably walk most places, and we enjoyed a comfortable walk too up to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Most major subway lines are within a half-block of the hotel for those venturing downtown, to the Lower East Side, or into Greenwich Village. In short, I'd highly recommend this hotel to those looking for a romantic weekend away from the kiddies.

Reviews.Title: “HIlton a Good choice, but I think there are better out there”
Reviews.Author: amandatx
Reviews.Content: Trip Overview: Took my mother to NY for her first time as a Mother's Day Gift. We stayed in New York for a long weekend June 9-12 at the Hilton New York. Hotel Selection: I am an Honors Gold member so we wanted to use points for our stay. We did not want to stay in Times Square (and once we got to NY, I was happy we didn't!). The Milennium Hilton, while it looked like a gorgeous hotel, was just too far out of the way from the things that we wanted to do. So, that left us with the Hilton NY. I had stayed in this area of NY before and enojoyed it so we gave the hotel a shot. This hotel is a nice place. Big lobby and a couple of bar areas. Taxis always waiting outside. This hotel seemed to be mainly used for business people/conventions and lacked any kind of unique or special feel. Also, due to the size of the hotel, elevator time was sometimes a problem. Upon arrival, we checked in at the Honors Desk and were upgraded to an "Executive Room" on the 35th Floor. Unless you really want the free continental breakfast, I think spending extra $$ on the Executive Room would be a rip-off! We entered the room and I could tell that it had not been updated. The room appeared dark and the bathroom was not very clean. I called the concierge and asked to be moved. She said someone would be right up to pick up our bags and move us to a remodeled room, but that we would still get the executive floor breakfast priveleges. After 20 minutes, no one came to get our bags so I went downstairs to get the new key for myself. We were moved to the 32nd floor into a remodeled room. It actually appeared to be a bit bigger and felt a lot lighter and cheerier. The modern TV area was much nicer. The bathrooms were pretty much the same in both rooms, but our 2nd room's bathroom did appear cleaner. Pros: Comfortable room and very comfortable bed and linens Nice desk workspace and sitting area Cool flat screen TV and wireless internet Neat MP3/Alarm clock deal Abundance of cabs outside Location is very good! Close to subway stops, Central Park and Times Square without being in the middle of a really loud area. Windows open so you can let the cool breeze in Cons: Remote and wireless access to the TV appeared to "lag" a bit. Bathroom could be more updated and modern to fit with the rest of the room Concierge service was rude and not helpful. There are some good books and maps to help you out at the concierge desk that you can take for free. In general, service was extremely slow. I found it easier to just do things for myself. Big hotel that lacks the charm of a smaller place Elevators sometimes slow Conclusion: A good comfortable and clean hotel, but definitely not a good value. It was fine for us since I used points, but the rate would have been about $500/nt (including tax). I think that is way too expensive, even by NY standards, for this hotel. I definitely think there are better values out there. Other Tips: The Top of the Rock which is located nearby at Rockefeller Center has one of the best views of the city. Although I have been to NY several times, I had never even heard of this. Got some great pictures from up there and I thought the view was better than from the Empire State Building and also NO LINE! Check out the Meatpacking District for some great places to eat and socialize. Seemed to be a pretty trendy, up and coming area. Ride the subway! Although the hotel is very centrally located, explore other parts of the city. Using the subway was not very difficult and we found New Yorkers to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - gret location”
Reviews.Author: NeilColeclough
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a party of eight. We had travelled from the UK for our friends' wedding in Central Park. The hotel suited our needs perfectly. It is very comfortable, and once we had made the hotel staff aware of the reason for our visit they pulled some stops out! We were all moved to higher floors with spectacular views of Central Park, and the night before the wedding strawberries and champagne were delivered to the Bride & Groom's room. The bars at this hotel are very relaxed with a great selection of beers and spirits. The staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't use the hotel's restauarant as there are plenty of restaurants and diners in the vicinity. One special tip - the irish bar around the corner (well 2 corners actually) on 5th avenue is well worth a visit for the jukebox alone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Christine45
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Hilton at the end of May 2006 staying in a deluxe room on the 22nd floor in a room which, according to the receptionist, had recently been refurbished. It was very clean and comfortable with very soft beds, two chairs, a flat screen TV and safe. Couldn't fault it. Location was great - we could walk to a number of the sites and rarely used the subway or taxis. We had no problems waiting for the lift and didn;t eat breakfast in the hotel so cannot add to the comments made by others. We had a meal one evening in the Etrusca restaurant - pricey but very nice. Service was relatively quick. We needed a taxi to the airport about 6 pm on the Friday. In the morning I asked about this and was told just to turn up at 6 pm. However, when we did this we found there was quite a queue and had to wait for about 30 minutes. You do have to pay to leave luggage but if they are not full, you can get a late check out for no extra cost. Overall, the hotel was very good and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York @ Av. of the Americas was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Hilton Club located on floors 34 and 35 of the Hilton New York... Everything I say is to be understated because this hotel is great!!! We both visit NY frequently, at least once a year, and it has been, by far, the best place... The room was huge!!! and by NY standards even bigger!!! the bathroom was like a room by itself. With a shower and a huge tub. The service was amazing also. They serve breakfast and cocktails and the food was delicious. Checkout was easy and efficient and I didn't have to pay for the internet service. Besides, the location is amazing!!! great shops and museums just 1 or 2 blocks away!!! Donâ€™t forget to visit the really famous Arab food stall right on the corner... delicious! L!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & comfort”
Reviews.Author: ScissorsAndPens
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at the Hilton NY on Avenue of the Americas (also known as 6th Ave) while we did a trade show at the Javits. It was not cheap, with extra charges for almost everything ($4 to receive a letter, $12.50 to hold a package for our arrival) But the comfort was wonderful, with the cosiest beds and quiet, immaculate rooms. I felt pampered. The convenience was great- staff friendly & helpful. The location can hardly be beat. If you are looking for a treat and don't mind spending for it, the Hilton NY is a terrific choice. A memorable choice.

Reviews.Title: “convention hotel, stay away from breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: bigmomma01
Reviews.Content: This is a NYC convention hotel- can be very expensive, and i was told it is almost always sold out. (there is a javits convention surcharge on the bill, which is crazy to me, since my meeting was in the hotel itself) I was here for work, and didn't have to pay $399 out of pocket for the average room I received. (I would't stay here if it were on my dime) Bed was comfortable, i'm so glad that the other major hotel chains followed Westin's example with the Westin Heavenly bed! The breakfast buffet is expensive ($29 total) and pretty bad. Lot of containers were empty and weren't being refilled, and the area looked messy. this hotel is a factory, with tons of people in and out and disinterested staff.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: slacker5555
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline and received a great deal on price at $120. So, overall, for the money we paid, we are satisfied. I was disappointed that this was what was considered 4 star. The room smelled like smoke. We were told it was a non-smoking room but that someone could come and spray it (uh, no thanks). The decor was outdated and dull. The bathroom had mould growing on portions of tile and the roof had clearly suffered a leak and an amateur patch-up job. Service was impersonal and you were encouraged to check-in and check-out via computer stations. The maids tried to open our door several times in the morning before we got out of bed at 9:30am. On the good side: it was clean, it was safe, and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. All in all, not really impressed. I wouldn't recommend it for someone paying full price and looking for a little bit of character and style. I would, however, recommend it for someone looking for basic accommodation in an excellent location (if you score a good nightly rate). MoMa is right down the street and you can walk to virtually every attraction around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 4 nights and found the hotel to be of any average standard. We had a room in the 20th floor which was quite spacious with 2 double beds. The beds and pillows where extremely comfortable... in fact I would love one at home. The bathroom was adequete size with plenty of towels. We did not eat in the hotel so I can not comment on the food. The Bridge Bar was very nice and had a lovely atmosphere but unfortunately does not open on a Sunday. The main drawback we found was the fact that there were no safes in the room. We did get a safety deposit box which was in a room behind reception. However the service here was the most inefficent we have ever found. The buzzers on the door do not work and even when we requested help from reception we had to wait over 10 minutes for someone to help. Then they had problems with the keys and we had to wait another 5 minutes while they tried to open the box.!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas deal ever!”
Reviews.Author: kwbts124
Reviews.Content: Aaahhh Christmas in New York! This was my first trip to NYC and one of the most memorable 3-day-3night getaways I've had. The hotel was top quality and a great value ($139 per night until Dec 26th when it went up to $339 per night - ouch!). We stayed the nights of Dec 23rd, 24th & 26th. We arrived at Kennedy airport and found that there was no shuttle to the hotel. We could have rode the train/subway but did not want to carry our luggage so we took a cab ($45). Check-in was a little slow as we had to wait in a 20-minute line (but it was Christmas in NYC). The lobby was large, nice and clean but not grand. We were given a great room on the 14th floor overlooking the Avenue of the Americas - spectacular view with all the Christmas decorations! The room was very large, had a beautifully clean marble bathroom (albeit a bit small); they heated the hotel and room perfectly (even for us and we live in Key West). The hotel was centrally located and we only used a cab once (due to tempurature and rain). There was a vender selling awesome food (a sort of a gyro) on the street next to the hotel - his food was sooo good that the line was typically 30 minutes or longer - but worth it! We had pre-purchased tickets (definitely the way to go as tickets can be hard to get at the door) to see a Broadway show and we asked for walking directions/maps from the conciege in the hotel lobby - very helpfull and pleasant. We used the tourist map given to us to the rest of our stay! We ate at the hotel's restaurant for breakfast once - nothing special and a little pricey for what you get. I used the gym twice during the stay - it cost extra but I couldn't run in Central Park in December (it was raining a lot) so I paid the daily rate (I believe it was $15 per day). The facilities were clean and adequate; the treadmills had a view of the Avenue of the Americas and TVs. The gym attendant dissappeared quite often but may have been cleaning equipment or helping guests. The elevators were very small and always crowded. We often had to wait two or three trips before we could get on together. We didn't mind becuase afterall, it was Christmas. Most guests were very happy and pleasant - we had no loud noises or distractions during our stay. Overall this was the perfect hotel for us in our price range - we were treated as if we spent $500/night by the staff and concierge. I would ONLY stay at this hotel during my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while attending a conference. I had a room on the 30th floor with a king bed, flat screen tv, and all the other standard amenities. The positives: 1. Terrific location - easy access to the best shopping areas, Times Square, theater district, Central Park, museums, etc. For this reason alone I would consider staying here again. 2. Room was pretty comfortable and well-equipped, although small. 3. Service was generally good, but I especially liked the room service staff. They were very friendly and able to do a couple custom orders. 4. Pricing for room service was surprisingly reasonable, given the hotel brand and location. The service charge was only $3 instead of the usual 17-18% surcharge. For the first time in a long time, I actually tipped. 5. Concierge was available later than most (I was able to stop by around 10 pm). The negatives: 1. As mentioned in other reviews, the area is NOISY! Lots of construction going on, even in the middle of the night (jackhammers at 2 am, taxis honking). There was even maintenance going on in the hotel at nights. After awhile I tuned it out, but light sleepers will have a rough time. 2. Can be crowded during busy times (i.e., Friday night, multiple conferences at the same time). The express elevator ride can be really slow when stopping at every floor. 3. Room temp was hard to control. I was feeling under the weather one night and tried to turn the heater on, but it just blew lukewarm air. 4. I was charged $150 for a wireless bridge, although they did refund it. 5. Flat screen tv remote was laggy, with a second delay between pushing the button and the channel or volume changing. Turning off the tv using the remote turned it back on again (finally figured out I had to hold the power button longer). 6. Restaurant food is mediocre. I ate a late dinner at the Marketplace when I arrived and got pasta to go at Etrusca one night. Overall, the stay was fine and I would certainly consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Levi22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a very busy time in New York and this hotel was one of the only nice hotels I could find available with only a few hours notice. The room was very nice, comfortable, and clean... The lobby was huge and elegant. My room was very noisy due to construction outside, but that can't last forever. Over all it was a good, expensive, stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a bachlorette weekend. There were 6 girls and we had two rooms that were connected. One with 2 double beds and one with a king. The rooms worked out perfectly. We got the rooms for $150 a night on Priceline. An incredible deal. The location is perfect to everything. The service to adequate, we didn't need much in the way of service but it did take a lot of questions and prodding before we got the connected rooms we wanted. The rooms are very clean and modern. Bathrooms are on the smaller side but I would say everything was great. Baggage check is $3.50 PER bag as everyone else has mentioned. It is rather annoying. Otherwise would highly recommend it. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my now fiancee in April. Having read the reviews on this site I wanted to book the Hilton Times Square. However due to an admin error I ended up booking the Hilton New York by mistake. The internet site I used didnt let me cancel however I neednt have worried... it was a great stay in a nice hotel. OK it wasnt the best hotel I have ever stayed in but it did everything we asked of it. First the good - the location - The best thing about this hotel - 5 mins walk from Central park in one direction and 5 mins from the theatre district / times square. The rooms - big and bright. Bathroom good, air con no probs, no street noise on the 39th floor. It wasnt a renovated room - we had one of those on the 32nd floor but due to a family staying next door we moved the next day (incidentally the front desk staff were perfectly amenable) to a room that had not been renovated on the 39th floor facing central park. OK so we didnt have a flat screen TV now but what the heck - we didnt go to NYC for the TV - we didnt even open the TV cabinet. Room service - friendly, very quick, not cheap but they brought it in on a big table and laid everything out spending a few minutes making sure everything was perfect. Maids - cleanliness up to standard, as soon as we took the do not disturb off the door they must have been in like a shot to start cleaning. The beds - very very comfortable - we had a king. The sheets are great and the pillows just the right support. Slept like a log. Zip out checkout using the phone - we didnt need to check out just press a button on the phone and hand the key cards in at the desk. There were periods when the reception was busy and others when it was dead so it was nice to just press a button in the room and go. Now the bad - OK there were a couple of times we saw trays and leftover food in the coridoor - we generally went out in the morning and then returned later and the trays were gone. Left luggage - bit steep - we checked out and left our bage while we went out for the rest of the day and it cost 14 US. We had coats and a couple of little bags and at least they didnt charge for those). Would have liked a room to get changed into when we got back etc but there wasnt one - except the rest rooms - problem was the floor was wet with an overflowing toilet ! We didnt eat in the restaurants so cant comment there. Try "Red Flame" 67 W44th Street for breakfast - dont bother with Lindy's near the hotel - its overpriced. Also "The Red Cat" in Chelsea for nice evening meal and go down to the Village and try a pizza at Johns and Jazz bars. You have got to walk over the Brooklyn bridge see the views of manhattan and try the brooklyn ice cream place under the bridge near water street. Its near to Lombardi's - famous excellent pizza place - prob best in NY. If you are looking for clothes shopping as well - go to the newish Abercrombie and Fitch across from Trump tower near to central park on 7th avenue - 5 mins from hotel. The tickets booth in the hotel was helpful getting us phantom tickets on the same day - great seats (paid twice the value of the tickets though). Overall I would say we really enjoyed our stay and we were not disappointed by the hotel - bit pricey, but overall pretty good. Maybe would try somewhere else in the same sort of location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would reccommend depening on your rate”
Reviews.Author: vtroper
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel with an excellent location. Highly recommend shopping for rates on Hilton(-) I was able to book a Net direct rate (which they charge you for upon making your reservation) at 209.00 per night when other sites were charging 329.00. Considering the rate that we payed we were very pleased with the hotel. Had we had to pay $120 more, I would of been much more critical. I do agree with the nickel and diming of some of the other posters. $3.50 per bag to store your luggage after you check out is poor. Their slightly above average good breakfast buffet was $23.95 per person. Parking was $40 per day. Overall, worth staying in if you can get it for less then $250 per night, above that, you should be able to find a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: bbtpls
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the New York Hilton. Nice large hotel with fast elevators. Food service pretty good. The day we checked in, there was plates, trash, and spilled food outside one room. We observed multiple hotel employees stepping over the stuff for an entire day before it was cleaned up. Be prepared to pay $12 per person for the pleasure of using the fitness room. Our return flight to California was not until late afternoon. Since we had to check out by 1:00, we decided to check our bags with the bellman so we could get lunch before heading to the airport. The bellman told us to take our own bags downstairs. Once downstairs, the man there told us it would be $3.50 per bag regardless of how long we left the bags. So, we payed $14.00 for the pleasure of leaving our bags for one hour. Now that's Customer Service!

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful about how you pay your bill”
Reviews.Author: decoratorsue
Reviews.Content: Not sure how to rate this review as to whether the problems are this hotels or Hilton in general. Booked a special Valentines weekend for all the family for their first visit to New York. Had seen this hotel on previous visits and thought the location was excellent for our family needs. Very central and easy walking to all main locations. Contacted hotel direct to request, and check, that we had interconnecting rooms as with a very late arrival and two small children problems at check-in to be avoided. Although I had a re-assuring reply from the hotel it didn't work. The check-in desk couldn't have cared less and I had to fight for the connecting rooms. Took us nearly 45 mins to check-in at midnight. Had booked on Executive floor but rooms very tired and paper peeling off the walls with obvious signs of damp. Not what was expected for the price. Next day very helpful young lady searched for a selection of rooms to maintain the connecting aspect whilst getting a better condition of room. Worked well till check out when the bill was wrong and then overcharged, item for mini bar charged for but we didn't use and wrong c/c charged for extras. I was paying the room--daughter the extra--so make sure you only give them one. Refund didn't take toooooo long but of course then the difference in exchange rates for taking and returning overcharging left me very out of pocket. Has taken till now(April) to get anyone to issue the HHpoints and airline miles and finish the refund. Not what you would expect from a top class hotel or company. Unfortunately took the shine off an otherwise enjoyable vacation. Will definately visit New York again--in fact we are in October but will have to find a superb rate before staying in a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton: Please check your standards!”
Reviews.Author: fauxy
Reviews.Content: For $359.00 we got a very cramped room on the 32nd floor. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. But there were problems: 1. The air-conditioner did not work so our room got very hot and humid in the daytime. Thankfully, we could open the windows just a bit to let some fresh air in though the room was still warm by the end of the day. 2. Wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom and room 3. Marble tiles were loose. You can feel it jingle when you step on the floor. I did take photos and I am posting them as well. 4. I don't understand why they keep not just ONE but 2 or 3 housekeeping trolleys filled with linen/towels, etc in the hallways ALL THE TIME day or night. It just was an eyesore! So terribly unprofessional. On the positive: The bed was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was very clean though cramped. The staff was very accommodating. The food was very good at Etrusca. PLEASE Hilton: don't let this wonderful location go below the Hilton standard.

Reviews.Title: “Street noise is a big problem; stealthy 50% early checkout penalty”
Reviews.Author: sfchris
Reviews.Content: Summary: This hotel has a huge problem with street noise that makes it a no go for light sleepers. This hotel has a HUGE problem with the seals on their window frames leading to street noise entering the room. I was on the 34th floor and heard lots of noise and I was in the middle of the block with the least traffic! I feel sorry for those on floors lower than that who are close to the 53rd or 54th streets where all the traffic is... I have stayed on the 16th floor of other NYC hotels on busy streets and never heard street noise... Another thing they do to force you to sign an agreement when you check in that you will pay a 50% penalty if you leave early. I was never informed of this penalty when I booked my trip and wanted to have a flex day at the end. It seems like they must receive a lot of complaints about this because when you go to do the automated phone check out, the testy voice on the recording reminds you sternly once again that you will be penalized if you check out early. Very few hotels charge this penalty and certainly not other Hiltons. Tacky. Finally, on the photos on this web site you see beautiful views of Central park. Keep in mind that you will only see that view if: a) you are on floor 41-44 (executive floors) b) your view is one of the few not blocked by ajacent buildings c) and you are on the Central park side of the hotel. All and all, a huge impersonal hotel that is showing its age... and the street noise is a deal killer. If you MUST stay there, insist on a high floor in the middle of the block.

Reviews.Title: “Strange experience!”
Reviews.Author: Fife_traveller
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 5 night stay in the Hilton - location is excellent, and room was very good - clean and comfortable. So much for the good points, now... Reception staff need a rocket up their backside - they only work with one speed and one attitude - i.e. they are doing you a massive favour by deigning to speak to you. We were B&B, and to benefit from this, you have to get vouchers from reception (why?) and hand these over in the restaurant. Of course, reception didn't offer these up front, so 1st morning was totally confusing. Even stranger, for a buffet breakfast you get presented with a bill despite being B&B - this bill includes a 15% service charge for a self-service breakfast! As waitress was so unhelpful on 1st morning we told her to 'get lost' (or words to that effect) and she actually chased us in to the lift demanding her 15% tip! I know that tipping is the American way, but where I come from you have to earn it... If you can, find a really nice hotel instead! (We stayed in the Sofitel in 2005 and it was truly fabulous in comparison...)

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and impressed”
Reviews.Author: AlanLight
Reviews.Content: This is a four-star hotel with touches of five-star, and it really tries to be five-star. I was impressed. I stayed there recently on business, in a one bedroom suite on the 43rd floor (there are 44). If I have anything bad to say about the room, it's the bed. They need to get the Hilton equivalent of Westin's "Heavely Bed" or something. The bed is hard and uncomfortable. The down pillows are terrific, though. The carpeting and furniture are nice but not top-notch. Still, maybe four star, but it's not The Beverly Hills Hotel or Peninsula. The staff I have encountered has all been exceptionally friendly. The room service food has been incredible. If you order a fruit plate or salmon & bagels for breakfast be aware there is enough of each for two people. Fresh squeezed orange juice was terrific. All the room service food (I've had one breakfast and one lunch) has been perfectly prepared, delivered in 20 minutes and beautifully presented. There are many elevators in a hotel this large, and each bunch services different floors. Three elevators service floor 43 and so I can only comment on that, but they are quite slow. You do wait a bit for them to arrive. the hotel is very conveniently located, within blocks of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave, etc. The Museum of Modern Art (MOMA) is across the street. Internet service is $9.95 per 24 hours. No view out of our room to speak of...just another tall office building. Temperature control was good. If only the bed were more comfortable I would recommend this hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Wlecome To New York”
Reviews.Author: Seanie_pc
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about booking this hotel. I thought the photo's they have posted looked a little shabby. But there was nothing to worry about. Having visited New York several times this was the best hotel I've visited. Everything worked here. The impressive lobby, the relaxing piano bar, friendly accomodating staff and excellent rooms. It also hosted the fastest checkin/out in the whole city. Dont forget your in New York so request a high floor room and breath in the view of the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Generall good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for the St. Patricks weekend. Hotel itself is large, but fairly standard. We had a 14th floor room which was small but well kept (flat screen TV) and sufficient for our needs. Better than I expected for the price ($200). Only thing which we didn't have which would have been useful was a hair dryer in room. The guest information intimated that there was one but we never found it. Didn't eat or drink in the hotel as we knew it would be pricey. Location is excellent for "tourist traps" and it's close to subway for anywhere. Would definitely recommend it at the price I paid, though I believe (reading the posts) that some get it even cheaper. Have had much worse rooms in NY for more cash.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in one-bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheRoad
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two young children in a one bedroom suite (room 4325) at Hilton New York for four nights from March 11 to 15, 2006. The rate we paid was US$479 per night before taxes. The room itself was clean and nicely decorated. There were little hints here and there in the room that the hotel has been around a long time, but most of the furnishings were probably only about four years old. We had a one-bedroom suite which had two double beds and a TV in the bedroom, a very small bathroom off the bedroom, a living room with a couch (with pull-out bed) in the living room, as well as one chair in the living room plus a second chair at a desk, and a kitchenette with a sink and a micro fridge plus a minibar. The room was not what was advertised on the Hilton web site. The Hilton web site has a picture of a very large living room with a six-seat dining table off to the side. Our living room, while nice, was small and did not include a dining table. It was just not as grand as advertised. This was disappointing given the rate we paid. But, it was still acceptable and mostly clean. While the living room was smaller than I expected, the bedroom was a good size, maybe slightly larger than average for New York City. There was no electrical outlet in the bathroom. This meant you had to take the portable hair dryer included in the bathroom out to another room to make it work. While the suite was mostly clean, there were a number of light stains in the carpet. As it was a suite, it was automatically on one of the executive floors (43rd floor). The executive lounge, where we checked in, and ate a continental breakfast a couple of times, was on the 44th floor and was large, open and well lit, and had lots of tables and (continental) breakfast food and juices. The elevators were not a problem and were fairly fast as they had rows of elevators for different groups of floors. We parked our car using valet parking at the parking garage on 53rd street. If you come east down the one-way 54th street, you will have to bypass the hotel which is on the Avenue of the Americas (Sixth Avenue) and go to Fifth Avenue, turn right onto Fifth Avenue and then immediately right again onto 53rd street, which is a one-way street headed west, then you will pass Avenue of the Americas while still on 53rd Street, then before you get to Seventh Avenue you will turn right into a parking garage that is part of the building that contains the Hilton. We ate breakfast once in the hotel restaurant "New York Marketplace", which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The breakfast was a little expensive, and though acceptable in taste, it was not great. There is a business office on the second floor of the hotel, but it is not run by the hotel. You can use a computer there with internet access for $15 for 10 minutes. There is a great grocery store called Ernest Klein & Co. International Supermarket between 54th and 55th streets (one street north of the Hilton), on the opposite side of the Avenue from the Hilton, at 1366 Avenue of the Americas. By "great" I don't mean the prices, I mean the selection. It is good to have a full grocery store nearby and not just a deli with limited selection. I would recommend the hotel for its location. You can walk to Central Park, to Times Square, and Fifth Avenue shopping. As for other tips about NYC, my favorite meal was at Virgil's Real BBQ on 44th Street between the Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue. A fun stop was at the "Ecomony Candy" store on 108 Rivington Street in the East Village, which was piled high with almost every candy you can imagine, and where we walked to after eating a great breakfast at the Clinton St. Baking Company. We then walked from "Economy Candy" to visit the soon to be demolished CBGB rock n' roll club on Bleeker & Bowery. I would advise you to buy your Empire State Building tickets online before you go (you don't commit to a specific use date when you buy them online) as you can then avoid the ticket purchase line when you get to the building. A fun place to visit if you have kids is Deb's Family Disco in Manhattan. The Grey Line bus tour is top-notch and a must see for a visit to Manhattan. The Burger Joint makes the best burgers I have ever had. It is secretly located in Le Parker Meridien hotel on 57th Street and Avenue of the Americas. I say secret location as it is not advertised and has no obvious signage except for a little neon hamburger that you can see if you peer down a dark hallway, between the check-out desk and a lage curtain in the lobby of Le Parker Meridien hotel. This is within easy walking distance of the Hilton New York. Photos of my Hilton room (one bedroom suite #4325) are attached.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Phil of England
Reviews.Content: In a city where a night in a halfway decent hotel costs about the same as my monthly mortgage payment, the Hilton New York seems to tick most of the boxes if you get a good deal. It's well located on 6th Avenue with all the facilities you'd want or need in a hotel. My ninth-floor room was not large but perfectly pleasant, with a very comfortable bed and a trendy flat-screen television. There are, however, a few negatives. The receptionists at both check-in and check-out were totally charmless people who answered every question with impatience and aggression - clearly some staff training is required here. And the bar was exorbitantly expensive at nearly $40 for four beers - though that did include the unscheduled entertainment of a couple having a slow-burning but spectacular row nearby. However, unlike his colleagues on reception, the bartender was friendly and recommended a bar across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cleanliness an issue”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. The room was a good size for a single traveler or a couple. Room was not really clean - coffee pot had grounds/filter leftover from preious guest. Service is fine but not extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: helenfromtoronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from March 10 to 12. We have no complaints about the hotel. We used the kiosks near the front desk to check ourselves in, and the phone in our room to check ourselves out. We had a queen room on the 10th floor near the elevator and although we could hear the elevators going up and down, it was not loud enough to keep us up at night. We couldnâ€™t hear any street noise. After reading other reviews, I was expecting the rooms to be tiny but they werenâ€™t. We were very happy with the rate (booked through ----) and we got exactly what we expected. We didnâ€™t pay Ritz prices so we didnâ€™t get Ritz rooms. The bed was very comfortable and the size was plenty big enough for our shopping, with room to spare. The bathroom was a bit outdated but who cares. The service was helpful; we called the concierge a couple of times for directions and we were always able to get a cab outside with almost no wait. I like that security screens everyone coming into the hotel at night. The location is a short walk to Times Square, Broadway, the Empire State Building, MOMA and shopping on Madison and 5th Avenues. One complaint is that the only restaurants in the area are all tourist traps; overpriced and nothing special, although we did eat at Normaâ€™s (expensive) and the Burger Joint (cheap), both at the Parker Meridian Hotel, and they were both great. We also ate at Bobby Flayâ€™s Bar Americain and it was not great. Also, because we tended to hang out in SoHo, Nolita and the Meatpacking District for dining and shopping, we will stay in a hotel in one of those areas next time (although if the rates arenâ€™t as good, weâ€™d definitely go back to the Hilton); we took $12 cab rides there and back each day. I took a shuttle from La Guardia when I arrived and paid $15 in advance for Supper Shuttle service (my husband was already in New York); the service was fine but I would only recommend it for solo travelers. Cabs are faster and cost around $35 to midtown plus tolls, so youâ€™re not saving that much money with a shuttle service. Plus, depending on the location of your hotel, you may get dropped off last, which could mean a long delay (although great for sightseeing). Bring comfy shoes and a spring jacket; the weather was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed multiple time and never had any problems”
Reviews.Author: PAWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 4 times and never had any problems. The Hotel is located a block away from 5th Avenue and a block away from Times Square. The rooms are clean and a nice size. You won't be disapointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC 5 times and each of the hotels I have stayed in before have been absolutely awful - but I was led to expect this of New York hotels. This time I asked my travel agents advice and she recommended this one without any reservations as she had stayed there before herself. The Hilton New York is nothing like the previous NY hotels I have visited. The location is fantastic, the staff welcoming and courteous and the hotel lobby and room were to the highest of standards. I emailed before I went to request a smoking room and also to ask if they could make sure there were no down or feather pillows/duvets etc as I am allergic. On arrival I was informed, before even asking, that all feathers had been removed from the room. We had room 1520 and it was lovely. Spotlessly clean, LCD tv and very spacious by New York standards. I have no complaints at all and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC who doesnt want to stay in the usual New York dive!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hilton New York and would definitely repeat it. We are Hilton Honors members so we were on an obviously renovated dedicated Honors floor (join the program. it's free. it's worth it.) and everything was beautiful. The room was lovely with an incredibly comfortable bed and a plasma tv. (Did I love the print of the bedspread? Who cares? The lines underneath were soft and pretty and comfortable.) We were on the 33rd floor so got very little street noise. All the staff members we encountered were very polite and friendly. The common spaces we walked through were very nice, although I can't speak to specifics on the restaurants, bars and gym because we didn't use those facilities. Excellent location, just a few blocks from several subway lines. Very good Middle Eastern food available from carts on local corners. Within walking distance of a lot of great stuff like Times Square and the 5th Avenue shopping district. My one negative comment is that they charge you $3.50 a bag to store your baggage after you check out. I have never in my life encountered this at any other hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and dreary, but great location”
Reviews.Author: applegator
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at the Hilton for a conference. First the positives: - Great location, felt like all the hot spots were only very short walk away - Maid service was spot on, leave your room for 30 minutes, you come back and your room is clean - Staff was friendly and helpful - Great shower heads and water was always high pressure and hot. - Workout facilities are great, plenty of equipment, steam and sauna. The negatives: - The rooms are very bland and somewhat dated. The flat screen tv helps, but it doesn't make up for late 80s decor. - The whole place just had a dreary feel to it for me. You can see "glimpses" of the renovations i've heard about in the common areas. But as far as renovated rooms, I never saw any of them nor did any of the 20 other people I was with, and we were scattered all throughout the hotel. - The heating/cooling system just didn't seem to work... it seemed to stay a constant 70 degrees in the room, but when it's 20 outside, you might want it a little warmer and the windows just let in all kinds of cold. All in all, there are no deal-breakers here. But there's also nothing that would make me instantly choose this hotel over another one.

Reviews.Title: “Major advantages over other NYC hotels”
Reviews.Author: BoogRock
Reviews.Content: You will find things in this hotel that you just won't find in other NYC hotels. The rooms are big, clean, and comfortable and are nicely decorated and well-appointed. The windows actually open, which is rare for a city hotel. In addition, this hotel is ideally located close to Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Best of all, it has it's own circular-covered driveway which can be used for off-the-street loading and unloading of luggage and passengers, which is extremely rare in the Big Apple. In addition, the hotel services, such as room service and snack carts, were much more reasonably priced than other NYC hotels I've stayed in. Because of all these conveniences, I highly recommend this hotel for families traveling with small children. Alas, there are some major drawbacks. This hotel is big and impersonal, and seems to exemplify the "NY minute" ideology with it's rushed and boisterous atmosphere. Because it is a popular convention and tour group hotel, it is always crowded with rude folks who will ignore queues and push and shove their way ahead of lines, especially with regard to the elevators. Worst of all, the walls in the guest rooms are paper thin and you can easily hear folks in adjacent rooms yelling into their cell phones. Anyone will tell you there is no perfect NYC hotel, but this one has so many conveniences that I think the negatives could be overlooked if you get it at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night girl's weekend in NYC and were able to get the hotel for $125/night ($150 w/tax) through Priceline. We checked in very late on Thursday night and had no problem getting a room with 2 beds. We were on the 34th floor facing south and could see the river through the buildings to our west. The room was great, plenty of towels and space for 3 shopping fiends. The 34th floor was great as you could catch one of two groups of elevators and never have to wait. The ice-machine was full and right by the service area so if you needed more soap/towels, you could have picked them up yourself too. The only negatives were no coffee the first morning (we called, they brought it promptly and called back to make sure we had it), then no coffee set-ups the next day. After that we left a note and had plenty. We were also charged for a "lint roller" on our bill (only charge since we had pre-paid) and when I went downstairs the last morning they immediately took it off, even saying "we don't offer lint rollers" (so WHY was it on there?). Not a big deal, but for $8.50 + tax, worth getting taken off. The concierge desk was wonderful. We asked for a casual close-by Japanese place the first night as our feet were completely worn out. The man there guided us to one less than 2 blocks away that was absolutely fabulous. We also found a liquor store, a breakfast spot and a restaurant in Chinatown through them - very happy with all of their recommendations! If you go soon and are looking for a show, we highly recommend "The Pajama Game" with Harry Connick Jr. Not hotel related, but a definite see!

Reviews.Title: “Seen better....”
Reviews.Author: JulieMeyer
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in the Hilton San Diego for a couple of weeks, I was disappointed by the Hilton NYC. Staff at check in was rude and told me I couldn't use the gym for free even though I'm a Silver member of the HiltonHHonors Program. I asked someone more friendly the next day and - surprise, surprise - was told the gym was free for silver members. The rooms are very small and I obviously had a non-renovated room on the 35th floor. Wall paper was peeling, the seat covers were very worn (with holes!) and the bathroom had seen better days. The maid left the stopper of the drain in the middle of the tub every day, and I couldn't fit it back into the drain. That was very disgusting. The coffeemaker and mugs were covered with dust, obviously neither used nor cleaned in a long time. Other than that, the location was great, and in contrast to the Hilton San Diego there was a Minibar with enough room for a yoghurt or juice brought in by myself, and there was also a safe in the room. The location is very convenient in midtown - the only reason why I will probably stay there again on my next trip. I will definetly ask for a renovated room - should be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DebMichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton New York for a 4 night break in February during the recent blizzard. We arrived late at night and when we got there the lady on the desk was rude, unhelpful and couldn't have cared less if we got the connecting rooms we were promised. Finally, we got to the rooms, and put the kids to bed at 1am. When we woke, we were amazed to see how basic the rooms were for the price. We had chosen rooms on the executive level so we could make use of the breakfast.We were on the 36th floor and the rooms were noisy,hot and small. We decided that the paper peeling off the rooms and the scruffy appearance just wasnt worth the $339 a night charge. So we went to complain. The lady was more than helpful and gave us a couple of rooms to choose from. We went for the refurbished rooms on the 22nd floor. THe views were not as good but the rooms were defintaly modern, with a wonderful walk in shower and flat screen tv. THe lady was kind enough to include free breakfasts in the restaurant for all 6 of us and full access to the executive lounge as well. The hotel is in a wonderful location close to rockerfella plaza, radio city, times square and because of that restaurants are not cheap. One thing i would warn future visitors about is the bill. We were over charged by $800 when we got home and it has taken a few days and numerous phonecalls to sort out. All in all New York is a wonderful place and i would go back to the Hilton New York and i would makesure i had a refurb room. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could live here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend at least 40 nights a year at Hilton hotels across North America, and this one offered us more than expected. As a HHonors members, our room was on the 36th floor - stunning views, spacious, all new, with a HUGE comfy king bed (for $90 a night). Access to the executive lounge with hors d'ouvres at night and breakfasts in the morning (delicious pastries included!) were all included. The maid service was also amazing - they don't knock on your door early, and when you leave at noon and come back an hour later your room is made. We also enjoyed the security -noone gets into the hotel late at night without showing their room card. The only downside is that rooms don't come with internet access included, as is customary at other hotels that are part of the Hilton chain. We would move here!

Reviews.Title: “Location A++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hilton New York from 1/27 - 1/29. Our room was ready for check in @ 9:00 AM It wasn't the biggest room with a Queen bed but it was suffice for us since most of our time was spent on the streets of NY. The location was great, we were only a few blocks from Time Square and NBC Studios, but at the same time not in the middle of Time square mayham. We were able to walk to anything we wanted from Central Park to Times square and subway was close for all else. Back to the Hotel Room. The Bed was very comfortable and we stayed on the Central Park side of the building which was not blocked by an ajacent building so we had a pretty nice view for the most part. If we were to stay in Midtown again I would book the Hilton. By the way we got it for $132 a night through Priceline. That is a plus also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ach0717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton New York for one night January 28-29. We got an amazing rate on priceline of $125 for the night. The hotel was in a great location and close to everything. We visit NYC often and thought this hotel was the total package. We arrived via cab and were dropped off right in front of the hotel and the doormen were quick to help us with our bags. Check in was a breeze. There were no long lines and 5 or 6 people at the desk to check guests in. The lobby was bright and pretty with lots of restaurants. Our room was ready and we found it with no problem. The room was smaller than others we have stayed in, but this caused no problem. The room was very clean, bed very comfortable. The flat screen TV was nice and the decor was updated and in style. We had plenty of towels in the bathroom and didnt need to ask for a thing while we were there. While we didnt spend very much time in the room, we had a great experience. We were very comfortable and taken care of. Check out was fast and easy. We had pre-paid on priceline and did what they call "Zip-checkout" over the phone. You just press the check out button on your phone and you are checked out. It was very fast and avoided any lines in the lobby. Overall we had a great stay in NYC and would stay at the Hilton again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: na9101
Reviews.Content: stayed at the NY Hilton for 1 night Jan 5th. was upgraded to a renovated room, with flat screen TV. Very modern looking, almost like a room at a 'W' Hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bigpat8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of January (after New Year), so got great price on Priceline, Â£80 per night. Possibly best location of any hotel in NY, right beside Rockefeller/Radio City, 3 mins to Central Park, 1 min to MOMA, 10mins to Times Square, less to most theatres, all walking. Hotel itself is huge, but staff were very good. One major problem was noise from outside and we were way up on 26th floor with windows closed. Also $18.50 for two bottles of Bud at bar was a bit extreme, even by NY prices. But room was big and kept very clean and location made up for any minor flaws. Would recommend if you dont mind noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was not being very professional during our check in. She was slouching and had one hand on her cheek while talking to us. On the whole, hotel was average, the interior looked a little old

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Don88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton New York in January 2006. The hotel is by far a 4 star in quality, amenities, and service. The 6th Avenue location was great and you are near many of the midtown activities. The staff was accommodating and friendly. One word of caution: if you are driving do not pull up to the main entrance on 6th Avenue. They will direct you to the hotel parking lot a quarter block down on W 53rd. When you park, they will call a porter from the hotel and you enter the lobby from the rear entrance. We didn't use the hotel restaurants - in NY City there are plenty of places to eat! Overall a great stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Good Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMom17
Reviews.Content: In view of some of the negative comments, we were looking forward, with trepidation, to our stay at the Hilton. We took our two ten-year old grandchildren, who are extremely well-traveled, as part of a AAA special Christmas tour and were very pleasantly surprised. Even the grandchildren approved and they are used to five star hotels!
