It had been at least 25 years since we had stayed at the Hilton but remembered the "old days" when it was new and one of the glitziest. We found the rooms clean and well decorated, the beds are redone with the wonderfully deep mattresses, feather duvets, and lots of pillows, and we had a great view from the 34th floor. Our bathroom was very large with a handheld shower and lots of thick towels (maybe because it was a handicap room). Although not requested, I must admit it was welcome because of the extra space usually involved in the bathroom areas. We ate a breakfast and lunch at the Marketplace and found it to be reasonable with pleasant food. The staff was accommodating but the Concierge sent us around the corner for lunch to a new restaurant with a menu featuring only four entrees and two salads and boasting a mighty price, knowing we had two children with us. She half-heartedly tried to get us a reservation at Tavern on the Green, and was non-committal when I said I had heard that the Tavern had gone down hill and was now barely more than a tourist trap. Our son had been in NY the week before and given us this info. Because of the wonderful location: Radio City across the street, MOMA in the next block, four blocks to Central Park, six blocks to Rockefeller Center, and a block off Fifth, you could hardly get a better hotel for walking everywhere. We discovered Rosie O'Grady's Restaurant/Pub behind the hotel on Seventh Ave. and enjoyed the great food and very fair prices, and as previously mentioned, Starbucks is across from the front door. When you consider we spent $199. per person for two nights at the hotel, four seats at the Rockettes Christmas Show, and a 2 1/2 hour Grayline tour of the Christmas Lights, it was the very best deal in town!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 4 days for our first time ever in NEW YORK CITY. We drove all the way from Florida. Needless to say we were tired when we arrived. Our check in process was to say the least.. VERY COLD AND RUDE. When we arrived in our room, as soon as we opened the door it had a foul smell. As my children were about to get sick from the smell, my husband noticed that there were not bedspreads on the beds . As he began to look around he noticed vomit all over the dust ruffle on the bed and on the floor. We called the front desk and was treated as if we were an inconvenience.They moved us to another room and it was horrible. Carpets were dirty, wallpaper peeling off the walls of the bathroom, rusty a/c vents, and our a/c would never cool the room off. Bathroom was tiny as were the supposed "queen size" bed. Very cramped and very lousy service... The restarant staff was also very rude. Not what I would call a luxurious hotel at all.. We were very disappointed.. Will never go back to this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms Are Great...Service So-so”
Reviews.Author: rahzamazin
Reviews.Content: Our family (two adults, two kids) stayed here Dec. 18-21. We had read the reviews on TripAdvisor so we knew that some of the rooms were not that great. We deliberately looked for and booked a 'New Room' on the Hilton web site. Got a $279 rate that included full breakfast; high, but quite decent for New York. Overall, we were happy. The room was great; the front desk, concierge and bell captain service was so-so; the restaurant 'NY Marketplace' was decent for breakfast, terrible for dinner. More detailed descriptions below for those who are interested. Pictures of the renovated room are also posted. The Room: We were very impressed with the renovated room. Of course, since it was recently renovated, it was very clean and things looked new. It was also very spacious (except for the bathroom). The renovation included nice touches which you normally find in smaller boutique style hotels, such as stylish/funky lamps and a large LCD tv. The beds were extremely comfortable. Fixtures in the bathroom were very stylish and attractive. I normally stay in Sheraton NY Hotel and Towers, and I've never had a room this nice, even when I've gotten a renovated one. The Sheraton rooms are smaller, darker and generally less well decorated. And the Hilton 'Comfortable Bed' was much more so than the Sheraton 'Heavenly Bed'. Our room in the Hilton was on the 22nd floor. Some other floors appeared to have been renovated, but several did not appear to be; those older floors looked quite depressing. Book a renovated room and you're much more likely to have a good stay here! The Service: if you've read the reviews here, you'll know not to expect too much in the way of service. The front desk staff was efficient but fairly disinterested at check in. The concierge seemed annoyed that they had to give out directions to the subway to yet another customer. On the last day of our stay, the room was not made up at all. Sometime between 6pm and 9pm, someone dropped a new set of towels on the unmade beds but did not clean up at all; we called the front desk but they said housekeeping was behind (no kidding) and they would get to our room as soon as they caught up. Needless to say, they never did! Finally, the Hilton airport shuttle service charged us twice for our ticket to the airport so now we have to get that cleared up with the credit card company. Oh well. We liked our room anyway. NY Marketplace Restaurant: Breakfast buffet (included in our rate) was extensive and most things tasted good. Dinner was horrible (calamari, pizza, burger) and extremely overpriced; don't waste your money there, especially with so many restaurants nearby. Overall: if we can get a renovated room at a decent rate, we will stay at the Hilton again. If not, we'll keep looking...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jackcd
Reviews.Content: we paid 195 on the sat before christmas. got it on priceline. i cannot understand why these people pay 500 and above. the hotel was terrific

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: tanka1
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is the key. This is the largest hotel in Manhattan with 2200 rooms and as such it is run like a factory (as such see many of previous comments - large variety of room and yes most rooms are small yet very clean, appropriate but not necessarily friendly services in lobby, $3.50/bag/day storage charge, busy elevators, host to hundreds of conferences etc.) Indeed would look for other hotel if required to pay rack rates. Nonetheless the stay was delighful especially since booking was Pricelined and for the weekend before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: samcraig33
Reviews.Content: We payed over $600 per night for an executive room and its was dreadful- tiny- not luxurious at all. The hotel itself is aimed at business people- there is nothing beautiful about it. Ok- so the location is great- just 5min walk to radio city to see the rockettes- and one block from 5th avenue- 5min walk from central park. We didnt eat at this hotel and the bar was awful. Dont stay here if u want luxury and beautiful surroundings- stay here for location and if ur only in ny for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3 night stay at the Hilton. We paid $750 per night which at the time did not seem that bad because we could not find another hotel and we were told we would be on the executive level which would include free breakfast and robes. We arrived at the hotel, no problems with check in at all, very fast. The hotel was so busy we ended up waiting for an elevator for about 15 minutes which was a little frustrating. We arrived at our room and it was very clean with a okay view. Basically we were looking directly at the Sheraton but it was not a big deal at all. The bathroom was smaller than I had expected. To be honest it was very cramped. We went out, returned around midnight to find our room to be really hot. We thought maybe it was just a temp. change from being outside and waited to see if turning the a/c on would help. Two hours later it was very uncomfortable. I opened the windows and noticed the rooms on both sides of us had opened their windows too. I called the front desk, said oh were having problems we promise it will be fixed by tomorrow. Needless to say, we got no sleep. Next morning we went to breakfast on 44th fl. had to wait 20 minutes for a table for free fruit because they will not let you take anything back to your room. We didn't do the breakfast the rest of our stay. The heat was never fixed in our room and the actually did take $300 off our bill which I was surprised by. Bottom Line: The hotel is in a great location, Starbucks across the street which is a real plus for me, Room is not bad, most people are not in their room that much, but I think there is a little too much going on and the service is not up to par.The rates are way inflated for what the hotel is. We would probably not stay here again. If you have any ?'s email me.

Reviews.Title: “Deteriorated in Service, Over Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Level of HHonors Member and a frequent traveler to NY City for business and pleasure. I simply need to state this hotel is no longer value for money except for location. I probably stayed at this hotel more than 20 times. They remodelled the rooms and after that, they have started overcharging for a small and shavy room. Service level at Front desk is terrible and no longer provide a friendly hospitality. Used to allow Gold and Diamond HHonors member to check in at the Excutive Tower but no longer available. This Last Memorial Holiday, I was still Gold Level HHonors and was told Gold Member was no longer permitted to check in on the Executive Floor. This November, after I was promoted to Diamond September, I was told that they downgraded Diamond Member not to be allowed to check in on the Executive Floor. Each time I came back to this hotel, I did discover some deteriorations in service. It must be a change in service quality due to a management change. Sometimes, overbooked and simply told to go to the another hotel despite Hhonors points reward stay , no way to move to another hotel . I do not recommmend any more for this hotel unless they charge less than 250.

Reviews.Title: “So you want to be a tourist”
Reviews.Author: DKraut
Reviews.Content: If you are a tourist and want to be in a tourist hotel, this Hilton suits you completely. It is big, shiny, has an expensive breakfast buffet that reminds you of every buffet you've had in every tourist hotel, and its very large lobby is brimming with people toting shopping bags and wheeling their travel bags. Once you walk into the lobby, you will not feel like you are in NYC, you could be in any large hotel in any city. Is it worth the rack rate? Definitely not. But,if you have the "points," it can be a good value if you want to walk to the basic midtown Manhattan tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “not a good hilton to stay at”
Reviews.Author: dcc224
Reviews.Content: I got the room through priceline and was very happy with the rate. However, I will not want to stay there unless they offer me a bargain rate again. 1)We stayed on the 6th floor, which was supposed to be a non smoking floor. However, we could smell the smoke coming from our neighbor when we woke up the next day morning. we did not switch to another room because we were checking out soon, but needless to say, i was very annoyed. 2)Hilton's overnight parking was $40, $10 more expensive than the hotel next door (sheraton). 3)They charge $3.5 to hold a suitcase. I found out about it earlier through this website, so was fine with that. Hilton NYC is a huge hotel, and i am not surprised they need to charge for that. 4)Since Hilton NYC is such a big hotel, I felt that i was staying at some sort of hotel central. the feeling is a bit overwhelming. 5)the only two things i like about this hotel is the fact that it's only 5 min walk to broadway, and the room was cleaned and comfortable. (our frige was broken and moldy though)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chriscallondon
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us on this trip and have previously stayed in two other NYC hotels. The location of the Hilton was perfect, one block from 5th and very close to Rockefeller and Central Park. We had a suite on floor 43 with access to the executive lounge. The rooms were large enough for us and the breakfast was perfectly adequate. We could have used the lounge for afternoon tea but we were always out and about. The check-in man was very unfriendly however the bell boy was great giving us all types of tips. We are going to NY again next year and will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK. Not more”
Reviews.Author: dr63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for two nights for business. I ordered an executive room for about 450 a night. The small room I got on the 39th floor had good views, enabling me a glimpse of central park. The king bed was comfortable, but the entire room had that "old" feeling you get from a hotel that needs some major renovations. The tiny bathroom was clean, but definitely sub-standard for the price. The executive lounge offered a comfortable setting for the reasonable continental breakfast and very quick check in arrangements. All in all - reasonable for business, if you don't mind the very small bathroom and the "old" feel of the room. I would still try other places for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, light, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakistoc
Reviews.Content: My family and I moved to the Hilton on Avenue of the Americas following an appalling experience at the Roosevelt Hotel (see separate review). The Hilton was an absolute breath of fresh air, with friendly staff, a good value breakfast and light, modern rooms. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Such A Bad Place”
Reviews.Author: CJSanti
Reviews.Content: I was actually pleased when I arrived after long flight. The staff was so quick and courtesy, and got us right into our room. The room was very clean, with very comfortable beds. Each bed had four pillows and plenty of towels in the bathroom. That was nice for a change. The location is magnificent. You couldnt ask for a better location. Everything about the hotel was well worth the 400.00 a night that I spent. I would do it again

Reviews.Title: “No wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: majorswede
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in September 05 and were depending on being able to use the in-room wireless internet. Most of the time we received no signal; when we did succeed, the signal would disappear in the middle of an email which was extremely frustrating. Otherwise, the hotel is very nice and in a convenient location. Parking costs are outrageous, but that's life in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Duberto
Reviews.Content: We Priceline'd a room for $150.00 (plus fees and taxes) in New York over Columbus Day weekend and were fortunate to get one at the Hilton for that price - when Travelocity, Expedia, etc. had been quoting $350.00-400.00. The room wasn't huge, but more than made up for it by having all new furniture, a LCD TV, etc. And a view! We didn't use any of the other features of the Hilton (e.g., gym, bars, etc.), but heard great things about them . . . and the location and the service were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during that weekend when the fire occurred. However we were out during that time and missed that "event". We came back after the hotel was cleared again by the fire department. Rooms had a light smoke smell that night and the next morning. But with open windows that smell was almost gone the end of next day. At least in our room. Staff worked hard to get the situation back to normal after the fire. I heard that people were not allowed to return to their rooms for a couple of hours after the evacuation but this is not the hotel's responsibility. They have to comply with the orders from the fire department. Anyhow besides this interruption we liked the hotel. Great location. A few minutes by foot from Time Square. Walking distance to Empire State Building and other major attractions. Subway station on the same block at 7th street. Due to its size it is a little impersonal like many Hiltons. Nothing spectacular. But we did not expect first class treatment since we got a good deal on Priceline for half of the prices shown at Expedia and Others. Not sure if the hotel is worth the regular price but if you get a good deal I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: Elainecde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Marquis last year, while the rooms there looked a little "newer" than the Hilton's, the location of the Hilton is so much better if you want to shop. The beds are nice and the pillows are great as is the water pressure in the shower. It's a pretty nondescript hotel as far as character goes and you don't get the feeling of being in great luxury, but if those things don't concern you this is a great place to stay. Location Location Location

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Love the Hilton NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton New York was selected for the 2nd annual girlsâ€™ trip to New York. We stayed September 2, 2005 - September 6, 2005. Four of us in our late twenties and early thirties shared an executive level room. This gave us access to the executive lounge, continental breakfast, and evening hors d' oeuvres. The rooms are small, but well appointed. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We took full advantage of the complimentary spa robes. Those were great for lounging after a long day of shopping. The hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the subway, but it is away from the hustle and bustle. We had a few issues with housekeeping, but management quickly resolved them. Iâ€™d recommend this hotel to anyone looking for quality accommodations that are close to the action, but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Hilton, New York to celebrate my 50th birthday. Had a fantastic time, hotel was everything we had hoped for (despite reading some negative reviews before we travelled !!) Staff were pleasant and helpful, room was above average size and very clean. We had a double bed each and they were the most comfortable beds I had ever slept it - including my own at home !! Check in and out was the smoothest I have ever had in a hotel. Location is ideal, close to all major shopping avenues (the hotel itself being on 6th Avenue) and an interesting walk to Times Square, Broadway etc. All in all a fabulous experience, and a brilliant memory of my 50th ! Would recommend this hotel to anyone and most definatley would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel & the best location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (soon to be husband as he proposed on this holiday!!!) and I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of August to celebrate my 30th birthday. We got a room on the 20th floor (a hilton honours floor, I think) and it was really really nice. The room was an alright size with plently wardrope & drawer space for two people. Also very nicely decorated and everything was clean and fresh. Housekeeping also did a grand job. The bathroom was quite small & compact but perfectly adequate. However the location of this hotel is fabulous - you are in easy walking distance to Fifth Ave, Rockafeller centre, Times Square, the theatre district & Central Park. When looking for a hotel we were wondering if we should stay at Times Sq but I am so glad that we didn't and choose to stay at this hotel. Didn't have all that much contact with the staff of the hotel but the ones that we did have contact with were plesant enough. I would mention though beware if you order a shuttle bus back to the airport, ENSURE you know where it will pick you up on the day as we had to run around the hotel (not the best when its 86F outside) trying to find the bus as we were given wrong info from the desk at the front of the hotel as to where we would be picked up. The Shuttle Bus guy was ok about it and says that they always do that! All in all was a fabulous hotel and I would definately book and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floors outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: KattZ
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the NY Hilton on the executive floors. Rooms are clean and attractive, beds and linens are luxurious, and service is very good. I traveled with my teenage daughter, and we loved the included continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres....served in a big, sunny, nicely decorated room on the 44th floor. Great people-watching at breakfast and cocktail hour, with business travelers and families visiting from all over the world. After a day or two we began to recognize many other visitors, which made us feel at home. We went to the theatre every night of our stay, so the evening hors d'oeuvres were perfect for a light pre-theatre supper. And the LOCATION is unbeatable. 5 minute walk to Central Park, Theatre district, 5th Ave shopping, Rockefeller Center. Taxis always available from the lobby. I highly recommend the executive level. It's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JADTraveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location! We were able to walk almost anywhere. Just one block from 5th avenue, where there is plenty of shopping. Just a couple blocks from Rockefeller Center (NBC, Today Show, etc), Central Park, Broadway, and Times Square. No need for transportation if you're interested in these items. The room was nice, but a little small, especially the bathroom - almost no counter space. We had an executive room, which allowed us access to the complimentary continental breakfast, and evening snacks. With the price of eating in a restaurant being very expensive, this was a nice treat. The one negative, was the sales guy at the entry, trying to get you to participate in a 90-minute pitch on their Hilton Vacation properties. We were supposed to have robes in our room, but didn't. And, the room description claimed the windows were floor to ceiling, but they weren't. Not a huge deal, but it wasn't as advertized. Other than that, the room was very clean, and nicely decorated. Even the cleaning woman was extremely friendly. We arrived on a day of a major thunderstorm, and the computer system was down. Amazingly, our check-in process was fast and smooth. Check-out was even easier, and a taxi was immediately available to take us to the airport. Highly recommend getting the 48-hour All-Loops Double Decker Greyline bus pass, AND the New York 48-hour Pass. The New York Pass even allowed us to skip a few of the ticket lines (like the Statue of Liberty), which was a HUGE benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy123
Reviews.Content: The NY Hilton is a class act! very nice staff.Clean rooms,VERY comfortable beds! When I mentioned that my wife and I were there for our anniversary they gave us an upgrade to the executive level rooms.Great view on the 39th floor.very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week here - how can it be so low rated?”
Reviews.Author: harvey28
Reviews.Content: Those who posted negative comments about this hotel must either have had very bad luck or be somehow difficult themselves! We have stayed at many 4 & 5 star hotels all over the world including NYC & this one was the best! Our room on the 'executive level' 39th floor had a stunning view over the park, was well equipped, spacious and immaculately maintained. Noteworthy were the generously supplied mineral water, fluffy bathrobes and superb quality Belgian 320 point linens - very comfy beds, too.The AC kept it icy cool in 92F heat, and nothing was too much trouble for the concierge. Likewise the bellhops, one of whom looked after our 13 pieces of luggage for 2 hours whilst we did a last shop - no charge, but of course we tipped him well. as he had a right to expect! The real 'kicker' here is the Executive Lounge, with complimentary breakfast, unlimited all day tea, coffee etc & freshly baked cookies, for which our kids insisted on a daily return to sample! There were also very good Hors d'Oeuvres daily at 5 pm - 7 pm. A great location, superb service and a good price - our stay was $259 a night. What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroad051
Reviews.Content: We had a great visit to the Hilton NY (Ave of Americas) The front desk staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The housekeepers were thorough! We look forward to staying with the Hilton NY again!

Reviews.Title: “value is good.”
Reviews.Author: capdeblu
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very prompt. The room was small but clean and updated. Bring ear plugs as cabs honk horns all night long. Paid a very reasonable rate of 99$ per night. I asked for a refrigerator and it was delivered free of charge. There are no soft drink machines in the NY Hilton... but there is a deli across the street with great food. The room service food was some of the best Ive ever had. The pizza was excellent. The resturant buffet was ok. Oddly this hotel does not allow airport shuttle vans into its driveway. So I'm outside waiting (almost an hour)and the van is parked on a side street where I couldnt see it. It is double parked and has to move and I see it and head toward it. And a bellman starts screaming at the driver to get the van out of the driveway. Very Rude!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton a geat experience!”
Reviews.Author: scmom
Reviews.Content: Mother, daughter and grandmother trip to NY city, The Hilton is in an excellant location to Broadway, Central park and 5th Ave shopping. We arrived before our room was ready and experienced no problems, no long lines, this hotel is huge, but beautiful and everyone friendly. Hotel held our luggage while we sightseed until room was ready. We were on 34th floor, awesome view, quiet and nice size room, 2dbl.beds very comfortable! My daughter was impressed w/ flat screen TV and Tv screen in elevator. Concier very friendly w/ directions and pre -theatre dinner reservations. Felt safe. I was pleasantly surprised and will definitley chose the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience and would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding stay at the Hilton Midtown. The location was great (only a few blocks from Times Square one way, a couple blocks to Central Park the other way and easy subway access. The stay started out wonderfully. We had booked a room on the executive level (top floors) which was a great move. It only cost a little bit more, but it is well worth it. There is a separate check in on the top floor with absolutely no wait. We were able to get early check in which was very convienent. The physical hotel itself was nice, nothing outrageous but nice. In the evening they served complimentary appetizers/fresh fruit/etc which were very good and in the mornings you had continental breakfast. When we went to check out the staff kindly offered us a very late check out (5:00 PM rather than noon). This was OUTSTANDING because all I was asking for was to check our bags with the bell desk because our flight was not leaving until the afternoon and our original plan was to do some more sight seeing during the day. It was a very rainy day so without us even asking for it they offered us this late checkout at no extra charge since we would be pretty misarable walking around the city in the rain. The concierge was also EXTREMELY friendly and helpful. This was a perfect stay and would highly recommend and if you do stay here, I would also advise the upgrade to executive level.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: scmc
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel for a conference. I had none of the problems that others have reported related to check-in - took me all of about 5 minutes, no line and desk clerk was very polite (I arrived around 7 p.m.). My room was on the 26th floor and was very quiet. Bed was extremely comfortable. Looks like the room had been recently renovated - new carpet, bedding, paint, wallpaper, etc. I would have to concur with the comments about the A/C - I had mine cranked down all the way on high and it really never got cold (but was not uncomfortably warm either - cool would be the best way to describe it). Because the hotel is very large, there are always a lot of people in the lobby, elevators, etc. Sometimes took a few minutes to get an elevator. Two bars in hotel (with ridiculous prices) and a cafe/restaurant which looked nice. Always easy to get a taxi at the front of the hotel. Subway nearby. Central Park a short walk away. Broadway two blocks over and 5th avenue one block the other way. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I were ever in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hilton New York on a Friday for a weekend getaway. The hotel is large and the lobby is normally busy, but not a problem. The staff was helpful. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel for New York, a central location to all attractions and something clean, I would not hesitate to stay here. I would keep checking prices and book early for the best rates. If we return we would book this hotel again. There is also a 24 hour deli right out the valet parking area and across the street, very convenient. You can get much more reasonably priced sodas, beer and snacks than you would pay from the mini-bar. We did not use the restaurant or bar in the hotel so I can't give an opinion on those. There are good street vendors outside the hotel that sell gyros and sandwiches. When walking back we said we could smell our hotel up ahead. I would not rent a car, but take a taxi or even the subway when visiting. You will pay a lot to park your vehicle and it is not necessary. We felt safe walking all over due to many tourists and locals also doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: ncdoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton in NYC this past weekend on the Ave.of the Americas and was very dissapointed. There was always a line at the check in counter. Morning, noon and night. We complained about the air-conditioning in our room 4 times and it was on but never got very cool. I heard other people' complaining about the same thing. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC but this is the lst time that I was ever charged to store my luggage. Our flight did not leave until late Monday evening and we had to pay $3.50 per bag to keep our luggage at this hotel. I have stayed at budget hotels in Manhattan that store your luggage for free and this is suppose to be a 4 star hotel. Very dissapointing!!!!! Aren't they making enough money on the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Should be better”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Not up to Hilton standards. Checking in for 5 nights no non smoking room was ready at 2.45. I had to ask for upgrade, as Hilton Honors member they are suppose to tell me why I am not getting one. Told none unavailable that week. Queued again at 3.30 in HHonors line. Man walked straight past bypassing line. I complained when I reached the front. Claimed they couldnâ€™t see their own line as it was so busy. After some discussion my upgrade was available as were some breakfast vouchers, credit to that guy but not the first one. Room on HHonors floor was fine with good view. Tour desk really helpful. Bar service slow and made a big deal of giving me a last drink after they had told me they were closing, they hadnâ€™t and it wasnâ€™t that late! They were open a lot later the previous night when a convention was still there. Brought wrong drinks also. Breakfast ok but nothing special, egg queue stupidly long. Really friendly and helpful waiters Didnâ€™t receive Zip out bill as expected, neither did others queueing to check out. Then they tried to charge me for a prepaid rate again. Corrected after help from supervisor with limited grace. Have to pay to store luggage in your own hotel $3.50 per piece, waived if room not ready. Business center staff generally indifferent, unless you wanted to talk about shopping, with 1 honourable exception. Seemed over staffed.

Reviews.Title: “High School Choir Enjoyed the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a chaperone for a High School choral group that got to sing at Carnegie Hall over Memorial Weekend. We Stayed at the Hilton New York on the Avenues of Americas. It was located so close to many places to such as; Rockefeller Center/NBC Studios, St. Patrick's Cathedral, MOMA, David Letterman, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, the Metropolitian, Times Square, shopping on 5th Avenue and so much more. As well as being close to many places the hotel was very accommadating for such a large group. The kids got to sing at St. Pauls Church across from Ground Zero which was very moving. I would say the only place that was mediocore was dinner at Mars 2112. The faux ride to mars was ok and the decore was neat. The food was pricey for just ok flavor. I would not recommend this place. We should have gone for pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week or so ago for a conference. This is definitely a large hotel - nothing intimate about it! However, my room was clean and spacious (for New York) and relatively quiet. The gym was very good but you have to pay $12 a day to use it - this should be free for hotel guests in my view. Overall, I was pretty happy and it is a good location, central for everything (especially Times Square and Midtown).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKVegasBound
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded by expectations after reading some bad reviews from this site. Check In at 12pm and was very quick and easy. Rooms were great. But price was high at Â£170 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lil_amy
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hilton. It was in a great location. It was close to Time Square but fortunately far enough away. Time Square can get too congested and this Hilton's location was no congested. It is only a few block from NBC/Radio City/Rockefeller. It was so quick and easy to get a cab. The staff was pleasant. The maid responded quickly to needs. What I did not like was how expensive it was but all of NYC is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hilton New York. My daughter, neice, and sister stayed in an Executive room on the 40th floor. Check in was a breeze and the room was ready even though we were early. The room was a little on the small side but I expected this with everything I had read about New York hotels. Despite the size, it ended up being just right for our needs. The room was very clean, the beds were plush and the linens were wonderful. We did ask for robes and received them promptly from the maid Hilda...who was wonderful and always friendly. Eileen at the check in desk on the 44th floor was friendly and helpful as well...she suggested several places to eat and we were never disappointed. Janet at the ticket desk was very helpful and friendly as well. The bathroom was on the small side but functional and clean. We ordered room service one night and the service was great and the food was hot. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and the whole week until Friday was great. No problems on the elevators and very few crowds. When Friday evening rolled around things changed. The hotel was very crowded and the elevators were slow. We ended up using service elevators on Friday and Saturday. This was the only real negative I had about the hotel. As for the street noise, that is to be expected. We could hear the traffic but you get used to it and it really did not bother us or prevent us from getting a good nights sleep. Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms...what more could you ask for?! I would definitely stay at the Hilton New York again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Usually stay at the Waldorf Astoria, this time it was full so I had to settle on the New York Hilton. I think the New York Hilton is in a more central location, parking is more convenient and the Hotel is cleaner and more user friendly. The next time I am in NYC I will pick the NY Hilton over the Waldorf Astoria!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from an overnight stay at the Hilton New York. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience. This hotel impressed me as more of a business hotel than a vacation or family hotel. There's no real ambience to speak of. The rooms were clean, nicely furnished and well maintained. I visit NYC on the average of 2-3 times a year, and I would say that the rooms were large for a New York City Hotel room. They were certainly a very adequate size, and comparable to hotel rooms other places, which makes them big for NYC. This is a very big hotel, the largest in NYC I have since learned, and it's very busy. The staff was pleaseant and helpful, but the overall feel was somewhat impersonal, which is not surprising given the size of the place. (Checking in was somewhat like checking in at an airline counter.) The concierge was pleasant and helpful. The location is great for all the midtown attractions and sites. Given it's location, I was surprised at how quiet the room was. All in all, the hotel was pleasant and reliable, and I would stay here again. The only thing I didn't like was the television in the elevator. We went to our room with a sleepy toddler, who was awakened by CNN in the elevator and it was a news story I would have turned off at home as more information than necessary for little ears. Who ever thought we'd yearn for the days of "elevator music"? :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week in May for 3 nights. First, the positives: good location, just a few blocks from mid-town Manhattan and 5 blocks or so from central Park and Times Square. Beds were comfortable. And as far as street noise that I've read from previous travelers, there aren't many hotels (if any) in NYC where you won't hear the street traffic - for ----- sake - it's NYC! A couple of issues kept this hotel from being better than just average. First, the Hilton employee at the check-in desk never cracked a smile and made little eye contact (and check-in wasn't even busy). Second, our room wasn't ready when we checked-in at 2:00p, no big deal, it's happened before at other hotels but when I called the hotel at 3:00p to check to see if the room was ready I was placed on hold and after being handed-off to 2 other employees, was finally answered by someone that sounded as if they were not having a good day. I found the overall attitude of the employees not very friendly. Third, I requested a non-smoking room and was told that's what I was getting at check-in, but as soon as I entered the room I noticed a very distinct smell of cigarette smoke and the bathroom, even for NYC standards, was tiny. Lastly, at check-out, I called the bellman to get my bags for storage because my plane didn't leave until 4pm - well he came and got them in a very short time but neglected to inform me there was a $3.50 per bag storage fee! I found this out when I went to collect my bags. I refused to pay but had to go speak to the manager before they would give me my bags! This is the first time in all my trips to NYC that I've ever had a hotel charge me for storing my bags for a few hours. I've traveled to NYC many times over the past 3 or 4 years and stayed at many different hotels so I have something to compare this experience to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights from 25th April through to 2nd May. I had read the comments on this website prior to travelling and was expecting the worse. When we arrived we checked in straight away without even queuing up but a smile from the check in staff wouldn't have gone amiss. We were given a room on the 23rd floor which was big with 2 double beds and seating. It was high up but not high enough to get any kind of decent view. The room was very tidy and well presented, with large TV and plenty of space. The bathroom was on the small side and there was no room around the vanity area for any toiletries etc. It had a small bath and the shower was great. Even on the 23rd floor there was plenty of street noise which didn't bother me but my wife needed ear plugs and I'm sure i could feel the vibrations of the subway through the pillow!! Our intention was only ever to use the hotel as a base for exploring Manhattan and for this purpose it is excellent. It is very close to Times Square and Central Park and a couple of blocks away from sveral subway stations. I can't comment on the food or other services of the hotel as we did not use them. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. In conclusion the room was comfatable but noisy, the hotel is in a great location but there is no wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shoredude1971
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. But I was extremely disappointed. The room was your average New York size room. So if you're expecting your average middle America size room, you won't find it in many New York hotels. I travel a lot so I wasn't expecting to find things at a New York City hotel (ie, pool, free parking, etc.) that you find in other parts of the country. The first thing I noticed upon entering the room, was there was a crumpled piece of paper underneath the chair. The second was the street level noise even though I was on the 30th floor. I've stayed on lower floors at other New York hotels and have never heard a peep. And then there was the heat. I've never called downstairs to complain before, but after fiddling with the thermostat and couldn't get the temperature to something below 80 (it was in the 20's outside), I called to find out how to lower the temperature. I was told to turn the heat off. The shower had a problem, because when I got out the bathroom floor was covered with water. And yes, I did have the curtain on the inside. I ate in the New York Marketplace restaurant. The service was very good, although for a restaurant in a four-star hotel I don't expect paper napkins. The ice machine on our floor was located in what appeared to be a housekeeping closet with a service area. When I walked in, I had a double take to make certain that it really said "Ice Machine" on the door. It did and it was hiding in the back. The gift shop was unique in that a great variety of newspapers. Brits travelling to New York who want news from home can find a couple of London newspapers there. The hotel is in a great location. Since I'm not a big fan of the treadmill, it was nice that Central Park was only five blocks away. Rockefeller Center was only three. And a subway station was only a couple of blocks up or down Sixth Avenue. The room had a very nice desk and internet connection. There was a television (I'd guess 20") that appeared to be new. But then I only watched the 11:00 news before going to bed. I can watch TV at home. I was disappointed, but thankfully I didn't pay rack. I wouldn't rule this hotel out, but I prefer others in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sansan3
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights this past weekend on the 19th floor. We pricelined the room for $100/night, and for that price, the hotel was good. The room was quite small, but from what I know, most rooms in NYC is on the smaller end. It was comfortable and clean, the towels seems old and overwashed though. On the 19th floor, we can still hear a lot of street noise. But it's convenient to most places, and 3 blocks away from the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Blusie
Reviews.Content: I believe the average room rate is normally $300, but my company covered the special conference rate of $215. If this was a leisure trip, I would book the â€œWâ€� hotel since it offers almost the same rates and is a much sweeter hotel. The Hiltonâ€™s location is ideal, especially for those who would like to check out Rockefeller plaza, Radio City Music Hall, and Broadway. Retail shops are in abundance, but thatâ€™s anywhere in the city. The hotel itself was pleasant and comfortable, but nothing I would call spectacular. The rooms are clean, but the bedding could use updating. The colorful printed bedspreads (typical in most hotels) bore meâ€¦and not soft on the eyes either. Room had a heating problem (too cold). Actually, the spa room was also cold, as were the hallways. Not sure if this was an isolated case. The bathroom could use a renovation as the tub was slightly discolored, etc. But I liked the marble floor and strong water pressureâ€¦.water was very hot, which is always a plus. Was on the 18th floor and still heard some street noise...although since I'm originally from Phila, I found that very comforting...lol. I used the spa services and was pleased with the masseuse named Melissa. The massage room was modern, but a bit too bright for a massage room, which should be tranquil & relaxing, in my opinion. This was the first hotel that I have been where they charge guests to use the fitness facilities, which I think is insulting! However guests have free reign of facilities after they get a spa treatment. The hotel bar is stylish and a comfortable spot to socialize or meet associates. The gentlemen in the front of the hotel were most helpful to call cabbies and load luggage in and out of vehicles. (Thanks!) Overall, had a nice stay at the Hilton on Avenue of the Americas. If I was looking for a romantic spot, would definitely look elsewhere. This hotel has "conference" written all over it.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Trip Not as Good as First”
Reviews.Author: SCFCanton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in December 2004. We had such a great time in NYC and experience at the Hilton, we decided come back with our children for Spring Break. Unfortuately our second experience at the Hilton was not as good as the first. We arrived just before 3:00 PM on Thursday afternoon and the line to check-in was huge. The NY State Teachers convention was being hosted at the hotel and everyone was checking in at that time. After looking at the line (we were told by those waiting that the line was 1-2 hours long), we tried to self-check in based on the advice of hotel employees. However, the self-serve kiosk would not recognize our confirmation number. A roaming employee was checking guests using a hand-held computer and he tried to get us checked in - then our room was not ready. Hilton allowed us to stow our bags for free so we took off for some sightseeing. When we returned to the hotel about 3 hours later - we were informed that they were "out" of non-smoking rooms. One of my children and my wife have asthma and are allergic to cigarette smoke, so we complained that the room reservation was unacceptable. We waited another 30 minutes or so, before they were able to put us in a "non-smoking" room. Once we got into our room, we felt like we had been duped. The room smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. We immediately contacted customer service who informed us that our room was a "non-smoking" room on a "non-smoking" floor and they would be happy to freshen up the room for us. Of course, freshen up meant opening the windows and spraying air freshener. We requested another room, but they did not have one available until Friday. Plus an ionizer/air purifier was not available. We were less than thrilled with their response to this matter as we felt as we were being treated as if we were inconveniencing them. Plus the room did not feel all that clean. The color scheme was dark. The room overlooked the roof to the main entrance. The floor was wet by the bathroom entrance and the mini bar was open. Not only did we have to sleep in the "smoking den", but the room next door featured a "late-night" drunken teachers party. They knocked on our wall repeatedly until about 2:00 AM. We contacted customer service to have them quiet down (about 12:30 AM) but we noticed no discernible difference in the volume level. Once the main party died down, the festivities carried on a bit longer as a "party for two." Even though the woman was a screamer, we were fortunate her partner only had enough stamina to go about 4:28 seconds. Nevertheless, my 6 year old woke up thinking "that the people in the next room are trying to break down the wall." The next morning, Hilton said we could move to our new room anytime after 12:00 PM. This was correct and we were moved to the exact room promised when we got back to the hotel around 5:30 PM. The front desk staff explained that in the week before our stay, the two floors that they have reserved for smokers were closed for repairs/remodeling, thus some of the non-smoking rooms were used for smokers. Our new room was much better. The colors were brighter. The room was much cleaner and there was a much better view. It did not smell like smoke. The rest of our stay was uneventful, although they shorted us a towel on Saturday morning. Check out on Sunday was a problem though. First, we were charged $13.00 in mini-bar charges for our first room - but as we explained to them when we moved the mini-bar was wide open when we first checked in. Second, with the concierge, we arranged for a car to take us to the airport. It was to arrive at 11:30 AM. We ended up leaving the hotel for a little while that morning - there was a parade. When it looked like that we might be slightly later than 11:30 AM we asked the concierge to hold our car for about 10 minutes. We got back to the hotel about 11:30 AM. My wife went immediately to the front desk to check out and clear up the mini-bar charges, while I went up to the room to gather our bags. I called the bell captain for a bellman to come assist me. 20 minutes later I had to call down again! 35 minutes after my first call, a bellman arrived to help with my bags! When we finally got downstairs, our car was gone! We had to arrange other transportation to the airport and almost missed our flight. The bellman claimed that he was sent up after my 2nd call Only the bellman apologized. We complained to the bell captain and the concierge - but neither seemed concerned. While we had a great time in NYC, we were disappointed with our stay this time. Our first trip in December, we were so impressed with the staff and the hotel. We wanted to come back soon. It was a shame this trip was not like our first.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.. but not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I got the room off of priceline and it was a smoking room. It certaintly was not a 4 star hotel in the room department. I don't know if our room was bad due to it being smoking or the priceline ( I named my own price)$125.00. The wallpaper was peeling, the room was very small. They said it was a queen but it was a full. It smelled musty and just "felt" dirty. It is close to everything, so I think you are paying for the location. Plus what a 4 star hotel is in my state may be different then NY. Parking was $40.00 a day. It is near the MBTA, broadway, times square, rocketfeller center, and the hotel is right off of the highway. We did feel safe in the area. Room service was a rip-off, but it always is. I have stayed at other hotels and rated the raddisson at LAX much higher then this and that was a 3 star hotel and this is suppossed to be a 4. If I had paid full price I would have been extremly upset. If you aren't going to be in your room much, This is ok but get it on discount

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hilton New York this past weekend. I am so thankful that I got a good rate on Priceline. It really took the curse off staying there. It is definitely not a four-star hotel. The room was dirty. There was trash under the bed. The bathroom was dirty. The ice maker on our floor didn't work. I was awakened at 5:00 AM on Saturday morning to the sound of dumpsters being emptied outside in the street below. (We were told that this only happens two times per week.) The television was very small and not a new model, for sure. We were extremely disappointed with the quality of this hotel. They also charge you $12 to use their gym which is ridiculous. Please heed the negative reviews for this hotel. They are so true.

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I spent 8 nights in this hotel at the end of March and early April 2005. Had read many of the reviews of this hotel and we were a little apprehensive. But the hotel and our room especially, were wonderful! When we checked in, we were told we could check out our room and see if it was to our liking. The room had been updated in 2000 and it was very nice. Fantastic location and the staff were all very friendly. The bedding was superb. The housekeeping staff did everything we asked of them and more. The conceirge always was very helpful. There is a wonderful Deli across the street with very reasonable prices and we got the true flavor of a New York Deli - such fun. Can walk all over midtown Manhatten and subways and busses were easily accessible. Felt safe both in the hotel and on the streets of New York. It was a welcome change of heart that we had about the city of New York. Many very wonderful people in the service industry in New York City. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice but......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and room is nice size for NYC. Nice to be able to check in on your own. BUT - housekeeping was mediocre - my garbage from the night before was never cleaned up, the room had problems in the bathroom cosmetically that should never happen in a hotel such as this. The main Italian restaurant refused my party of six five minutes before closing because the kitchen staff wanted to leave early. So, on a RAINY night we all walked to the Carnegie Deli. What a joke. Alternative restaurant nice for late snack and desert - but a total rip-off for breakfast. Wireless internet available $10 per day. Stay at the Warwick across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Booking, security an issue”
Reviews.Author: kem232
Reviews.Content: The Hilton was okay. I visited one weekend last September on business. Like most pricey hotels, the lobby was more lavish than the rooms by far. My co-worker and I were placed in a handicapped room due to overbooking. The bathroom was aggravating for that reason. Instead of a counter sink, which would have been helpful for grooming activities, the sink just protruded from the wall, and was very low. The shower did not have a stationery showerhead, just a sprayer. Imagine trying to scrub and shampoo yourself with one hand while trying to spray with the other. All of this would be understandable and helpful had we been handicapped. Since we are not, it was simply a nuisance. The shower drainage was awful. It was hard to feel like I was getting clean when I was wading in gray, dirty water that left a residue. I reported the problem and never saw evidence of any improvement. I did use the spa services the afternooon before my company's dinner, which was held at the Hilton. Both the spa staff and the event staff for the dinner were great. We pulled off a 1400 person dinner without a hitch. At the end of the night, I was harassed by a male guest on the way to my room. In such a large and famous hotel used by high profile guests and businesses, you would think there would be security or at least cameras somewhere, but I was on my own to deal with the incident. Luckily it didn't end too badly, and the security staff fell all over themselves the next day to apologize and shower me with gifts and even offered a free night and an escort to the train station, but it was all too little, too late.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aiterry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference my company was having. The conference went great, the staff was very helpful and my room was good. We had meals and some evening events and everything went well. There was one small problem with the room contract but everything was fixed to everyone's satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “hectic hotel but good”
Reviews.Author: simonstreatfield
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hilton new york in mid march 05 for 4 nights,weather was very cold and snowed on our first night,woke up on our first morning to a white new york, lovely!!!! Check in was quick and effiecent,the lobby does get very busy, luckily we checked in at a very quiet period,we were on the 27th floor,good view even if it was of other buildings,what you expect in NY.Room was very warm,good when we came in from the cold but got a bit hot at night when sleeping, so we borrowed a fan from the ice machine room,we were fine after that.Lovely bathroom with shower,some have said small but it was very adequate,beds were comfy and rooms nicely decorated.Didn`t experience any of the bars or restarants in the hotel but they looked pleasent.Location was great,4 blocks from central park,6 blocks from times square.Radio city across the road and shopping everywhere!!!!! We found the staff to be very polite and had no problem checking out, they put the invoice under the door on the last morning so you can check the bill before going down to check out. Negative points if any,rooms near the lifts are subject to some noise,charging $3.50 per bag in left luggage for a late departure,busy lobby, they lots of conferences there. We have stayed at both hilton`s now in midtown and would go back to both but the times square hilton on 42nd st is better by far.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy & Will Return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a delightful night at the Hilton...yes the lobby is large and bustling, but this is NYC! Very quick service by a delightful customer service lady at check in. She placed us on the 27th floor, a renovated floor, which even had a slice of Central Park in our view. The room was lovely -- high ceilings, tastefully decorated, fabulous linens, very comfortable bed, fine bath, lots of towels. Our robes were missing and once we called for them, they were brought up to our room pronto. Fast elevators, tons of very hot water. The temperature in our room and the hallways was just fine, not too hot at all. And you can't beat the location. We plan on returning this fall. And check out was a breeze! We got a wonderful rate through Priceline, $125. We usually prefer older hotels with lots of grand detail, but I have to say that I was thoroughly satisfied with the feel of our room -- with the high ceilings and lovely appointments, plus great view, I don't see how we could have done better without paying much, much more. Also we parked our car further west where the parking garages are cheaper ($25 for 24 hours) and walked to the Hilton. No big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roverman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton New York (6th Ave, Avenue of the Americas) from 13/2/05 to 20/2/05 and was not disappointed. We booked an Executive Suite and we were placed on the 44th floor where the Executive Lounge and check in were. We had no problems whatsoever with anything. Rooms were lovely and comfortable, room service prompt, staff very friendly and helpful, everything was just great. We shall definitely be returning to New York and we dont want to stay anywhere else other than this hotel, its location is great too, handy for 5th Ave, Times Square, Central Park, in fact almost everything within walking distance, which we did all the time. Fantastic hotel, fantastic city, i wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, we didnt want to come home!!

Reviews.Title: “Big & Impersonal, But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby is a beehive, jammed with people, large groups, piles of luggage, etc. But once you get to your room, it's not bad. Rooms are small, typical for New York, but nicely furnished. Good bed. Great location. A big, bustling, not-the-least-bit-personal hotel. But it's fine, just so long as you stay out of the lobby and don't expect much in the way of service.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: sc_UK
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from three nights in the Hilton New York, having done my homework and looked at a number of reviews before I chose this hotel. We arrived fairly late in the evening and the hotel lobby was like an airport departures hall: it was mayhem. As soon as we stepped out of our cab from the airport it was besieged by other guests desperate for a taxi (we assumed this was due the snow shower which everyone was over reacting to, as it wasn't a major storm). Check-in was efficient and quick, although the staff were like robots. with little in the way of personality. This didn't bother me, as I've visited New York before and I expected it. The bedroom was on the 25th floor. It was clean and a reasonable size, although it smelt of smoke even though it was a non-smoking floor. It was far too warm (another over reaction to the weather?) and the ventilation system didn't make any difference, which made it difficult to sleep at night. There was no in-room safe which meant we had to waste time putting stuff in a safe deposit box at reception which was a bit of a pain. The bathroom was tiny and pretty basic. The bathroom light switch was filthy and looked like it had been covered in chewing gum which hadn't been removed properly. We checked out pretty early on a Sunday morning and expected the hotel to be quiet, but we were wrong. It was mayhem again. We were overcharged by 700% on the minibar and when I explained this to the receptionist at check-out she (deliberately?) misunderstood me and added the disputed amount to my final bill. When I finally managed to make myself understood there was no apology or even a light hearted comment, just an insolent, cold and pitiful 'attitude'. Emptying the safe deposit box when we left the hotel was a horrible experience due to the fact that the receptionist said she was too busy to help and the staff at the end of the 'house phone' she directed me to couldn't understand my non-American accent. Surely in a hotel of this size in a city like New York you think they could employ people who understand British English. I dread to think what they're like with Europeans or Asians! We asked for our luggage to be kept for a few hours until we were ready to go to the airport. In every single other hotel I have ever stayed at (including the Hilton in downtown NY) this is free of charge, but here it costs $3.50 per item. Again, the porter was sullen, rude and a bad advertisement for the hotel. We stayed in the Sofitel for our final two nights in New York and the difference was as different as night and day. I would not stay at the New York Hilton again or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New York for the very first time it was a break without our 3 kids to celebrate my 30th birthday. We stayed for 4 days from Feb 26th till March 2nd at The Hilton. It is a great looking hotel and our room was on the 23rd floor, we had a king bed, the room was kept very clean and with fresh towels and the toiletries were regularly replaced even if they were only half used. The Bridges Bar was the better out of the hotel's 2 bars as there was table service and music and the tables and glasses were always clean, which unfortunately could NOT be said about the Lobby Bar. The location of the hotel is ideal for getting around and for shopping, it is also near the lovely Central Park. The hotel was busy as there were a couple of conferences going on at the time but this was not a problem. Infact the only negatives were that some of the reception staff were a bit rude and not very keen to help like they were meant to. But not all of them. I would go back but ideally I would love to try the Plaza next time!

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us (myself, my husband and my in-laws) spent a very pleasant 4 nights in the Hilton during Thanksgiving, and we couldn't have been happier! At check-in, myself and my husband were upgraded to a Executive room which we were very pleasantly surprised with. The room itself was clean, looked well maintained and had all of the facilities that you would expect. The real bonus for us was getting a view of Central Park, which we didn't even realise was possible from the hotel, let alone expected it! The free breakfast, hors d'oeuvres etc came in very handy and we found the lounge very nice. We found all of the staff there to be very helpful, which considering the amount of stress they must have been under with large groups of performers from the parade staying there, was very welcome. We didn't encounter a single problem during our stay. Of course, the location of the hotel is fantastic and for that alone, I would recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so-so. I recently stayed there because I was going to a conference. The room was fine- clean but nothing special. Every night I heard garbage trucks going by- and I was on the 18th floor (although it is New York) The room service was fine and the location is great. Right neear 7th avenue shopping, Times Square.... The only major problem is that that high speed internet service did not always work. When I called the front desk they told me that too many guests were trying to use it. I would not stay there if I was travelling for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: keysgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the New York Hilton on the Club Level (37th floor) and had one of the best hotel experiences ever. From the warm welcome by the concierge in the Club Lounge on the 37th floor, to the beautifully decorated and accomodating studio suite, to the glass enclosed shower with 3 shower heads, to the Crabtree & Evelyn amenities....it could not have been better. We enjoyed complimentary continental breakfast each morning and complimentary cocktails and horsdevours each afternoon in the lounge. The hotel is centrally located near 10 blocks from Broadway, 3 blocks from the garment district, down the street from Radio City Music Hall, and few blocks from the subway station. I would not hesitate to recommend this wonderful hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: MAGalinNC
Reviews.Content: The Good: Great location, attractive lobby with many shops, early check-in, good size rooms, nice bathrooms (Previous trip advisors had mentioned the small sink area, but they must not have realized there was a medicine cabinet for bits and pieces.), the beds (better than the Westin's Heavenly Beds). The Bad: Hot, hot, hot! The hallways were so hot that we had to turn the AC on in the middle of January. Hallways were a bit worn. Lobby bar staff members were too busy watching a fight on TV to serve any customers. Parking is expensive by comparison to other lots and hotels, especially if you have an SUV. The Ugly: After touring the city during the day, we returned in late afternoon to take a shower and dress for dinner and the theater. No water on the middle 10 floors of the hotel for couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful New York experience”
Reviews.Author: lccalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently was in New York for the Carnegie Hall concert of our friend, Robert Sims, Lyric Tenor. We came through a package from his managment company. The stay was wonderful. The room was spacious. We have two queen sized beds. The room was well appointed. The bed was very comfortful with designer sheets and covers. The bathroom was very very clean. A lot of white fluffy towels. I always note this feature of a hotel when I travel. The staff was friendly and helpful. A staff person is positioned to get you cabs in a hurry 24 hours a day. No wait time at all. They are very helpful in giving directions. The hotel is located with walking distance to Caregie Hall, Radio City Music Hall, the shows and everything. I would stay at this hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Above average experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the New York Hilton one night in early February. The service and accomodations were excellent , and I got a steal of a deal...($100 through priceline). The location is excellent. We walked back to the hotel after an evening showing of Rent. It was a quick 10-15 minute walk through the fashion district and past Radio City Music Hall. I appreciated the security at night (must show room key to get in the main lobby). The staff were friendly and knowledgable, especially Alan at the theatre/attractions ticket desk. Will stay there again next time I'm in the City for a show.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: gwillis
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a lovely suite with separate living room, and dining room area.The service was simply superlative.Room service very quick . Surely a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A little late on my review, but...got the room through Priceline for $100/night in August, 2004. Was traveling with my sister, so requested 2 beds; non smoking room, however, we were a little nervous since room type(s) were not guaranteed. Fortunately, for us our requests were not only met but we were given a room with a spetacular view! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: sdc1127
Reviews.Content: Had a great priceline stay at this hotel. Upgraded to a two room suite with access to the executive lounge free continental breakfast, snacks etc. Great location convenient to theater, time square 5th Ave shopping etc. Only complaint conceirge recommended a little restaurant up the block called Pazza Notte. Felt I was unfairly overcharged at this restaurant and would advise tourists to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: radiochick55
Reviews.Content: After spending the night amongst wrecking balls, jackhammers, firetrucks, sirens, and an above average amount of street and traffic noise (at no extra charge) at the Carnegie Suite Hotel on 58th Street, we moved to the Hilton for our second night in the city. We booked a room on the Executive floor and the rate included continental breakfast, hot beverages and cookies throughout the day and evening hors d'oeuvres. The rate we paid was actually less than what we would have paid at the the hotel we checked out of, and we got so much more! After hightailing it out of the Carnegie, we arrived at the Hilton very early (9am). Although our room was not ready, we were invited to partake in the lovely continental breakfast served in the Executive lounge. The lounge was very large and comfortable with tables, chairs and sofas throughout. Two televisions were on so travellers can get caught up on news. We had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building as we ate. They offered a nice assortment of breakfast breads, cakes, muffins, pastries, bagels, fresh fruit, cereal, juice and several hot beverages (including different types of tea, coffee and hot chocolate). Bottled water was available upon request. From 5 - 7 pm the lounge serves hors d'oeuvres and offers a cash bar for beer and liquor. Soft drinks are complimentary. The items offered were fresh and abundant. There were cheese and crackers, raw veggies with dip and assorted fried finger food such as wings, jalepeno poppers and mini egg rolls. The one mystery was the mock shrimp. It looked like fried shrimp but in fact was some sort of unidentified meat and some sort of mayonaise based gunk shaped to resemble shrimp. The room was a good size by NYC standards with a king bed , mini bar, desk and armchair, and there was still enough room for a roll away bed for our son. They offer a good selection of TV stations including Nickelodeon for the kids. There is also in room Nintendo for a very reasonable price of $6.95 per hour with a very impressive selection of N64 games. Ethernet and wireless internet access are available for $9.95 per 24 hour cycle. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful. The first room we checked into was too small for 3 people, but a brief visit to the desk was all it took to get a larger room. The Marketplace restaurant is great for casual dining. There is also a nice market a block away and several inexpensive places to eat within a block or two. When we received our check out bill, there was an erroneous charge. Again the front desk was extremely helpful and took the charge off with no questions asked. All in all a very pleasant experience. I would strongly recommend this hotel and will make this my number one choice when staying in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A little cold!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton, for a very cold (stay) three nights. The busiest week before christmas. We checked in at a machine in the lobby, which provided the room key. Throughout our stay we did not speak to anyone who worked at this hotel, or not once were we asked if everything was o.k. There was no friendly atmosphere, we felt just like a number on our credit card. On our final morning a bill was slipped under our door, $285 a night plus taxes upon taxes, which was taken from our credit card, this didn't include breakfast may I add. Also be warned when you place your luggage in the luggage room, they charge $3.50 an item with no warning. Some people had several bags with no cash, and they don't accept credit cards for this service. Surely this service should be provided as part of your stay. On a more positive note the Hilton is very central, with Radio City, and Rockerfella centre a few yards away. Walking distance to fifth avenue, Times Square and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton from December 13th through 15th, 2004. Everthing was as good if not better than anticipated. We loved the Executive Lounge and used it twice a day during our stay on th 41st floor. The elevators were fast and there was minimal waiting time. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was large enough considering the average size of NYC hotel rooms and very clean. We have stayed at other hotels in New York in the past but this will be our permanent base on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “first trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: snl1129
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton NY and towers thanksgiving weekend, Nov 25-28 2004. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to the executive level on the 40th floor which included continental breakfast each morning and snacks each evening from 5-7pm. The room was especially small but we have nothing in NYC to compare it to. It was clean and very updated. We were placed near the service elevator and could hear the sounds at all hours but that didn't bother us. Everyone in the hotel was especially nice and courteous. The manager of the hotel came to our room one evening to get us set up with special internet access when the standard access wasn't working on our floor. The location was the BEST! Out the front of the entrance, about two blocks was Radio City music hall. We walked everywhere and took the subway also. The one complaint we had.. Our car was damaged in the valet parking lot. $500. damage! Scratches and a dent on my rear quarter. We've yet to hear back from them on this matter. But overall.. it was a great trip and I would stay there again only when booking through priceline. It's not worth the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: SOBEMiamiBeach
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, comfortable, staff is friendly and attentive. New York Marketplace restaurant had good food and good service. The best thing about this hotel though is you really get the sense that you are right in the middle of The City That Never Sleeps, as there seems to be people coming and going all hours of the day and night. If you like people watching, the lobby is fantastic for this. You will see airline crews heading out to their flights around the world (I spoke with a pilot who was flying out to Tel Aviv that night and another who was piloting a 747 to London that evening). And the location can not be beat. Literally in the heart of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: arnoldboon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from November 23rd to 25th. Nice hotel. I have read a lot about hotels in New York and was kind of scared to book. I have famiy there, so I always stay with them, except that they were getting married this time. THe Hitlton was nice. Not the best, but far from the worse. Our room on the 34th floor was small, but had a reasonable size bathroom. I received a price of 127 a night on priceline. The hotel is a busy place. The restaraunt downstairs is not great, edible, but its New York, many fabulous other places to eat. FOr the same rate, I would definetley stay here again. For 300 a night, I would look elsewhere. THis is not a 5 star hotel, so don't expect it. But do expect it to be clean and comfortable. Location is great, next to everything. Staff is also good about giving directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....glad I checked with tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: greeneggs
Reviews.Content: After confirming an excellent price from Priceline for 4 nights and airfare for two at $919, I was a bit leery about the hotel and wondered everything from would I be sleeping in the broom closet to whether I would have to endure an 8 am sales pitch for timeshares. I consulted tripadvisor and read many mixed reviews, one of which suggested we use the kiosk in the lobby to check-in. When we arrived on Oct 29, we did just that. The kiosk is the first thing you see when you walk in the door; you can't miss it! We got a room with two double beds (i'm assuming newly renovated), no problem. The keys are distributed from the kiosk. While the view from our 15th floor room was nothing to behold, the room was nicely appointed with big fluffy comforters and lots of pillows on the beds. I never visited the restaurant, so cannot comment on that, but used both the concierge and theatre desks to inquire about locations and shows and found both to be helpful and the theatre desk girl to be knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Our room was always nicely cleaned when we returned and never found anything missing (except a business card I got from a really nice guy I met...darn!).
