The hotel is easy to find....if you walk down any N/S avenue from Central Park (North) or the theatre district (South) and look down 54th street, you will see the huge red-lit Radio City Music Hall sign and you know if you walk toward it, you are nearly there or will pass it. As for hotel security, there are many people in and out of the lobby, but never anyone I felt the slightest bit threatened by. There is always a doorman to hail a taxi and occasionally, but not always, a security person checking keys before allowing entry. The hotel is also very centrally located. Our personal aim was to wander about and see Broadway shows. We were within walking distance to Central Park which we walked to quickly and then strolled through slowly. We wandered the East side and visited the Met on one day and wandered the West side to Strawberry Fields and the reservoir the next and walked to different Broadway shows at night. Central Park was absolutely breathtaking. The leaves were falling on the sidewalks in beautiful yellows and oranges. Late October/early November was a perfect time for visiting New York. Overall our stay was very memorable and the Hilton was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Reasonable for New York”
Reviews.Author: Shton1
Reviews.Content: Just returned on Oct. 31st from New York and a stay at the New York Hilton. You won't find a more centrally located hotel, and while its not The Four Seasons its a clean comfortable hotel with all the standard Hilton ammenities. One thing that impressed me was the bathrooms, while small had fantastic water pressure and copious amounts of hot water. The decor in the rooms is definitely early 80's institutional, but the rooms are clean and the staff does a pretty good job of taking care of the rooms and public spaces. The front desk staff while they weren't the gracious types we have down South, they were cordial and efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel to a tourist or business traveler looking for a central location at a reasonable rate. More experienced travelers or those looking for luxury accomodations will probably want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kayess00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights midweek (27-29 Oct) for Â£50 / night via Priceline. The hotel is large and busy but when we checked in around 1pm there was very little line and we used the express checkout so that didn't take any time at all. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator either. Our room was on the 31st floor, decent size with 2 doubles, everything very clean and comfortable although we didn't have or need the most modern TV or high-speed internet access. The location was unbelievably good for first time tourist visitors like us - a block away from 5th Avenue, minutes from Central Park and Times Square. We walked comfortably to and from the Empire State Building and Grand Central Station and just about any subway line has a stop a couple of blocks away. We felt comfortable in the area at all times of day - it isn't frenetic like Times Square but there were always lots of people around. We didn't eat in the hotel at all (although reading reviews on here I wish we'd tried!). I can highly recommend the W53rd Street Gourmet Deli just behind the hotel - wonderful selection of decent hot and cold food at very reasonable prices. We would be delighted to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices”
Reviews.Author: CamiGirl55
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel was the restaurant on premises..fabulous food..enormous portions and excellent prices. Other than that..the hotel itself was rather disappointing in that the room was simply average for the price..with the furnishings merely average and the bathroom painfully lacking in counter space..the shower curtain smelled musty. They were generous with the towels..however the most annoying part were the elevators whereby if you stayed on a lower floor..you had to take one elevator to get to your room..then get in and exit that elevator in order to get another elevator to gain access to the Executive Floors where the continental breakfast and cocktail hour were held. These functions were nice and I must say had a very nice offerring of breakfast items as well as some commanding views of the City. We would not stay here again when we discovered many, smaller boutique type hotels with similar rates and far more inviting amenities and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations for a Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hilton NY is in a great location, very convenient to head anywhere in Manhattan either by cab or subway. My fiancee and I booked a room for a sat nite stay just a few days beforehand through priceline. We got a pretty decent rate ($170nt) and when checking in asked for a renovated room which we got. After reading some of the other reviews I wasn't sure what to expect, but we were happily surprised that our room was very clean, modern & comfortable. Overall we had a positive experience at this hotel and it's a very good value if you book through priceline or a similar discount travel site.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hilton on Sunday, 10 Oct. Received a good deal on Priceline - $150 per night (price included taxes). Large hotel with lots of people, but my standard room on the 21st floor was nice. I can see how you probably would not receive very personal service since there are just too many tourists running around. But I was happy with the location, the room, and the price. So if you are not high maintenance and don't need the pampering, stay here for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but could do lots better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a visit to the Big Apple, partly on business and partly pleasure. The business aspect was held in the Hilton New York.------Location-wise, the hotel is good. The rooms, while well appointed and clean are quite small. The bathrooms are tiny with practically no counter space. You have to reach underneath the sink to be able to flush the commode. While I was taking a shower one morning, I leaned against the tile soap dispenser, and it fell off the wall. On another morning, the whole hotel was without any hot water. Check-in at this hotel was a breeze with practically no waiting on Saturday afternoon. The concierge was somewhat helpful, but certainly not enthusiastically so. On one occasion, when we tried to get into the room with the card/key, the door would not open. We summoned a maid who said she could not open the door with her card (?), and called security. After waiting awhile, the security arrived and informed us that he could not open the door either, but would go get a master key. After sitting in the floor for about 30 minutes, we were finally able to get into the room!!!! So, our stay at the New York Hilton was not a total bust, but you can certainly do better when staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Demand High Floor”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel, located a few blocks from Central Park and Rockefeller Center, is a typical Hilton with the usual amenities. However, if you book online and get a good rate, it is a bargain. Be sure, however, to negotiate for a high floor room facing north (the park) and preferably near the west end of the hotel, which will give you at least a partial view of the Hudson River. Otherwise, if you don't ask, you can get stuck with a room facing south that fronts tall buildings with no view, thus resulting in a rather dismal atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in May 2004 and were pleasantly surprised how good it was after reading the reviews here. The room was clean, nicely decorated and quiet. The staff were very helpful and I cannot find a bad thing to say about this hotel. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location, just up from Times Square and only a short walk from ESB. Central Park is two minutes walk away. Would definitely recommend staying here and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Make another choice...”
Reviews.Author: SFO-World-Traveller
Reviews.Content: NY Hilton is a dark hotel with average/below average rooms, rushed service and the feeling that you are, well, staying in the largest hotel in Manhattan. Pros: Its well located, and rooms are always available. Cons: Size, hordes of tourists, rooms in major need of repairs/upgrades (stains on carpet, chipped furniture). New York City is full of hotel choices. Don't make this one of yours. For the same money you can make a booking at much nicer hotels (try the Paramount, which often has reasonable rates).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews on this site and was somewhat nervous about this property. Got a phenomenal rate of $120 on priceline and spent 3 nights here. Pleasantly surprised on most aspects of the hotel. Excellent staff, awesome location, great fitness facility and good sized, clean, well furnished rooms. The wall paper and carpets could do with a change but can't ask for more at this price. Thank you priceline, trip advisor and Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a bit disappointed with the Hilton ... not quite 4* in our opinion. It was functional, but nothing special. If you need a bed for the night it does the job, but be prepared to pay extra for any incidentals such as baggage check.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: firstlove
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through Priceline on the day before I left for my vacation. (We changed hotels at the last minute because we read the reviews of the Marcel on tripadvisor and thought we had better stay away.) Boy am I glad that we found the Hilton New York. We stayed at the Hilton on labor day weekend. I was nervous because of the negative reviews, but refused to pass up on the great price, especially considering that it was a last minute reservation. When we arrived, we were astonished by the service. The hotel was excellant!!!! The Republicans were leaving on Friday when we arrived, which was better for us as the hotel was less crowded (the Republican National Convention was held in New York on Monday - Thursday). The hotel clerk offered us a king bed, because there were two of us (without us even asking). There was no mention of our "cheap" rate with Priceline, and I did not feel that we were treated any differently. The hotel was more spacious than many I have stayed in. I took pictures to show everyone as proof. The location was great as we were able to easily walk to the Empire State Building, Times Square, and Broadway (several times). The concierge desk personnel were knowledgeable and efficient. I was never let down. It was fantastic and I will not stay anywhere else when I return to New York, especially because of the price. Although Astro's diner down the street came highly recommended, I would not eat there on a regular basis. The service was quick, but the prices were a little steep. Breakfast for two was about 18.00, without tip. Not worth the price at all.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton on the Avenue of the Americas August 25 to 29, 2004. Did we all stay at the same hotel???? The Hilton is a mid-range average hotel and that's what we got. I am surprised at some of the negative reviews which seem to come from those who purchased a discount room and then were shocked when they didn't get the best room in the hotel. You cannot expect to get the same room as those paying twice or three-times as much as you. That is why you get the rooms that have not been renovated etc. Check-in was fast and courteous (not overly friendly but that's okay). Room was exactly as we requested, two double beds, non-smoking. The room was large and nicely decorated, bathroom had marble floors and walls. Some of the furniture was a bit older but fit in nicely with the overall scheme. Very clean, lots of clean white towels and twice daily "maid service". Was at first concerned that our room was beside the elevator on the 11th floor but no noise problem. When in the bathroom which is right beside the entry door, you can hear a low noise from people waiting for the elevator and the low drone of the elevator itself but when in the room you could not hear anything. Air conditioner worked great. We normally stay at more up-scale hotels, such as the Ritz or when in Vegas at the Bellagio or Paris, or in small Inns. We found the Hilton to be just fine for a mid-range hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: sarah1051
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY Hilton over labor day weekend. We also booked through priceline at $117 per night. Over all we enjoyed our stay. We checked ourselves in at a kiosk in the lobby, and were able to select a newly renovated room on the 20th floor. We were impressed that we were able to check into our room at 10 AM, so we did not have to check our bags. The room itself was large, nicely decorated, and quiet. The only complaint that I have is that internet was $10 per day, which seems steep for a wireless connection... but this seems to be standard practice these days. We were a little nervous about this hotel after reading some reviews posted here, but we had a great experience. I guess it pays to check your self in!

Reviews.Title: “This is a deal if you book on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an excellent stay at the Hilton. Booked two rooms on Priceline and payed $110 for each. We stayed four nights at the end of the RNC - so needless to say - the place was packed to capacity. That didn't hinder us from checking in [early] without incident and being treated just like any other full paying customer. We were actually treated very well when we requested to switch one of the rooms since the carpet was wet from a previous guest. No problem at all. Hotel staff was very accomodating. After reading previous reviews I was very nervous about what I would find at the Hilton. Anyone getting a discount here is getting a DEAL! I did not encounter any of the "peeling paint, dark hallways, or long, long waits for the elevator." I agree -- this hotel is not on par with what most seasoned travelers probably consider four star -- but the rooms are clean, bright and well maintained. The main draw to the hotel is the location. It's within easy walking distance of the park, Times Square, 5th Ave., and numerous, numerous METRO stops -- you can't go wrong with the location. Avoid the marketplace [hotel restaurant] for breakfast though. $20 pp for the buffet is NOT worth the money. The ASTRO diner down the block provides the same for 1/4 the price. Also got great take out from SERRA NOVA [two restaurants down from the ASTRO]. Grocery store across the street from the hotel is also fully stocked with food and spirits at pretty much non-NYC prices. For what I paid I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel again. You can't beat the location. However, if you're wanting full upscale, quiet, boutique NYC -- then this is NOT for you.

Reviews.Title: “not worth reg price!”
Reviews.Author: Shanenj
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hilton over labor day weekend. We booked our reservations thru Priceline and got a great price. $124/night. Upon arrival, we were immediately informed that we could not upgrade thru our Hhonors b/c of the priceline booking, and b/c we booked thru Priceline, we were given a room in the unrenovated section of the hotel. This section definitely showed its age. If not for the great rate, and the location of the hotel, I would not recomend staying here. The lobby is beautiful, but do not expect 4 stars for the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay over Labor Day”
Reviews.Author: chem_flwr
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hilton through Priceline at $130/night for 2 rooms. Traveling with 2 teenagers and requested one room with double beds and one with a Queen bed through the Hilton Honors reservation number. We arrived the evening of the last day of the RNC. Needless to say that security was very tight all over. The double bed room we requested was not available at check in but they gave us a rollaway bed @ no charge told us to check with them the next morning and they would accomodate us. They also and gave us 4 breakfast vouchers for our trouble. Nice gesture considering that it's $20 for the buffet breakfast. We ended up having nice rooms on the 20th floor and they looked renovated. The plumbing fixtures were a little bit hard to handle and loose. Overall the rooms were nice size for NYC. The place was packed but never had to wait too long for the elevators. Nice service and attitude at the concierge and tour reservation desks. This was a great trip and our kids loved the location. Every night we walked to Times Square to do some people watching and we took the Gray Line tour which I highly recommend. I was quite concerned after reading some of the reviews but in the end we were really pleased with our stay and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Thought this was a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked 1 night stopover at this Hilton for a group of 10 people (mixed rooms for singles, doubles & triples), was a bit concerned as I only found this website after booking, and some of the reviews are bad. However, we all thought it was very good - it was 27th August which was while Rep conference was on and everywhere was busy - however check-in was very fast, we were all given rooms on the 20th floor, which is the recently renovated one - and all the rooms were large, well decorated and in good condition. The views were of the Sheraton hotel (mentioned elsewhere, but so what! who wants good views for night in a NY hotel?) Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment but there's plenty of good eating places within a block. Also, thought it was a good situation as a lot of tourist sites were within easy walking distance. Someone mentioned security issues earlier, but we were asked to show room keys when we returned in the evening. We did have a problems with reclaiming some bags which were left with the porter after we checked out, but this was due to internal wranglings between porters & bellhops and as soon as the Dep Manager got involved it was settled immediately. I would be quite happy to stay here again - but it is probably best to ask for the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but Good for Low Price”
Reviews.Author: BringHomeTroops
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-night stay that I booked through Priceline for $125/night. I was worried, as I needed two beds and others using Priceline had trouble. Yes, when you call the hotel directly to request a specific room type they are rude and unhelpful. The know darn well that Priceline does not allow users to specify room type, but they act stupid and say â€œYouâ€™ll get what ever room Priceline has requested for you.â€�â€¦thanks. Anyway, upon check in we got a room on the 16th floor with two doubles. The room size was pretty good for NYC. There was a large closet and dresser, plus desk and chair. The furnishings werenâ€™t brand new but were fine for the price. The bathroom was actually really nice. It was quite large for NYC and looked like it was recently renovated. It was all granite (floor, walls), and a very sparkly white tub/tiles. The caulk was not moldy (usually most hotels have some kind of mold) and the shower worked great and the tub drained!! (I hate it when tubs drain slowly), also there were lots of mirrors. I think we had a handicapped accessible room. Some front desk people where helpful, others wouldnâ€™t even make eye contact and treated you as if you were interrupting their lives (this without even knowing we booked through Priceline.) Concierge was only knowledgeable about very mainstream activities. We asked where the main shopping drag was in Chelsea, we prefer funky shopping to big department stores, she didnâ€™t know and told us there was no shopping in Chelsea (she was wrong). Other than that, it was just a Hilton as another reviewer said... nothing great, not horrible either. For $125/night, I think it was a good deal. It was reasonable clean and quiet with above average bathroom in our room. However, I wouldnâ€™t want to pay their regular rates, Iâ€™d stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Standard”
Reviews.Author: KarenDUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Hilton from 21-08-04 to 26-08-04. This was my my first stay at the Hilton. I visit New York on a regular basis and thought I'd give the Hilton a try this time mainly because of the brand name. When I got to the hotel my double room wasn't available, so I was put in a small room which I didn't want. I asked to be upgraded to a suite, but they wouldn't give me one, even though I was willing to pay a considerable difference. The paper was peeling off the walls, and the paint was peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom. The loo didn't flush properly, and the bath took a life time to drain away. The view from my window was ghastly (the back of the Sheraton), and the hotel wasn't as nicely lit up at night as the brochures would have you believe. Breakfast was like a rugby scrum, and the (breakfast) menu was mainly geared towards Japanese tourists. (Be warned ...Breakfast is extra. It is not included with the price of the room. Eat elsewhere. There is a perfectly good and far less costly 24 hour diner on the corner of the block) Avoid using the hotel restuarant in the evening. The selection/choice of food on the evening menu is extremely poor and limited. If you're into shopping and sightseeing, chose a hotel nearer Times Square because this particular Hilton is a 'bit of a long treck' from all the action. My biggest concern is security ...There is NO security! Anyone can come and go without question! Apart from the above, I found the staff to be pleasant, and the bed was clean and comfy. All in all, I was disappointed that such a brand name provided budget standard accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “ASK FOR AN UPGRADE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 6-7. Spent $200 on a deluxe room with a king bed, and their breakfast promotion. Check in took forever, yes it was busy, but I waited in line for over 20 minutes. I was put in a room on the 20th floor, good I thought. The room was horrible. Small TV, VERY WORN carpet, bed, desk. NOTHING was renovated. There are much nicer hotels in New york for less, with much better rooms. So I called the Front Desk and told them what I thought of the room. They lady asked me if I wanted a renovated room. I said, excuse me, why woudl I need to ASK for a renovated room! The renovated room was nice, but upon check out I was informed that I was in an executive room. ASK FOR THE RENOVATED ROOMS or DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasently surprised at how clean and nice the rooms were. You get what you pay for here. Very quiet in the room at night, you don't hear the busy streets. Nice shampoos and bathrooms too!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Saltbreeze
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton property, a "flagship", this property was very disappointing. The wallpaper was peeling, the hallways were far too worn and dirty, the room decor was old and unnappealing. The website says that a $148 million redesign was recently completed, and that was the reason I booked in spite of bad past reviews, but if that is true I shudder to think what our room looked like before! And tho it can't be helped, the location is very noisy. If you don't mind taking a subway or a taxi, we enjoyed the subway, we loved our stay at the Hilton Millenium overlooking Ground Zero. The decor was ultra modern with a bed you wouldn't want to leave if it wasn't NYC! Plasma tv to boot. In contrast, at the NY Hilton, the mini bar was so old I could barely open it and once I did, it was baaaaad. I opened a Chardonnay that was rancid, then a Bailey's that was actually curdled! The first person I called for credit on the wine was polite, but the dude I called about the Bailey's was very rude. Shrug. As for rates, I paid $169 nonrefundable, whereas the Millenium weekend rates that extended from Th-Sunday on our stay were only $152 (a fully cancellable AAA rate, the .com rate was $144) There is simply no comparison between the two properties. Enjoy this beautiful city, and stay at the quiet, elegant Millenium.

Reviews.Title: “Fab holiday.”
Reviews.Author: fairybella
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked the Hilton New York in the Uk and were a little concerned by the reviews, however we had no problems, we checked straight in at the desk, got a good sized room on the 30th floor, the room was clean, the beds were comfy and we had two doubles, there was enough room to walk around and store all our luggage and the extra we bought out there! The staff we encounted were very polite and friendly-even at 4am one morning when the guest in the next room appeared to be having a party! This was one small irratation that was delt with swiflty. We even asked for and received a later check out time because we had a later flight home-definatley worth asking for. This was the third time my friend and I had been to New York, peviously staying at the Park Central on 7th Ave. My friend and I tried the Pazza Notte Italian on the advise of another Hilton guest and enjoyed it-pasta was lovely and we received a generous portion. We have three of our own recommendations-China Regency chinease restaurant on 7th Ave-around 55/56th street, Lindys breakfast bar/restaurant 7th ave-heading towards times square and the Stanhope Hotel opposite the mueseum of modern art for a more sophisticated atmosphere. All in All a great stay. C. in England.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 night stay at Hilton New York. No complaints here. Great location. Only staff members that were not cordial were the luggage storage staff. Everyone else always greeted us with a smile and "good morning" Rooms were clean and spacious. Stayed on 29th floor. Never waited for more than 30 seconds for an elevator. Breakfast buffet was pricey but very good. Would stay there again without thinking twice. Very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: NYRanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2003. It's a Hilton. What more do you need to know. It is no better and no worse than any Hilton anywhere else in the world. It is reasonably priced, the rooms are a decent size, the hotel is clean. Service is not exceptional, though not bad. Room service burgers were a lot better than I expected - seemed to be made with real beef, rather than meat-flavoured offal. Choosing a hotel in New York before you get there is a gamble. This is a low risk option. Though far from thrilling, you at least know that you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good. But crowded 44th flr. exec lounge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reasonably good stay. Stayed on one of the executive floors. Was completely surprised by how busy the 44th floor lounge was, quite surprising, and have never seen this from a hotel lounge before. Another point which I picked up about the lounge is the fact that the food and drinks were not complimentary (in other hiltons they are). Guests staying on one of the executive floors should check in on the 44th floor and not on the ground floor. Also, we were promised that there would be a 42'' plasma television in the room, when opening the tv cabinet, I was marginally shocked to see a 20'' 1m thick television. Views of the city are good due to the height of the hotel and the concierge on the exec. floor was very helpful for finding good restaurants in NYC. The hotel is in a beautiful location and there is room for improvement, however, it is in general a reasonably impressive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: tdijetta
Reviews.Content: Nothing impressive about this place. The hotel is huge and staff are in general rude. I have stayed here twice via Priceline ($100) and I wouldn't pay a penny more.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: calgal818
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel and loved it! Hotel was very clean and the bed was very comfortable, shower was amazing. Great location. Would totally recommend it. Did not eat in the Hotel at all so can't comment on the food but if i am going back to NYC will defo. be trying to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Two words: Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: philadelphiastory
Reviews.Content: Mortifying, but true: Room 2409 is infested with bed bugs. Let's hope the management is taking care of it. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York”
Reviews.Author: taraandpete
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to New York City June 19-23. We stayed at the Hilton New York on Avenue of the Americas (6th Avenue). We purchased a flight/hotel package from expedia. The hotel was great. It was in a great location...close to shopping on 5th Avenue, Central Park and even Times Square. It was not within walking distance of downtown (Ground Zero, Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, etc). We purchased a 2-day Hop On/Hop Off bus ticket, which allowed us to get off at any number of stops and then get back on when we had spent enough time in that particular area. I would HIGHLY recommend purchasing this for first time visitors. The tour guides give you a lot of inside information and it is a great way to see all of the city if you have a limited amount of time. The tickets were actually pretty inexpensive, around $45 per person. That price also included a night tour which took us over to Brooklyn for a view of the Manhattan skyline from the other side of the river. In addition to the Hop On/Hop Off tour, we purchased a Sopranos tour. This also was well worth it. If you are a Sopranos fan, this is for you. It takes you to various locations where the show has been filmed in New Jersey, including the Bada Bing. It was a really great experience because we were then able to not only visit NYC, but also parts of New Jersey. The website for the Hop On/Hop Off tour is: ----------------------------- The website for the Sopranos tour is: www.sceneontv.com Have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sfowler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton NY and Towers for 5 nites in May. It was our first trip to New York City and it was a good experience. The hotel was wonderful and we were able to obtain a great rate thru the AAA travel site. The location was great for walking to Rockerfeller Center, Times Square, and Central Park. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: socratesa
Reviews.Content: Modern uninspiring on the outside, pretty nice on the inside. Wide & busy lobby lacking however any sitting area to do any people watching. Room was clean and decent size and so was the bathroom. The best feature is the location a couple of blocks from Central Park and Rockefeler Plaza and very close to MOMA (Modern Art Museum). If your looking for something very classy w/ character try the Waldorf Astoria also a Hilton (we stayed there the following week) or if visiting Lower Manhattan try the Millenium Hilton right across from Ground Zero close to Wall Street and Battery Park, a favorite w/ reviewers on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in New York City. Stayed at the New York Hilton â€“ excellent location! About a ten minute walk (tops) to Central Park, Rockafeller Center, and the rest of the area attractions. The only minor disappointment was the subway access. Returned from Little Italy one evening via the subway â€“ intended to get off at the 51st St. station â€“ only to find it was not open (not sure why). Had to continue on to the 59th street Station and walk back. The staff was very friendly. I booked the room through Priceline â€“ but never received any â€˜looksâ€™ or comments as others have stated. Requested a room with 2 beds upon arrival (traveling as a family) which they were more than willing to accommodate. Also requested a refrigerator which I was told was a fifteen dollar per night charge â€“ turns out I was not charged for it (at least through this date). The refrigerator was delivered and set up promptly and by a very friendly staff member. We did not have a long wait for elevators as previously posted. We also had a safe in the room â€“ which proved to be invaluable. I used the phone check-out (the TV check-out was not working at that time) which was quick and easy â€“ no problems at all. We tried Astroâ€™s for breakfast â€“ extremely fast service (had our breakfast within 5 minutes from the time we sat down). But by the time we were leaving there was a line out the door â€“ guess it depends on your timing! Summing it all up â€“ we would not hesitate to stay there again â€“ loved the location!

Reviews.Title: “sleep in the street and be the first at the today show”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I tried to book a room for the nyc bar show and was told that there were not any rooms available for the bar show rate. I ended up paying 280.00 for a sunday night stay when I wanted to stay 2 nights. After being told that the parking was included in this exuberant rate I come to find out upon ck out that parking was 40.00 for 1 night. I would haven taken the chance and slept in my car if i would have know this. Bath robes were in the description and were not in the room, either was the "free gift" for staying on the consierge level. The staff was ok at best but the best part was the bed. Very comfy after a long days work. I manage a 253 room restort/timeshare hotel in the poconos and have for 20 years and will stay at a motel 6 near the city before i visit this tourist trap again that does not cater to their own (people in the business).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skyline_Drifter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for 4 nights on our honeymoon from 7th to 10th June and had a great time with no significant problems at all. It was booked through United Vacations so I've no idea what particular room rate I paid as the total cost for the holiday incorporated all flights and another hotel in Hawaii also. Arrived early evening on the Monday night and checked in without any delay or problem whatsoever. We had requested a double non-smoking room and got exactly what we'd asked for on the 30th floor. Our room was certainly more than big enough for us. We may have gotten an upgrade for all I know given that it was a honeymoon but if that was the case then no-one actually informed us of it. It was a very big bed as far as I'm concerned also. I think it was a King size but as I'm not overly familiar with what's a King size and what's a Queen size I might be wrong. Location was perfect, easy walking distance for Central Park, Broadway and much of Manhattan. Tour buses passing the door also. Our first visit to New York so we wanted to do the obvious things like visit the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Empire State, World Trade Center site, Central Park, Macy's, etc, etc. Apart from one day when there was a big conference going on we never found the lobby especially busy as some reviews on here have suggested. The staff were never a problem at all and always very helpful, including the lady at the concierge desk who helped us book our return transfer to the airport. The hotel also has an activities desk within it which can book you tours and theatre tickets, etc. That may be an independant concern though. We used that to book tickets to Mamma Mia and a couple of tours and found the staff to be extremely helpful and informative. Our room was clean though there were a few small strange orange stains on the carpet but that's getting really picky I guess. We had a problem with the toilet not flushing properly right from when we arrived but one call to customer services and someone was up to fix it within 10 minutes. I'd agree with the person who recommended Astro's for breakfast. We went there a couple of times. Cheap and chearful. If you want something a little fancier then there's an Irish bar down the street from the Bridges Bar which does fine breakfasts for not all that much more cash. Can't recall its name though. For dinner there's a brilliant Italian restaurant just beyond Astros called 'Pazza Notte'. We also ate in Bensons which does phenomenal steaks but it's very expensive. First night treat but $150 for two one course meals with a couple of drinks was way above my expectations. Fortunately they're not all that expensive. Ate in the Hilton Marketplace one night and found it to be okay but nowhere near as good as the 'Pazza Notte' for instance. They put an invoice under your door overnight on your last night so if it's fine in the morning you can auto-check-out using either the phone or the tv which saves any potential queueing. We used the phone method and I presume it worked out properly though as I haven't had the final bill yet I can't confirm that. As it happens though, when we went downstairs to leave the reception area was quiet. The hotel bar is spacious and pleasant though certainly not the cheapest place to drink at $6 for a beer! The elevators were reliable and pretty quick. To sum up, we enjoyed our stay and, were we ever to come back to New York, I wouldn't hesitate to book the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently and was reluctant to stay here because of the mix-reviews. I decided to try the hotel out and found it to be a nice experience. I did stay on the executive floors, that may have made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great midtown location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great midtown location - front reception staff were really friendly as were all the staff we encountered during our 4 nt stay. Adequate size rooms were clean & shower was fierce! Didn't eat at hotel but can recommend Astros for b/f and Ben Bensons for a great steak. Not all rooms have a safe but reception has safety deposit boxes. Would recommend hotel and would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fair at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the location to be the best, it was central to almost everything. I want to let other Hilton honors members know that if you book through any on line travel sites other than hilton you will not be able to get upgraded. I found most of the desk staff to be very rude and not very well informed. I had asked for a smoking room with 2 beds and they tried to give me a nonsmoking with a king. Then after speaking to the manager I was given a room with 2 beds but still on a non smoking floor with a broken shower. I had to go down and speak to the manager before I had the room that I had asked for, even when I just wanted quarters for the bus it was a problem. They need to work on there customer sevice and make you feel like your money is worth something. I will not stay there again and would stay at the Hilton across from ground zero. Also the water pressure was a slow drip in the shower. The other problem was the shuttle going to lga. They sell tickets for 16 per person but do not tell you that it will be the first of 2 buses that you will have to take. Make sure you ask because I found out that for a few dollors more I could have had a non stop to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt have even given this hotel one star, but that is the lowest you can give. I would also tell you to avoid reserving a room through PRICELINE if you are going to NYC. You will end up with ths horrible hotel. They have THE WORST customer service and all you can get out of them is that its not under their control. I was told by the reservationist that she had no control over what type of room we were given (even though its their hotel) and that I had to call Priceline, because they had been the one to send the request for what type of room we wanted. Of course Priceline said that they always request non-smoking and that it is up to the hotel to assign rooms (which seems reasonable to me). I finally gave up after being told by BOTH Priceline and the hotel that neither one of them had control over the type of room you had. They only thing they both could seem to control was the collection of money. I understand that we were getting a special price, but if they intened on treating us poorly because of that rate they should not have accepted it. They both offer poor customer service and I would not advise using either the Hiton New York or Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms! Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending two nights in hell at The West Park Hotel, we checked into the Hilton. Just walking into the lobby was a drastic change from the other place! I knew this was going to be a much better experience. We had a complimentary massage, and even had bath robes in the room! I was very satisfied with the Hilton, and will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Rockefellar Plaza and Times Square. Room in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter holiday in NYC from 9th to 14th April. The Staff at the reception is unfriendly and the lobby is overcrowded and noisy at at all times. There is no place to sit. It feels like Grand Central all day. The rooms are small but quite well funrnished. We were on 24th floor and obtained a non smoking King size. Please note that all customers who book through Pricelne can't get advantages of HHonors like access to lounge and free breakfast. I would try some other location next time

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price and in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: magic739
Reviews.Content: My wife, teenage son and I stayed at the Hilton for 4 days in late March 2004. We were in a 1 bedroom suite. The bedroom portion had two beds, and the living room had a pull out sofa, which my 6ft long son slept in very comfortably (although the bed got stuck every time we tried to put it back in the sofa). The room was spacious, with a partial view of Central Park three blocks away. The decor is OK, and we liked the desk and internet connections to use our Apple portable in broadband mode. Besides the minibar, there is another refrigerator for your own use, which can be a money saver. The biggest drawback was only having 1 bathroom, and a small one at that. The walk-in closet is bigger than the bathroom ! As others have remarked, the lobby is more like an international airport (with self service kiosks for checking in) than you might like. We liked the easy access to the concierge (up to 10 p.m. at night), and the terrific central location. You're at Central Park in a three minute walk and at Times Square in ten minutes. We walked around till after midnight with no problem. Yes, the elevators get busy, but so what ? Once you're in, you can watch CNN on a screen above the elevator buttons. There is a little store for drinks, snacks, mgs etc, and a couple of restaurants and a bar, but we didn't use them, so no comment one way or the other. Overall, a very good experience. We're going back to New York in June, and we're planning to stay at the Hilton again. It's not cheap but that's New York for you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly commended”
Reviews.Author: Andypip14
Reviews.Content: An excellent location for a hotel for anyone wanting a true taste of New York - we got priceline rooms for $90 - I thought that this would be OK for a family but it turned out we only got a double room - not a problem, a rollaway bed that fitted conveniently at the end of the bed soon arrived at a very reasonable additional rate - yes I agree the "holding charge" for luggage is steep but at least you can leave stuff if you have late flights. Superb location for Central Park and 5th avenue - don't have the hotel breakfast instead go to Astro Diner one block towards Central Park - much better and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ilovenewport36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 7 nights, April 2004. Requested connecting rooms and received them. The hotel is clean, rooms are small, but not for New York standards. The bathrooms are very small. We paid more through Hotel.com than anyone mentioned here. Our room rate was $219.00-$239.00 per night, per room. Our room was near the elevator and you could hear it all day and night. The hotel location is excellant, walking distance to most everywhere. The rooms looked newer, but the ventilation in the bathroom smelled like it was connected to a smoking room. Housekeeping is excellant, immediate response and rooms were spotless. Lots of groups stayed here, so the lobby was always busy. Concierge was very informative about where to go, how to get there, but tickets were very expensive for any theatre, go to box office for tickets. Broadway is 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for the view...”
Reviews.Author: jad376
Reviews.Content: I booked one night here on a whim after I found a great prepaid deall of $134 for a concierge level room. I tacked on a night in New York on the way down the coast from Montreal. My advice: don't stay here unless you can get a concierge level room on the 41-45th floor, or unless you absolutely have to. My narrow 'deluxe' room seemed to be well furnished at first glance, but upon closer inspection, I noticed worn fabrics, holes on the bedside armchair, stains on the desk, and drapes in need of dusting. The bathroom was clean, yet tiny and utilitarian (think motel 6). Thank goodness I stayed here in the middle of winter, because if I hadn't opened the window, I think I would have melted...yes, the room was that hot! I couldn't get the air conditioning on! Since I was only here one night, it wasn't worth complaining to the front desk about these issues; I figure someone else will notice sooner or later. However, I loved the experience of staying on the 41st floor in the center of Manhattan. My room, 4144, had a view of Central Park between the towers. For me, there's nothing like the solace of sitting in the 'sky' observing the rhythms of the city. This hotel is very convenient to both Central Park and Times Square, but I would not recommend this place to first-timers. Stay at the Westin, the Inter-Continental, or the Millenium Hilton downtown. Oh -- before I forget -- the calm and friendly nighttime bell staff is awesome compared to the snippy and rude daytime employees. The daytime bell staff tried to charge me $20 to hold my luggage for 5 minutes while I went to park my car! Not very professional...

Reviews.Title: “great staff ... even better location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends and I stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel was booked on Priceline for $120 p/night. We stayed on lucky floor number 13 (at least it was lucky for us). The Hilton staff was incredible and the location of the hotel was even better. Beware of room service though. Paying $20 for two fabulous desserts (not including tip) was not that bad when compared to the $18 we spent on two 20oz sodas. Just read the costs carefully (ex: $6.00 eat-in-room charge). They did have a wonderful spa & work-out facility ($12 a day to use, plus additional costs for additional services) - well worth every penny. The location was my favorite part! I stayed right at the heart of Times Square on my first trip to NYC, so it was a nice change to stay a little further away from all the noise created from every tourist in town clammering to see the bright lights. Still close enough to walk to, but just far enough to enjoy a good nights rest or afternoon nap. Definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, BAD ELEVATORS!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, and was actually better than I expected. When you book a Hilton, you are getting a known commodity. It's a mid-range hotel. I took a trip there with my mother this week and had booked at their website. I got a great internet special. I paid a little extra for an executive room; it guarantees you a high floor with a free continental breakfast, evening hors d'ourves, and a speedy check-in on the 44th floor -- definately worth it! I got a corner room with a view of Central Park. It was Spring Break, and the hotel was full, and booked heavily with 2 high school groups. But it's a giant hotel in New York, you have to expect these things. I called for extra pillows, delivered immediately. Room Service -- exactly on time. The staff was responsive and professional. The bed and pillows were pretty good, and I am picky about these things. Everything was in good shape. My only real complaint is that the hotel doesn't have enough elevators. It was built for the 1964 World's Fair and was planned to be a condominum. It stayed as a hotel, and simply doesn't have enough elevators. Expect to wait several minutes at peak times. But again, if you want something better, book at a smaller hotel. The location is perfect if you want Midtown...a nice stroll to the theater district, but you're not on Times Square. The Hilton New York delivers good value and I was impressed at how smoothly it ran, considering how big and full it was. However, the tvs in the elevators were extremely annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC this past weekend to see the Lion King-a must see!!!! I booked the Hilton New York back in December through priceline for $100. It was great! The rooms are a bit small-but how much time are you really spending in it? We had our 10 yr. old son and 4yr. old daughter with us who had no problem walking to and from Times Square and Central Park! It was great and I couldn't ask for a better location! We will definitly go the the Hilton again! By the way-Carmine's on 44th was great for the kids for dinner!!! Just put your name in -find out how long the wait is-and go to Toy's "r" Us or ESPN Zone-the go back- it worked out great and was the best dinner ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel? Not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at Hilton New York on Priceline, where this was a "4 Star Hotel". An associate was to join me the 3rd night, so I called the Hilton to make sure the room had 2 beds and a huffy clerk assured me all was OK. But at check-in, front desk said they were sold out, and I was stuck in a tiny room with just one double bed. It was next to the elevators, which I heard through the wall as I tried to sleep. I called Customer Service to switch rooms but the night manager said nothing was available & offered a credit for that night's lodging. But at checkout, no such credit appeared on the bill. After 20 minutes fencing with another manager, the credit was finally granted.This Hilton dates from the 1960's, when "Efficiency" ruled hotel design, so even a room with 2 double beds was very cramped, with mismatched pieces of old furniture. Tiny bathroom, with no window, no fan, no ventilation! The hallways are half-a-block long and grungy. Worst of all: TV in the elevators, that constantly screech Fox "News" at their captive audience.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton New York - EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: darrylpmatthews
Reviews.Content: What a place! I am glad I chose such a fine hotel to stay at whilst visiting New York for the first time. The location is excellent, central park and times square a mere 5 minute walk away. I chose the executive level which meant a room between 37th - 44th floors. I got 43rd which gave some unbelievable views towards central park!The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was very clean. Well worth paying that bit extra for executive level. Go on, give it a try - you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to New York and we chose the Hilton because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. There were no problems with the lifts, our room was lovely and clean (and large with a huge bed), all our amenities were available and working and the staff were extremely helpful. The main plus point of this hotel is the location. Its 5 minutes from Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square and Rockerfella. I would recommend this to anyone visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: I took my neice to New York City for the first time. This was a perfect location. The staff at the hotel was helpful in giving us direction to get to the tourist spot like Times Square,etc. It may be a big Convention Hotel but it was a great place for us to stay. In fact we liked the busy lobby, it is so New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Unless Paris is here, skip the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the lobby is beautiful. However, the devil is in the details, and the details fall short at this place. The clock was off by an hour in time set, the hair dryer was missing in action (and it took over 30 minutes to get a replacement). The TV sound sounded like a blown speaker, room was listed as a queen bed, but was a double. Old style wall heat & AC unit. Ultra small room. The grafitti in the closet said "hilton sucks", and while I wouldn't condone vandalism, I understand the frustration. Using Hotwire or others, you should be able to get the Westin or Millenium for about the same which are much nicer, or get it for $100 or less on Priceline. Unless Paris is here, skip the Hilton.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton New York
HotelInfo.Address: 1335 Avenue of the Americas, 6th Avenue at 54th Street, New York City, NY 10019
